First off, while the discs are single-sided and don't require flipping like the previous sets, there is a slight loss in picture quality as a result. I watch the show on a 65" 4K television, so those with lesser displays may not notice, but on my end the picture is not as clear, there are a lot of noticeable jagged lines, and there are quick instances of visible interlacing. These are not issues I had with the previous sets, and they don't warrant skipping out on this release, but they are worth noting. Also, there is no longer a chapter break after the opening theme song, so while I could hit "Skip" to bypass the intro on previous sets, I cannot on the Olive Films season seven release because it will bring you to the mid-mark of the episode. Instead one must manually fast-forward if they don't want to see the theme song before every episode.

review_title: Good show, Great to have the set. Good packaging
review_description: I just revived my copy of season 7 and 8 on physical DVD Like many other fans I am thrilled to get to own seasons 7 and 8 on DVD. I'm not a big fan of digital distribution so when I herd they were being released on DVD a few months ago I instantly  pre-ordered.Both season 7 and 8 feature nice packaging in the style of normal size cases with a swing flap that I personally prefer over the older style fold outs or slim cases. The artwork is nice and colorful. The cases are clear and an episode list is printed on the reverse side of the art work.I was happy to see that the three discs are single sided and not flippers. They house about eight episodes a disc. The only small drawback for me is that there are no bonus features at all. I am still extremely happy with everything else. I hope Olive Films will continue to release the remaining seasons on DVD. These two sets have been the first DVDs I have ever pre-ordered, and I would be more then happy to pre-order the rest of the seasons as they become available.

review_title: Great show for anyone into comedy
review_description: Such an excellent show, one of the best-of-all-time in my personal opinion. Filled with laughs that address the times it was made in, it can be appreciated by both adults & children alike. Anyone who grew up in the 2000s should have an appreciation for this show which brings a level of nostalgia to the table. Written, produced, & directed by some of the same people responsible for the American-version of the "The Office," if you like this show, you'll love "King of the Hill."

review_title: Not sure how to rate this.
review_description: The seller shipped my order promptly and it arrived in perfect condition. The season comes in a case that is single DVD size and holds three discs, so I like the space-saving aspect. I am collecting all if the seasons of King of the Hill, my favorite show, but this season, season 7, is just damn boring. So I give all seasons prior a 5 star because they are awesone and this one a three because they are okay.

review_title: AT LONG LAST! THANKS, OLIVE FILMS!
review_description: A wrong has finally been righted with the release of Seasons 7 through 10 of "King of the Hill," an animated classic. The characters were all likeable, even Peggy when the writers began dumbing down her character. As much as I loved the risque animated shows like "The Simpsons," "Family Guy," and "Futurama" (which was less risque than the former two), it was nice to see a show about a normal family in a normal neighborhood. I'm clinging on to the hope that the remaining three seasons will see release on DVD before the end of the year. I understand that it was considered by Fox that it was not financially viable to release the remaining seasons on DVD (which is why "Malcolm in the Middle" has only seen one season on DVD); well, whatever the reason, I'm just glad that we fans now have these classics.

review_title: King Of The Hill Is Back!!!!
review_description: Well, I’ve never thought I’d see the day when King Of The Hill seasons 7-13 would finally be on DVD…It’s about fricking time!! Two Thumbs way way up for Olive Films for getting the rights to distribute the rest of this awesome show!! Now for the people leaving two, and one star ratings complaining about the DVD Quality? Claiming that the show won’t go back to the episode menu if you decide to watch it by episode? Well, either they have jacked up DVD players, or they’re lying sacks of dirt! I’ve tested it on my personal Desktop computer, My PS3 gaming console and my Sony Blu-Ray player and the disks play just fine!!! You can either watch all the episodes back to back, or individually. It works fine!Now for the people whining about Special Features, They pretty stopped doing all that after season 3 or so. Once they tell you how they draw the characters, and demonstrate how the show is made, it makes sense that they would eventually stop… right?Anyway, Thanks Olive Films for doing this for all the fans of King Of The Hill!

review_title: The best episode in a strong Season 7
review_description: The best episode in a strong Season 7 -- indeed, one of the best in the whole series. The main characters are at their most believable (the episode's early stages positively crackle with authenticity), it moves along crisply and logically and the script is consistently hilarious, thanks not least to an inspired, detailed performance by David Cross as lead "witch" Ward Rackley. (KotH always got the best out of its guest stars.) Even the ending works -- and this is where many otherwise excellent episodes of the show fall down. Simply brilliant from start to finish.

review_title: Make sure no scratches if it came like mine
review_description: Not new? DVDs inside were out of order in box and one was flipped upside down. Very strange. Nothing else was wrong and dvds were flawless so no biggy
Love this series was disappointed when they took it off air use to recited it and watch it every morning

review_title: King of the Hill Season 7 Instant video.
review_description: I love this show and wish they would put the rest of the series on DVD, Hopefully they still will. But for now this is the only option. I bought the season and downloaded the episodes and the Amazon Unbox player to my computer. Depending on the speed of your computer it could take a while for the episodes to download. It took almost a whole day (24hrs) to finish downloading all 23 episodes. Plays well on the Unbox player and if you sync your compatible blu-ray player or device that has the amazon instant video app, It plays great on there too. If you watch using the instant video app on a compatible device you do not need to download the episodes they just play from your videos that you purchased. For me the video quality is good and the sound is great. I first bought this on itunes but would not play properly through itunes on my computer. I did not have an Ipod to test it on there. Price is also cheaper here on amazon. So I would recommend purchasing from Amazon Instant Video.

review_title: One of my all time favorite cartoons. I am so glad the remainder of ...
review_description: One of my all time favorite cartoons. I am so glad the remainder of the seasons were finally released on DVD after having to wait what must have been at least 10 years between the release of season 6 and 7, I think. I had actually given up thinking they weren't going to release the reminding seasons on DVD.

Continues with solid and unique ways to deal with the problems these characters get into.  Do think this program doesn't get credit for its mainstream appeal that it helped to generate for animated programs.  It also does reflect the current times.

Olive Films, thanks for releasing seasons seven and eight of KOTH (and better yet, both at once)! Thus a great wrong has been righted. Please release the remaining seasons as well! Picture and sound are fine. My only small complaint is that the DVD cases are so fragile, they crack if you merely look hard at them.
Wish the price was $10 a season but I'm still happy to have these on DVD after all this time

review_title: the first disk worked fine, but the second dish is not working
review_description: The dvd case is broken on the bottom, the first disk worked fine, but the second dish is not working. Cant see any scratches but it is skipping constantly or not playing any sound just showing the animation. Hoping its just a bad disk. And the 3rd disk wont be like this.
Fantastic show.
This is my 3rd King of the Hill purchase through Amazon and always satisfied! Love this show!
i love how this season dvd looks the case is awesomethere are 3 discs and you don't have toflip any of them there are 8 episodeson a disc i just love it
Great show
Love this show
I love king of the hill
Excellent season of King of the Hill.

review_title: One of the best animated shows made!
review_description: I actually bought this as a gift, but it came in amazing condition and no issues playing. However, this only contains the episodes and no extras such as commentary. Unfortunate, but it adds to the collection of this amazing show.
One of the funniest animated series ever. I can totally relate to every character.Mike Judge outdid himself with this series.I sure hope that one day there are more seasons!
Its a good show that can help make a work day miserable turn to a good day at home

review_title: I love KOTH. I own all 13 seasons.
review_description: I love KOTH. I own all 13 seasons.
Been working on buying all seasons
Impressed by Olive Films in regards to this series. I like the packaging much better than the original releases. The quality is great. Glad Olive films released the series.

review_title: An Amazing Show - Don't Deny it.
review_description: This is the best show ever. Once Netflix took it off their instant viewing, I had to find a place to satisfy my hunger for an amazing show that you can laugh with and learn from. The quality is great and the ease of maneuvering between episodes makes this a great way to watch the show after a long day of work.
Great product, great service.
Exactly as expected
Loved the TV show wish it didn't get cancelled
I waited soooo long for this. Discs were great quality and the season didn't disappoint. Just as humorous as always.
We ordered this for my girlfriend's mother. She's been a huge fan of the series since it aired. Finally getting it on DVD made her so happy!
King of the Hill is the best
Plays great, glad I bought it, missed this show when Netflix dropped it.

review_description: The picture and sound and color is GREAT!!!!  The problem is at the end of the episode after the credits the DVD is not returning to the menu so I can pick another episode. I have used to different Reg. DVD PLAYERS.  I have the same problem with all the disc from season 7 & 8. Please write a review if you are having the same problem and let me know. review_title: Best characters on tv ...and they are animated.
review_description: I wish this show was still on. I can watch over and over and sometimes binge watch 4 to 5 episodes.
One of the best seasons of one of the best shows ever created.  We should all be more like Hank Hill. :)
As a Texan, the writing is spot on.  But, be aware it takes a special type of sense of humor to like this.  Also, if Texan, you have to be sucre enough to laugh at yourself.

review_title: If you're gonna buy one then you better plan on buying them all
review_description: If you're gonna buy one then you better plan on buying them all! Funny and great for my collection.
Wish they’d bring this show back on TV.
Love King of the Hill and this makes a perfect addition to the other seasons that I own.
Good
One of the greatest shows ever bar none
I bought this show for my husband, but we both love it almost as much as Hank loves propane and propane accessories!
loving this show more and more, I was so excited to see that this season was available I couldn't stand it. Now I am keeping my fingers crossed that season
Awesome!

Great game ....love how simple it is but a lot fun too.....easy to pick up and play ...came very quickly...but unfortunately i was disappointed because the box was badly damaged on arrival which is a real shame :( ....would of given it 5 star elseQuick update ......i was contacted by the seller about the damaged box which was obviously damaged in transit so not his fault just a bad delivery drivr .But he has very kindly offered to send out a new box which is amazing service from a small company...very impressed....will definitely be buying more of there games ...this one is very cool love it

Bag of Dungeon is a fun hack and slash dungeon exploring game with accessible rules and depth to keep it interesting. No two game is the same and can be played solo on your own or with up to three others.The website has free expansions you can print out to extend the game further, with three additional character sheets (plus a blank one if you want to design your own), skills and agendas for rewarding secret styles of play.A fun game with high quality tiles, cards and wooden Meeples. Highly recommended.

If, like me, you found D&D a little to intense and confusing, but want to get into RPG board games, then this game is for you.Simple gameplay - This game strikes the perfect balance of easy mechanics but with enough layers you wont get bored.Quality - i'd never purchased a kickstarter funded product and was worried. I needn't had, its sleek and with fantastic RPG detail.Replay-ability - Solo, multiplayer, cooperative, competitive its got them all.Allthough the gameplay is easy to pick up the game evolves as you go, and you can adapt it as you wish.It even has story/mission/objective cards to throw in later to spice things up. I've yet to deafeat the game so will be going back for more.Its worth the low price. Highly recomend.

The game is great fun! High replayability in minimalistic style, easy to understand rules and a perfect intro for tabletop D&D.I replaced the heroes and monster tokens to painted miniatures to have a better experience with the kids and they loved it.

-5 stars plus 20 temporary starsThe title is Bag Of Dungeon.You need to escape a dungeon. To win you must escape WITH the ring. The Ring Of Creation appears when the last tile is placed. Each turn you need to move, battle, use some items, and make the dungeon with APs (Action Points).My most favourite thing to do is (drum roll please) SLAYING MONSTERS!!!!!! My fave item is The Blade Of Death. I created The Blade Of Death (NOT with The Ring Of Creation LOL) with the spare item tiles. Spare item tiles are tiles to replace worn-out items/monsters or… create your own! If The Blade Of Death is your only item +6 to battle roll. If it is your last item (inventory full) +11 to battle roll.I wouldn’t change anything about the game. I love the game as it is so there is nothing I don`t like. It`s a good game because…you…can…kill…a…DRAGON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!- S. aged 7 &11/12

Written and designed by two very talented guys. Great for playing solo too and as a co-operative game. I cannot fault it especially as their are updates and extras available free from Gunpowder studios website. Fantastic.

I bought this game mainly for a one player dungeon crawler game. Once I saw the free extras you can get from the gunpowder studios; extra characters, magic items etc I thought the price reflected what I was getting and I wasn’t disappointed, the game is easy to play yet can be challenging and there are extra quests on scrolls to use where you have to rescue someone, escape the flood and there are 8 others.Best thing is that it doesn’t take long to set up and the game won’t take too long to play. I’ve enjoyed using my old Heroquest character figures and I love the mixture of monsters which you fight as you pull them out of the bag.

Such an easy game to get into and a lot of fun. Wander in and explore, collect loot and get out if you can get past the dragon who wants his ring back. You can solo it, co-op or all for yourself. Good bit of fun and great for kids getting into board games like my 10 year old son.Some newer rules online at the makers website which explains a few little things better but apart from that a good game.
On the face of it a lightweight dungeon crawler, in reality encourages a range of strategies within a rule set that is easy to grasp; an excellent excample of well-crafted design.

Always looking for the perfect little dungeon crawler.  May have just found it. Easy to set up, portable,easy to learn rules and quick to play with good replay-ability in like literally all the other dungeon crawlers out there.I have played it a number of times solo and love it.  So does my wife as it also takes up so little space again unknot gets.

This is a brilliantly simple game with some complex bits you work out the more you play, has excellent mechanics and a sense of unknown leading to excitement or dread depending on situation. Extra features are free to download on the website and add more to your game.

Fantastic game! Kept me busy during Covid19 lockdown. Played it solo and still yet to beat it, having tried probably 10-15 times. I love how it's different every time I play! I love how most games last 30-40 minutes so it's no big deal if you die.I've never played D&D before but I think this is the perfect entry point to that kind of thing.Brilliant quality tiles and great fun! Buy it!

I wanted a game i can play in a short amount of time yet still create a narrative about the adventure. This game provides that. The first couple of games the adventures didn't survive the beings in the tunnels, but on third try they managed to work their way out and escape with the ring of confidence, I mean creation.
Very enjoyable game which is great fun to play. Never the same dungeon twice in a row and rules are straight forward and easy to learn. Would definitely recommend.

Brilliant game, nicely done. Nice and easy to pick up and play. A great introduction and alternative to D&D. Instructions could do with a little refining as it’s not entirely clear with certain rules in the gameplay we came across. Would benefit to play with someone familiar with D&D but not necessary. Thoroughly enjoyable and adventures will always vary from one to the next so will never be the same.

Played a couple of times already and we haven't won the base game yet.The monsters are surprisingly difficult to beat and the luck factor is huge.Easy to learn, quick setup and most importantly it fits nicely in the small box.Hopefully there will be expansions to this :)

A fantastic game, the basic rules are simple to learn, my 6year old daughter knows them verbatim.The extra rules and online expansion sets are excellent and add to the game very nicely. I can not recommend this enough.
Amazing  game!!  Good quality.  Quick to learn. I played 3 games in a row using 2 of the characters.  Each was totally different. A great dungeon laying system.  Easy to take anywhere in its own bag!
Great gameQuick and easy to learnCan be played solo, competitive or co operativeWould recommend for anyone any age

Really good little rpg game. Great for kids and adults. Played several times now with my son and we both love it. Great if you are looking to introduce anyone to dungeons and dragons type of games. Easy to set up, learn and quick to play. Hoping for expansions for this.
Great little game, even played it with six year old-although he always wants to run in and kill the dragon on his own!
I bought this for my son for his birthday and he was really delighted. I would also like to say at how pleased I was withthe speed of the delivery.
Ideal fun for the family. My 10 year old loves this. It's also a good way to slip in some stealth maths with adding to dice rolls!
Great game and great support on line for your questions on Board Geek.
Great old school style dungeon crawl.
Awesome game. Loving playing it
Fun game. Easy to play. Quick to learn. Convenient size. Good quality
Good game for one person on lockdown
Brilliant little game that is easy to learn and will give you (and your friends) a different adventure every time it is played. I am looking forward to the next game this studio releases.
AAA+
Great game, no set up as you go it as you go along. No 2 games are the same
Great little dungeon explorer easy to pick up, fast play and handy enough to take anywhere.
Played it once as a family better than expected
best to be played with people that are a bit familiar with fantasy D&D type games.
Good introduction to roleplay
Super simples Spiel was Spass macht .

Tolles Spiel , die Original Regel ist nur auf Englisch, aber gut zu lesen. Nach zwei Testspielen findet man Spass .Eigentlich nur ein Manko, dt. Regel ist nur über Homepage zum runterladen, nicht in der Spielpackung dabei.

review_title: I want to love this game, but just cannot
review_description: At one time this was my number one most excited board game that I ever wanted to own.Now, this is my number one disappointment for games I've ever bought.  It's collecting dust and sits on my shelf.  Don't think though it's not because we don't play it or don't try to play it, because we did.  I kept pulling it off the shelf at game nights only to hear my Group of 4-6 players usually moan and groan, but I persisted.  I told them it would be different this time, that we could try a different house rule or online play variation I had read about.  We could get energy faster so the cards actually become usable, and we would remove many of the cards that just had useless effects.With each play, each attempt at changing playstyles on my part to make it fun for others, each time we tried to make it better it  just worsened for us.There is little to no point in every collecting energy and buying cards, the game just doesn't last long enough for that.  One of two things will happen in ever game.  Everyone will roll entirely for claws and go last monster standing, and in games of 4-6 you hardly get a turn or two before people are dropping like flies just from die rolls.  Or instead of claws some or everyone rolls purely for victory points, which can make the game even more boring and someone can win even faster.I just found in the end it wasn't worth even pulling to the table anymore.  Which is sad because, I LOVE the theme, the standees, the power up cards, the funny characters and powers.  I love it all as its individual components, it just doesn't feel like there is a game left over in the end.  You would leave everything in the box and just roll the dice until someone reaches 20 points and play the same game.I want to like it, I want to love it again, I just don't think that will ever happen for me or our Group.  I wanted to save this game so much in my collection that I even added the Power Up Expansion hoping it would fix things.  Sadly it also did not help.Great looking game, nice components, pointless parts of the game play and plays faster than setup and breakdown of it.

review_title: Great game, easy to learn for gaming newbs.
review_description: Great game. Quick to learn.  Playable for Non gamers.  For hardcore gamers it will get boring fast it you play several rounds in a row, but is an amazingly balanced good game in small doses.My game group uses it as a warm up or a night cap.  Or if we have a non gamer over!  A must own for the collection.Once players are familiar, games can take as little as ten glorious minutes of Smashing!

review_title: A quick fun game for the family, or a filler game while you wait for your last gamer friend to drive over/pick up food.
review_description: This 2-6 player game is fairly quick and simple to play. You roll dice like you would in Yahtzee, and you try and either accumulate points or knock the other monsters out.There's strategy, so it's not all dice rolling, but I would say that luck plays a bigger factor than actual skill in this game. But it's not as lopsided in the luck department like in Yahtzee by any means.There are also some cards that you can buy to either help improve your monster, or to help harm other monsters.All in all, it's a fun family game that doesn't take up a lot of time, and even younger kids can enjoy. There is the unlikely scenario where a person gets knocked out very early in the game, and if it's a child, she/he might be angry or upset that she/he has to sit on the sidelines whilst she/he waits for the game to end.

review_title: Good. Could have been great. Modified rules make it more fun for 2.
review_description: I write this review coming from a two player standpoint.Overall I like the idea. A battle of Kaiju over Tokyo. At the start, it's a dice rolling press-your-luck game. Glorified Yahtzee. But what makes this unique is the dynamic of not healing while in Tokyo, the ticking clock of staying in Tokyo, and the cards.What a shame, is that the game is over VERY quickly. And it seems like the cards and income accrual just aren't there before the clock runs out. I would much prefer it to last a little longer. Not using the cards are a shame because those are what makes the game more interesting!Modified rules can help and are likely needed. Such as getting two energy cube (currency) per die. Or double health ("die" then resurrect with a penalty, like a Street Fighter game).I really do think it needs a second revision to address these issues.But this is coming from the perspective of only playing in two player. A 4,5,6 player game may be totally different.

We love King of Tokyo. It’s easy to learn how to play, combining dice rolling (like Yahtzee) with monsters and power cards.  There are two ways to win, either get 20 Victory Points first or be the last monster standing (alive).This is one of our go-to games when friends are over (we enjoy playing games like Dominion, Survive, 7 Wonders, Pandemic, 6 Nimmt, Feast or Famine, etc).A game usually takes us around 30 minutes to play (even with 6 players, though we often play with 3).  We have so much fun, that most times we immediately play it again.We bought the Pandakai power up pack separately, thinking it would add a fun element, but we prefer playing the game in its original form. We do like having Pandakai as an additional monster option, though.It’s simple enough that 8 year olds and up would have fun playing this game, yet complex enough that it’s never boring.Our 4 and 6 year olds still play on “teams” with a parent, but they love to roll the dice.We are so happy we bought this game for Christmas (almost 2 months ago).

review_title: My husband and I loved this game
review_description: My husband and I loved this game. We played it together and had a great time. My husband does not like that much strategy games, but loves monsters and action games, so I bought this thinking that he would enjoy it and I wasn't wrong, he said this was perfect and actually had a very good time together. The materials and quality if the game is also very good, colorful and fun.

review_title: Great for family game night, beat up your siblings
review_description: Tabletop gaming truly has reached a great renaissance lately, and this is a perfect example of it.  This game is relatively easy to learn, and I'd say the monsters all acting identically is actually a strength because of its simplicity.  This is essentially a king of the hill game, with all the players acting as generic mega-monsters out to crush human civilization.  You're not the only one though, as other horrific B-movie monsters also want to claim Tokyo as their own.  You can either play a dominance strategy, trying to take control of Tokyo and bash all other players to death, or go for more subtle glory through star power (points).  Players that opt for the survival strategy risk getting bashed by each other player, but if they manage to survive, they can bring the pain to all other players simultaneously on their turn!  Players going for victory by points still have to worry about whoever controls Tokyo, or risk them quickly running away with the game.  It's a very interesting kind of "push your luck" design that doesn't take long to explain at all, allowing players to get right into bashing each other silly!  Although I personally prefer King of New York, or at least using the Upgrade Pack, this clearly has the widest appeal.  If this is "Yahtzee with monsters," why would you ever play Yahtzee again?

review_title: As Easy as Yahtzee - A Lot More Fun
review_description: Three chances to roll the six dice - keep whichever dice you want after each roll, just like Yahtzee! It is this quick, simple game action that makes King of Tokyo fast and easy to learn, even for beginners. Special features that make it more challenging than Yahtzee: When you roll Smash, you only smash monsters that are NOT at your location (inside or outside of Tokyo); when you roll Healing (hearts), you only heal if you are Outside of Toyko; and you can only leave Tokyo if you've been dealt damage (but staying in for a full round gets you extra victory points). So do you take the smash and try to last until it's your turn again, or bail out, forcing the smasher to go into Tokyo? Super fun, quick game. My only complaint is that the cardboard score cards use rotating dials that don't stay in place very well, you constantly have to adjust (did I have 6 health or 7?) - otherwise awesome game - great graphics, and super creative special power cards!

This was bought for our daughter’s seventh birthday and has provided endless hours of fun for the family. Easy to pick up, with just enough depth to entertain both adults and children, it’s highly reccomended! The mechanics are simple, but allow for strategy and planning, all of which can go out the window when the dice land a certain way.Although some multi-player table top games aren’t as fun with fewer people, this game holds up quite well in a duel situation, providing a different dynamic when only two players are present.We typically play the game with two adults and a child of 7; each time ends in a completely different way and is always enjoyable. The expansion sets provide enough variety to keep things fresh, should the base game become to stale.It’s not your typical childrens board game, but is highly reccomended for kids and adults alike!

Fun, fast and easy game for the whole family. To me it plays like a video game, but with more interaction and more fun. The art work is adorable and being a monster is fun. Once you learn the rules, it goes fast. My 8 year old son and husband LOVE this game. It was easy enough that my 5 year old daughter and I teamed up against them and won. She would roll the die and “advise” me on which to keep. She did pretty good too.) This is definelty a good game if you want something about 15 to 30 min play. (Unless you are like us and we play a couple of rounds because there is no way you going to let someone else be King of Tokyo. If you are a board gamer, add this to your collection. I’m glad I did.

My boys are 9 and 4. Wanted to find a game we could all play... you know, fun family game nights. WRONG. These kids are cutthroat! Aggressive, YOLO-style dice rolling. Healing? Who needs stinkin' healing. MOAR ATTACK! Secret alliances. There mom gets in on the action. It's their turn to roll... and surprise surprise, she needs me in the kitchen for something. I come back and amazingly, the kids have rolled exactly what they need. *grumble grumble*I'd knock a star off the rating for making it TOO easy for kids to play... but really, it's not their fault I get outsmarted by my kids.

My new favorite board game. The different ways of winning (killing people, scoring points, using cards to power up and then score points) make for great strategic complexity and replay-ability. My friends and I have a lot of fun playing this and it's became a new favorite board game. The art and names of cards are also quite charming. If I had to nitpick, it feels like combat is a bit too powerful - in maybe 75% of games, the winner wins by killing the other players rather than scoring points. But that could just be our personalities

Easy to learn?  Check.Special abilities to be gained?  Check.Monstrous (tee hee hee) combos to be created?  Check.Easy for childen (at least as young as my 8-year-old nephew) and adults (up to 63 so far :) )???? Check.Massive replayability?  Check (probably played about 40 games over the last year or so, and enjoyed them all).Loads of fun?  Check.Bought this for myself, family, and friends (100% of whom have enjoyed it)?  Check.Assurance that you should buy it?  Check.Check, mate.

review_title: If you want a simple but still fun game, get it.  Now!
review_description: I can't believe how simple, fast and fun this game is.  My 8 yr old absolutely loves it, and every time he's taken it to school for a class game day he tells me it was the most popular game of the day.  The only time he doesn't take it is when my 10 yr old is faster than him and snags it 1st.  I sometimes wish the different monsters had something to differentiate them instead of just the look of the cardboard play piece, but the formula to keep it really simple is working like a charm, so why change it I guess?  This is like Yatzee but cooler for kids.

review_title: The mechanics are simple enough that my 7 year old nephew could play and have fun, but complex enough that my friends and parents ...
review_description: Quite possibly one of the most casual board-games that I have ever played, each game taking 30 minutes give or take. The mechanics are simple enough that my 7 year old nephew could play and have fun, but complex enough that my friends and parents enjoy playing it as well.The only reason it doesn't get 5 out of 5 is that the monsters only represent the players and have no special abilities of their own. Flat River Group eventually noticed this flaw and came out with an expansion that gives all monster uniqueness.That expansion is called POWER UP!, and I recommend getting it at the same time if possible to get the complete experience, but the original is still a fun stand alone game.

review_title: Amazing game to get kids and new players into board games
review_description: This game is extremely easy to learn and very fun. I pull this out as an introduction for people new to board games beyond Monopoly, and it has yet to not be a hit. I have even gifted it to my nephews and they enjoyed it as well. If they can learn Yahtzee rules, they can learn King of Tokyo (and this is even easier than Yahtzee!) Recommended for new players and experienced players alike. It is a light-hearted and fun game that you can pop out between those long sessions or as a family game.

review_title: Fantastic Board Game for Light Game Night or Family Fun
review_description: Fantastic board game for a light game night or fun with the family.  Easy setup and a relatively short playtime make this a great pick for a game night.  The random power cards mean that the game will not get stale - and the dice add some drama!  Playing with my 2nd and 3rd grader often, and they can form strategies on their own (stay in Tokyo to get points and risk death, or flee to heal up?).Would recommend this for sure!

review_title: A game that the whole family will enjoy.
review_description: Turned into a family favorite. A game I can play with my 8 year old grandson and yet i still enjoy as an adult.Recently my son, his wife, and children went on vacation for a week and borrowed some games from me including this one. My daughter-in-law enjoyed the game so much that this was the only game she wanted to play so everyone had to play it over and over again. Kind of burned my son's family out from playing it. So don't make that mistake. Don't go over 5 times in a row playing it in a 48 hour period... Great game, but don't go nuts playing it.

Well made and entertaining game. I own a good number of board games and this is probably my second favorite dice game right behind BANG. I like how there are different strategies to win the game but strategies that are too difficult to understand that a first time player wouldn't have a chance to win against a veteran. The best way to win (i.e. try to kill off other monsters, go for power cards, go for victory points) will change depending on what gets rolled and the decisions of other players. My kids (8 and 5) both understand the game play and can play independently, however, the youngest still needs suggestions such as don't just buy a card just because you can. This game plays from 2-6 players but I think 4 is really the sweet spot. When you go more than 4, two spots open up inside Tokyo where your monster takes the most damage and I feel there is less skill involved, you can get thrown into Tokyo almost every round and not be able to heal during your turn. It feels more of a game of survival than planning out your best path to victory. Definitely worth a spot in your collection, especially given the wide age ranges that would enjoy playing it.

We purchased KOT because we want a goood family game with a little luck involved.  Something we could kick out brains out of gear from playing Catan, Pureto Rico or Ticket to Ride, something with luck involved.  So, we ha heard & reviewed KOT and decided this dice game would do the trick.  We love KOT so we bought the power up expansion thinking we would like extra powers (it sounded good).  However, we didn't like it!  It slowed the game down, there was way to much going on....too many cards for us and we didn't like it slowing the game down to figure out what your vards did, because you had so many. So, KOT is a great game, but not big on the power up.

If you enjoy dice games, this is a great one.The game mechanics are simple and easy to learn. The fact that you get to roll the dice 3 times mitigate some of the luck of the rolling and I like that.There is definitely strategy to be had in this game.That's not to say it's on the level of grand Austrian hotel or a eclipse by any means. Fun, light, and quick I can play a game with 4 people in about 15 minutes.

review_title: My kids love King of Tokyo
review_description: My kids love this game.  The great thing about king of Tokyo is that it is easy for kids to learn and with the purchase of an expansion the complexity of the game can be increased which adds play value to the game for adults.  The base game itself is also fun for adults, but if you want to add variety or complexity to the game it is easy to do with an affordable expansion.

review_title: Easy game. Punch your friends in the face! Buy it.
review_description: What makes this game interesting is the powers available to buy.A little bit of RNG because in order to complete actions, you need to rely on dice rolls.The art is great.I bought this game because I had played it previously and wanted it enough to own it myself!Buy it.

Picked up the game on sale and I've only had the it for one weekend now but I've played at least ten rounds as it was a hit with my friends. The game has a great blend of strategy and luck. Each game has a different feel to it with different cards. I've played the game one on one and with four players and the dynamic changes with the amount of players too. I personally enjoyed it more with more players. Very well designed game and Im looking into buying expansion cards to add on. Would recommend to anyone who enjoys board games, especially if it's on sale.

review_title: I'm a big fan of this game, play it ...
review_description: I'm a big fan of this game, play it and King of New York with my friends every chance we get. This version is an artwork update with some characters replaced. Now that the evolution expansion is out, I can say the replacement characters are very unique. The version I received of this was actually the Target exclusive edition, which was unexpected. It comes with Baby Gigasaur instead of normal Gigasaur (he uses the same evolutions in the expansion, something I was unsure of until it was released). So do note you may not get the exact edition pictured on Amazon.

This is a really innovative game.  It just doesn't play like any other game that I have tried.  It became one of my family's favorites right away.  It is not terribly difficult to learn and has some solid replayability.  What's not to like- being a giant monster on a rampage of destruction.  The power up cards make you really think about strategy.  All around solid game.

I won't go through how to play, since others have done that, but this is a great game that hits home for a lot of different genre lovers. Play time can vary significantly, so, depending on how things shake out, short attention spans may falter before the game ends. My only real criticism of the game is that players can be eliminated (potentially pretty early on), so that leaves them with nothing to do until the game ends.

I'm torn here. I think the game really is a 4 star game, but I have to say since we purchased King of Tokyo and King of New York, they sit on the shelf and collect dust. When the wife and I played the game with 3 or more players it was fun...but it is very short and kind of dull with two players. So, keep that in mind...I think it works best with 3-4.

All the contents in the box are super high quality. Even the box itself is high quality! The game is also fun. The dice makes the game really fun because it makes a nice blend of chance and strategy. All the monsters are full of character and are aesthetically distinct from each other. Wouldn't really recommend playing with only two people though.

review_title: Easy, fast and fun. Great game.
review_description: This is a great “gateway” game. It’s easy to learn, easy to teach. It’s a fast game to play (30 minutes). The only think to keep in mind is that it’s an elimination game, so if you’re the first one out, you could be sitting bored until the game is done. Overall, this game is great fun and you’ll never have trouble getting it to the table.

review_title: A lot of fun for a variety of ages
review_description: A lot of fun for a variety of ages. I bought it to play during the Thanksgiving festivities. The kids, the parents, and even grandpa got in on the action. We had a house rule that you had to say your characters name in a dramatic voice whenever you entered Tokyo. It was great!

review_title: Chunky dice. Easy to learn.  Fun!
review_description: This game is easy to learn and lots of fun.  The creator is Richard Garfield who also designed Magic the Gathering.  It plays in about 30 minutes. The stand-up cutouts of characters look cool.  I've played the original and this version.  It's essentially the same game with some altered artwork and characters.  The instructions have been made clearer in this version.  Cards make the game different every time.  Players love to roll the chunky dice.

review_title: Dice and Card game, NOT a board game
review_description: Description says "board game", but it doesn't count as a board game simply because it comes with a [relatively tiny] board. When the only interaction that you have with the "board" is moving onto the board, or moving off the board, it doesn't count. Those looking for a traditional board game (i.e. MOVING around a board) should look elsewhere, otherwise this is a "dice and card" game of entertaining value for all ages. I recommend it.

If you're looking for a game to get both the kids and the adults involved in, then look no further. Such a simple concept, yet endless laughter and fun. The biggest struggle is watching spouses go at it and deciding if they should attack each other or not. This is King of Tokyo, all gloves are off!

review_title: We Are a Huge Game Playing Family
review_description: This is a great game for families that play once in awhile but there are not a lot of ways to mix it up if you want to play a lot. Maybe we weren't playing right but the game went pretty fast and didn't leave a lot of change to want to play it again.

review_title: Fun, family friendly and easy game
review_description: This game is fun for my family  (5 yr, 10yr kids). We also really enjoy this game on adult game night. I purchased a package of green lighting bolts to use in place of the energy cubes. Do yourself a favor and treat your family and friends to a battle to the death in Tokyo!

Got this for my sons birthday, he loves board games and monsters, he loves it. Instructions are pretty complex I’ll say, but that hasn’t stopped him. He adds in his own part to the game and describes his attacks on the other monsters.

Man, we love this game. You can knock it out in 10 minutes and it's very exciting.Between this and King of NY, I like this game better.  KoNY adds significant complexity in the form of the army tokens. I like this game better because it's easier to learn and it doesn't bog down while players decide what to do like KoNY.. It's just "roll them dice as fast as you can and hope for the best".

review_title: A Great Fun Game got Friends and Family!
review_description: The game is really fun to play, easy to learn, great for family, and friends. My siblings always want to play this game. It’s addicting, fun, and competitive. I mean hack you play a giant avatar monsters ready to fight and destroy each other lol. Who doesn’t love that.

review_title: Excellent game, a necessity for every board game enthusiast
review_description: This is probably one of the most played games in my portfolio.  I love this game and it gets a lot of table time.  It works for casual to serious players, has a lot of different strategies, and isn't luck heavy enough to unbalance it.  It fits a broad age range, and is fun to jump into a game anytime.

review_title: Best board game we have ever played
review_description: My family and I have been playing this game at least once every night for the last two months. The learning curve is fast, and the game is extremely fun. I would recommend this game for any board game night.

I cannot say enough about how much we love this game!  As a family of 5, it's sometimes hard to find a game we can all play and that we all love, but this one is the bomb!  It sounds much more confusing upon initial play than it really is.  I say it takes about 1 round and you're on your way to total Tokyo domination!  We even play on adult game nights and it's been loved and obsessed over by everyone who plays!

review_title: Super fun even though it came with a broken piece
review_description: The penguine score card keeper was broken when we opened the box. The brad doesn't stick so you can't turn the wheel, which is too bad since that is everyone's favorite character.My six year old can play this game and I enjoy it too (40 year old). Even my teenage daughter likes to play with us. Rules about some of the power cards are a little confusing - wish they had some rules clarifications somewhere.

I bought this after my sister brought hers over and I knew I had to purchase it. She has the original and I was so stuck on those characters but ended up purchasing this and it really does not make a difference. I don’t know why I was so worried about it.But this game is the BOMB. I’ve gotten board game haters to love and request to play this. Holla!

Lots of fun for family, both 7 and 12 year old enjoyed it along with adults. There are several different ways to win so each person can develop their own approach which makes it more complex and fun.  I will say it takes either an older kid or adult to walk through rules, there are aspects of the game that are not difficult but take time to understand, once you get them though it all  adds to the gameplay.

review_title: Great Game For The Whole Family
review_description: This game is great! The kids and the adults love this game. Our 7 year old plays with no problems and can easily win. Our 5 year old still needs a little help. The rules are simple and easy to start playing without having to read page after page of directions. The artwork is fun and colorful. We all have our favorite monster to use. There is not a lot of pieces and it is easy to set up.The average game goes about 20 minutes with 4 people.This has been a great addition to our family game nights.

review_title: Fun game, easy to explain to others (my 11 ...
review_description: Fun game, easy to explain to others (my 11 and 9 year old nephews LOVE it).  But you can definitely do more strategy as you learn the game better, by purchasing different combo of cards.

This game is super fun, love it!! Once you learn it, it isn’t too complicated. And can be a quick fun two player game, or a little longer 4-6 player game. Also, works to play over video chat, if the other people have the game too, we played with 8 players and 2 boards!The monsters look a little scary, so wouldn’t have thought about playing it at first lol,  but ended up loving it!

review_title: One of the few games that my players enjoy across the board
review_description: One of the few games that my players enjoy across the board. I have a picky group, and this is a game that they will almost never say no to. It can be a little hard on new players in that pushing your luck at all almost always results in an elimination from the game. Once that lesson is learned the hard way, everyone tends to have a great time.

review_title: One of the best games of this century with an artwork update
review_description: King of Tokyo is definitely a five star game. For us it has been the better gateway game than Catan because it's faster paced and you can play off-the-cuff turn to turn. This second edition didn't break anything. Really, it's a cosmetic overhaul.If you have King of Tokyo, you're not missing anything gameplay by skipping the second edition. If you don't have King of Tokyo, why aren't you buying this???It's a dice game. I've heard it called Yahtzee with monsters. And yeah, I can see that, but it has a lot more. There is a lot more interaction than Yahtzee with the battle theme. There are heavily unbalanced cards to collect and play, but that just adds to the outlandish gameplay. There's definitely more luck than strategy, but there's a real opportunity to make choices with what luck you're given. In a game of 4 people, you can all four go different ways in trying to win and it's hard to say which strategy will take it all. It's a great group game and is my church youth group's favorite game and I got this second edition to have a copy at our church.As far as the new version goes. I like the old artwork better. All the artwork looks more plasticy. The new board works the same with updated artwork of the same scene. And the Kraken is gone!!! Who in the world decided that a 3-2-1 Penguin poser was better than the mighty Kraken? "Release the penguin" in a small squeeky voice is just not the same as a thunderous "RELEASE THE KRAKEN". The cyber bunny has been replaced with cyber kitty--who cares. The card back and front artwork is updated (I think the card info is pretty much the same). The dice and energy cubes are the same.The possible problem is the lack of compatibility with expansions. Some of the expansions expect certain characters, and they've said there will be a version 2 Powerup expansion. So don't buy Powerup to go with this yet. The Halloween expansion that few like will not be updated, and the Halloween card backs are not compatible unless you put the cards in sleeves. I own the Halloween expansion but have never taken it out of the box so I can't speak for how much of a loss that is...The rules have been clarified slightly and I understand that the cards are also slightly clarified. But if you have version 1, you can get the rules from iellogames website and use them with version 1!So really if you have version 1, there's no reason to move up unless you have a strange penguin fetish. But if you don't have King of Tokyo--get this game! It's a lot of fun to play with 4-6 people.
Arrived in good condition and on time. The board is sturdy - better than others I've seen. Checkers are plastic but durable. Perfect for playing checkers with a grandson.
The checker game set was well enjoyed by the grandkids this summer at the beach.  Good for Rainey days. Highly recommend.
I bought this to teach my granddaughter how to play but I was disappointed when it arrived. The checkers do not stack and keep sliding all over the board when playing your Kings!!
Love the checkers game! My family and I have lots of fun playing it!

review_title: THE PUZZEL IS VERY  GOOD MATERIAL AND THE COLORS ARE TERRIFIC I LIKE IT...TED
review_description: I USE THIS WITH MY WIFE,GRANDKIDS AND FREINDS..GOES TOGETHER WELL AND STAYS TOGETHER.. GOOD FUN...TED
Great games,the kids love them. I'll be back.
Brings back old memories
Good sturdy board and box. Durable. Exactly what I was looking for.

The checkers are not regulation size, they are tiny, plastic and not stackable. So once you king someone they won't stay together. Also. tiny size makes them hard to handle for kids, the elderly, and people with arthritis. Very disappointed
Our grandson loved receiving this as one of his birthday gifts!  It will bring many years of fun to him, his friends and family members!
Great gift for grandson
Both colors missing one piece.  Unplayable. Checkers do not have ridges to lock together when kings. Returning...

review_title: Definitely a thumbs down for me😔
review_description: Pieces are not stackable so you won’t be “Kinging” anyone in this game! Doesn’t  fold in half it folds in four even though it’s a standard size. Definitely a thumbs down for me. Wasn’t ideal for a gift at all in my opinion.

My 6 yr. grandson wanted a game of checkers, he really enjoys playing this game. Maybe it is not as durable as the older checker board games but it does the trick! His 11 year old brother enjoys playing now too. Nice to see them put their devices down for a change!

review_title: As described but checkers aren't like they used to be.
review_description: Bought this aware that it was not the greatest checker set in the world. You get what you pay for, almost. The checkers are small and kinda thin but they do have serrated edges so that they will stack on top of each other. The board is paper but sturdy enough for children to use to use. Looked for a set with larger checkers and larger board but could not find one.

review_title: The checkers won’t stack when you have King.
review_description: The checkers don’t stack well on top of each other. So if you “King” your opponent the top checker keeps sliding off. A poor design.But the boards isn’t flimsy.

The set does what it's supposed to do. You can play checkers on it. It's just feels like a $5 game. I could have got the same thing at the dollar store. I would save your money and buy something a little bit better quality.

review_title: It was so easy but no.
review_description: Checkers don't stack to make a Mo g. There’s no ridges or anything to make it stay in place. They just slide off when you move them.

review_title: Too cheap when they were priced more than many others
review_description: The board and checkers are very cheap.  The board is thin and doesn't lay flat so when you slide the checkers, they catch on the seams.  The checkers are thin and cheap and have a little plastic notch on the outer edge, like left over plastic.
Disappointed that this was "Amazon's Choice" and surprised it had an average rating of 4 stars. The checkers don't lock together when you make a king. :(
Non stackable

review_title: You get what you pay for.
review_description: I  disliked that the King checker board looked proffesionaly packed but apparently someone doesnt know how to count checker pieces. Four black checkers are missing.Too frustrated to send it back.

The game arrived in very good shape, the shipping box was intact and durable.  The game board and the plastic pieces are fine but not the quality we "used to get many years ago." However, the price was right and worth the $(dollars). I bought the mid-priced game.  I know it will be fun to play the checker games with this set.

review_title: checkers are thin, and so is the board
review_description: Bought these to teach the grands an old-fashioned game. I was disappointed with their quality. The checkers were no thicker than the board. It does come in a quarter-fold game set which is easier to store.

This checkers set is nice except for one important feature. There is no edging on the checkers that allows a kinged checker (2 checkers on top of one another) to stay together easily. This is really unfortunate and makes playing difficult for kids.

I guess this set is ok for the price.  The "chips" are very thin and don't fit together very well.  The board folds into quarters.  The chips don't move smoothly over the middle fold. The board is a decent thickness and seems sturdy.

This is a good beginning checker set for children or the occasional player.  It's not so flimsy that it is going to tear or fall apart with normal use, but it is about what I expected for the price.  Plastic and cardboard.

review_title: Pieces look like they came from dollar store
review_description: Checker pieces look nothing like actual checker pieces but it does the job

It was probably worth the $10 I paid for it. Board is cheap and thin. Checkers are very cheap plastic. If I hadn't got it on a lightening deal, I'd have sent it back.  I haven't lost a game yet though, so maybe it's blessed 🙏
It made so cheap. The checkers dont stack. Poor quality.
I got this for my grandsons birthday. He opened it yesterday to play with me and to our disappointment one black checker missing... not good

I ordered two checker sets, one for my house and one for my granddaughter.  Needless to say that when my granddaughter opened her box she found that the box was missing the checker pieces... poor QA QC
Both of the games were very small not what I would think is a standard size.

review_title: Read your verified reviews before purchasing
review_description: The checkers are small and have NO serrated edges to hold them together when you are crowned...big disappointment. I’ll give it a 2 star because the board and box are sturdy and very nice. I’ll try to order better checkers separately if I can.

Pretty standard old style red and black checkers game plastic pieces bout 1.5 inch diameter folding board divided into fourths pretty sturdy folds into small box the pieces do stack but not perfectly and theres no extra pieces at all

review_title: This inexpensive checker set has been enthusiastically used by my great niece and great nephew.
review_description: My great niece and great nephew had been unsuccessfully using chess pieces to play checkers. Having a real checker set was very appreciated.
I was worried that this would be a very flimsy board but it was not it is very nice. The checkers have the grooves in them so they work very well.

review_title: Did not pack the checker pieces in the box
review_description: All we got when it arrived was a checkerboard no no black and red checker pieces
Board folds to a nice compact square. The checkers themselves are nicely finished with no rough edges.
Didn’t think it was all that great, but the customer service was outstanding.
Quality of product was good.  Shipping timely.  We enjoy playing the game.
Is missing one checker piece. Only 11 black checkers/12 red. Would have been okay if all pieces were included.
Our set only had 23 checkers! We are missing a black one.
We use this checker game for seniors at our church church functions.  It works great.
This old tried and true board game is great for nursing home patients
I bought this for my 9 yr old grandson and he loves it!
Feels good to play again, just don't make the checkers like they used too.
This game is to play with the family.
I know things run much smaller in size over there, so I ordered a 3X. Thought for sure it would fit it even baggy. Nope. Wont even go over my chest as I tried putting it on
Never been a fan of the cut board but otherwise very sturdy and priced Right!

Must buy for families amd gamers alike!Trekking is great! The second edition is easier to teach, shorter to play, and more satisfying to play. The game has gone from  ' i think i can teach this to my mom' to 'grandma is going to love this!'. Components and pieces are top notch. The player pawns, tents, stones and bear are all chunky and feel so good!

review_title: Fantastic family game from littles to adults...including teens!
review_description: I bought this game for my 15 year old son for his birthday. It was the same price as the video game he wanted, and this was the WAY WAY WAY better choice. He has played it more than once every single day since his birthday, and I’ve even found him sitting around reading the national park cards and planning out where he would like to go someday! The whole family enjoys the game from the 7 year old up. The video instructions were fabulous and made the learning curve of how to’s a snap.The price May seem high for a board game if you are comparing it to the $10 you’d spend to buy sorry or clue, but for an interactive game it is pretty on par with others. And if you consider the other alternatives for your $50 this is a no brained. You can barely take a family of 4 to the movies for that much (let alone a family of 8).We’ve had great fun with this game, and I would definitely recommend buying it!

We are really enjoying this game. At first the set-up seemed a little daunting, but after doing it once, it's fairly simple. It was fun to learn about the parks as we played and it encouraged family conversation about traveling. A unique game!

I purchased this game for my family. But mostly for my 8 year old Granddaughter. I have been to 25 parks and I want to spark a love in her to travel and visit our parks. I even purchased the companion guide, we read about 1 park each time we play the game.

Fun!!!! Once we figured this out we had a great time playing this game. Not that it’s hard to learn, we’re just lazy.  This is the second edition so if looking at YouTube make sure you choose the correct video
Easy to Learn and Play.  I would rate it as one of our three favorites along with Catan and Carcassone.

Our family really likes board games and national parks so we were all excited about playing this one! After Christmas lunch we watched the video, then played in teams, slowly and referring to the instruction book. We helped each other for awhile, but once we understood the rules, it got crazy with competition and booting each other back to start. So much fun! It took about 30 minutes for all generations to catch on. My in-laws are in their 80’s and have been to most of the parks. Everyone enjoyed hearing about their memories. Here’s a picture of our winner. We will play again soon since we’re taking it on the next family vacation. The whole family recommends Trekking the National Parks.

review_title: Kind of like Harry Potter Monopoly
review_description: My headline is the best analogy I can offer.  The game itself is OK and has a fair mix of strategy and luck.  Quality of the pieces and documentation is high.  However, despite it's name, it's not a game about the National Parks.  The National Parks  have nothing to do with how you play.  It's also about as informative about the National Parks as reading a post card about them (basically the park cards in the game are a single post card about the park).  So, if you buy this, forget the National Parks aspect and buy it based on the game play alone. I'd be OK with all of this if it were not for the price.  This is a $10 game in terms of it's uniqueness and play that costs 5x that much.  If you've played any of the Ticket to Ride games, you've played this already just like if you've played Monopoly, you've played Harry Potter Monopoly with just different names on the cards, board, and pieces.

review_title: Shame on capitalizing on the national parks name with a game that midas well be monopoly
review_description: We thought it would be fun and educational , it Midas well be just monopoly with a whole lot more rules and difficult to learn . They are capitalizing on the national parks . we found it to be thumbs down in every category , not even fun - not one teaching moment anywhere

To start with, I am an avid board gamer with a big collection of board games. At the same time, I also loves the outdoors. With a friend's recommendation, I picked up this game hoping it will be a good game I can play with my kids. I thought I was just getting a basic simple family game but I was wrong. This game is simple to learn yet offers enough depth even for gamers!This game is well produced with quality components. The cardboard, cards, plastic beads, and wooden tokens are well produced. The game play is very engaging as there are multiple objectives you can choose to go for. The rule can be easily learned within 10 minutes from the rule book, and taught within 5 minutes. The theme is great and is integrated with the game play very well. I love the pictures of the parks on the cards, accompanied with informative text that are very educational for kids and adults alike. Overall, I'm very happy with game and it will stay in my collection of games for sure!

review_title: Great Idea but Needs More Development Time
review_description: We are an avid game family and love to try new games in hopes that they'll become those family favorites that create memories. We've played this game a dozen or more times now and feel really comfortable with the rules/strategy/that sort of thing and while the concept is great (I mean it is basically a copy of Ticket to Ride but not as good). Every time we play it we are always commenting on how it would be better if this, or it should have been like that, or more of this, or we would have added/deleted/etc. and we've never done that with any other game we've played. So its like it needed more development time to really hone in a set of rules/cards/tokens that makes more sense and would make the game more interesting and exciting. It feels like a lot of different ideas were crammed into one game and a big mess came out. I mean its called trekking and claims to be about national parks but despite the cute game pieces, you don't really get to set up camps as much as you'd like to or use the bear. It isn't the worst game or a bad game, it just could have been much better with a little more thought and definitely not worth the $50. Just buy a ticket to ride.However, if you're looking for a family game and are concerned its for older kids/adults, its NOT 10+, our just 5 year old plays this game without any difficultly and scores just as many points as adults (as does my 9 year old). Also, the 'leather' bag is a waste. It isn't used in the game at all and is just for storage in the box? And while that is 'nice' it doesn't make a ton of sense. But the game board and tokens and cards are all of a good quality, it doesn't feel cheap.I really wanted to love this game though, it just needs something more/else to it....

review_title: Great game for kids and experienced gamers both!
review_description: I love this game.  I had the pleasure to be able to experience this game from its earliest stages, and it keeps getting better.  This family friendly game is a great combination of educational game for the kids, but still full of enough strategy and different play styles that experienced gamers will enjoy it over and over again.  I actually own an original version, but when I saw that it was getting a new release, I had to buy another copy to give out as a great holiday gift for some game loving friends.  You won’t be sorry with the play, the education factor, or the artwork of this game. Enjoy!

review_title: Great Family game, fun for all ages!
review_description: Great game for the family and friends. Fun game that changes play by play. Learned a lot about America's National parks, some of them I didnt even know existed! Overall great buy, endless fun.

Pros - The game parts are very well made. They feel nice and sturdy in your hand,  and they are visually pleasing. The board and cards setup pretty fast. Game play moves pretty fairly quick. Victory Points are gathered in several ways and we were surprised by who won the first game. You Camp at  (occupy) some parks for points, collect stones, and buy (acquire) other parks. You have to play a few times to grasp the diversity of total points earned. On the first game we played, I thought I was losing, with only 3 parks acquired, but I ended up winning when all was tallied.  It changed the way everyone played the second game. I'm looking forward to playing more and devising my strategy.Besides being a good, competitive game, it is fun to learn all the National Park names and locations. The game sparked a lot of fun player conversations and interactions. Game play had a mix of quiet, concentration on one's next move and joking, ribbing, helping and misdirecting conversation.Con - The one con I have is that only 5 players max. can play. My game group is 3 couples, 6 players so I am limited to play when I can find a smaller group. Hoping a player expansion will be available in the future?I very much recommend this game, especially if you love to camp and hike and enjoy the National Parks!

I bought this game as a family gift for Christmas. My 12 year old granddaughter and I played it for the first time this weekend and we really enjoyed it. First, make sure you watch the video before you attempt to play the game. It is very helpful. Second, use the cheat sheets, also very helpful. We didn't read the directions except as things came up like the special gifts that come with each park occupied - make sure you read those in the rule book to fully understand them. We both enjoyed the variety of things you can do in the game and the strategies involved. There was no way to tell who was winning or losing until everything was scored at the end and we enjoyed that. The quality of the game is excellent with a rugged board and sturdy cards and pieces. I would have gladly given this 5 stars except for one glaring issue. The map is incorrect. They should have taken the time to have each state clearly outlined accurately on the map.

This game disappointed.  It's not really about the National Parks.  It just uses a map of the National Parks as a template for the game.  This is an expensive game that isn't that great.  I was super excited because we love national parks.  Darn.

Our 11 year old grandson and 15 year old granddaughter dove right in and played a round. Instructions are visual and easy to understand. The same evening we played with them and found it to be fun as well. Good strategy game and lots of options for winning points.

review_title: Too complicated & doesn't offer a learning opportunity about the National Parks
review_description: This game is not at all what it appeared to be and I wish I would have returned this while I still had time.  I'm a trivia buff, especially when it comes to nature, and my mother loves games of any kind.  The biggest disappointment was the lack of information about the National Parks, their ecosystems and the animals that live in them.  I thought this could be a learning experience but instead, it was a HUGE opportunity missed by the people who created the game.  Other reviewers aren't exaggerating how complicated this is and it is in no way suitable for a 10 yr old.  We spent close to an hour trying to understand it before giving up.

review_title: Beautiful, fun, so easy to learn!
review_description: I'm a hobby gamer with a large game collection, but I still love finding games that can be enjoyed by family and friends who aren't into board games as much. This game is a knockout success! It is certainly inspired by Ticket to Ride but is ultimately a very different game that I believe will be easier to learn and get "good" at than Ticket to ride for most casual players. The game is beautiful with an extremely high quality board, lovely cards (the park cards are huge!), big chunky wooden player pieces, and even the box is super thick.I am honestly stunned at the reviews who say they couldn't figure the game out. If you want something a little better than Uno or The game of life, this is as easy to learn as you could ask for. The rule book is perfect. It's rare that I have zero questions after reading the rule book just once. Keep in mind this game is now in its second edition which did make the rules easier. Maybe the negative reviews are all referring to the first edition which is no longer available. In any case: wonderful family game with lovely art and components!

review_title: Awesome game for family game night
review_description: I am so happy with this product!! Exactly what i wanted... great game with the family

I was hesitant to purchase Trekking because of the price.  I was afraid that it wouldn't be fun.  I was wrong!  We read through the instructions and then watched the video just to solidify our understanding and to tie up any questions we had.  The video made starting a breeze.  I feel like the game is good for both younger kids and older kids.  Younger ones can play straightforward while older ones can be more strategic in how they move, what they are planning, etc.  The game lasted the perfect amount of time.  Overall, I do think the game is pricey and I appreciate the pre-Christmas sale but it's a lot of fun and it's a game that won't just sit on the shelf.  The cards are very pretty.  I love that each park card has an interesting tidbit of information about the park.  I do wish each state would be labeled as that would be a great teaching tool to younger kids.

review_title: Read the rules ahead and you'll love it!
review_description: I bought this to hype my family up for a national parks road trip we're taking this fall. I have one big piece of advice. Read the rule book in its entirety before playing. It seems a little complicated until you get through the rules and you realize it's not that complicated at all. I read them and my 9 year old daughter read them and we were successfully able to guide our group of 4 kids and 3 adults (adults helping kids) through the game. Everyone loved it. Then the kids went to bed and the adults pulled it back out. A game usually took about 20 minutes for the grown ups. Played 3 more games with my daughter the next day. We really love this game and I don't see it getting old.Our first round we played with children 5, 6, 9, and 9. The nine year olds had NO problems with the rules or the strategy. Obviously it was a bit much for the younger ones, but they weren't about to be left out!! They played with adult partners. I would say that after a round or two with guidance, anyone 8 and over could easily play and enjoy this game. Someone said it was too hard to figure out who the winner is but the 6 year old was able to tally his points without help, so......I was really hesitant to spend this much on a game, but it's definitely a new family favorite, and the board and pieces are of a really nice quality. But it's not a game you should try to "learn as you go" like I usually do for new games. Read the rulebook. The video they send you to does NOT adequately explain gameplay.

review_title: very impressed with the quality of the board and pieces
review_description: I have had my eye on this board game for several months. I was hesitant to buy it because of the price tag. I have never spent $50 on a board game. However, my love of all things national parks won out, and I treated myself. First, let me say that the quality of every piece of the game is extremely high and impressive. The quality of card stock used is very good. The board, itself, is great. The pieces are very good quality. The game was fun to play. I like the fact that it took an hour for us to play (only two of us). I hate a game that ends too quickly. My husband and I went with slightly different strategies. He wanted to gather as many stones as he could from as many parks as he could. I focused more on acquiring the national parks or camping in the parks. In the end, I won by a small number of points. It reminded me ever-so-slightly of monopoly, but in general, I would say this is a unique game. We will definitely bring it to game night with our nieces soon!

review_title: Fun once you figure out the rules
review_description: Purchased this because we have an interest in visiting as many National Parks as possible once we retire. Hoping this will let us learn about the lesser known parks. It did take us a little bit of time to figure out how to play. The learn to play video was a start but really had to go over the written instructions a few times. Once we had the concept down we just had to start to play and it all came together. Definitely not for children. But the 4 adults who played had it figured out pretty quickly and we had fun playing. On each of the park cards you attempt to "win" there are fun facts about the park. Whoever won the card had to read the fun fact to the rest of us.  In the end, we all enjoyed the game and learned about a few more parks. I'm sure the 2nd time we play it will be even more fun. Knocked it down to 4 stars only because it does take a bit to learn all the rules.

Bought this game for the family for Christmas...we played it probably 6 times in a row because we had such a good time! The game is set up to give you enough time to come back from behind, but not drag on forever. It seems a little complex when you first start, pretty much every game is while you try to learn it, but once you play a turn or two it becomes very basic and easy to fly through the game. There are different strategies involved, but it is isn't complex, so younger ones can enjoy using their own strategies. It took us about 45 minutes to play each game. They really did think of every scenario and the rules make it easy to continue along. There is even a video tutorial to learn how to play. This is a great game for a family, I'm not sure I'd be totally into it if I were playing with a bunch of adult friends, but I couldn't get enough of it with my kids and I love them learning geography and about some of the national parks! This game was definitely a hit and worth every penny.

review_title: Great, fun family game that quickly sparks interest in our national parks
review_description: We just received the game today and immediately broke it out. Our first impression of this game is that it’s fairly easy to learn, easier to set up, and fun to play for most ages. There is definitely strategy and planning involved but not completely necessary to play. Our 6 year old just moved around collecting stones and, with a little help, managed to get a couple parks. He obviously didn’t win but it was still engaging enough for him to stick around. The rest of us had a lot of fun racing to parks across the U.S. It has already sparked interest in getting out there and seeing the places in person—which makes me love this game even more. The only con is that the kids were a little disappointed in the purpose of the bear. To remedy their disappointment they decided its job was to chase around and torment anyone who got sent back to start.

review_title: Well worth the money.  Great for homeschool too!
review_description: This was a good buy.  I played with my 11yo & 8yo.  Once we got the hang of the rules it was surprisingly fun and we were disappointed when I got the last stone, ending the game.  My 11yo said "aw!  I don't want it to end.).  My 8yo had a harder time grasping the motive but once she did she was very clever.  She started collecting the highest pointed park cards - all the 10 pointers.Also, the board, cards and game pieces are a good quality.
