We haven't played it yet but so far so good everything seems to be in good condition and worth the money. My boyfriend obsessed with friends he loved it.
Fun spin on a the classic monopoly

review_title: Vino la caja rota! Pero muy bueno!
review_description: Me encanta el juego!  Pero vino con la caja un poco rota... esto es muy importante como objeto de colección!

review_title: Great game for fans of Friends
review_description: My kids love Monopoly and we enjoyed playing a new one.
as expected
My daughter is a Friends fanatic. She absolutely loves this game.

review_title: The one with the MONOPOLY game
review_description: Great for all Friends fan!

I was so excited to open this package until I saw the box was ripped and torn. I am very disappointment. If I am paying for something that is suppose to be brand new I expect it in mint condition and this game was certainly not.
Lots of fun

review_title: Friends fans and monopoly lovers must have
review_description: Cool, chandlers token threw me off but then I couldn’t think of what else it could have been..lol
Haven’t played it. But the box came pretty damaged which is very unfortunate!
Really great game for game night with friends and family! Arrived on time as well.
Family funGood Quality
Great game, although there are 3 spots where the pics don’t match the words. :(

review_title: Perfect gift for anyone who loves friends
review_description: My daughter loved it!  Good quality and fun for the whole family.

review_title: Must have for any FRIENDS fan!
review_description: LOVE IT! Must have for any FRIENDS fan!
Happy to add this to my games
Great gift!
If you like Friends and Monopoly this is perfect. My wife is a Friends fanatic and was thrilled when this came in. Classic monopoly play with a hilarious Friends theme...what's not to love?
Good value and competitive pricing. Corner of box was damaged. That was the only reason for the 4 stars.
Great, I love friends and I love monopoly
This game, is way cooler than I could have even pictured and I haven't even opened it!
It really brings the friends world to your table. So much fun for friends lovers. I like this version even better than the original.
I'm a Friends fanatic.  So, of course,  I had to have this. It's so fun!
Perfect for any Friends fan. Super cute.

Best game ever. Just like the original I loved growing up. My kids love it. It was a little tricky to get the game started at first. The instructions say to press and hold the center button to start the game. However, we had to press the center button as well as the side buttons down to start. I thought it was broken at first but it works fine now.

review_title: Mall Sadness! Defective Electronic Device. Does not work!!!
review_description: I preordered this game. I installed 2 different sets of brand, new batteries but the electronic device does not function. Without the electronic aspect of this game, this game is useless. Seems people are receiving defective devices. I’m so disappointed.

Electronic device does not work! I tried 3 sets of batteries- returned it and got a new one and same issue! Just read other reviews and seems like everyone has the same problem. I also pushed too and side and held down middle as stated in directions and that doesn’t help. Such a disappointment because it took a while to set it up.

review_title: Good, but not as good as original
review_description: We still have and play the original Mall Madness all the time so the anticipation level for this was high. It’s still fun and the male out of stock voice is hilarious. However, it is set to be done after 6 stores (which only lasts about 15 minutes) so you are restricted to a quick game. Also, after playing for only a couple of days, the cardboard store list is already a little damaged from the marker pieces.FYI, like many other reviewers, I thought it was broken even after trying multiple batteries. Turns out, you have to hold down the celebration side button, not the center button as the diagram shows.

I was so excited to get this game. I even pre-ordered it and it doesn’t work. The main part of the game which is the electronic part doesn’t work. I installed new batteries even went out and bought different kind and it doesn’t work. My daughters and me are so disappointed
Electronic console did not work. Clearly quality control is lacking on this game judging by the number of others writing the same thing. Id avoid purchasing until Hasbro fixes this problem.

review_title: Absolutely perfect!!! Purchase now before they get sold out!
review_description: Preordered back in February and was not expecting delivery until October but much to our surprise, we just received our mall madness game today. It’s great! Brought back so many memories of when I used to play this growing up with my sister and our friends! Being able to play the game with my 8 year old daughter and watching her have fun(especially when reality of how fast money goes when you buy things) was great as a mom to be apart of! Its a fun game but also teaches about how to be smart with your money, to consider sales and clearance before regular priced items because that will make your money last longer. It’s perfect! Great quality!! Highly recommend!!!

I bought this for a family game night. It's now our favorite board game. Works well for all genders and ages. Initial setup took some time and I wish the play money was better quality however, for $26 this was a great deal. It's kind of like playing monopoly but no one gets mad at each other. They included "Boy" players so it's good for all kids.Id love it if they made a nostalgic version with 80s mall stores. No phones no TV just sit around and laugh together, good times.

How disappointing ! planning game night only to find the most important part doesn’t work. It’s not talking**Edited** read a review that you have to push not only the center button but the center and side buttons at the same time to activate the electronic mechanism.  Thought the replacement wasn’t working but after doing this we have it going!

review_title: Fun game once you figure out which button actually starts it
review_description: Great game once we figured out which button we were actually supposed to push. At first when we went to set up the game we tried to pushing the middle button bc in the instructions it appears as though that’s the button you press, however, it’s actually one of the side buttons that has a party/celebration picture...we had a good laugh once we figured it out. Just as much fun playing the new version as the original from when I was a kiddo.
Doesn’t work, tried multiple different batteries

So. Much. Fun! I had this game when it came out in the 90s and this version plays very similarly to the original. Only four stars because the shopping list cards get torn so easily when putting the pegs on them. I wish they had made them plastic OR provided cardboard and clips that fit together better.

review_title: Do not buy - electronic unit doesn’t work!
review_description: Been waiting for months for the game to be released and shipped only to have received a defective electronic unit:( Much disappointment after my daughters had set up the game ready to play to find out the electronic unit is broken.

So I LOVED this game growing up and recently purchased it for my girls. We have been SUPER careful with the game but the shopping card markers have ruined the shopping cards :( They are all ripped and look horrible from the game list markers after two uses. I would love to figure out how to get them replaced.

review_title: Ordered 2 and both electronic devices do not work
review_description: I ordered 2 of these games.  Please check the electronic device first.  After setting up the entire game, we tried using the electronic device and it did not work.  I switched out with every battery I had.  I decided to exchange and the new one did not work either.  I used batteries from a working device and no it did not work again.  Ugh just a waste of time.

Dang. I was so excited to play this. Pre ordered it, got it early and the electronic part doesn’t work. I returned to Amazon and was sent a brand new one. Same problem. I’ve tried multiple sets of brand new batteries and still nothing.

review_title: Try the side button and enjoy this nostalgia!
review_description: I thought my original speaker was broken but did some troubleshooting and found out you press the button on the side, not the center button like it looks in the picture. My 8 year old daughter and I are having so much fun playing this. Although it’s not exactly like the original I remember, I think the smaller game board speeds things up a bit which I appreciate.

review_title: Exactly as I remember. Best game ever !!!
review_description: This is just like I remember as a kid. All 3 of my kids agreed that this is the most fun game they’ve ever played. They didn’t even care who won. It was just good fun.  Unlike any other game you can buy. LOVE IT!!!
Speaker does not work. I have received 2  games now and they both are defective.

review_title: Fun but cards are destroyed after one game
review_description: Super fun! Different from the one I had when I was little but still fun.The cards are terrible though. After 1 game putting the sliders on, rips them apart.

review_title: Electronic game piece didn't work on 2 separate orders of this game
review_description: On the first order of this game, the electronic piece didn't work at all. Got the replacement and that electronic piece on that one didn't work either.
When my daughter was younger this was her favorite board game.  When I saw this new edition I bought it for her daughter and they both enjoy playing it together.
I received two and neither of the electronic consoles worked. Very poor quality. Returning.
The main electronic piece does not work!!!

review_title: Going to be a fun game!
review_description: I was happily surprised to receive this early but disappointed in the shape of the game box. This was supposed to be a gift.
Does not work
Great game and the kids love it! Just like the game from the 80s.

After gifting this, the speaker part doesn't work!  I'm outside of my return window so too bad for me, I guess. Buyer beware!  If you're getting this for someone else, go ahead and open it up and test the little speaker thing.  Otherwise you're gonna be stuck with $25 of useless junk.
People be sure to hold down center top button or side button to initially start talking.  Love it as much as when I played it 30 years ago.  Just missing stands for the people.  Kind of annoying
Fun game!! At first I thought it didn't work, but I realized that you have to hold the button down to turn it on (written in the directions actually).
Just as good as the original!
I loved this game as a kid and now play it with my daughter.  Hello how cool!  same silly voice i remember.  Cant go wrong! so glad i purchased this.

I was so excited to see this game released from my childhood.  I preordered it and it came over a month before expected.  It was easy to setup and learn to play.  We had a great time and our girls loved it!

So excited! It feels like forever since I heard it was being re-released! Very pleased it came a month early. I am disappointed the “Chichin” is no longer in the mall! Great game had a blast playing with my kids!!!

review_title: Not so much of a clearance
review_description: Fun game. Would have rated at five stars, But the prices in the game were way overpriced for my liking. $175 for a giant chocolate unicorn? Get real!

review_title: Would be great if it work correctly.
review_description: Ours does not work right 🙁 the computer does not announce when someone has purchased 6 items. We were so excited to get this game but so bummed that it don’t work right.

this was my favorite childhood game. My sister bought this for my birthday. She lives out of state so I have resorted to playing with my three year old. He loves it. The money number skills and space moving is great practice. The game is practically the same but here are my complaints: (note I have only played as a 2 player game) the game seems to go very quickly the electronic system has us going to atm like every 3rd to 4th turn so you never run out of money, it also gives us large amounts of spaces to move, so like every turn you can buy something. The game setup takes forever, i wish the store signs stayed put but they always fall out and I haven't figured out how to put game away without removing the top store signs. The game has black markers to k keep track of what stores you have been to, they tear up the cardboard boards. I wish the credit cards were plastic because the cardboard bends and gets destroyed.  Overall, still happy to have this game.
Love this game! Make sure you read the directions when turning on the electronic part, you have to press and hold the celebration button!!

review_title: Poorly executed, no replay value for adults.
review_description: This was a highly anticipated game for me, but didn't hit the mark. The premise is quiet simple, you move your ship towards the end goal with as much cargo, and as many people as you can. There are a few strategic things you can do, but the game itself is largely luck-based and the winner won't feel like they did anything to win. The jokes are all very funny if you're a Disney fan, but, a typical four player game goes through all the cards around 3/4 times, so they get old and repetitive. The mechanics of the game are worn out in the first 3rd of the game, and there's nothing interesting on the board to run into.The only value I can see is a good introduction as a middle ground between typical family games and more strategy games for young adults and up - this is what you'd play between monopoly and Catan to get your 12-14 year old child introduced to more complicated games. Too many moving parts for those younger.I really wanted to like it but doubt we'll ever play again.

So listen. If your an avid board game player this game might seem dull. I happen to enjoy the nostalgia of the art and theme more than the actual gameplay. If your looking for a massive epic game this isn’t it. If you want the Disney experience and the funny puns, get it. Unlike other reviews I see replay ability with it. And yes the dice are supposed to look dirty.

This was actually very fun.  I bought it because I'm a big Disney fan and Jungle Cruise is one of my favorite rides.  Its a little confusing with so many directions but once you get it down, it's fun.  Basically you have a boat full of passengers and you collect cargo and lose passengers along the ride route and when you get to the end, you count up to see who kept more on the boat.  The cards have the skippers jokes on them.  The game it's self is very high quality.  No cheap  flimsy pieces.  It's a solid game.

review_title: Fun and funny entry level strategy game.
review_description: The game has some very strong elements.  The board is well crafted and sturdy.  The art style and layout is very true to the ride.  The puns and jokes, for fans of the namesake ride, are spot on.  I agree with other reviews that the jokes can get repetetive on multiple playthroughs, but if you've been on the ride more than a few times you've heard them all anyway.  They are charmingly stupid jokes, and it's just fun to roll your eyes and go with it.Set-up is quick but there are quite a few pieces to track.  Gameplay seems more complicated than it really is initially, but once you get the flow you can start to develop something akin to a strategy.  If you are a fan of the awesome Villainous series of games by the same company, this doesn't approach that level of strategy or complexity.  My 7 almost 8 year old started to get the hang of the game after a few turns.Overall a fun little game.  Not something I'll play all the time, but it is one I'll bust out once in a while when I need a stupid laugh or want to experience the silliness of the ride from home.

review_title: Fun game with a disney theme
review_description: Like many games once everyone knows the rules it is pretty straight forward, you should understand most of the rules after your first play through, if you have any experience with other strategy board games.It is fun with just enough strategy, the passengers that are worth the most points changes each game and is a mystery to the players early and based off of your luck with rolling die helps to lead you in the direction of trying to maintain your passangers on board or if going for sets of cargo makes more sense.Overall I see enough replay value for us to enjoy this for a while, you do go through the jokes after the first game, but they are lightharted and themed to the jungle cruise ride, some of which I have heard in person on the ride.

review_title: A bit of a disappointment for Ravensberger.
review_description: I am a Disney fanatic.  And when I heard that Disney was making another film based on a theme park ride, it was a no-brainer ordering this game.  Ravensberger is an excellent company and to date, I have never really been disappointed with anything that they've produced.Many people will say that a game based on some kind of intellectual property is doomed from the start.  I must disagree.  I have purchased Jaws and Jurassic Park, both made by this same company and have been delighted to see the integration of the theme into the game.  It's always refreshing to see how little nuances in the plot of the film make their way into the mechanics of a board game.  And, after reading through the rules and watching the video on youtube, the premise of this game sounded like another home-run.The problem though is that the game mechanics become worn out very quickly and at a certain point, everyone just wants it to end.  The repetition of drawing hazard cards and dealing with them EVERY SINGLE TURN is the idea that brings this game to a screeching stop.  I am very surprised that play testers didn't say the same thing.  It sounded great when I read the rules, but when you actually start to play, it gets old very quickly.The quality of the components are top-notch and I wanted to love this game.  Although I will keep it in my collection, I do so only because of what it is themed after.  I will only be able to use this with nieces and nephews - they won't complain about the repetitive nature of it (I hope!).I still place Ravensberger on a pedestal.  I forgive them for this atrocity.  I gave it two stars because the game components are amazing.  If you are looking for an entertaining game to play with people your own age, don't buy this!

review_title: I hope we get more Disney Ride games!
review_description: My husband and I have friends we love to have game nights with, and while we usually opt for more strategic and in-depth stuff, this is a great game to pass time with. It's very simple to learn, super easy to play, and if your love for Disney is anything like mine, you'll enjoy the jokes on the cards and artwork! It's not a game we will want to whip out every game night, and we may not play it super often, I still feel like it has a space on your board game shelf. I feel like Disney kids could also grasp the concept easily, and would be a great family game.Even if your family isn't Disney obsessed, I still think it's a great game to get introduced into board games. If your a hardcore gaming group looking for something to add, I doubt this game would be for you (if you are a hardcore group, and love Disney, check out Villainous.)Recommended by me! And I look forward to the new Haunted Mansion game coming out later this year.

review_title: If you love the Jungle Cruise and board games, you need to own this game!
review_description: This game is simple enough to learn and the concept is unique enough to not feel boring or overdone. Really enjoyable for my family, some of whom were previously Skippers. My Skipper family members wonder if the people who worked on the writing in this game are also “retired” Skippers based on style and certain sentiments in the rules. It really seems like the writers knew their stuff about the ride this game is based off of.We also have the Ravensburger Jurassic Park and Jaws games and those are both also really enjoyable. It seems like Ravensburger always does a great job of making games that are unique and vastly different than other games in our collection.If I was told I had to make one change to this game, it would be the same change I’d make to many of my favorites; I’d love to be able to play with more than four players without having to do “teams” or having someone sit out until the next round.

review_title: A must have for families and Disney fans
review_description: We preordered this game, really excited for it after loving Villainous and craving more Disney fun. It didn’t disappoint. It has the right objective to make it “feel” like the jungle cruise, and even has classic jungle cruise jokes and puns throughout the game.We felt it was very easy to learn, even for kids. It has a simple mystery aspect like Clue and simple dice rolling/card drafting to avoid the perils of the river. There are different strategies to employ, but really you could just go through the motions and still have a shot at winning. It’s all the luck of the dice.We thought the materials were very high quality. The dice especially are weighted nicely and even appear like they were found on the Jungle Cruise which is fun!All in all it’s well worth the price and something we will always enjoy playing when Disney fever sets in.

It's a new family favorite, fun and easy to learn. Even our five year old grandkids can get it and they often win even when we try to beat them. Strategy is simple and it isn't just roll and go like most kid games. I worked at the attraction myself for 17 years so I know most of the jokes, but there were some that even made me laugh having not heard them all. I was disappointed that most of the jokes are repeated at least twice in the deck (and it's a huge deck) when there are so many jokes they could have included from 50 yrs of Jungle Cruises. Still now my whole family wants their own copies but they are sold out everywhere so fast. Get yours if you can.

review_title: Meh. I would pass this one up if I could do it over.
review_description: Theme is strong. It is pretty to look at. The gameplay is very meh. I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone it is very boring and uneventful. While the game has decisions for you to make it is obvious what the thing you should do is leaving you with an illusion of choices that is very transparent.

Seriously such a fun game! The jokes are punny just like on the ride and there is some strategy involved in winning! I just played this with my 9yo niece and she caught on pretty quick (however she is used to playing games listed for 14+).  All the adults playing had just as much fun trying to bring their passengers and cargo to the port. It is definitely one of our family’s top favorite games now- right up there with Villainous, Ticket to Ride, and Dominion.

We had a family trip we had to cancel this spring for Disneyland, and so this game really helped soften that blow for my kids!Lots of fun and silly jokes -- you'll be sailing around the backside of water as you try to keep your guests in the boat for the ride and win the game!Great family fun for kids as young as 6 (if they're accustomed to playing games).

review_title: Highly recommend for the Disney and Board Game lovers out there.
review_description: We are a family that lives board games and Disney. It is a bit long and seems complicated at the beginning. It really isn't once you get going. If you are a fan of the ride, you will love this game!  Make sure you allot extra time to play it on your first round.
Awesome game!  Easy to learn and great to play with family.  Works well even with only two players. Love it!
Once you have learned the basic set up and rules, you will have a blast travelling around the board and crowing a winner in this pun-filled fast moving adventure!

This game is such fun! All parts are of excellent quality. I will admit that it's a lot to learn but the instructions lead you step by step and are easy to understand. There are many twists and turns and once we got the hang of it, we couldn't wait to play again and perfect our technique! I highly recommend this game!

Travel down the world famous Jungle Cruise and try to score the most points by delivering passengers and cargo. As you navigate the river, you will encounter dangers, outposts and come across clues. Once you get the hang of the rules, which doesn’t take long, the game moves along quickly. Fans of Disney’s Jungle Cruise ride will enjoy this game, as the cards include some of the ride’s classic jokes and there’s new jokes too. Happy to have added this game to my collection.

review_title: Fun once you learn the rules
review_description: It’s one of our favorite rides and now it’s one of our favorite games. The amazing puns are a fun addition to the game.

review_title: Lots of moving parts for a family game
review_description: The game looks like it could be pretty fun, we took it out last night to play with the family. There are so many moving parts that and chills just gave up. I think the concept is decent for a family game, but the piece count and set up might be a huge turn off.Going to try this one with my core game group and see how it goes post pandemic, but if you’re looking for a family game, this experience might be a little heavy for them. So for a Disney game meant for family, this gives out a very confusing vibe. Lots of moving parts and hefty rulebook.Anyone who is going to buy this should definitely know the piece count before buying (close to 100.)

review_title: A great strategy game for Disney Parks fans.
review_description: A seriously fun game! You gotta play through once before you start to pick up the strategies to know what you’re doing. Fantastic art work by — just glorious. Highly recommend. Pro-tip: play the Jungle Cruise Boathouse music loop to enhance the mood. :)

review_title: A decent board game for the Disney fan
review_description: This is a good game for the younger set, as it is a much "lighter" game than Villanous. Very easy to understand, and also very luck based, which may turn off those looking for something with a little more meat to it.Speaking of meat, I took away one star as they left out my favorite character from the Cruise: Trader Sam! Heads should roll for this travesty!

review_title: Lots of fun, once you get used to the rules.
review_description: My family had a blast during our first play-through. Plan on some extra time during the first one or two tries, though, as the rules take some getting used to. A lot of fun in the end, captures the spirit of the attraction.

review_title: Great Board Game for the Whole Family!
review_description: Love that Disney came out with this game. Great for any Jungle Cruise fan like myself. Great for the whole family. Yet I would suggest 10+ due to the nature of the game. Just like the ride as all aspects were thought about.

review_title: A little confusing but a fun family game
review_description: I love this game! It will take a time or two to truly get the gest of this game though because there is a lot to understand. It is fun once you get the hang of it though.

We’re big board game and Disneyland fans so this was a great purchase for us. The game is fun, especially with all the puns on the cards. It is a long game though, so keep that in mind for younger ones who might get bored.
Game is cute. Fun for a family of all ages.So, I bought another to gift to a Disney loving friend and the entire box was ripped and bent. Not cool.
The game itself is adorable and super fun. Prepare to set aside some time to familiarize yourself with the rules though, because there’s a lot.

review_title: Must Have for Disney Parks Fans
review_description: A must have for Disney Parks fans. I love the jokes and puns that are included in the game. Everything is well made and fit the appearance of the ride.

Cute game, fun for someone who loves the Disney attraction but lacks real strategy. Disney fans will like this as there are typical cast member / Skipper jokes on each card. (House Rule: you must read the joke) Fun game to pull out for a game night but not one that will become a household favorite.
Great game! Perfect time killer. Makes the family miss Disneyland.

review_title: Great game with a Disney touch
review_description: Great game for kids and adults. Keeps you busy for about 40 to 60 minutes. Very nice game board and details. Brings the fun from the attraction to your home!
Not Ravensburger's best offering but still a fun game for the whole family.
Super fast delivery & great price.  Thanks

review_title: Not new to me, game box was open and crushed
review_description: Box was open and ripped. The shipping package was fine so this was not a result of shipping. Not new as described.

review_title: Many days late and still hasnt arrived
review_description: Im really excited about the game but it should have been here days ago

review_title: Easy to learn, but too long to play.
review_description: We really wanted to love this game because we really enjoy the ride. Plus, the components are awesome. It's very well made.Unfortunately, the gameplay isn't very engaging. It's very luck dependent and there aren't many interesting choices at all in the game. Not much strategy. And as such, it's way too long for a game based on the luck of the dice rolls.See our full review at The Board Game Family website.

If you’re a Disney fan then you would enjoy this with your friends and family. You will see some familiar jokes shared from the Jungle Cruise Skippers. Advanced gamers may find this game too light. It is for the younger generation. Some of the game mechanics are roll and move, set collection, and deduction. I wish they could come up with some expansions to cater to advanced players because there’s a whole generation of Disney fans that are missing out.
Given as a gift. Board was cracked on the back side of seam. Poor quality control.

review_title: Don’t Let The Cuteness Fool You!
review_description: This game is more mind bending and crazy than you think. Don’t let the cuteness fool you. This game is by far the most competitive and fun party game to play with friends!! The special cards mess with you mind!Pros: hours of fun, cute drawing style, unique packaging, easy to playCons: may result in red hands, strain of voice from intense playing

Pros:It's fast pacedCatchy nameFun for the right groupCould be short or longSimple in a good wayWould make an awesome drinking / drunk gamekids would like thisCons:You could hurt yourself or others with the slapping if you're too vigorous.If you're just bad at fast reaction games, you will never win.With the wrong people, this game would just be a total bummerThe rule of "no flinching" is stupid and you will probably house rule it outAbout my experience:Okay, so I've only played this once so far, but the results were outstanding. I played with a group of 4 people who just wanted to play games and have fun. It was hilarious, because we were so interested in slapping NOT LAST that we were slamming the table too hard. Some cards require actions before you slap the cards like beating your chest or the table first. We would go too hard at the start until we realized that it's not how hard you slap, it's how fast.Players who were not as good at card recognition fell behind. Some of the cards are coloured differently to try and throw you off. It's not who slaps first, but who slaps last, so you just have to be faster than one friend. I can see how playing this with boring people who are too serious could really put a cramp on it's style.

Beware of slapped hands :-) What a fun somewhat physical card game. Simple game to learn and our 10yr old loves it.  Rules are simple: If spoken word from player matches the card played everyone slaps the stack of cards, last one has to take all the cards in the pile.  Although this can be fun for all ages, I think the sweet spot is 8-12yrs. With so many dumb kids "board games" out there, this is a game that as a parent I don't mind playing over and over. It can at times feel a bit like the card game War where it can drag on at times but if played strictly by the rules it can go pretty quick.
This game is hysterical! I played with my 7 year old daughter and my 70 year old father and we all enjoyed it. I haven't laughed that hard in a long time!

review_title: My family's new go-to filler game
review_description: This card game is perfect as a filler or starter game because it's fun for everyone and very light (simple) to play.  It's a game of reflexes essentially, and kids seem as good or better than the adults at it!  I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a fun, quick card game for parties or family game nights.  Just be advised that after a few games you'll want to move on to something else with more depth.  But this is great for what it is!

We got this for our 9 year old daughter for her birthday. While she was upstairs playing with her new gifts, my husband and I decided to try this game out. Well to our surprise it was so much fun, a tad frustrating because you get competitive and want to win! It got violent though, my watch thought I had taken a hard fall and needed SOS! lol #facepalm It might be a bit too rough for our daughter, but maybe we just need to tone down the competitiveness when playing with her! We like it!*update. Our daughter loves it too! Great family game all around! Can be played as a two player, but the more people you have the more fun it becomes!

Move over slap-jack there is a new hand crushing/finger dislocating game in town! Lots of fun for everyone!Playing with just adults brings it a step harder. We tend to go as fast as possible. Watch out flinchers.Side Note: The narwhal has become my nemesis. I am always last.
I wasn’t expecting much but purchased new to the reviews. We have a lot of games that we play with our kids to laugh. This is everyone’s favorite now, and the one they always want to play.
Seems a little bizarre and complicated at first but absolutely hilarious when you figure it out.  Can get vicious and a little painful with competitive people LOL.

We love this game!  I got it with my eight year old in mind but we were able to teach our four year old too.  Basically you each take turns flipping over cards and saying the words in order (first person says “taco” when they flip a card, next person says “cat” etc.) regardless of the card you flip.  So if you’re first you say “taco” even if that does not match the card you actually turn over. In the case that what a player says does match the card they flip, everyone must race to put their hands on top of the pile.  Last player to do so takes all the cards.  Object is to get rid of your cards.  There are silly special cards here and there which require you to all do a silly movement first. I would say a six year old or older could play.  Like I said, our four year old could figure out the rules, but she was slow to get her hand to the pile which got frustrating.  Fun game for on the go and even adults can have fun with it.

Played with my 9 year old son and adult friends. We laughed non stop. A bit of advice (or warning) make sure people playing have trimmed their nails....or be prepared to wear safety gear LOL a total blast! I'll be buying this as gifts for friends and family!

I was looking for a game that would be quick to play, keep everyone's attention, and be able to be played with a diverse group of players.  Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza fits the bill perfectly!  We opened up the box of cards, read the instructions, and were off to great fun.  It is so silly that elementary kids find it a delight.  It is so fun that adults laugh over how ridiculous it is. (I hope you can understand that this is a good thing.)  The game is great good clean fun. A game lasts around 15 minutes; it's a great party game. I would say that the game is good for ages 8-55, too much younger and they won't grasp the concept, too much older and it will be too silly or physically tasking.

Cards came with greasy black stains on almost every surface. We tried our best to wipe them off but it only worked to smudge the grease or ink even more into the cards. We're really upset because we were using this brand new card game for a free library program for children.

This game is hilarious! I gave it to my nephew for his 11th birthday. We were able to start playing within moments of opening the deck and reading the directions. There were five of us, two kids and three adults. We laughed so hard we couldn’t stop!To play the game, you go around the table each saying one of the words taco, cat, goat, cheese, pizza in sequence and throw down a card. If the card matches the word just said, everyone has to slap the card. The last hand to slap, has to take the deck. To add to the fun there are special cards: gorilla, groundhog and narwhal. For these you have to pound your chest like a gorilla, knock on the table or clap your hands above your head before slapping your hand on the card.One word of warning...the game can get a little rough during the slap down, so rings off and nails clipped!

review_title: Not Your Average Sit Down Card Game
review_description: I got this for my daughter's graduation party and let me tell you.... it was a HIT!  Such a fun game, keeps you on your toes, definitely uses your mental acuity (really... it does!), and it makes for a lot of laughs.  It's just a fun, old fashioned type of game (i.e. no electronics.... unless you want to video tape all the fun you and your friends will be having with it.)

The game is fun to play with a group of 4 or more people.  My kids are 7, 6, and 4 and the two older ones didn't have any problems picking it up.  Just a note, if you're playing with kids, try playing first without the Gorilla, Groundhog, and Narwhal, and then add them in as the kids understand the game better,My only gripe was with the quality of the cards.  The artwork while unspectacular, is nice.  Buit for a game that has so much physical action involved in it, I would've hoped that the maker would have sprung for better quality cards.

review_title: Holds up to even the biggest of messes!
review_description: I buy a new game for each of my kids every December and we play them as our advent activities.  This one had so many 5 star reviews, I knew we had to give it a try.It is so easy and quick to learn, it takes about 2 minutes to read the whole rules, and 1 minute to explain them.  The deck says it's for 2-4 players, but we have 5 people, and just dealt out less cards.  We will be buying another deck, though, so that we can play with lots of friends.Besides how fun this game is to play, my biggest complement is how they held up to the biggest mess we've ever made just playing cards as a family.  DD just couldn't contain her laughter, and Christmas punch was spit all over her stack of cards!  After laughing as a family for a few seconds at the ridiculousness, we quickly got the cards under some water, and then let them sit out to dry.  Luckily she was close to winning and had only 8 cards left.  I figured these cards were ruined.  BUT I was wrong!  They dried just fine, and only 2 of them have a little waviness on a corner.  In the whole scheme of how the game is played, two marked cards aren't going to make a huge difference.We highly recommend this one!

review_title: Super fun with adults, two 6th graders, and 1 8th grader
review_description: I had so much fun playing this game with my nephews and friend last night (ages 12-32). we're all pretty competitive, so we played pretty fiercely (a little blood on your knuckles from the action of 'knocking on the table' is normal, right??). It was a great mix of easy to learn without being too simple. The game comes with quite good directions, but I'll summarize, in case it helps anyone to make a decision...-Divide the entire deck between players-cards stay face down in front of you & you win by getting rid of all of your cards-one at a time, each player flips over a card in the center while saying 'goat, cat, etc' (always the same order listed in the game title)-when the word aloud matches the flipped card (saying and seeing cat, for example), everyone slaps the middle pile- slowest person has to add those cards to their own stack-there are a few different types of action cards, like gorilla, and when a gorilla card randomly pops up, you have to beat on your chest and then slap the pile (again, don't be the slowest or you get stuck with the pile). The action cards, especially, created a lot of laughs!If we didn't know who was slowest to slap the pile, we usually did rock, paper, scissors between the two most likely suspects. Most of the time, we knew and confessed to being the slowest and took the middle stack of cards so we could keep the game going. It was a bonus that you had to pay attention or you usually got stuck with extra cards- kept the tempo of the game high without the normal pauses of people checking their phone or getting a snack. Every time my mind wandered, I got stuck with extra cards, much to the delight of my nephews. Can't blame them- teenagers aren't the only ones who get distracted! ;)After the first night of trying this game, I feel like I've gotten my money's worth already. Two thumbs up!!

This is one of the most fun, and simple games. It seemed like it might be fun when I bought it, and it was! We played it at Christmas, and brought it to a friends house on New Years. Everyone had so much fun playing it on New Years, that I bought our friends a copy before we even left their house. It has been successfully fun with ages 5+ (we just leave out the flinching rule for the little ones).

review_title: It was a no for us
review_description: Kids did not like it. Ages 7&10

Bought this to play with friends and everyone loved it. My only complaint is that with regular use (such as flipping up a card and hands slamming on them) they bend and wear relatively easily. Expect some general wear. Otherwise great game!

review_title: Hilarious, quick to learn, fun for all ages
review_description: I have now bought 4 copies of this game--one for myself and 3 for extended family members. Everyone loves it! One family uses it with their adult children (ages 18-27), one family with teenagers and special needs kids (ages 18-10), and my older kids (13-5) all love it. The younger kids are obviously a bit slower with their reactions, but it's a game that adults can play with kids or other adults and still enjoy (unlike most games for kids--I'm looking at you Candy Land!). My kids will even take it to their friends' houses and play with them. I love that it's a game kids can play with other kids, or adults with other adults. That's rare. Plus the hours of laughing at my brother-in-law as he curses the narwhal cards were well worth the $10 for this game.

I love games. All kinds. Especially board games. However, my wife and daughter only really enjoy card games. I bought this for us all to try. My wife an I have 7 children. 6 Boys and 1 Girl. They range in age from 19 down to 5. So far, I have played this with everyone, as a group, but the oldest two and everyone loves it! It's laugh out loud, interactive, fast, funny, and easy to learn. Buy it. Add it to your collection. You will be happy you did.
I purchased it as a gift so that I haven't tested the game itself.It's the size of a standard set of playing cards and slightly thicker as shown in pictures. This works as a stocking stuffer.

This may be the most fun we have ever had playing a game as a family. We love, love, love playing games and do it often. I bought this game to give us one more thing to do during this covid-19 quarantine. This game is a blast. Easy, fast-paced, and hysterical. We have not laughed that hard in a long time! My 14 year old and 12 year old were super into it and wanted to play again but my voice was so hoarse from laughing and yelling that I just couldn’t handle another round (I did win though!). I can’t wait til we can socialize again and play this with a big group of friends.

review_title: This game is "pee your pants" fun!!!!!
review_description: Do yourself a favor and watch the YouTube let's play video about this. I cracked up laughing and bought this after watching the players beat eachother up. My 13 year old daughter and I played this with 3 family friends. I won't name names, but somebody wound up laughing so hard they peed their pants. My only caution is make sure everyone cuts any long fingernails before playing, especially if players are super competitive. Battle scars are a thing. I can't recommend this game highly enough - it's SO amazingly fun!!!!!

We love it. I thought there was no way this game could really be as good as people were saying. Bought it to give it a try and was pleasantly surprised. Our whole family ages 5-35 had tons of fun laughing at each other. I was super glad to beat my husbands hand down to the pile until his came down on top of mine. Minor ouch, but could probably be solved by wearing thin gloves. At any rate, it was lots of fun. It's great when the whole family can laugh and agree on something.

review_title: A big dud as a family game
review_description: I got this for a new family game. It sounded really fun but . .  . unfortunately my (college graduates) family members read the instructions and said it would be too hard to learn. They wanted something easy to learn and play immediately. It didn’t fit the bill at all. I sent it home with them and asked them to try and find someone interested in using it before tossing it away. The good news, the game  didn’t cost much!

I was looking for a new card game to play with the family, especially one that our 8 year old boy could play. I saw the reviews for this product and the high star rating. For ten dollars, I figured I would give it a go. I am glad I did. This game is so much fun! It is very easy to learn and silly at the same time. Expect people getting loud, laughing, and so forth. Our boy requests playing this game often. I believe some of the motions for special cards played was a genius move to not only add variety, but it keeps young players engaged. You never know when the gorilla or groundhog card, for example, will appear and require you to react a certain way to get rid of the cards. Highly recommend it. If you have a rather large gathering (6+ players), you may want to buy two decks so you have enough to go around. I have done 8 players on one deck, but it would have been more enjoyable to have more cards as you need to distribute all cards from one deck. Hence combining two decks will give players more cards. Anyway, grab this fun and silly game!

I purchased the card f game for my son and I. I read in the Q&A that it works for two players.Nope.It was gifted from “Santa” to my son on our late Xmas late January.The box says right on it, 3-8 players.I fault myself for not zooming in on the pictures.However, it is misleading. The description does not mention how many players are needed. Therefore, I noticed the question was asked in the Q&A, and went by that advice rather then scrolling through pictures.Bad idea. Because I gifted so long after purchasing, then it took weeks to find time to play, it wasn’t until recently I learned it is useless for us. It was a splurge because my son wanted to be a Taco cat” for halloween, and is known for his taco cat sweatshirt.Now it is too late to return and I am in no position to waste money.

review_title: easy, fun, loud, can be painful :)
review_description: Really no learning curve - get right into playing and slapping, and interestingly enough, making odd noises! There are no odd noises to be made per the rules, but people can't seem to help themselves!  There are a few special cards that require you to do an action before you slap the cards.  This is apparently very difficult to remember and people do all sorts of things trying to remember the correct move.  As part of they (me too!) make goofy animal noises - especially gorilla like sounds.  It's hysterical.Painful because as you are all slapping your hands down someone can jam a finger, get hit by someone's sharp nail, etc...  Still very funny!

Very easy to learn, you can leave out the 3 "action" cards in the deck until you really learn the game and add them in one at a time to make it easier.  Easy to transport for vacation- simply a deck of cards. How to play: lay out a card, you have to say TACO- whether your card IS a picture of a taco or not. You have 5 words that have to be said in order each time someone lays down a card. The trick is that your eyes see a PIZZA, but you may have to say GOAT because that was the next word in order.  If you lay out a GOAT and the word list happens to be on GOAT- slap the deck first to give those cards to your opponent because the objective is, to give away all your cards.  There are 3 different ACTION cards that make the game even more challenging. You may be saying, PIZZA but the ACTION card says to clap. Everyone has to do the ACTION and then slap the deck- last one to slap? Gets all the cards.  Very, very fun game. The videos did not explain it very well which is why I wrote this post.

This game is addictive, fun, easy to learn, yet challenging!  I introduced it yesterday and we played several rounds.  There is just enough of a challenge that even if you have played before, it takes concentration and focus to win.  Great for most ages, but I wouldn't recommend adults play with small children simply because they may get hurt if the pile slap is too hard and the little one's hand is on the bottom.I love how the makers creatively used color and artistic license to make the cards harder to distinguish at first glance.  Flinchers beware!  There's also a suitable sized deck to allow for variation in the cards.  This is one of our new family favorites for quick games and take along games.

I purchased this game for my 9 year old niece for her birthday.  I had never heard of this game before, but the reviews were great so I thought I would give it a try.  As soon as she opened it she was pumped.  Apparently, she had recently played it for the first time at a friend's house.  We immediately opened it up and she taught us how to play (we also read the easy-to-follow directions to be sure).  There were five of us playing, four adults and the 9 year old.  We had the BEST time!  It is a fast paced and silly game.  I would recommend putting a towel on the table where you are laying the cards because as others have noted, your hand will start to hurt slapping the table/counter too hard over and over.  We will be purchasing this game for our own adult game night.  Highly recommend.

Simple, adorable, small little deck of FUN! We each get a game every christmas, and sometimes I'll throw an extra in as a stocking stuffer. This was a stocking stuffer, but 3 days of playing later, I can confirm that it is the most fun. It has confusing elements my kids like (reminiscent of Snorta) in a simple dynamic like Cuckoo Zoo. We had some great games this year but for simplicity (this is an out-of-the-box, 5-seconds-later-you're-playing kind of game) and fun (even with 3 players it's fun, but this truly is a More the Merrier kind of game) Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza got the most laughs and the most straight-up fun.

I’m sorry to say I hate playing this game. People (who shall remain nameless to preserve domestic tranquility) slap my hands much too hard and I end up with sore reddened hands after playing (what can I say - I’m quick and usually the one whose hand is on the bottom).

My boys (7 and 10) love this game, they have so much fun playing it. Bought it to bring on vacation, it's a very small box so it's easy to take on a trip. The game is quick and fun, the rules are super simple anyone could play it. My boys have quicker reflexes than me and my husband, so they always win and they love winning 😄. Its too simple a game for me but I love how much fun my kids have playing it.

review_title: Not bad I just don't know what the fuss is about
review_description: Quick to learn and fun to play. Its good for 10-15 minutes IMHO.  Good range for kids or adults. But seriously the game is like WAR, but enhanced with one big change.  My box came a little ripped and the cards were a little stiff and hard to shuffle. But for $10 not a bad game to have around the house.

If people nearby don't know what you're playing, they might think you're a little crazy. But who cares? I've played this game with kids, I've played it with adults, I've played it with kids and adults...every single time it's fun. And it's nice to get out a little aggression on someone you're upset with when you slap their hand as hard as you possibly can. :) This is a really portable game. I've played it in restaurants, on picnics, in the breakroom at work, camping. anywhere you have a flat surface.

review_title: Put this at the top of your family game night pile.
review_description: My family loves this game! It's easy to learn, fun to play, and really gets the giggles going. When our barely-four-year-old plays, she just spreads her cards on the table face+up and chooses a match when it's her turn, then delights in slapping down the cards and making the motions. Our almost-six-year-old plays by the rules, but he sometimes needs reminding of what word we're on at his turn. All the kids older than that have no trouble whatsoever, and it can get really fast-paced, with fun, unexpected consequences.Note: we have a little child-size table that fits four perfectly and let's everyone reach the slap pile equally. I can't imagine more than five or maybe six people playing at once because of the physical requirements. It would be too crowded.

review_title: surprisingly SO MUCH FUN!!✨ just buy it!
review_description: this game is surprisingly SO FUN!!!after reading other reviews, i purchased this to play with my family over the holidays while i was visiting. upon showing them the deck of cards, they looked at me like i was a crazy person who ordered a flash card game for toddlers. LOL. that said, the cards are adorable! the game is not at all what you would expect.after convincing them it would be great, they obliged and we had SO MUCH FUN. we were laughing the entire time, and our first round probably only lasted 15 minutes playing with six people!it’s easy to learn, fast paced, interesting and surprising. i knew it would be fun, but didn’t realize how much fun! i love that the game is fast paced, and you are forced to pay attention to what’s going on. no checking out or getting up to do something while you wait for your turn — in fact, any player NOT paying attention or who doesn’t realize it’s their turn gets penalized! it keeps everyone engaged and in the game. no room to get bored! brilliant concept from the game makers.if you’re on the fence, GET IT. i promise you will be surprised at how much fun you have and how sore your abs will be from laughing so much!!

review_title: HIGH ON FUN - LOW ON QUALITY
review_description: My family had so much fun playing this last night!  I’m so glad I bought this game.  It got to the point where we had to quit for the night because our hands hurt!  We laughed harder than we had in a long time.  Buy this game!  Anyone can play.  It’s a fun game & easy to learn.  It arrived on time.  I don’t expect this deck of cards nor it’s box to last very long as it’s not very good quality, but in the meantime we’ll have fun playing it while it lasts.  In fact, my deck arrived dented up.  I wouldn’t have minded paying a couple of dollars more for a higher quality product.  At $10 this card game is pricey for what you get.  I hope this is helpful.

I have two kids: 16 year old son and almost 10 year old daughter. Getting together to do family things is challenging. Having a teen and pre-teen the kids have their own things going on. So when I come across a card game that everyone enjoys and are willing to stop and play as a family, that’s a win in my book! We had a blast and those 3 special cards made it that much more fun. It takes a little bit of time to get into the rhythm and we found ourselves messing up after someone had to take the pile. We’d completely forget which word we were on, but we just thought that was funny and picked a spot to begin again. You’ll get faster - and if you don’t you’ll be the one with the pile at the end. :)

review_title: Fun to play with a group of any age
review_description: I purchased this game for my 7 year old daughter. She doesn't request to play it much now, but I really love playing it! The pictures are super cute. It is hilarious to play because your brain wants you to say the picture on the card instead of going in the order "taco, cat, goat, cheese, pizza, ...), and there are lots of laughs and opportunities to slap the deck (with the special cards). I love it because my whole family can play and it is fast paced. It isn't hard to learn, and there isn't one quick slapper because there are multiple ways to slap the deck. If you love slap jack, fast-paced games, brain teasers, and lots of laughs then this game is for you!

review_title: Fun Game -- If you don't mind being slapped
review_description: This is a simple card game. All the cards are distributed evenly among the players. Each player, in turn, says the next word in the sequence (taco, cat, goat, cheese, pizza) and flips the top card of their deck onto a pile in the middle of the players. If the card matches the word, everyone slams their hand onto the pile; the last one to get their hand in place takes all the cards. There are three special cards (gorilla, narwhal, and groundhog) that require you to perform an action with your hands before slapping the pile. Again, the last person to slap the pile takes all the cards. If you flinch toward the pile or perform the wrong action for the special cards, you have to take the pile. The game ends when someone has no cards left in their deck and is first to slap the pile at the next opportunity.Pros: Easy to learn. You'll laugh a lot as you play it. The motions for the special cards are goofy. Families can play it together.Cons: Your hand *will* get slapped, and you might be scratched by fingernails. If you're playing with a competitive group, the likelihood of minor pain goes up. This game rewards players with sharp eyesight and fast reflexes. There is no strategy and not much replayability.The game is a decent value for the money, you can play it with kids, and it will be fun the first few times. After that, you're likely to leave this one on the shelf and only bring it out occasionally. And there's nothing wrong with that.

This game is fun but is very hard for older folks to do. If you wear bifocals or readers it's hard to see picture on card in middle until it's too late. I'm a senior and ended up with the whole deck practically! Was very hard to see and quickly hit the pile. So if you want grandma and grandpa to play, you may want to pick another card game!It's definitely for younger players.  But even my grandchildren who are teenagers did not like it, maybe preteens or younger might like it.

review_title: Be quick. Be faster. Have no mercy.
review_description: Wanna slap the sh*t outta your friends!?Got some some aggression or an urge to never be a loser?This is the game for you.Super easy to learn and can be quite enjoyable to play. I bought this for my friends and family once Exploding Kittens was worn out. This game has brought out some demons in my kids especially about the rules. No flinching! Make sure you're the quickest! Most importantly don't mess up the tempo of the game play. The 3 speciality cards that pop up are hilarious and keep the game interesting. I must know the most competitive people because we are all really into this game and have no mercy. We have drawn blood from time to time trying to slap the fastest & sometimes hardest in the thrill of the game. It's hilarious and doesn't have to be intense, but come on, it's much better that way.

review_title: The card game I didn’t know I needed!
review_description: I originally saw this game on a Vat19 youtube video. The game looked fun so I thought I’d buy it.The images on the cards are so darn cute! So Fun to play for such a simple card game. Has you laughing during the entire game. Love it so much!Will be buying more to be able to play with more people at a time. As is, the deck it probably good for 3 players max; about 21 cards per player.

review_title: Great game when you have kids of all ages!!
review_description: I play this with young children, tweens, and teens all at the same time. The first time we played; (Parental torture... the beginning of any forced family time) First we did the you're playing get over it, I know your life is ruined because I turned off your xbox, you can't go online, play with your dolls, watch netflix, make a mud pie, return those life and death texts drama. Then came the I'm not sitting by so and so blah, blah , blah madness which led to name calling chaos. Next thing you know I'm sitting at a table with a bunch of sullen bratty children with mutiny in their eyes because I asked (I tried), told (yeah because that always works), yelled (obviously not loud enough because I still didn't get their attention), screamed (ah blessed quiet) at them them to sit down and shut up. Then we actually started playing, big thumbs up for simple rules and game play... drum roll please.. after the first 5 to 10 minutes the grumblings and mumblings stopped. No more "This game is boring, dumb, lame" or other negative comments. They actually started laughing and enjoying themselves. Also, guess what... if I ask "want to play TCGCP?" they still grumble and moan but thats just for appearances so they don't lose their cool kid cred by actually expressing a positive emotion at playing a game with mom. I don't have to force them to play and BIGGEST SHOCKER of all, I've caught them playing it TOGETHER on their own, TOGETHER without me. This fun, hilarious, game is a big win for the whole family!!!

I got this for my wife because her best friend said she liked it. It arrived at our house, we opened it, it took about 3 minutes to learn the game, and we started playing. We laughed the whole time, had a great time, & played a total of 5 times in one day!It has now been moved to our “always travels with us card games” box. It is fun, fast-paced, and one of the best card games that we have played as a family. If you like simple family games that pack tons of fun, this is a must buy game. Our 6 year old, 9 year old, & 11 year old absolutely loved it and did not want to stop playing.

I bought this game as a gift for my 8 year old daughter who loves games.  I was expecting lots of gross foods--but I was surprised at the inappropriate cards--eyeball, human burger, blood salsa, and fresh brains.  Those are not foods that typical people find in their refrigerators.  We do not practice cannibalism.  She was very upset when I suggested that we just take out those cards.  I seriously wonder who thinks that those cards are appropriate for kids.  The rest of the game is funny, but I wish I would have looked through the cards before I gave it to her.

review_title: Quick and easy, great for families; see NOTE for box lid opening hack
review_description: Taco vs Burrito plays a lot like Uno, but with funnier cards.  Much like Uno, you can sabotage your opponents, or be nice; whatever suits your playstyle.  You can totally play with only 2 players, but more people means more opportunities for mischief and mayhem!Pros:- easy to learn how to play (each Action card tells you how to use it)- setup and teardown are super simple (no dice or color-coded gamepieces to lose and step on later)- gameplay is quick and easy (10 min/game; no Monopoly marathons here!)- amusing food ingredients (creative/gross foods will give you a chuckle)- once you master the basic game, there are many variations that keep the game interesting- my 7-year-old does enjoy this game a lot, and I don't mind playing 1-on-1 (it's more strategic and exciting with more people)Cons:- the game box is ridiculously hard to open, for some reason.  See NOTE below for a quick hack fix.- I feel like there should be more ingredient cards. Perhaps that is what is in the expansion pack?- you choose to build either a taco or a burrito, but the choice does not affect gameplay *at all*. I feel like it should, though. If I think up a game variation that does, I'll post it here on a later edit.- considering you're basically just getting a pack of funny cards, I feel that $20 is a little expensive. I would have been fine with paying $15 or so.Bottom line: This game is easy to learn and fun to play. It's great for when you want to play one or a few quick games with family or friends. It would make a good gift, especially if you can get it on sale.NOTE: The game box lid creates a vacuum or something that makes the box really hard to open. So what I did was take  a square of clean aluminum foil (about 1 foot x 1 foot) and fold it over itself several times to make a strong strip roughly 1 foot long and 2 inches wide. Then place the strip horizontally *underneath the plastic tray* in the box (please see the attached photo). Tuck the leftover ends under the box bottom to hide the aluminum strip when the box is closed and in storage.When you want to open the box, just untuck the ends, balance the box on your leg (or have the other person hold it), and pull *downwards* on both of the ends of the aluminum strip *equally*. This downward motion will push the plastic tray upwards, and the lid will magically float up and pop off. You don't need to use a lot of force! Alternatively, you could just open the box normally, as the aluminum strip breaks the vacuum seal and makes it much easier, but where's the fun in that? :)If you found this review to be helpful, please click on the 'Helpful' button below so more people like you can find it. Thank you!

review_title: I laughed myself into an asthma attack!
review_description: Ok, this game is legitimately hilarious, and devious enough to bring out people's competitive nature! It says a round is roughly 15 minutes, but we kept reshuffling the trash pile, so the round wound up being closer to 45.It's SUPER easy to play -- you literally deal the cards and start playing because instructions are written on the cards themselves. We had a few scenarios where we had to adapt as the game went on, namely with the "Food Fight" action card. The deck has so many action cards that it was hard to draw ingredient cards for the Food Fight, so we decided that action cards are just Null rather than to keep drawing until you hit an ingredient. Simple adjustment.The game itself is perfect for family night since it's easy to play and the gross ingredients appeal to a kid's sense of humor. But my friends and I are all mid-30s and we still had a blast! After the third time getting "Health Inspector," one friend started cursing. Our other friend, who is a notorious trash-talker when she plays spades, called me a "heifer" when I smacked her, once again, with Tummy Ache. Did I mention this was a faith-based group for graduate students? LOLI've already bought the expansion pack and we're looking forward to playing again at our next monthly potluck. I might filter out a few of the action cards to help balance the deck with the Food Fight issue, but that's my only potential "negative" from the entire game.

review_title: Seriously a game for kid to adults.
review_description: Absolutely love Taco vs burrito. I️ bought it as a kickstarter. I️ originally bought this game because my husband and I️ love to play games with friends but most of them are not targeted to children so I️ got this to add to our collection so we had options when our friends with kids came. I’m not gonna lie I️ did No have high expectations for this to be a game for adult but I️ was Sooooo wrong!!!!!! We have now played with several different groups of friends and it’s a hit!!!!! With adults it becomes a major strategy game. I️ have Now bought it as a Christmas present bc it was so well received!!!!

This was so puzzling none of 6 kids ranging from 20,s to 9 could understand it.we gave up and donated it.its strange and has nothing to do w tacos ( we got it for taco tuesday nights)i cant believe it said a kid created this???Also had cards that stated puke-barf-boogers :/

The game is ok. It's fun to play the first time, but after a while it got kind of boring. Not a whole lot of challenge/strategy to it. I thought it would at least be similar to exploding kittens but it wasn't as good.

review_title: This is a lot more fun than you think it'll be!
review_description: Unlike several of the reviewers here, I didn't purchase this originally for when kids are around. I bought it because of the reviews that said the adults all loved it too! I'm always on the lookout for games playable by 2 people and this was a great one. It's incredibly simple, but brings a lot of laughs with the competition and sabotage. I'm really glad I gave this game a chance.

review_title: Fun for game night, especially adults!
review_description: **just got the expansion pack**Buy the expansion pack you won’t be disappointed!!!!!!!we are a group of adults who love board games, card games, murder mystery, we’ll basically fun game nights. This game I bought and we played and it’s so much fun! We’re all late 20’a to early 30’s and we played non stop. So the no bueno, what we did was when it would be played against another’s player anyone could play another no bueno to block the no bueno hence saving the one player but really we would just team up against one player until the very end then things got serious. Lol. Loads of fun I recommend it.

First of all, the game is cute. Good ideas from a creative kid, I'm happy to say that. However, it's not the kid's job to make sure that this game works as a game. This game's rules are so poorly written that we have to create our own rules just to play it. A good rulebook would address all possibilities and this one barely addresses any.First of all, the Food Fight card is incredibly confusing. Players compete in a fast-paced showdown and draw cards until they draw points cards, then compete to see who gets the highest point value card. But it's the details that matter. What happens when you draw an action card? According to the game rules, you can choose to play the action card immediately. But what about the point values? Do we keep drawing? Do we stop after drawing an action card? What happens if the action card is dependent on other things? What happens if we never draw a point value card? One time I got 12 action cards in a row and that literally wiped the whole deck. Is a Food Fight card supposed to basically end the game?And there's the fact that the entire purpose of the game, Taco vs Burrito, is completely pointless. There is no game mechanic that actually cares about whether you choose Taco or Burrito. It's aesthetic only. Why is the name of the game literally an aesthetic feature?To make it worse, there are even contradicting rules. The quick rules cards say that you can only put cards into your own burrito. But the full rulebook says you can put cards into OTHER peoples' burritos as well. Which one is it???? Makes a pretty big difference.This game is good if you're playing with children who don't understand board games much, and just want some dumb silly gross food fun. But if you're literally ANYBODY except a child, avoid this game until they clean up their rulebook.

HIKARIOUS GAME. Laughing at this sensitive Sally’s saying the cards like eyeball and blood sauce are gross and inappropriate for kids. My nephew talks about blood and gore all the time and he’s 10. Perfectly appropriate for kids ESPECIALLY BOYS. You can tell a boy made this game.

review_title: As much fun for adults as kids!
review_description: My granddaughters aged 5 and 8 love this game! The best thing about it is the adults have as much fun as the kids. The "No Bueno" cards are similar to the "Nope" cards in Exploding Kittens but the other action cards are original and perhaps even more fun. It is super-quick to learn and kids don't really have to read to play; it only takes them one round to know what all the cards do. My 5 year old beat the pants off us and we were hysterical with all the twists and turns. My only complaint is that I wish more could play, especially as $19.95 is a lot for a card game. When you have a game all ages can play, you need 6-8 people to be able to join in. We'll simply buy a second. Hopefully it goes on lightening deal again soon.

review_title: Fun but the game is not fully fleshed out
review_description: The game is fun, my complaint (sort of) is their are basically no rules.  Basic gameplay instructions but no fleshed out details.  My family and I had to make up our own "house rules" for almost everything.  Actually, that was in some ways fun and creative for us to do, but what will happen if we ever play with anyone else who has the game?  We will have to negotiate and argue over each others rules (not fun).  I'll give an example: A player plays a minus card and the other plays a no bueno card.  What happens?  The game does not inform you.  Is it just a block and we can both keep our cards? we decided no.  Does it mean the player who blocks loses their no bueno card? Does the player who tried to play the minus just return it to their hand? do they still get to play something else? Or, does the attempted play count as their turn? Still what about the minus card? Is it considered played and discarded in the discard pile? Same question for the no bueno block card.  We decided that both cards are considered played and placed in the discard pile and the attempted play of the minus card counts as the players turn.  My point in writing this, is you will have to decided about things like this for quiet a bit until you figure out for yourselves all the different scenarios and card plays.  Really, all these things should be written out in a real rule book.I'll add one last thing, we find the game is fun played in a pre-determined number of rounds with the dealing passing around from player to player to keep it balanced.  You add up the scores of each round to determine a winner.  Adds a nice additional strategy level to each round game play.Still fun game.  Interesting strategy game.

review_title: Doesn’t live up to the hype
review_description: This game is exactly as much fun as you would expect a game designed by a seven year old to be.  It has some novelty value, as the cards have silly names, but even for other seven year olds it’s not very fun.  There are very few tactics, the lead shifts around according to chance, and a lot of the moves are zero-sum.  I can’t believe I paid $20 for this; we played it once and doubt we will bother again.  Save your money!

I played this with my children, ages 8-12. They like and are good at card games so I gifted one of them this game.Cons: Instructions not clear as instructions on sheet and quick instructions on cards differ with amount of information. Too much confusion on what to do with cards in hand when game ends.No clear directions how to “tally” cards at end of game. Example, if you take “+cards” and the subtract “-card” then multiply “X2” card you will get different result then if you take “+card” then x2 then -cards. In one game it make a difference of one winner or two people tie.No instruction on game ending in tie.My kids didn’t really want to play again. Suggestion: Skip this card game and get Exploding Kittens

I previously didn’t rate this game very high, but after playing some more, I really enjoy it and so does my daughter! This is a fun game that helps with being strategic while it being fun because of the gross foods on the cards and actions that can be used. Your kid will love it and so will you. Games go by fast which is always a plus.
It doesn’t explain the game completely...’it states there is a video online, but there isn’t and the grandkids got bored after a couple of attempts, and changed to Yeti in my Spaghetti (great game)

I purchased Taco Vs. Burrito for my middle school classroom. Even the most difficult to engage, eye-rolling 13 year old loves it!  I can group 4 students who do not get along for a game of Taco Vs. Burrito and they will be giggling together within minutes. Competitive enough to hold their attention yet simple enough to not require adult intervention, Taco Vs. Burrito is highly recommended by this teacher for the classroom!
This game was invented by a 7 year old.  Enough said.  Wildly popular?  Really?  It’s probably good for families with young children, but absolutely NOT for adults.

review_title: Some strategy but probably more fun with a younger group.
review_description: This is another game we tried today. Created by a 7 year old. It has some strategy but not nearly as fun as deck 10 for our family. Better for younger kids like 4/5-10ish maybe. They will like the silly food combinations. And it’s a fast game because it’s a small deck. And parents who play with them will like the bit of strategy in it. My youngest is 13. I don’t feel it was worth $20. I’d say more $10. But still a clever game. It would make a great gift.  The directions could be a little more clear on things like do you look at cards before you steal, and that your original 5 cards start in your hand not your taco. But it worked out as we played.

review_title: Not a good game, ends to quickly
review_description: We love Exploding Kittens and thought this would be as good but it is not and we returned it.  It is too easy to lose, which is frustrating for all playing it.  I do not recommend.

I was hoping for a fun, easy to learn game.  There isn't much to this game and it gets boring quickly.  There is a "Health Inspector" card which is basically a "you lose" card and the 2 games my family played was won by the 1 person who did not get the Health Inspector card.  Spend your money on somethng else.  The Sushi Go game is a little more complicated but more fun.

In this house we have a 10 year old, 26 year old, and two 50 year old members.  We all enjoy this game.  It reminds me a little of UNO, but the object before you go out of cards is to fill your taco/burrito with point cards.  We had to watch a youtube video on how to play, because the written instructions were slightly confusing on how the game ended.  The first time we played we turned over the discard pile and kept going, but as far as we can tell that is incorrect.  Once the draw pile is gone, the play continues until someone is out of cards from their hand.  Most points collected wins.  Lots of fun with cards that let you rob from other players, the discard pile, and change hands at the last minute with someone who was winning.  Hope this helps.

We gave our 6 year old son this for Christmas. It was an absolute hit! Easy to learn and easy and fun to play. We finally opened the game tonight and spent about 2 hours playing this game (which if you have a 6/7 year old you know it’s a LONG time). It’s not a long game, that’s just how long we played before it was bedtime. We had to take a break and he ran for a notepad and left me this note. Great game.
