review_description: If you are looking for a game the whole family will love, get this game.It is colorful, well built and fun.  My son loves maps and trains, so this was a win-win.  You draw out destinations your trains need to go and you build tracks between here and there.  Other train makers can block your path on the way to their destinations and you may have to find another route.  We played on Christmas day and we had a great time.  This is a well made game and should be in every game-loving family.  We are considering purchasing the other versions as well.  Good times for all.Update:  Just have to say this really is a great game.  We play it all of the time.  Buy this game!

review_title: Great game. Fun to play with Alexa (or just let her keep score!)
review_description: We play a lot of games with our friends but they are I guess what you would call party games. Games like That's What She Said, Apples to Apples, The meme game. A lot of giving your cards to the reader and hoping your card gets picked. They are fun but we wanted something more, and this was just the ticket!The game was easy to learn and a lot of fun to play.Being able to play along with Alexa was a great bonus. She walked us through the game since it was our first time. She can play as another player. I think you can even play alone against her. You can also just use her to keep track of the game and keep score. There are train sound effects and old timey music as background music. It was fun, and it actually worked.

review_title: Fun game to play with family and is about 1 hour long
review_description: This was a fun game with the strategy of monopoly but without the passing of money and long playing time.  We played twice over a weekend and both games were about an hour long. It has very good directions just read them all with everyone and we were off and playing.  The second time we played was fun because we knew the rules and were able to concentrate on our strategies.  Great quality and large playing board.  This game was recommended to us and I will recommend it to anyone looking for a game to play.  We played this game with all adults

review_title: We aren't into gaming at all but really enjoy the strategy that goes into this game and that ...
review_description: My husband and I were introduced to this game by friends and then he HAD to have it. We took it on vacation with my family and I think there were at least 3 games a day among various groups of people. Needless to say, it has become a go-to game when we are together with friends or family. You can play with just 2 people but I find that it is much more enjoyable and interesting with at least 4. We aren't into gaming at all but really enjoy the strategy that goes into this game and that you can complete the game in a reasonable time frame.The board is a big map with destination cities. Each player has destination cards and the goal is to get from one destination to another by linking train pieces across the map. You connect city to city by collecting and playing cards of different colors. Earn points by connecting cities - the longer the distance, the more points. Once a destination route is complete, you also earn points for that card. A shorter distance (New York to Chicago) is worth less than longer distances (New York to LA). Of course there are different rules for collecting and using cards, how to score points, etc. that you can read into deeper once you purchase.

review_title: young and old all love this game
review_description: Got it for my 10 year old niceces for christmas. Didn't seem interested at first playing with other gifts. Later on and next day the adults were all over it. Few days later the girls played and are hooked too.This game is easy enough to learn and provides a variety of play. In other words, good replay value, and various ways to win. I've been a gamer since birth, from board games and chess through the birth of video games, i can tell you this IS a GOOD game.

review_title: Very easy to play, lots of fun, not overly long
review_description: This is a great game for families of all ages. It's easy to learn for ages 10 and older, and can probably be played by those as young as 7 or 8 with the right help. We've played it twice now since getting it for Christmas. The construction of the board and the pieces is very well made and sturdy. There are a lot of small plastic trains though, so I recommend playing this on a very solid surface and be sure to count all your game pieces when you are finished.Lots of fun though and I highly recommend for a fun family game night. It's easy to learn and does involve a bit of strategic game playing.

DO NOT BUY THIS BOARD! This board is fake. It’s missing pieces, the board is backwards, and the pieces aren’t the right colors or size. My daughter owns the board already, which is why I purchased the game; however, we can’t play correctly due to the amount of missing pieces. I am returning this product.

review_title: Original version: not as good as TTR Europe
review_description: We bought Ticket to Ride Europe after reading a lot of reviews and then bought this one. We enjoyed playing TTR Europe because it has tunnel and ferry routes that add more elements/dimensions  to the  game. The U.S.A map feels lackluster compared to the Europe map because all you do is just use connect point A to point B using rail routes. This is the only reason why I have deducted a star. It's good if you want a simple straightforward game that requires less planning and strategy.

review_title: One ring to rule them all...
review_description: There are 1000s of board-games out there.  The trick is to find one that everyone is going to enjoy and that can be played over and over AND doesn't take four hours to play (monopoly).  This game is fun, challenging, and highly competitive.  We came upon this game while we were on vacation visiting a local target.  I, of course, checked amazon for it ( to compare price and reviews) and knew we had to have it.  Note that we are not board-game players in my house and we have very few games for that reason.  That said, we can't stop playing this game.  Get it and enjoy it.

review_title: Really fun, easy to pick up but with many layers of strategy as you advance
review_description: This game is great for the family and even children as young as first grade in my opinion.  It seems daunting when you read about the set up but the instructions are pretty clear and after one or two times you can easily set it up without having to look back at instructions.  The play is pretty straightforward on face value, which makes it enjoyable for young kids, but there are multiple strategies and ways to score, that can make it fun for adults and for children who are developing their sense of strategy and foresight.  Great game!

review_title: I would expect it to be better quality.
review_description: The tiles were not uniform and letters all over the place.  The board is defective.  I wrote a complaint to Hasbro and they claimed this product is no longer in production and wondered if I purchased from a third party.  With paying a premium price, I would expect it to be better quality.

review_title: Bring back the Scrabble Deluxe Edition Game (Amazon Exclusive)
review_description: Absolutely hate this scrabble deluxe edition game.This scrabble is cheaply built, split away during games. Plus you have to lug around a big  box. Tell me Hasbro, this newer deluxe is far worst than the previous and how come you cant store the items inside the other Scrabble deluxe.  This Scrabble Deluxe is failure. Go back to the previous version.  I had purchased the Scrabble Deluxe Edition Game (Amazon Exclusive) in December , Amazon please bring back  Scrabble Deluxe Edition Game (Amazon Exclusive) which was better. You could store all everything inside the bottom of the game. And clean up was quick and easy.

review_title: I would recommend purchasing another version with a lazy-Susan type of revolving ...
review_description: The playing surface is made of two pieces of molded plastic that connect with two pull-out plastic hinges.  When you turn the board so your opposing player can see the letters, the board comes apart all the time and you have to fix it.  The design defeats the purpose of buying this version of the game.  I would recommend purchasing another version with a lazy-Susan type of revolving mechanism.  The game itself is a classic, but this particular version of it is annoying to deal with.

This was by no means a deluxe edition.  It is very cheaply made with an awkward method of connecting the two halves of the board.  The two halves were not even.  It‘s not a turntable like previous deluxe scrabble editions - the two halves of the board have wheels, instead.  Not a dealbreaker, but not smooth rotation.  The pieces were highly irregular as well, all different shapes and sizes, some patterns not printed in the center, and one piece was just straight-up broken.  Even the manual was poorly formatted and confusing.  I would feel slightly ripped off at paying $20 for this cheap plastic garbage, much less $40!  From what i can tell, all the Scrabble editions made by “Winning Solutions”, “Winning Moves” and “WS Games” are all very cheaply made and overpriced.  Returning it and ordering one of the earlier deluxe editions that were made 20-30 years ago.

This is VERY poor quality - so bad that players can't really enjoy the game.  By no definition is this "Deluxe".  This is nothing like the classic products made and sold by Hasbro (or whatever company had it some years ago).  The price is completely unjustifiable.  The materials are all very cheap, and feel, sound and play that way.  Again, players just can't really enjoy the game, because of the distractions attributable to poor quality (such as the board always coming apart).Older versions are available and better, even if used.  You might find them on Amazon, or you can find them on other large auction sites.  If you require a new version, do your research and try to get a look at an opened product before you buy, even in a retail store.  There are older wooden versions, and other better-made plastic and cardboard versions.  If you want the true deluxe, you can find the 'Scrabble Deluxe Classic [or Wooden] Edition' here on Amazon and elsewhere.  It's much more expensive, but the quality is there.  If you want to spend about the same as this product costs, you'd do better to find a slightly used older version, including with wooden turntables and wooden trays and pieces, on an auction site (or maybe on Amazon).

review_title: the board itself is not a good quality nor are the tiles
review_description: Not sure what I was expecting for the price, but I would not refer to this as "deluxe".  I already had a deluxe board and tiles, and was looking for a more transportable set. While the ridges on the board hold the tiles, the board itself is not a good quality nor are the tiles. there doesn't appear to be much quality control in printing and cutting the tiles.  The letters were not always the same color tone nor were the letters centered in the tile.  I gave it to a friend, as she has children that are learning to play the game.  It is not a set that will last a long time if used frequently.

I bought this after having only the classic Scrabble for a few years. I love Scrabble and wanted a nicer board to play when family comes over. They have a very nice board that sits on a lazy Susan and looks very nice.  I was hesitant about this particular model after hearing about it's quality, but the product I received is fine. The letters are all okay and none are broken like other reviews. The letters are also pretty center.  However, they are not as high quality as what another nicer more luxury set would offer.The board itself has a colorful design rather than the more elegant design of past deluxe sets.Overall it's not as nice as deluxe sets in the past. It's okay for the price point, but one day I would like to upgrade once again to a $100+ board when I can justify it.

review_title: Good but not great. Still worth buying.
review_description: Pros: Not being on a lazy susan (turning table) but instead having angled wheels makes the game board lower to the table which I like. The raised borders work well and the letter pieces stay in place. The way the board hooks together in the center is easy.Cons: pressing the middle of the board makes it cave in a little. The fact it doesn’t snap together but lay in place is neither a good or bad design.  The cardboard box is the carrying case. Not a lasting design and kinda cheap. The wooden pieces aren’t all printed center and that bothers some people. I personally don’t care.Overall: I think it’s good for the price but not great. It’s built well enough for just home use but travel is iffy with a cardboard case. I’m satisfied with this purchase.
We love this game and the quality of the board is very good. Awesome purchase.

review_title: Disappointing way it is put together. I have an ...
review_description: Disappointing way it is put together.  I have an older version of the "Scrabble Deluxe Edition which is one molded piece of plastic that you just open up.  This one, when you open it, the board is in two pieces that often comes apart or sticks up in one place.  This has been "dumbed down" in assembly excepting for the price.  I would not get another one.

review_title: The "carrying case" is a handle attached to the game's cardboard box.
review_description: The game itself is fine.  However, I bought it because the product listing said it came with a carrying case and my plan was to store the game in the carrying case aboard my sailboat for rainy day or evening fun in the cabin.  Once I received the game, I realized they just attached a handle to the top of the game box then called it a carrying case.  Had I known the case was just a cardboard box (which is not a good way to store things aboard a boat, for obvious reasons), I would not have bought this.

review_title: the craftsmanship is incredibly poor. It's clear Hasbro really reduced quality in order ...
review_description: This edition is in no way deluxe, the craftsmanship is incredibly poor. It's clear Hasbro really reduced quality in order to increase profits, the older versions of the game have much better tiles, a board that is more sturdy with an actual hinge and handle, and nice amenities like little drawers to hold your tiles and racks. Even the printing on the board is low-quality, with many smudges in the ink. Hasbro should be ashamed and embarrassed to sell something this low quality.

I personally never played Scrabble but have heard and seen it plenty of times. Played it with the family one day and less than a week later we have it ourselves and enjoy it everytime.Product is great and the box acts as a case to carry it where you need to. Wooden pieces feels light and sorta cheap but we are not that picky about it. Set up is truly quick and smooth. Simply pull the small hinges out from one side of the board and connect the other. It would be nice to have some type of lock with it so you wouldn’t have to keep it on a flat surface. We played on carpet and it still spun fine, just remember that my carpet/floor may be more leveled than your own. It did separate a few times from one hinge. Once you finish spinning the board just reconnect and continue. If we were on a flat surface then this wouldn’t be an issue. Board grids fit each piece slightly loose but I expect it to be like this.Overall, it’s worth the buy. Would recommend this to anyone. Price could be another factor but I feel this will last a very long time if taken cared of. Why the 4 stars? Cause if Hasbro could add locking hinges so it prevents or lessen the chances of separating during the game then it would be a well deserved 5 stars.

review_title: Hasbro please just sell us a round rotating board like tournaments
review_description: Bought this on sale, would not have been happy at full price, but I’m fine with it on sale.As others have noted, the tiles are printed unevenly (how difficult could that be?), and the board sometimes comes apart during play if people aren’t gentle turning it - especially on my grooved wooden table. It’s hollow plastic so also rattley on such surfaces.What annoys me the most, however, is that Hasbro refuses to sell a *circular* game board like they use in tournaments, which is ideal. With a rotating square board (or worse, rectangular like this one, for reasons I don’t understand), people tend to move their tiles too close during play and they have to move them again for rotation.I would pay good money for one of those tournament boards, although I do understand they are impractical to store for most consumers.

review_title: Deluxe-o Oh No! Not entirely what you pay for.
review_description: The letter tiles are made of wood; however, the tile holders are light, bendable plastic. These cheap-o tile holders are not depicted on the cover of the box which I later deemed deceptive.  Your letters can easily be knocked off the plastic rack due to the lack of weight.  There goes your game plan. For the money, I think the tile holders should be made out of wood as they used to be and as you might expect.  I would keep the game if wooden tile holder replacements were provided and I were allowed to simply throw the nasty plastic ones away without having to go to the PO to return them during this pandemic.

What a disapointment on this product. I am returning it. There is nothing of Deluxe about this product: Tiles are non uniform in size and printing is so off from the centre that seems to be made for a prototype!!!  The joint betwen the two sections is too lack of engineering design that is just a shame.There were some good references / reviews for this products; so, I took the chance, but I think those were from the designers or the very same vendors. I realistic price for this item in a school rifle would be $8. That may be a rip off though.

review_title: This is a toy version of scrabble!
review_description: I wish I could give this game less than one star. I bought this game as a travel game and was surprised when I got it that the case was as bulky as it was. So, I made a fabric bag to hold all of the components.  I didn’t examine the game when I first got it but I was so disappointed in EVERY component when I sat down tonight to play for the first time. The tiles are cheap and the printing is in no way uniform. The clips to hold the two halves of the board together are completely ineffective and the tile racks are not level. This is a giant waste of money!

review_title: The construction of the game was far under par to what I expected.
review_description: For the price that I paid for this Scrabble game I expected far better. I guess in today’s standards it’s to be expected but I remember the one my mother had which the board was a sturdy cardboard the tile holders were wooden and the tiles were a finished tile. This one has a decent board kind of flimsy the tile holders are very thin plastic and the wooden tiles are just cut pieces of wood not finished at all. I would not buy this again as a gift myself.

review_title: good features for a good price
review_description: I had a REALLY nice Scrabble set I bought years ago, board made of wood and on a turntable. I say had because I lost it when our home flooded from tropical storm Harvey. I wanted another one that could be rotated, but unwilling to pay well over $100 for one. So this one is the next best thing. And it has ridges that keep the letters in place too. Nice set for the money.

review_title: Overall, great version for the price
review_description: I got this as a gift for my mother-in-law. I like the price point, the grid lines for the tiles and the rotating board. My only real issue was that there was a lack of uniformity in the title size. 1 or 2 of them were shorter than the others. Not a huge deal except that it bothered my OCD and, if there are only a couple, it tips your hand to the other players because they can figure out what tile it could be if they've played with you before.

I wish that, in my haste to get a turn table Scrabble board, I had taken the time to read these reviews. Doing so would have spared me considerable disappointment when I opened the Deluxe Scrabble and found just about the cheapest piece of manufacturing I have ever seen--especially at the price point. The tiles are featherweight, for starters, and drop off the table unnoticed (I can so attest). The red plastic trays are appalling. The font used on the design of the board looks like it's designed for the preteens, at best. And, finally, while it's true that the board does turn, it involves both hands to send on to the partner without clattering. I will give the board one star, but only because of past, now questioned, loyalty to the game itself. Awful.

Divorced a few years ago and she took the Scrabble game.  Yeah, I know....but at least I got the dog!It was a solidly-made, turntable board.  I've searched for a suitable replacement, and found this.  Priced as a deluxe game, I expected it to be very similar.Not even close.  This is cheap plastic and the board is two pieces that click together.She can have the dog, I want that game back!

review_title: Fortunately was able to return for full refund
review_description: I had to return this. It was SOOOO cheaply made. The board wouldn't even fit together as much as we tried. Fortunately was able to return for full refund. Very very plasticy.

review_title: Previous edition much better! Buy older edition on Amazon
review_description: Board comes in 2 pieces that do not securely fit together. Does not come with hard case for travel like the previous edition. I'm returning this edition and puchasing the previous edition which is still sold on Amazon.

The quality of this is just exactly what I was not looking for, the tiles fit nicely but the feel of the board is just so cheap. If you want to use this board frequently it's just not worth it because the board does not snap together and stay as one piece for very long. I dont wan't to spend over $100, but this feels like a durable cheap board. I'm looking for something more permanent, I sent it back.

review_title: Not bad but far from good
review_description: Somewhat disappointed in the quality. Considering it is the ‘deluxe’ edition, it leaves a bit to be desired. Overall build quality is low.. the plastic is flimsy and the wooden tiles are of greatly varied quality. My mother has a version with a proper swivel base and better quality material from the 80s. Not bad, but far from good.

I was disappointed in this product. It swivels and that’s what I was looking for, however, the board has to be put together. It comes in two halves that you put together but they do NOT lock in.  As a result when your playing the game and turning it, it comes apart. This is extremely annoying.  Outside of that I’d say it’s ok.

review_title: Cheaply made, board comes in halves, wouldn’t recommend.
review_description: Board sucks...comes in two halves and it rests on a little hook-like clip but doesn’t even secure. Rolls nicely but if you’re not careful it comes unhooked. Not sure if I’m doing something wrong but it’s not ideal and the letters aren’t even wood...they’re plastic with printed letters (not engraved like the old days) with cheap little plastic letter holders. Not worth the money if you ask me.
Good game for kids and adults

This game is a piece of junk.  No part of it is deluxe.  The plastic is cheap and thin.  The print on the letters isn’t even centered.  The “carrying case” is the the cardboard box it came in that has a handle.  I can’t believe they are selling this garbage for $50.  It should be $10.  Still wouldn’t t buy it at that price.

review_title: Poor design, does not stay together.
review_description: Poor design. The board does NOT stay together. It was advertised as the "newer model". Its terrible.  But the Deluxe one with the drawers.  This one is going back!

Love the ease of assembly yet the board tends to separate on one end if not careful. Also the letter holders are a light plastic prefer a little heavier or wooden. The case is cardboard with handle but sturdy. Prefer a tin case instead for fear of it wearing out sooner. Otherwise it’s a nice set.

This is a great product! The turntable glides nicely to turn to each player. The game board itself has indentions for the tiles so they don’t move around like the traditional board. The only complaint I have is that we had to order 3 times to get a box that wasn’t smashed (shipping box was in perfect condition).

review_title: I was very disappointed with this product when it arrived
review_description: I was very disappointed with this product when it arrived.  I was expecting something of much higher quality and substantial for the price. The tile trays a small and of poor quality plastic, the board itself is in two pieces with poorly designed plastic clips to hole the two sides together.  I was expecting a regular turn table attached to a single board.  The package was in pretty poor shape as well and looked like it might have been returned before, it looked battered and if it might have been sitting around in a shop or warehouse for a very long time.  I will be returning this product and searching for something more substantial for the price.  This is my first review of a product and I was very disappointed
Like very much the "Deluxe" version; big, clear board, nice ridges to "lock in" pieces.  All in all, good value for the board quality and design.

This is one of the beat versions of Scrabble you will find, don’t bother with the expensive “Deluxe” edition it’s way overpriced and cheaply made. This one is great value and not a bad price and has excellent features

I remember the older version of "deluxe scrabble" and this sure isn't it. It doesn't have a base to swivel on (but it does rotate ok if you're on a hard surface) and the letter tiles are low quality. They are lightweight and seem cheap. Not like the older ones -- which I remember being smooth, glossy, heavy, and rounded at the edges. This will certainly work, but I'm disappointed by the quality.
Made for ease of access, the rotating board, but otherwise not any different from other versions of scrabble.  Only downside is putting it back in the box which can be a little bit of a hassle.

review_title: Not what I thought I was getting...
review_description: Instead of the deluxe version with the lazy susan, this is a weird design where the board splits in half and has wheels underneath. I was also disappointed in the "cheap-looking" quality of the letters (not varnished, inconsistent sizing) and the cheap plastic tile holders instead of the wooden ones most sets come with.

The quality of the pieces, including the board itself is terrible! The plastic is thin and cheap, the board doesn't hold together well and the printing on the tiles themselves is uneven and even the font is inconsistent. I am extremely disappointed and angry at having paid for this product! The best part about it is the carrier box, and the fact that the tiles actually fit into the squares on the board. It's definitely an embarrassing gift to give anyone.

Very nice set. The board rotates and translates easily. Unlike the original flat board that allowed the tiles to migrate about when you bump it, this board has molded recesses that hold each tile perfectly.  It makes it more difficult to put the tiles away at the end of the game, but it's worth it. Love it. Great value.

review_title: not the game or board expected
review_description: I have a Scrabble Deluxe game made by winning moves and I thought when looking it closing on line the 4 corners scored quadruple points which my game has.  I wanted to get one just like it for a relative and was disappointed that the one that came only got triple points for the 4 corners.  The one I got from Amazon seems to be put out by Hasbro and isn't as much fun as the one I have with 441 spaces and 200 wood tiles.  So was disappointed.

review_title: Great improvement on a old pastime game
review_description: This is a pretty good edition of an old game. The board keeps the tiles neat on the playing field. The board moves effortlessly for players to play. The case is made of cardboard and would need reinforcing to last for some time.

review_title: Grids help keep tiles in place.
review_description: We love the grids.  And the tiles.  However it is difficult to turn on a card table sized table.  I am in a group who plays weekly for 2 to 4 hours.  We all have drinks and snacks on the table as well as a score pad.  Please reduce the width of the board.

Best game ever for all ages.  Get your mind thinking and the best way to pass time with family. I most enjoy coming up with new words, keeps my peeps on their toes. This deluxe version can turn so your able to really see the board. Worth every penny I spent.  Timeless game for all to play.  Once again, Scrabble, enough said!

review_title: This is the worst board I've ever played on
review_description: This is the worst board I've ever played on. For being "deluxe" it sure feels cheap and it bends in the middle so if the surface you're playing on is even slightly uneven you run the risk of the board splitting mid-game.
One of my favorite games. This addition has the rotation assist with a turntable. Plastic squares keep letters in place. Fun for all ages.

review_title: I like the fact that this scrabble game is compact but ...
review_description: I like the fact that this scrabble game is compact but when I ordered this one it looked like the one I ordered last year that fold up and is it’s own carrying case. This one is in two pieces that doesn’t stay connected when turning and the paper box is its carrying case

review_title: for the price wasn't really happy with the quality
review_description: for the price wasn't really happy with the quality.. it comes in 2 halfs which come apart very easy. the grooves that hold the letters are vert shallow and work so so.. the word holders are just cheap plastic, it came with no score pad.. i remember when i was a kid i got a really nice all wooden scrabble game and for less money.. nowadays they just produce cheap plastic remakes and the price is higher for profit i guess. stinks.
Love this set!  Got for my 9 year old grandson and we’re enjoying it several times a week. Plan on taking a cross country trip via train this summer and we’ll be taking this along!

This game makes for a nice change from regular Monopoly with the game being both team-based and focused on territorial control over pure wealth.Players form even teams and go around the board claiming free tiles, stealing them from other players, or locking them down by cementing control. Team members share money and properties. The game ends once all properties have been claimed and one team has the majority.The game itself goes pretty quickly with properties bouncing back and forth and having spaces that take a player to the nearest unclaimed spot. As players share resources, discussing strategy is important as to stop overextension (as running out of money can start a brutal chain reaction). Out first game stayed rather even to the end, with it ending with a score of 9-7, a llama victory.Where the game really fails is organization. The components include character pieces, dice, a property deck, 2 chance decks, a set of control tokens for each team, and some money (in two denominations, $100 and $500). To hold all this, you're given a basic bankers try for the standard monopoly game. This means besides the money, which only needs two of the slots, nothing fits right. And to further top it off, you can't keep it in the tray as the box is too short to allow the cards to remain upright in the slots, forcing a person to either throw everything together (either in the tray or loose in the box) or have a box that is unable to be closed all the way.

Super cute! You are divided up into teams. Instead of buying properties, it's most titles like "Most Fluffiest" to win game. The tokens are plastic Unicorn and Llama pieces in pastel colors. It's an Amazon exclusive so maybe that's why it's pricier than your average Monopoly board game and why I took away a star. Fun for young and young at heart!

Cute and colorful is the only good thing I have to say. This game is pretty confusing. We played 2 times and quit early both times. Adults and children were all very frustrated both times. We are a board game playing family. The rules need to be made CLEAR.
It was missing parts. My 7 year old was very upset when we tried to play it during family game night. Don’t purchase from this seller.
What’s not to like?

This is a really fun game. I'd say it's best for ages 7+ The were a few things that weren't explained well in the rules, but we were able to decide the rules ourselves and move on with the game.  Compared to original monopoly, game play is faster and more competitive, players are sorted into teams, and there were lots of laughs as chance cards include fun ways to get ahead or bring the opposing team down. We found that if teams aren't even there's a slight advantage to the team with fewer players, as their tokens will pass Go more frequently. I think next time we will modify by using the same number of game pieces per team and having the odd person out choose between the teammates tokens on their turn. Overall we enjoyed the game a lot and will definitely play often.

It’s kind of a weird version of monopoly. I mean, I’m not sure what I expected since it’s llamas vs unicorns. My daughter wanted it for Christmas so I (I mean Santa) got it for her. The game goes fast so I don’t feel like I have to pull my hair out trying to finish the game.The game ends when all the “properties” are bought. But the properties are properties like the original version, they are traits. Traits like “Coolest Room Decor” or “Most likely to Save the Day”. So you can “buy” and collect traits, but that also means you can take traits from other players. Each trait switches hands super fast. At first I didn’t like it because I kept thinking of them like properties from the original monopoly. But you just have to think of them as traits because that’s what they are. Think of them as the “Most likely to ...” from the high school year book. If you aren’t popular one week you’re not cool anymore and the next person gets the glory.

review_title: Not Regulation Sized Cheap Representation of Monopoly
review_description: I was disappointed in this product. It is not regulation sized. The player pieces are cheap plastic, and the 'hotels' are simply cardboard rectangles with pictures of rainbows. This may suffice for children ages 5-10, but certainly not for teens or adults. (Yes, even adults like llamas and unicorns).

review_title: Loves Unicorns and/or Llamas.... this game is for you!
review_description: My daughter is into both unicorns and llamas and was delighted to receive this game. We have played a few times so far. It is easy to learn. Similar, but different to monopoly. Such as you are not buying and then adding houses/hotels. You work with only two values of money versus the multiple in Monopoly. I like how it is simplified so children can be the banker and still keep things moving at a decent pace. Lots of opportunities to incorporate math and reading into play. Encourages team building when you have multiple players. Provides positive attributes and relatable content for purchasing such most huggable or best room decor. My son played, but at five he tired easily and had no interest in finishing.

The product box came damaged extensively in an undamaged Amazon box, which means it was damaged before shipping. It was “punched through” to the inside playing piece container. The game itself was not damaged. I used gorilla tape to fix the box so pieces wouldn’t get lost. The game play is fun for the kids. Kind of silly but hey it keeps them entertained. 2 stars for the careless nature in which I was sold this item.

This version of Monopoly is quicker than standard Monopoly and you're divided into teams. The team approach makes it easy for younger kids to get in on the Monopoly fun without having a clear understanding of the game. If they can roll a dice and count, they can play! The rules are a bit different than monopoly and money only comes in 100s and 500s. It is a simplified, but fun, version of Monopoly.

It's Monopoly! Daughter is pleased as peas, I mean, seriously, its Llamas AND Unicorns!Only thing we weren't aware of (our own fault for not reading more about it thinking it was, well, Monopoly) is it is team based. Not an issue but, wasn't expecting to kind of having to learn Monopoly a different way.Daughter loves it and already dragging her cousins from every corner during Christmas holiday to play.

I got this for my 5. -9 years old think that it would be like the good old monopoly with a little unicorn flair , however the way this particular game is set up it doesn’t help kids learn about money and/or real state. It’s useless as a learning game and it’s not even fun with the modifications made. Now I’m buying the older version of monopoly

review_title: Room for improvement but overall a light fun family game
review_description: We're all about the family games in our household, this one was added at Christmas for our 10 yr old children. The game play itself has some of the traditional Monopoly game play (chance, free parking, pass go, go to jail, etc) outside of that the game play is very different than the original, and much lighter (good for younger kids). The only reason I didn't give this game 5 stars is due to some of the rules not being clear (for example, one of the chance cards lets you move any player from the other team to the space you're on and they must follow the rules of that space... but it doesn't say what that looks like for Jail, if you're in jail and call someone to that place are they just visiting or do they go to jail with you?) Just a few little things like that - overall though, we had a lot of fun playing this light game as a family.
This was purchased for a birthday gift.  It arrived promptly and in excellent condition.  Recommend this for a child's present.
Box is totally smushed! This was a Christmas gift

We bought this game for our daughter and niece for Christmas. They both loved the game! We've played with them as well. Super easy to learn. It is a game that doesn't take too long to play as well. It was fun for the whole family. My daughter is 9, but my husband and I and my 16 year old daughter enjoyed playing it with her. Would definitely recommend.

It’s not quite the typical monopoly but still the same concept. We didn’t used to be able to play monopoly as a family because I would end up flipping over the table or throwing things (😂) but we haven’t had that issue with this game. My daughter just LOVES how adorable it is. I think it’s an amazing purchase for family game nights with little girls.

review_title: Difficult to learn and more of an icon game for older kids.
review_description: This game was pretty confusing. And NOT for an odd number of players because you don’t take turns around in a circle. There are two teams and you take turns by a llama player going then a unicorn player going. So odd number of players is weird. And it’s very difficult to get all the way around the board and you don’t start out with enough money to buy the trophy spots. Do not recommend for those under 8ish.

review_title: Most confusing rules and game is stagnates  nice
review_description: This game so confusing. You can play with just two players but it makes no sense. Best with 4+ players, however it still makes no sense. The team llama and team unicorn makes it difficult to understand how do you gain money? So weird to win. Tributes are not rent...not sure whats going on with this version. I am at a loss for words

review_title: Novel addition to family game night
review_description: I’m still not sure if we’re playing this exactly right, the directions could be written better, but it’s fun and cute for the kids. Nothing overly special about the bells and whistles, but it has enough added whimsy to give game night a bit of flair. Our whole family likes board games so it’s a nice, novel addition to our collection.

Positives; only need two players, lots of dumb jokes, llamas and unicorns, very colorful, and easy to play.Negatives; takes really long to play, kids get mad when their qualities get bought, and there's some serious trash talking going on with the chance cards that can make for sibling attitudes.

This was a Christmas gift for my 8 year old granddaughter.  She specifically asked for this one.  We have already played a couple of games.  What fun!!  It is not nearly long as the original Monopoly game.  It is basically short sweet & fun!!  I lost one and won one.  Easy to learn.  Fun to play.

I have  5 year old and 7 year old daughter, and they love this game! It was very easy for my 5 year old to learn, and it is helping my 7 year old build critical thinking and strengthen her adding skills. The game breaks you up into unicorns vs llamas, and we find it better to do one adult and one child per team. The game board is smaller (8x8 instead of 10x10) and it’s claims that the game ends when all spots are purchased, so it it a shorter game to keep the littles’ attention. Would definitely recommend for a household with kids

review_title: Research the Rules of the Game Before You Buy
review_description: Definitely not what we were expecting when we got this as a game for our family. Not the easiest to learn and follow which makes it not much fun. We ended up making up our own rules as we go. And it’s a good thing we did because if not the game would be sitting in the cabinet collecting dust.

Kids loved it, we were also able to play a faster game thanks to the teamwork and fact that the game ends when all places have been landed on instead of bankruptcy. Only complaint is that the colors are all similar and it can be a little harder visually for us older folk.

review_title: Would recommend, neat verson of monopoly
review_description: A bit pricey but the game pieces are indestructible metal and the game pieces are made of thick cardboard. Easy to learn to play as long as you read the directions as it is different from original monopoly. The game makes money easy by only having $500 and $100 bills. Is a combo of cooperative play AND competitive play.

review_title: Children’s version, terrible chemical odor after opening
review_description: Not a complete monopoly game, this is a children's version and is missing multiple aspects of classic monopoly such as railroads and utilities. Also only comes with $100 and $500 bills. Also reeks of chemicals for weeks after opening. Would not buy for children!

review_title: Fun, entertaining, and can be played in less than 30 minutes
review_description: This is a fun family game.  It's a quick game, but fun and something new to play.  We play an extended version if we feel like playing longer where the game ends when all spaces have three tokens on them (versus ending the game when the last space is "bought").  Definitely recommend!

review_title: cute game that requires team work
review_description: I like this version of monopoly. I purchased it for my 7 year old and it's very fun. I wish there was more denominations of money to make it more challenging, and it would be nice to have a team or individual player option. (Right now it's only teams). Overall 9/10.

This game is so fun to play! Easy to learn and play. I played with my little sisters age 8 14 and 16 and we all had lots of fun! This isn’t long like normal monopoly so it’s perfect for younger kids or people who hate the commitment monopoly takes!

We play this with my sons, ages 6 and 8, and we all love it.  Includes the aspects of Monopoly that make it fun, but it's way less complex and doesn't take hours to play.  A board game that kids and adults both sincerely enjoy is itself a rare unicorn - highly recommend!

Loved this game! It's a simplified version of Monopoly, but not so simple that we (age 44 & 50) didn't enjoy it.  Note: the unicorns and llamas play in teams,  so it's a good version for 2 people. Or 4 or 6, but 3 or 5 people would be unbalanced teams.

review_title: My 8 year old granddaughter loves it.
review_description: We have played on original Monopoly board with my granddaughter since she was 5. Of Course, relaxing the rules. She loves this Unicorns and Llamas game. We think Monopoly helps build strategy. And really like that she isn't in front of the TV

review_title: Llamas eat candy, Unicorns poop rainbows
review_description: This version is amazing. It’s a great bridge between Monopoly Jr., and regular Monopoly. It’s engaging AND doesn’t last forever! Plus who doesn’t love a little llama/ unicorn competition? Very cute family game.

My family loves Monopoly and we get all the different ones that come out. I gotta say this one might be the cutest one they have made!! My daughter who is 7 just fell in love with this game. If you're looking for a fun game to play with the whole family you should pick this one up.

We got this as a gift for my daughter who is obsewith llamas. Little did we know it would be a family fun time for all. Easy to follow directions, team play AND competition, positive messages... yup. Major win.  LOVE THIS.

review_title: It is one of the best purchases I have made for my family
review_description: I am a die hard classic Monopoly player, so I was a bit hesitant to purchase the Ultimate. It is one of the best purchases I have made for my family. We have played this almost every night since we got it a week or so ago. We love it!! Only wish more players could play at one time but other than that it's amazing!! The speed of this game gives you a chance to play multiple rounds. It's fast, fun and a nice change from the classic. Never thought I would ever say that!! Thanks for making our vacation that much more fun!!!

Love it. Colors are great, all the pieces were there and the directions are the same as regular monopoly with a few twists. Great game but should be for kids of 12 years or older, it is not as easy for younger kids to catch on.

review_title: More fun than I thought it would be
review_description: This game is so much fun. It is shorter than the original Monopoly and longer than Monopoly Jr. It had its own similarities to both the original and junior versions but with its own twist, too. You play as teams. Each team can be made up of only one person. We usually have the odd man out be the banker.
Pretty fun game.  The same basic gameplay as old-school Monopoly, but played with "teams" of Unicorns or Llamas.  Much quicker gameplay than regular Monopoly game, so kids shouldn't lose interest.

Awesome. Was fun for all the kids (2, 4, 6, 8) and not boring for mom. Instructions are super easy to follow, and the art is cute. 10/10, highly recommended. The only downside is that the kids want to play it multiple times per day!

review_title: Cute game, takes awhile to finish though!
review_description: Great game, super cute my 8 year old loves the idea of llamas vs unicorns!! It's basic Monopoly but I feel the introduction of the ability to take back properties makes the game go on FOREVER. Even more so than regular Monopoly. 🤣

review_title: Fun game for the whole family
review_description: My sons bought this game for their sister's 7th birthday. The three of them (10yo, 8yo & 7yo) have enjoyed playing together several times. The game is easy to learn, fun to play and appeals to my daughter's girly sensibilities.

I got this game as a Christmas gift for my daughter, thinking it was just a unicorn/llama version of normal monopoly. Completely wrong, it is such a strange version and is nothing like the normal game. Very confusing and not very much fun to play.
This is honestly the weirdest monopoly game I’ve ever played the rules are nothing like the original game not even close. My daughter played it once and hated it.
Very similar to Monopoly. Only you have types of unicorns and llamas rather than properties. Played all day with my 7 year old granddaughter who asked for it for Christmas. Such fun!

My granddaughter and I played this the other night and we had a blast...It is not like other Monopoly games at all, so know that going in bit my granddaughter, who is 9, and loves Monopoly games still loved this one...Younger kids could play this one easily, bit older kids can have fun too...
My granddaughter wanted this for Christmas and was thrilled when she opened it last night. When I called after getting home last night - they were playing it and having a ball!!
I ordered this as a gift for a 7YO granddaughter.  She enjoys playing the game and the 5YO sibling is able to play with a little help.  The adults enjoyed it also.

review_title: Save your money on this particular one
review_description: We are highly disappointed in this product. This was delivered Sunday, and we took turns playing it Monday and Tuesday evenings. This pic was just taken this morning, Wednesday, after only 2 nights of use. It is very cheaply made and scuffed up so badly that the little pucks do not glide smoothly anymore and kind of defeats the purpose of the game.

This FULL price game arrived in the bare box (not a shipping box) unsealed with the word "DEMO" written on both sides using a sharpie. The game board inside had the word "DEMO" handwritten on it using a permanent marker. Really nice touch when presenting as a gift. Ended up giving it away and building a much better version using a tray, checkers and a smattering of imagination.

My brother wanted this for his birthday, not understanding what the heck it was about, I ordered it anyways since we are all avid hockey fans. As soon as he opened it and explained it to us we were all hooked. It's so simple, yet addictive! We are all adults and now have extreme competitions with this game! Lol!

its very basic and small, most the time the wooden disks fly out the top of the game not into the intended slot. one of those purchases that sounded good after spending too long browsing amazon. its cute but unnecessary. I would buy it at a yard sale if I saw it.

What a fun game! I thouht it may be too simple but after reading the other reviews I decided to buy it for my hockey loving husband. We’ve taken it to parties and have played countless times together. Don’t let the simplicity fool you; it’s an awesome game.

review_title: Cool game but check for defects before giving it as a gift or storing it away.
review_description: The first order of this the item had a defect. The bottom board that is glued to the border had one corner that was slanted down. So when you try to line up the discs, the disc would go under the rope rather then in front of it.I wasn't able to press the bottom board up to be flush with the border, since the glue was blocking it from being flush.I do like the game and a good alternative to playing video games.

I had loved this game my friend had for her kid's so I bought it for mine. The new one didn't work like her older version. Instead of wooden disks with a star on them we got slick, black hockey pucks. They don't slide the same! Maybe the elastic is placed different too but the black pucks fly all over the place and don't slide along the board like the wooden disk did. It makes the game frustrating instead of fun. So sad!

I love the idea of this game., it’s super fun for kids and adults alike. The game board isn’t very thick, though it’s sturdy enough. It is smaller than I thought it would be. The elastic bands that you use to sling the puck aren’t as tight as they should be, making the shot fairly weak, but if you hold the slack on one side it works well. Overall we’ve had a ton of fun with the game, but I wish it was more nicely made.

review_title: Perfect for those who are in love with hockey
review_description: Purchased for my 5 year old nephew. Never was really into board games, but he has played this game for hours and hours. Perfect for those who are in love with hockey!!!
Rubber bands mounted too high. Puck goes underneath

To start, my girlfriend and I were excited to get this game and play. Unfortunately the craftsmanship of this item is lacking. One side gets a very unfair advantage as the other side was not put together flat making the pucks slide under the bungie. It is a fun game, but the craftsmanship can be better. It's not fun to play when one person wins everytime due to one side being defective.
So far so good.. 4 and 5 year old like to play this together (although they argue and try to push them through if it is touching) teaches them to work under pressure and far game.
It’s a family game. I have really good time playing against my family members.This is a weekend entertainer to me.

This game is a real winner.  It's so simple you can't believe you didn't think it up!  Of course, it's ridiculously expensive for what it is, but there's no denying that it's fun.  Strangely addictive.  It can be pretty competitive too, but it's fast moving, so each game is quickly over, and the losing player is ready to try to win the next one.  Probably very good to help develop manual dexterity for the 5 to 7 year old child.  It's also entertaining for one player to play alone (is that called "practicing"?)  The adult kids in their 40's seemed to have just as much fun with it as the grandkids did!
Super fun game in my opinion. Simple, inexpensive, fun for all and no mess to clean up. Definitely a fun game to play
Paid $19 for a ripped item..
I saw an expensive version of this in a magazine and came here to find it.  This version is just as good, inexpensive and a ton of fun for all ages.  (Really!)

review_title: Quick to learn and can play right out of the box.
review_description: Super easy game that get everyone addicted. Just watching the kids play the adults want to get in on the action. Simple concept but everyone has differing strategies. Do you just keep shooting relentlessly or do you plan and aim your shot? Some strategies work better than others. One plus is the kids can start playing right out of the box..no instructions are really needed. Open and play. Love it..great go to family gift.

Giving a 2 star review as of right now. We received this Monday and it was missing one puck. A small item to be missing, but missing nonetheless. Went to the company's website and left a message Tuesday the 7th. Have not heard back. Finally left a voicemail today.Will update if it gets resolved.It is a fun little game though! Definitely worth the money

Super fun game!  (4-5 years +)  The board is slightly unlevel and tips corner to corner.  Probably just mass produced and a lack of attention to detail.  The game still plays just fine, just a pet pive of mine.
This game is so much fun! Super simple to learn and play. It's been a good way for me to connect with my teenagers and get them away from their video games for a minute.

This game is really fun. It doesn’t take forever to finish so you can play many games in little time. The only negative I have is that the band should be a little tighter. So far though I love this game.
Don't want to do the dishes or clean the room? Challenge your friend or partner and the winner doesn't have to clean at all!
Was a gift for my daughter's boyfriend. They have a ball playing it. Nice and compact. Doesn't take up much room at the Dorm.
Fun quick paced game. Only issue is the one string is starting to move up so the mini pucks are sliding under it when pulling back. Maybe from too much use the first couple days.
It’s fun and super addicting! If you want to have fun and pass the time? This is the perfect game to get. Looks a little cheap but the game works as it’s described!

This game is so fun, super easy to catch on, and the quality is amazing. I gave it as a gift and I ask to play all the time ... the board and pieces are smooth and the game pieces slide nicely. 10/10 reccomend for anyone

review_title: So much fun for kids and adults
review_description: Fun to play, it's always a blast playing this game with my 10 and 8 year old! Nothing to assemble, just open the box, split the pucks and go!

review_title: FUN FUN FUN  Kids will LOVE It!
review_description: WE LOVE this game! Our family has so much fun with this!!! Get this and your kids will get hooked. Better than video games. Have tournaments with your kids. It's a lot of fun.
Very fun, easy for anyone to play. The board slides around a little bit when playing fast, maybe can use a little rubber on bottom but not a big deal.
Both adults and kids in our family enjoy playing this game. Fast paced and simple enough for a 5 year old or a 70 year old.  No parts to break and fast moving.  Highly recommended.  Need two players.

I stumbled upon this while looking for a good, but inexpensive table top air hockey game for my nephew for Christmas. I learned that it basically does not exist. I purchased this instead because of good reviews. My nephew was a little confused as to what it was at first, but was very excited when he figured it out.

THE BEST GAME EVER! My 10 year old son keeps bringing it to school every year for the "board games day" and it is a hit every time! Kids that play this game with my son always ask where to buy it. It really gets kids and adults hooked! :)
This has to be the best present I've ever got for my kids.  They play and laugh together.  Because just when you think you are winning? You better look again 😄 so much fun.

This game is fun for virtually anyone! We had to have it after playing it at a brewery. My young nephews love it as well since they can sometimes beat the adults even when we are trying to win! Came from seller in plastic wrap, brand new.
My 5 year old grandson LOVES this game! I bought it to use as a break from online school but I gave up and sent it home with him to play with! This was a Gramma “win.” Easy to play and set up!
I wish the board was several inches bigger in each dimension and especially the side walls.  Puck sails off the board often

review_title: Great family fun, nimble fingers required!
review_description: Got this for the family and have played a few times with my kids, it's definitely a fun, exciting little game. We've had some surprisingly good battles that go back and forth so even the spectators enjoy themselves.Games are also fairly quick!

review_title: What I liked about this game is the whole competitive nature it ...
review_description: What I liked about this game is the whole competitive nature it brings out in the whole family. It's like a tournament when brought out and the next person says, "I got winner!" Another good part is that the youngest player can even beat the oldest. Good wholesome family fun.
I heard friends talking about playing FastTrack and how much fun it was.  This is not the Fast Track they were talking about I found out much later.  Their game is played with cards and a game board.
Quick. Simple. Fun.I love it just as much as my kids (10yo and 12yo)
Fun game that is fast paced and challenging. Good for putting away the electronics and faster than a board game.
Good fun for kids and adults.
Fun to pass the time and easy to travel with. It's not very big (they sell smaller versions)
So much fun! I can’t believe this game isn’t more popular.
great game. Kids love it. It's always a hit when they have game day at school. Easy to take along at places where you need to keep the kids busy when doing something too.

review_title: Great Game For My Little Nephew
review_description: I bought this for my three year old nephew, who absolutely loves this game. It's well built and easy for young kids to play.
It's smaller than other brands!

review_title: A little too small but still gets use
review_description: Cute little game. Fun. It's very small. Too small in my opinion, a couple of inches larger would be ideal as it's too easy to get it through the goal. Which my boys got bored quickly with it because of that.  (They are 7 & 5)It fits in a small backpack, which is nice and has come in handy.
Product came defective. Poor workmanship. One side was not even fastened properly. Will return.

review_title: Electronic bookkeeping for each player!  Nicely updated classic game!
review_description: Nice updated version, allows electronic bookkeeping of players portfolio and banking information.  Allows sears to choose a career path or continue education in the start of the game.  Fun.PLEASE NOTE: If you appreciated this review please give it a “thumbs up/like” your helping me to continue to give honest/unbiased insight into products I’ve used and you may have questions about. Interested in a product but don't know enough about it and would like it reviewed? Please let me know and I'll see what I can do... Thank you 🙏

review_title: More Like a Distant Cousin of the Original Game But Still Fun
review_description: Overall my family loved this game, but there are some cons in addition to pros.First, if you're looking for the old-fashioned traditional game of life, this isn't it. Not even close. It's more like a distant cousin than a twin. However, with that being said, it is much easier to play and when your kids are insisting on game night and all you want to do is curl up with a book it is so much easier to use the ATM type money counter that comes with the game than handing out actually fake money for your kids to lose and your vacuum to suck up at a later date.The biggest drawback is that only 4 people can play at a time. I have six kids. Fortunately two of them are three and under and are happy to play "teams" with some of the other kids.Bottom line, if you're looking for the game you loved as a child this isn't it. If you're looking for something new and amusing, this is definitely worth the money.

review_title: Twice as complicated and half as fun as the original
review_description: This isn't just an electronic version of the same "Life" game from years ago.  In addition to making it electronic the game itself is different, but not necessarily better (no stock, auto insurance or life insurance to buy for example, and no wedding gifts or baby gifts etc).Every player gets a card and one calculator-type device gets passed around.  You put your card in it and record whatever money you received or paid during a turn. The device tallies all the money and tells you who won. If you prefer the original "Life" game but not the hassle of dealing with paper money on every turn just give every player a calculator and let them tally their individual money totals on their own devices. Then you don't have to pass around one device, you don't have any cards to keep track of, and you can play the original game but "electronically."

review_title: A fantastic update to a classic game.  In addition to the electronic banking, lots of little changes to make it better.
review_description: We wanted a new Life game because our old one's spinner was terrible.  This one has a FANTASTIC spinner that can't jam, and the new electronic banking is really easy and fun to use.  We were playing the original version once a week so I feel like I can speak from authority here - this one is loads better.  It's really well-designed.Top tip - have the banker hold onto all the credit cards.  It makes no sense to keep giving them back to each player at the end of every turn.It's a really fantastic way to update a game and they've changed so much, making it easy to play and lots of fun.  My kids love it.

review_title: Fun and laughs for the whole family
review_description: Our family has been playing a much older version of Life for the last few years, so we were looking for an updated game. This was such a step up! We received it super fast (thank you Amazon prime!!), and played it the evening we received it. Our kids are 11 and 13 and they had lots of fun. This version has cards and a card reader instead of paper cash, so my daughter loved being the “banker” adding and subtracting cash from everyone’s cards. There is so much interactive opportunities with the “action” cards, which made the game so much more fun. Some of them have you compare dance moves, try to make each other laugh, list your dream vacation and so much more. This is a longer game- it took us almost an hour to play it, but was full of laughter the entire time. I highly recommend this as a fun family game!

review_title: Didn't think I would like it, but really enjoyed it
review_description: I tend not to like remakes of classic games. I bought this for my nephew for Christmas, per his request. I really didn't think I would like the game. I was pleasantly surprised. We ended up playing it several times and we plan to play it next time we visit. The electronic counter was accurate and the addition of different career options and different housing options was fun. I still won't give up my classic game, but I will certainly play this version again. We could use more babies as we were overloading our cars :)

I wasn’t sure if I would like this version. We got it due to the banking aspect and my daughter was excited to be the banker and use the cards. The bank cards actually work well, easier than I thought it would be. One change I wasn’t sure about was the fact that the board isn’t the same as before. Now instead of landing on something and it’s always the same there are cards to draw which can change up the game. I am very pleased with this version.

Great family game.  It allows you to address some crazy questions in a fun way with kids, tweens.  It does teach them math and think about what they want to their money on.  However, get ready for people to be upset.  Fun for family gatherings, or quality time together.

review_title: Great Fun and Easy to Learn
review_description: Much like the classic Game of Life, the object of the game is to collect the most money, property, and overall value by the end of the game.  It is very straightforward and super easy to learn.  The electronic banking makes things go a lot more smoothly and eases up that aspect of the game in comparison to the older versions which use fake dollar bills and can get a bit overwhelming.The game is fun for those young and old and easy to understand.  The only downside that I have against it is that it is a bit TOO straightforward and simplistic.  There really isn't much strategy involved at all, more luck.  It is very a much a game where you take your turn, move your piece, do your part, and repeat.Because of the simplicity and ease of learning, I would say that this game is great for a family game night.

review_title: Love it! Love it!  Love it!
review_description: This is by far my favorite childhood board game.  I love the Electronic Banking part, it makes it much harder for people to cheat and keeps the game under control in that regard.  Life is a fun simulated life board game requiring you and your opponents to got through the many different stages of life including going to school, getting married, finding a job, having children, and retiring.  Many obstacle pop up through the game to give you some challanges.  Still one of favorite board games!

review_title: Worth to pay for the banking system
review_description: We are a bit worried about the banking system. My son recently started learning money and calculations. Should we go with the original version (paper money) or this version??  We are so glad that we got this. This device is very easy to use and even 7 year old can become "a banker" on this game.  The game does not take too long so both parents and kids can have a stress-free wonderful time together.

This version is way better than the original. The original you had to play with dollar bills which take forever to organize, but now all you have to do is type in the number and it's added or subtracted from you card! Also all the dollar bills get folded and wrinkled every time you put them away. Also it is easy to learn and easy to use. Not to mention that it comes fast and in much better quality than the original life game. This game is definitely 5 stars and I recommend it to everybody on Earth!!!! (P.S. what a cheap price!)

review_title: Fun and easy to play game for everyone
review_description: I bought this game for nostalgic purposes plus I was curious about the electronic banking.  After a couple games it became very easy to use.  The gameboard is smaller and redesigned and gameplay has been changed as well.  You still have the same styles game pieces and the spinner but none of the other pieces attached to the game board from previous versions.  At least you don't have to keep up with the paper money which is a plus in my opinion.  I still have fun playing this game with family and friends so I believe it's well worth the price.

I've always loved this game as a kid growing up and was excited to try out the "electronic" version.  While they have updated the game a bit and changed some of the classic features I used to love, my family tweaked the rules a bit without any problem.  My young nephew was at my house over the holidays and absolutely had a blast playing this game with the grownups.  The new addition of adding actual "actions" to be performed for the standard action places added a new and highly entertaining element to the game.

review_title: Hate board games but this one was quick and fun
review_description: Our Grandkids love us to play board games with them.  Their favorite is the old Monopoly game--which I hate because it takes so long!  This one is so much faster and players get to choose the paths they want to take (not as boring).  I am so glad I got it for them as a gift...it's a fun exchange (and so nice with the electronic money function), and it doesn't take what seems like a "year" to finish.  Good purchase.

Great game for all ages! Youngest player was 6 and two middle schools and one adult completed the foursome. All enjoyed it. I wish the game included more than 4 players. Also, a bonus pack of additional “Action, College, Career, etc. cards (for purchase) would be fun. Great buy.

My daughters were so excited for this to come in the mail. When it got here, it was missing 2 of the 4 Credit cards. Amazon says to contact Hasbro for missing parts. I reached out to the website given by Amazon to the “live chat” where I was told I was fourth in line, then only one person ahead of me and then suddenly, a statement saying there were no customer service reps to help me. So I called the customer service phone number also given by Amazon, and there was a voice message saying they had no one available and directing me to the live chat on the website again.

It is a good twist to the original game. Kids love the card reader. It also makes it much easier to award money to the players. The paper money takes longer and is more to clean up. I would like to see a better disparity on salary for college and none college jobs.

As the wonderful mothers we are, we bought our 10yr old this because they love playing it on their phone. We play this at least once a day and was definitely worth the price! The updated debit cards are great!

Christmas gift for the grandkids and it was a hit! The game has changed since I've played it but still enjoyed it. We played it all week and didn't get bored. Kids ages 6, 9 and 11. Liked the addition of the computer bank and the new twists of rolling for prize money. Lots of fun!

review_title: Wrong version, but a fun game
review_description: We ordered the Electronic Banking version but got the non-electronic version.  My kids were super disappointed, but we kept the game anyway so as not to deal with the return process and waiting involved.  It's just harder for the youngest ones to play and I dislike having the paper money to deal with as well.
Purchased for family game night. Definitely made the game a lot easier when dealing with the money part for sure. LOVE IT

Great game! I bought it for a 12 year old and we both enjoyed it! Only problem was the cool little bank that showed your money amount. When we first opened the game and played with it, the screen was already a little hard to read. By the end of the third game, about a week later, I couldn't read the numbers without smashing the screen! Although the game itself is fun, I'm a little bummed at the cheap calculator bank that comes with it.

review_title: Not your “grandma’s” game of life, but fun to play
review_description: We have had more fun with this game than we thought. Kids love it. Need to get used to the bank card thing but it’s worth it. If you have kids, and you used to play the old “Game of Life” you’ll like this a lot as  Long as you get used to the differences. Would definitely buy it again

review_title: Definitely different than the original but great version
review_description: So this is a bit different than the original. You will have to go over the instructions a few times. That being said I love this new way of life and the electronic banking is so fun for kids. My 6 year old loves being able to control his own money

My kids ages 11 and 9 now ha e a new favorite game! It is very entertaining. We have probably 10+ board games too and have game nights saturday nights. Only bummer is that it only plays four people at most.

review_title: All Games Should Have Electronic Banking!!!! <3 LOVE IT!!!
review_description: We purchased another game with electronic banking last year so when we were in the market for another game and saw LIFE with electronic banking, it was a no-brainer! LIFE is a great family game and we are enjoying it very much. We are just wondering when LIFE will get with the times and let us choose to get married, have kids and/or get divorced. LOL

Our favorite family game night game! My husband, my 8 year old daughter, my 6 year old son, and myself all love this game. Sometimes it takes a long time but we never notice. Lots of fun and easy to play!
Lots of fun, no fumbling with cash... max 4 players as there are only 4 cards with it... preferred over original for gameplay ease, not for number of players

I really loved playing this with my husband and 10 year old. They said they had a lot of fun as well. Gameplay was long / short enough to perfectly enjoy and we adults agreed how nice it was that we didnt have to deal with paper money.

My niece loves doing the electronic banking, and it makes the hassle of counting paper money so much easier.  Hopefully, this is the future for all money-based board games.  But be warned, this is not the original LIFE game or the original LIFE board.  There are new, updated life events.it's  I do probably prefer the old game better, but it's a nice way to make the game quicker and more efficient.

my kids love it but the electronic banking is boring, lets the calculator do simple math that would be better done by the kids (easy learning for them) and I really dislike all the action blocks.  I'd use the electronic banking with the original game.

review_title: will easily be lost if not kept altogether
review_description: My children enjoys it very much. But pegs are very small, will easily be lost if not kept altogether.
its fun and one little problem are that it is a little bit hard to learn. (it's our first time to play, confuse to learn. )but it's easy to play and put the card in.
Didn’t care for the electronic banking. More trouble than its worth. Faster to just use paper money.
We enjoy this version of Life. My kids particularly enjoy this version. We have kids under 10. Usually one adult does the credit cards. It works best that way.
I might be a terrible gamer, but you can buy a more fun and cheaper life game at target for $15. There's no need to buy a $25 game. The other even comes with pets in the game.
We learned it quick and the game credit cards are fun to use! Doesn't take a long time to play, but long enough to keep a good competition going with a 7 year old!

I play this game with girls that range from 8 years old to 15 and we have so much fun. We love pretending and trying to see what life might be like form the going to school and retiring. these credit cards make it easier to keep up with our money.
Grandchildren loved the addition of the hand-held bank! No paper $$ to divide up and find on the floor and under furniture when the game is put away.

review_title: We have really enjoyed playing this during our family game days
review_description: A must get game to play with the family. I was never much of a fan of this game but with the addition of the electronic banking it has made it more entertaining & less of a pain to play. We have really enjoyed playing this during our family game days.

Love this new twist on a good ole standby!  So much fun. The credit card option is great...and so much more fun than dealing with money.  Plus, you can't tell how much money the competitors have until the game is over! Yay!

This is my family's Go-To game. We love it. Play it every couple of months. We have the paper money version but wanted to get the credit card version for easier game play. Dealing with paper can be time consuming. The batteries in the card reader have lasted the entire time we've had it.
So much easier for the litter ones than counting stacks of thousand dollar bills lol.

My daughter loves it! No longer messy and cluttered with those paper bills etc. (we have the old version). And the good thing with it was, the game just gathered us all as a family playing and enjoying more. This has just changed our routine of taking time out from FB and Twitter! We are loving it!

review_title: The electronic banking makes it so easy!
review_description: My daughter is 7 and loves this game. The electronic banking makes it so easy!

Kids and adults love this game!  The addition of an electronic card system to tally your money is novel and fun.  We have the electronic version and an earlier version, and we agree that we wish there were more options in the newer version.
Arrived on time and very great product, so much easier than using all the paper money and works perfectly!
My kids, my husband and I spend a very good family moments playing this game. Very good!
I bought this for family time with our 12 year old daughter. Fun game that takes about 1 hour to play. Each player is issued a “credit card” that stores all your data, pretty neat novelty for kids!

review_title: The Most Underated Game of Our Time
review_description: Perfect for couples who can't afford a mediator. My man and I keep this game locked and loaded for any rapid rounds we need to engage in when we cannot agree on where to eat or who's turn it is to take out the trash. Add an element of fun to your life rather than responsibility and duke it out over some connect four! easy to use, fun to play, like 5x above rock paper scissors or tic tac toe. Invest in your relationship, invest in connect four.

So this connect 4 is your standard connect 4. It’s not the strongest model but it gets the job done. Coming out off the box it’s 4 pieces the slide that holds or drops the chips which stays on after that and the 2 legs. To store it in the box you have to take the 2 legs off. So each time you play you need to put on the legs but it doesn’t take more than 15 seconds. Even my 3 year old nephew can do it on his own.

I have been a connect four person for YEARS!!! After finally breaking my last board ( yes... we play a lot of Connect 4 in our house), I had to finally buy a new one.
