I honestly have not used the blue chips included in this set... I tend to stick to the original rules of the game... What can I say, I'm old-fashioned :). Maybe one day we'll break them out.. interesting concept- just not sure if we're ready for it as of yet :).The board itself is made of a hard, and durable plastic. The chips are also very sturdy. I see this board last us quite a number of years.

review_title: Connect Four in a row, BUT before your opponent does it. Fun game!
review_description: Connect Four is a winner for the very young, the little bit older, and the lot older (yes, the grownups).  The really small ones have fun dropping the colored discs into patterns and then releasing them from the bottom.  Fun.  A little older kids will be getting the idea of putting four discs in a row while picking up a bit of basic math.  Some fun and some learning at that age. The grownups should enjoy the game as they attempt to connect four in a row before their opponent does so. Setup is pretty quick. Slip on the two legs and the game is set to go. If you found this review helpful, please click the 'Helpful' button below. Thank you!  P.S., While the grownups here have enjoyed this game pretty much forever, our recent experiences have been from watching a two-year-old and her four-year-old brother experience the game at their young ages.  It’s a winner at our house.

This game is so flimsy. It's missing the feature that holds the chips at the bottom and keeps them from rolling all over the place when you clear the game. Would have spent a lot more on a quality product
I had this as a child best game ever and bought it as an adult. I play with my children  and we have endless hours of fun with this game plus it helps with math this is awesome!

review_title: The game itself is great. My students love that the tokens are serrated ...
review_description: The game itself is great. My students love that the tokens are serrated for easy stacking. But whoever designed this box was crazy. The box looks like a perfect square but is very slightly NOT a perfect square. It took one class period for a frustrated fifth grader to rip the box in order for it to fit the correct way. And after opening the box myself, I don't blame the kid one bit.

When I play this with my grandchildren, we don't use the blue blocker discs.  This game did not use to have that but to buy this game in the original version was much more expensive.  Still, grandchildren enjoy it and I do think it is a good brain game.

Connect Four is a family fun game from my childhood. This game is built with a bit better construction than the game of my youth although played just the same. My 6 yr old twins and 10 yr old grandkids all enjoy competing in this game for bragging rights of who is the most clever for the day.It stores easily in its game box and is set up quickly for play. Connect Four has been a staple in my game closet for 30 plus years. I purchased this to replace my love-worn game from the early 80’s. I hope this review is helpful in convincing you that this is 10$ well spent for decades of family fun. It’s a two-player game, but we play it tournament style so all can play when more than 2 want to compete. If you don’t lose the checkers... you’ll love this game still in 2050!

I loved Connect 4 growing up and was super excited to get it for my boys (3 and 5). I ran across it in Fred Meyer for 17 bucks.... seriously!? Amazon had it for WAY cheaper so obviously this is where it is at. The game itself is made well and easy to put together. My 3 yo likes to mess about with it, even if he doesn't really get the concept. My 5 year old loves it. I had to hide the blue pieces though because I have no idea what they do. I looked for instructions in the box and there weren't any.... I mean, I get the main concept, but shouldn't all games have a thing telling you how to do it!? Would have given 5, but the blue things are weird.

review_title: This game is a classic for old and young alike!
review_description: We still use the same connect 4 game from when my own kids were young, but had to buy a second one for the grandchildren to play with! They are only toddlers, but for now, they like to make different patterns with the colors then delight in sliding open the bottom to watch the pieces drop out. Excellent quality, easy to learn, and fun for all ages.

This is a wonderful classic game and I was so happy to find it on Amazon. The game board isn't the best quality plastic, but I didn't see any better quality options anywhere. The game was easy to set up, and it was easy to teach my child how to play. Great game if you want to help your child work on those critical thinking skills, plus its fun! Overall, great find, and glad this game is still on the market. Brings back many childhood memories.

review_title: Great tool for social skills and relationships.
review_description: This game is one of my favorite tools to foster social skills in young children and strengthen child-adult relationships.Facing each other and in close proximity, the eye contact and alternating turns f this game encourage conversation and bonding. Both the child and the adult have something to focus on which makes them more relaxed and in turn helps them open up to each other. Classic

This Connect Four Game is exactly as you would expect. We had to put it together which took less than 30 seconds. It seems plenty sturdy and my 6 year old granddaughter loves playing the game. The bottom release worked very well to let the discs drop so we could begin a new game.  We easily fit everything back in the box once we were done.

review_title: Mom doesn't let kids win to be nice, they have to earn it haha
review_description: This game has really shown my little one the importance of strategy. Mom doesn't let kids win to be nice, they have to earn it haha.

review_title: Connect4 is an old favorite in this house
review_description: Connect4 is an old favorite in this house.  Such a great way to encourage middle schoolers to think beyond decisions "right now".  Helps them to consider, "What if I...?"  But a great game and gets kids away from screens!Be careful with the stand.  The stands aren't super sturdy.  I fear the stand will break as our last one did.

I purchased this game (that we all played as kids) for a Toys for Tots gift collection.  The package lookedgreat and the super sale price was under $10.00. I felt generous, and hoping that the child who received ithad lots of fun.  Amazon has some great "Toy" sales.

Great value for money. I played this as a kid, and now play with my 6 year old. There are now some blue discs which are a new addition, they make it a little easier to block the other player. Otherwise it's the same exact game from my childhood. Still fun to play!

review_title: Very cheaply made. Not the game construction you remember.
review_description: I played this game as a kid and my toddler just recently broke one of the arms on my game from when I was little. I bought this to replace my 80s version. It is not sturdy and definitely will not hold up to rough play at all. I am keeping it until she is a bit older and will see how it fairs.

My girlfriend and I bust out the Connect Four whenever there's a big decision that needs to be made. Take mother in law on life support? Connect Four. Minivan or SUV? Connect Four. We don't flip coins in this house. We play connect Four.

I decided to order a connect4 game for my 10 year old brother for Christmas and I was really excited for it. When it was shipped and I opened the package I was terribly surprised to find that the whole side of the game box was broken and ripped. THEN TAPED BACK TOGETHER! However, the box that it was shipped in appeared totally fine. I am very angry to have received this torn box from Amazon. I really believed that this gift would be perfect.

review_title: Purchased as a gift to keep cousins happy while we can't leave the house!
review_description: An eleven year old helped her four year old cousin play the game with her. The little one kept asking to play again and again. Also, adults enjoyed having some fun with it! Definitely recommended. An oldie but a goodie.

I love this game and so do the kids! Purchased this one and everything is all right. The pieces are a little fragile, not made for a tough duty. You know how the kids are, I'm surprised it has lasted this long.

Connect 4 was always a favorite game of mine as a child, and I was very excited to play it again. It's a fair price for a fun and easy to learn with great play-ability. The plastic also seems to be made well: the board and stands fit snugly with little play, and the pieces themselves are nice.All in all, I highly recommend it to anyone who liked connect 4 growing up, or have children in their lives who enjoy some competition and using their noggins!-Joe

review_title: Kids need more games like this!
review_description: Grandkids, ages 5 and 9 play this together and LOVE IT! Gets them off the computer stuff and laughing and playing together.  Adults can have a blast playing this with the kids. Truly fun for all the family.
Great dealAnd the kids love it
This is cute and fun. I didnt realize when I bought it that it had the little blue pieces as additions and new way to play with them. We gave it a chance and it was pretty fun.

I received this game in February but never opened it to play until May 11th which was then I found out that the bottom piece that slides to keep the chips in, is actually missing and did not come in the box. I am not sure what to do at this point cause the game is useless to me now😞

review_title: Fun Way to Learn Patterns and Planning Skills
review_description: I got this for my 9 year old nephew, he loved playing it. There was a twist with black discs in the game, which was fun for me to learn as a new version of the game. Easy to set up and store.

My son requested this for one of his Christmas gifts. I played with him a few times and it's a fun active game. We enjoyed it. Packaged well with no missing pieces. Order arrived pretty quick. Thanks.
My family loves connect 4. It’s a great game that you can play for 5 minutes or an hour. My 6 year-old honestly beats me sometimes. We’ve even had family tournaments.

My daughter is dreadful at playing this game but hearing her yell "I WIN!" after placing a new piece in all of the wrong places makes me excited to teach her how to play for real -- This will be a favorite for years, I can tell.

review_title: Great game for adults with multitasking, memory,agility and fine motor skills challenges.
review_description: We use this game to help adults improve memory, fine motor skills and multitasking.  It's just a fun game no matter what the age.  The price is right too!

Great game for adults when combined with Flip Cup; finish your beer, flip your cup, then race to the Connect 4 game on the other side of the room and play your move!  Adds an element of speed to the original game and will get your friends VERY drunk VERY quickly!

review_title: One of the Best Games Ever Thought Up
review_description: Whether you are a genius or of typical intelligence, this game is a terrific way to development strategic skills. This is a very good game for developing your child's mental precision. Truly one of the best games every thunk up!

review_title: If you are looking for hours of fun, then you must buy it.
review_description: We spend so much fun time on this. We all love it, we really likes to spend our time playing it. My son was a lost 4 when we started playing it, and it was super easy to teach and learn.
This is by far the sweetest gift for my grandma. She loved it and this was affordable and they advised it was going to run late but it was perfect timing.
A classic game for a classy price.
Easy to play and fun game. Gave 4 stars because I wish it was more sturdier. It’s little bit filmsy and feels cheap. Otherwise fun game to play.
Great price and I think my grandson who is 5 almost 6 is going to love playing with it.  The parents take one night a week to have game night so I think they will love it.
Traditional entertainment and a great way to put aside digital entertainment.Good exercise for strategizing, thinking before acting, and counting.Easy to loose pieces.
Cannot believe how cheaply this and many other popular games are made these days. This game is really worth about 5 bucks if that.

review_title: Good Strategy Enhancer for a 9 Year Old
review_description: A lot of fun for a 9 year old.  My son, of that age, wins 1/3 of the time.  So, just the right level of strategy at this age.  We play 10 games over dinner.  Chess, at 8, was way over his flowzone.
Came on time, was easy to set up.  My 4 yr old and 8yr old love to play this.. they have no problem setting it up and playing or putting it up!
We love this game. It's a timeless classic. This piece is very well made, and we will be enjoying the set for a very long time.
Kids love the game. Funny mistake on the board game photo, the big red coin is about to block his own connect four win with a blue coin.
This is a great kid/family game. You can start doing this around four years old all the way up to 104. Highly recommend
Our grandchildren (ages 4 & 7) love this game. My son and his girlfriend who are in their late 20's had fun with it too!
My grandmother loves games but hates when they take forever ( sorry monopoly) this game is great for a family fun night! its simple enough for young kids and fun enough for adults!!!!
ABSOLUTE TRASH! please don’t but this item. It is made out of a think plastic and cane in with already broken parts. I had to immediately return it. It is not worth you money

The actual game board is barely thicker than thick paper. Im not one to complain and write negative reviews. I purchased thinking it would be like the regular thick cardboard game board of my childhood. But they've gone cheap. This board is really flimsy and cheap and isn't even a great beginner set for children, in my opinion, because it won't last long. Not worth the price.

review_title: I would be embarrassed to donate them for a Christmas Toy Drive
review_description: I read the bad reviews and was skeptical. I purchased two boxes for a Christmas Toy Drive. Very very disappointing, I would be embarrassed to donate these the quality is so poor. AND now I am being told that I cannot return them!!They are wafer thin ( like those vanilla wafer cookies) and are made of pressboard. ( Pressman is the brand name)I don’t have a stove or fireplace to burn them in and I live in Florida so it wouldn’t help anyway with heat for the winter (LOL)I did email Amazon about not being able to return them so maybe there is hope.Bottom line they aren’t worth a dollar at the dollar store.

review_title: Not at all what I was expecting, expected a half way decent version, price should be a clue.
review_description: I guess our expectations were a lot higher than they should have been. Saw the box and it was the same box as when we were kids except now it is so cheap. The board sits flat on the table so marbles will just roll off all the time. The board is made out of cardboard that is thinner than a cereal box and it is folded into quarters with a slit down half of it to fold better. This allows for the board to spread when trying to play allowing marbles to go all over the place.Spend the extra money and get a better version, not even worth attempting on this one.

review_title: Smaller than expected, and felt like plastic....
review_description: I was a little disappointed when these arrived today. I bought them for my daughter, who commented on how small they were. I am in total agreement. These are definitely NOT the "large" , solid hardwood dominoes  that was advertised. They felt more plastic than anything, and were a lot smaller than expected. Listen to the reviews on this one folks. Not worth it. The paint job on these were terrible, and nothing like the original Dominoes that I grew up playing with.

It was cheap, so I wasn't expecting more than a cardboard surface and plastic marbles ... the marbles are actually glass, which I appreciate, but the cardboard is so flimsy that it bows under the weight of the marbles. You can still play the game, but don't bump it or they'll all roll!
These were terrible. They arrived splintery. Very cheaply made. They didn’t even send us the black stick. Theyre already in the trash.
The are super tiny and not for adults - spend the extra money and by the professional size. Also, you cannot return them so DO NOT BUY!

review_title: The Board Is WRONG! This Is NOT Pahrcheesi, But A Bad Immitation!
review_description: Besides being cheap and flimsy as other people have said (and the pieces are tiny), more importantly, THE BOARD IS DESIGNED INCORRECTLY; it shows incorrect Safety/Home zones -- and they're colored, so there's no mistaking that.Here's a link for the original board: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00134MJWE/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1. I grew up with this very same board, which is great. LOOK AT THE IMAGE. The picture shows the yellow pieces in the Start zone. There's one yellow piece in the Safety zone, which is to the left of -- and AFTER -- the Start zone. That's the way the game's played!This game presumably has you only go three quarters of the way around the board, because the Safety/Home zone is BEFORE the Start zone.If you can afford it, spend the extra $14 on the REAL game. and disregard this one. You can always keep your eyes on the lookout for a used board....

review_title: They measure 1.72" x .86" x .23"  Good dominos - great for the price
review_description: Actual dimensions are 1.72" x .86" x .23", which is very slightly below (about 1/32 of an inch smaller) than1 3/4 x 7/8 x 1/4.  These are the only wooden dominos I've seen except for a set my parents have had since the 1970s.  Comparing these to those, the '70s set seem a little bit better, as my parents' are made from harder and heavier wood (almost feel like metal), with more defined engraving on both the front and back, and more clearly painted dots.  This Pressman set is more what I would expect a wooden domino to look like if I had never seen "really good ones" before.  And both sets are about the same size, which puts them in a tie for the smallest dominos I've ever used.  And if you want lightweight, these are very light.  The cardboard box is oversized (4" x 6" x 1 5/8") - the dominos just rattle around in it loosely, which detracts from them being well suited for traveling.  You could pack the dominos neatly stacked into a box that is 3 1/2" x 1 3/4" x 1 1/4".  If you made a box like that, this would be an awesome travel set or even a pocket-sized set, which is what I intend to do.  They're nice.  And they are consistent enough that I don't expect to be able to recognize specific dominos from the back unless I were to specifically try to learn that.  I feel nostalgic about them already and am very happy I bought them.

review_title: Pretty much Like I remember but . . . . ..
review_description: Pretty much Like I remember but . . . . .. the cardboard is a bit thinner and the chess and checker pieces are made out of a thinner plastic then they were made with back in the 80's. Like they say, "They don't make things like they use to." But even with that said it is still a good deal. All 3 games in one. And You can't put a Price Tag on Memories. It is PRICELESS. Back in the day I don't know if you could get all 3 games together. I do know that you could get them separate because I remember helping the Park Rec Coach tape the boxes back when i was a L.I.T. [Leader In Training].  When I was a Kid and just remember going to the Local Rec Park and playing, A LOT as well. We were poor and never got one of our own. I don't know if this is the same brand of way back when but it sure does look like it. Nor do I know the price of back then. Oh and the Box is also made of a thinner cardboard as well. But it all good. This is our 2nd one like this because of moving and other people not respecting other ppls things. But we will enjoy this one with care just as much as we enjoyed the other one. The Memories with this Brand New set have already began. hehehe. My 2 youngest Boys that are still home are ages 10-1/2 and 9. This is a total Classic but still winning and filling Our Hearts. <3

review_title: I was disappointed to find that the most valuable stick (black) was ...
review_description: I was really excited about this purchase and introducing the game to my students. I ordered the game over the summer and didn't open it until about 2 months later when the school year began. While explaining how to play the game to a couple of children, I was disappointed to find that the most valuable stick (black) was missing even before the game had even been played. Unfortunately, the return window for the product is closed, and I'm now stuck with an incomplete game.

review_title: JUNK... Woodgrain Clings & Makes This Game Impossible
review_description: The traditional pickup sticks from when I was a child were lightweight, thin, perfectly rounded, perfectly pointed plastic that was really fun to play because you could actually pick up the sticks without others moving. These “new and improved”, ahem, wooden sticks just simply don’t work. Regardless of how well-sanded and smooth they are, it is nearly impossible to pick any up without moving others because woodgrain clings to woodgrain. Mayyyyybe if they were much smaller and lighter weight they would work in wood, but these make the game impossible to play properly. Junk.

review_title: You get what you pay for.
review_description: I bought this item with plans to teach my children how to play checkers, chess, and backgammon. Because the price was so low, I will not be as upset when they inevitably lose pieces. The pieces are cheap plastic, but will easily serve their purpose. The board however leaves something to be desired. It is so thin, that I expect it to be torn after a very short period of time. The board appears to be thinner than standard poster board. Instruction page that comes with the game is fairly acceptable except for the backgammon instructions which are pretty vague. With all of this said, I still feel it will still work for teaching my children how to play all three games, and we will purchase another more durable and expensive set as the get older and more responsible.

I was in NYC recently and visited a Greenwich Village boutique that had a wonderful wall tiled in dominoes. I was completely taken with the look, and decided then and there that I would do the same when I returned home to Tucson. After some experimentation, I chose black dominoes with white dots and began searching for the right ones for my project. To tile the backsplash area of my kitchen, I wanted to use double-nine dominoes for the variety it would produce in the pattern overall. When I began shopping around, I quickly discovered that many of the cheaper imports have no quality control and half the dominoes in any box were unusable, either because they were chipped or because of overprinting. I realized I should just head to Amazon, and found these Pressman dominoes which are absolutely fabulous. They are each the exact same size, and not a single one was overprinted in all the boxes I ordered! While I realize this may not be a traditional use for these game tiles, I couldn't be happier with the results!

This version is exactly what I was looking for. Something inexpensive to help the kids learn how to play. The pieces are thin plastic, so they are light; and the board is a little bit thinner than I expected, but works just fine. Three games for under $10, so again, basically what I figured it would be.

review_title: Deeply Disappointed with how they Bundled this
review_description: As a child pressman checker/chess/backgammon boards were all over.  They were good little starter sets and were made just as well as other kids games.  Alas this is no longer the case.  Here are my problems with it:- The box it comes in is to thin and it has those cardboard sharp edges.- The game board is way thinner than the old ones and seems like slightly thicker than poster board (like another reviewer said).  I looks like they printed a sheet with the squares on it and then glued it to the cardboard. Cheap, cheap.- The checkers are cheaper plastic and not as substantial.  They are easily knocked around.- The Chess pieces were ok and again not substantial so easily knocked over.  My set was incomplete. I was missing a black knight and had an extra bishop.- The board is not slippery so the pieces do not slide nicely.- The board and pieces are made in China.  Not that China makes all bad things, but it appears they bid this out to the Cheapest bidder and it shows.I normal do not write a lot of reviews, but if you are like me and remember the original pressman boards this will disappoint.Hope this helps

My 9-year-old could not move without knocking other marbles over most of the time. The board was too flimsy for his spazzed out hands. While I never knocked any marbles loose, my 13-year occasionally did as well. Unless you have really steady hands, the marbles will roll when you move. It makes it hard to play on this board. Because he moved them almost every turn, I recycled the board after one game making the board a waste of money. As the marbles have some value, I did not rate this 1-star. These are not high quality marbles as expected given the price, so you'd be better off purchasing marbles separately and trying to get a better deal if you are only purchasing this for the marbles. If you are purchasing for the board, good luck. You're going to need it.

review_title: board is folded CARDBOARD/marbles are PLASTIC
review_description: This was a very inexpensive item/You get what you pay for/ Board is made of thin CARDBOARD/ "marbles" are PLASTIC.

I ordered two sets for my vacation rental homes. I liked the fact that it came with three game options:  checkers, chess and backgammon, however the quality is very poor and it wouldn't have lasted long. The box is made of very flimsy corrugated cardboard. The game board is made of thin cardstock and it doesn't lie flat. It's more of a game "card" than a game "board." I would have paid a few dollars more for a thicker and more durable game board and box. I returned both sets. I wouldn't have kept this set for my family, much less a vacation rental. Not recommended.

review_title: I love this game, but regret buying this set
review_description: I was so excited to share my love of Chinese Checkers with my kids, but when the package arrived I was quite disappointed. The "marbles" don't match the colors on the board. The board is just a flat and extremely thin piece of cardboard that barely holds the marbles in place. It is so easy to knock them off. I would recommend spending a little more extra money to get a set you can actually enjoy playing.

review_title: No vale la pena comprarlo de cartón
review_description: Bien ligero pero cuando lo abrí estaba doblado.

Very low quality product. After making an additional search on Amazon, I find a wood board for about the same price. The board in this set is like thick cardstock and holds the folds, so marbles roll everywhere. The board in the photo on the box and in the Amazon listing is different from what you get. All pieces were included, so it gets 2 stars. I recommend a different product.
Please my recommendation is improve item repacking

You get what you pay for! This is a great first set for my 6 & 8 yr old sons. They are loving chess and checkers. Backgammon not so much, but who honestly likes that game? The set is definitely very cheap. It's essentially very thick card stock doubled over. But it's holding up well and i do not regret this purchase at all! We'll get a few years out of it for sure. The boys love chess enough that the next set will be nicer, but this is a great first set without knowing if they'd like chess.

I knew this game set was a budget set wasnt expecting much in quality. I just wanted a few cheap sets for my high school students to play when they eat lunch in my room. It has three games in one. The board is laminated card stock so you have to gentle with it.  Not quality enough to gift, but will work for light game play.

review_title: Do not order this game! Cheaply made garbage!
review_description: Board game only comes wrapped in plastic. The box was damaged. No pieces were missing but the game is so cheaply made it will never last. Please take my advice and buy this game at a store or at least a more expensive one. Do not order this one! I returned it as soon as I got it.

These are the best made pick up sticks I have seen. They are made of strong wood and very colorful. I use these with math facts, vocabulary, etc. Students answer a question before they have a chance to pick up a stick. At the end of the game, math skills are required to find each student's score. This is the number one requested game in my first through fifth grade resource room.  Very surprising with all the technology we offer.

A fun game for when the grandkids visit.  They always ask to play a game of pick up sticks when they come.  I feel it builds dexterity, eye/hand coordination and concentration skills.  I like the sturdy storage container it comes with.  A hit all around, and I'm hoping it helps wean my grandson from his video game addiction!

I purchased these dominoes as a prop.  For my purposes they will work.  I noticed several negative reviews which did make me hesitant to buy, but I decided that for $3 it was worth the risk.  Whether you want to buy these will depend on what you want to use them for.Details:Size: Quite small, ~1.5" x 1" (they are slightly larger than this on both sides, but I don't remember the exact quarter/eighth amounts)Color: for all reasonable purposes, black. This is all right for me, though I would have preferred if the dominoes were the color pictured.Material: It might be wood? through the black paint/stain you can see what looks like wood grain, but they don't Feel like wood. Maybe that is just due to the paint (or what ever they used)?Quality: despite being small not quite as I pictured them these feel like they will be sturdy dominoes. I set them up and they all balanced fine and made a typical domino chain. They do have a quieter sound when falling, which is nice.Back: The back does have the pressman logo on it, so if you want a blank back these aren't for you.Overall: I like them.  They aren't as perfect as I would like, but they are $3.  If I wanted super nice ones I would have gone for the other wooden domino set that costs $30. I posted some pictures so you can get a better idea of what these dominoes are like.

Marbled don't mach the colors on the board. The board will not lay flay no matter what you do.The worst thing is the marbles sit so high up, the slightly bump sends everything rolling like Hungry Hipos, ruining the game. After 5 tries we gave up.

Very disappointed.  Poor quality, poorly constructed, too light. Can't even stand them up to make those domino's mazes as they are too light and poorly cut.  Bought a bunch of boxes for my nephew for Christmas for him to learn Domino's and for him to play with and he cannot even use them.  Amazon was very nice and gave me a credit.

I love Chinese Checkers, but this specific set is awful. The board is foldable which means that one of the triangles is cut in half thereby making the board uneven. It is very easy to knock the balls off in the middle of the game. I would not recommend it.

Somehow I thought there'd be a third set of pieces for the backgammon board. It indicates the checkers pieces are for that, too. I suppose it does nicely about resourcefulness. Smaller and separate pieces would have suited me personally though since we have a different, little board collecting dust. Well, you win some...The chess pieces aren't too bad. A bit on the light plasticy side, functional though and are sized pretty well. They'll probably fall over if you're trying to play in a moving vehicle. Yet for a table game that you simply want to play or teach chess with and aren't worried about "quality," this is for you. Also comes with checkers that do stack (woohoo!) and a pair of dice, plus a list of other games you could try with these pieces. For roughly ten dollars on technically three games to start, I'd say this is a nice deal.The board is durable so it is flimsy, but it's not completely flat either. Cosmetically, a whole corner had a line of white that looked like the paint was scraped off. I'll upload a picture when I get around to it.To recap, a perfectly fuctional chess, checkers and backgammon set. I like the color scheme. On the plus side of being cheap, you could play with this until your pocket is ready for a more 'solid' set.Can't complain. Nothing missing or broken on arrival.[edit 7/14/15 -- Cat keeps knocking down the game pieces when we leave it on the table. So we know now he jumps up there regularly during the night.  Hey, kitty, share your strategy with one of us.

My wife and I are bored and, having watched Grantchester on PBS, we decided to try to learn Backgammon.  We bought this economical set to see if (a) we can learn the game, and (b) we like playing Backgammon.  This is the perfect set for that, plus it offers chess and checkers.  This allows us to decide without spending a lot of money.  If we like Backgammon, we will buy a more expensive set.  Again, this set is a perfect set for those who want to learn the game and play chess and/or checkers.

review_title: Game board will not lay flat because it is paper thin.
review_description: Not worth a penny! You'd be better off printing your own Pahrcheesi board at home. This board is thin as card stock. No matter what you do you will not be able to have the board lay flat. I've had it under heavy books for a week and it still remains warped. The light plastic game pieces cannot stand upright on the board because of it. I want my money back.

We received the game and the box was completely mauled. It seemed they kicked it all the way here. I had to find a way to store the game elsewhere. The game board had some damage to it as well. Not worth it.

I don't know why people were complaining about the size and quality of these. Read the description. Its exactly what it says it is.I needed something that wasn't color so my kids could quickly learn and actually recognize how many dots is what number. These are perfect. I'm actually planning on ordering more so we have a bigger set. :)

After reading some reviews I was hesitant to order this particular domino set, but I'm glad I did. I don't see any problem at all with the weight or size of this set in any way. We bought it for a game to play with grandkids and it will be perfect! Totally satisfied and definitely recommend.

review_title: This is a great way to store a high number of chess sets
review_description: This is meant to be a cheap chess set.  It is definitely made of cheap materials, which is totally expected.  I'm rating it low because something cheap should still be functional.  I ordered eight of these boards to use with students.  The boards all came warped.  They are so bent that they don't function effectively.  We attempted to bend them into a workable flatness, but are not having any luck.I gave it a two star because the pieces are acceptable, and the board does fold down and fit into a gallon bag.  This is a great way to store a high number of chess sets.  That said, I'm really hoping that the boards flatten out over time

We had a lot of fun playing this game Santa brought my six-year-old granddaughter. She was great at picking up the sticks with her little fingers, but adults enjoyed playing the game as well. It’s a great way to practice math skills, too.Although the colors are not uniform, various shades of green instead of one color of green for example, it’s not that big of a deal.

I get that it is cheap, I just had no idea how cheap the quality would be. I was at least expecting normal game-board quality out of the board itself. No luck there, it is just thick tag board. The chess pieces are small and hollow with no decent weighting to them and they have open bottoms. Returning it to buy a better quality set. I would pass unless you absolutely want the cheapest set available. If I saw this on a store shelf, I would have known immediately by the weight and cheap box it came in that it would be an absolute bust.

review_title: Pressman Toys Giant Pick Up Sticks
review_description: I like the size of the sticks and my older granddaughter loves them. I would also heed the recommendation that this is not for younger children 3 and under...the sticks are very sharp and could literally cause a problem if poked in an eye or other body part.  I would have given 5 stars if the sticks were not so sharp.

review_title: Obviously given the price this is a pretty bare-bones set (hollow plastic pieces
review_description: I bought this to use a cheap checkers/chess set to use with a kid I do autism therapy with. Obviously given the price this is a pretty bare-bones set (hollow plastic pieces, thin cardboard, etc.), but it gets the job done. The kid and I managed not to damage the board or pieces (and had fun!) so it'll probably work fine for you if you just need something cheap. Unlike other cheapo sets, this one is actually about the size of a normal checkers/chessboard. Great for broke public school teachers or people without the highest expectations.

I wasn't sure if my wife would like backgammon so I wanted a cheap game to introduce her to it. This is perfect for that. It is a cheaply made game, but accomplishes the goal of learning the game. Now that I know she likes the game, I can look at buying one of the much more expensive models.  I do wish they would have printed a checker board on the back.

review_title: Super thin cardboard makes this game nearly unplayable
review_description: Board is cut to the middle so it can fold into a square.  Board is very thin cardboard which does not lay flat when unfolded. Super cheaply made.

review_title: Works Fine/ Just Handle With Care ❤
review_description: Even though its thin cardboard for the bingo sheets etc. It is a beautiful design. The bingo peices are thick circular yellow plastic which is great. And the spinner is thin so just spin it lightly instead. And works fine and I'm an adult the description says sugested for younger age groups if I remember correctly. Works well for me and I'm happy with it!
This was the cheapest and most poor quality game of Chinese Checkers I have ever run across.  I found better luck at the dollar store.

review_title: Balls work great for Hungry Hungry Hippos lol
review_description: The checker board is flimsy cardboard, I wouldnt buy this particular Chinese checkers if you plan on using it for its purpose. However the plastic balls are great! I used them to replace the balls in our Hungry Hungry Hippos game and they work perfectly! Got 60 balls for $5. Whereas when you try and buy replacement balls made specifically for Hungry Hungry Hippos, it costs $10 for only 20 balls.

Do not and I repeat don't not buy. This game is on a piece of 1/16"cardboard. It is not worth anything and when you move marbles the board moves. This is something that you would get from the dollar tree.

review_title: How difficult is it to validate qty of pieces prior to taking my money?
review_description: Seriously if you can’t hire an 17 year old Intern to count/validate the number of pieces in a box you should not sell these.This is precisely why parents open up board games in the store to check pieces.

review_title: If you play a lot of Catan this is a must have
review_description: How many times have you been playing catan and this happens?-mid game, you need the table space back-players bump into the board or roll dice ON the board and pieces fly everywhere-do not have a large enough table-have wanted to play on a flat sturdy surface-need to move the game boardIf you play catan frequently enough this is a super solid choice. Nothing else really like it available right now and it’s a super good quality plastic that comes with the 5-6 player expansion component!!Set up is literally 5 seconds and it solves all the problems listed above that come up when playing catan.You can pick up the whole board from a table and play on the ground if you wanted to. The road pieces fit in perfectly. Cities and settlements don’t have dedicated spots however.This thing is awesome!

Feels a lot more like work than a game. It's set collection, which you turn in for additional butterflies, and then race back to the start. It seems like one of those games that "works" but it's not really that much fun.The art is pretty, except that the numbers on the wood butterflies are way way way too small to see easily. One of the few games that I stopped playing after the first third of the game, because it was tedious, and really not that fun.

This is a gorgeous looking game, with beautiful and high quality components, but something about the game play is lacking. I've only played 2 player, so perhaps it's better with more players. But just when the game starts to get going, it's over. I was expecting more from the designer of Wingspan, which is possibly my favorite game of all time. I played this game 5 times and decided to sell my copy.

Really good looking game from the box to the components. It can be played 2 player or more - I’ve played both ways and slightly prefer 2-player. The game is slightly lighter fare which I appreciate and allows for multiple plays in a session. 5 stars highly recommend

review_title: For beauty mainly, but very hard to play with it! Does not work right! It's just a nice decoration.
review_description: For beauty mainly, but hard to play with, since pieces/checkers don't slide and get stuck on fabric stiches & vinyl triangles, and have no finger groove s hence they are too slippery for hand grip or sliding by finger. The box sides are too low  and dices jump out often.  It looks nice, but for those of you who really want to relax and enjoy playing it will be annoying, as it takes an extra effort and caution to play compared to the simply wood ones. So as a decoraion to be shelved it's OK, but as to actually playing with it I would avoid it.  Obviously the Chinese manufacturer is not a savvy backgammon player...
I received this today and it's nice but didn't come with the dice!  How am I supposed to play with out dice?

This arrived ahead of time bus few days.Very well packaged and pulling the case from the box was exciting. My kids have never seen such a game, and actually thought I had made up the name and the game until it came.My only gripe is that the seams on the board are not tight and appears to come untucked. The chips/checkers are slippery but most game pieces are made this. As a kid, I played with checkers board pieces to make it easier to grab. I might do the same for this one.This is great as a travel game. And just like I had enjoyed the game so are my kids and I'm sure this will be our new add on travel game.

review_title: Quality control checked was missed on this game.
review_description: There is a definitely a product defect on the inside. Two of markers are missing from the main board and are inside where the dice are kept.  It is unfortunate that this was a gift for our grandson and didn’t realize it until we started playing it with him. Didn’t have the heart to pack it up and send it back.
Product just came in ....  and it’s in perfect condition! Exactly what I was wanting and expecting. So excited to teach my kids the game I grew up loving to play!

review_title: Excellent Value with Very Good Quality
review_description: I'm no Backgammon pro - far from it. I bought this set to train on and am very happy with it. Especially for the price point, it is impossible to deny the value. Product feels high-quality enough to keep and so far, in the first week or so, it has shown no signs of any issues.I gave it 3 stars in the "giftable" section, because I do understand that a good Backgammon gift set ought to be seriously hand-crafted and a one-of. 3 stars for traveling as well, as it is not a small set. But I didn't buy it for gifting or traveling, so overall I am very satisfied with the quality for the price and it honestly earns 5 stars overall.
This is a really nice backgammon set. I saw one in a gaming store and it was over $50! Then I saw this was on Amazon the price is just right for a nice product.

This product is a decent but disappointing backgammon set. The size is good for its price but the craftsmanship is all too much what you get out of China these days with marginal quality control.  See pics. There are likely better boards out there for the money but the convenience and price make it serviceable if you get a well constructed board.
Very cool. Brought back memories. Well built
I always love this game, the purchase is worth it!

review_title: Backgammon is a great game and we have a blast with this board.
review_description: Great board and quality. Have gotten a couple of them for home and vacation.
This is the exact same set I had a a kid. Good quality for the price.
I love this game and this board is pretty and big I’m a fan
This is a great board for the serious backgammon player.  The board is constructed well and the plastic pieces are a good size and they glide on the felt.
Nice set but just wish leather was a bit higher quality.  Set came on time and looks good !
this was perfect for my intended use home and camping
THE PRICE WAS OKAY, BUT REALLY DIDN'T LIKE THE COLOR!

The product was exactly as represented. Not only is it beautiful but it’s fun to play. It arrived exactly when promised. I would highly recommend this product and I would highly recommend this reliable seller.
Wife got this for us for Christmas.  Very nice set. Great quality materials, very portable. Enjoying in a lot.
Outstanding product
Great for “family time.” Quality made. Reminds me of being a kid & playing with my own family.
It's a good size and quality.
Just what the headline says!

review_title: The case is made very well.
review_description: This was as I expected. I have had this product before. It was made very good and I will enjoy playing it for years to come.
Of all the Board Games For Kids I have bought this Year, this is the most educational.  My kids are finally using their mind.  Hallelujah
Well made, easy to carry around, fun to play. Only negative: instructions are written with small orange print and they are hard to see.
Very nice
The board brings back great memories. I would play for hours. It’s looks so nice. The dice and checkers included with the game look and feel like stone.
This will be a xmas gift!

I bought this backgammon set for my Grandma.  She almost cried when she opened it.  The quality of the backgammon board and backgammon case and also the backgammon pieces is out of this world.  Seriously 5 Stars.

LOOOOOVE THIS.  Here is why.1. Easy setup.  Seriously.  It takes like 1 minute to set up.2. Easy to learn.  Again.  You can learn this game in about two minutes by reading the instructions...and about 15 seconds when someone explains it to you.3. FANTASTIC for large groups.  It allows everyone to play.  Especially this large size.4. It doesn't take a ton of brain power to play.  That's a GOOD thing since when we play this game...it's usually cards in one hand...cocktail in the other.5.  Camaraderie by playing on teams.  How fun is that!?6. Great for all ages.  Kids can play too!

review_title: LOVE this game! Wish I'd known about it decades ago.
review_description: I absolutely LOVE this game! We've been playing it for years. My only regret is that I didn't learn about this game decades ago. You won't regret the purchase. You'll have so much fun with this easy to learn & play, delightful family game. You can include the kids and enjoy it with just adults too. It's a GREAT TWO PLAYER game as well. We enjoy partners competition. We keep a running tally just for fun.Careful when choosing which version to buy. There are several different sizes of this game. I love the largest soft matt version. I actually leave it up on my game table under the glass table top to protect it. It looks like a bit of art deco. My first purchase was the small box version... way too small for comfortable play. Second purchase was the Jumbo Tube. That was the perfect size matt. But the tube is too big. Then I saw the box version of the same jumbo size soft matt and bought it for my week ends away. I don't store it in the box (except for travel). I kept it rolled up in a drawer so it lays flat when playing. If your looking for the largest jumbo matt read the descriptions carefully & see the game description that tells you the exact inches. It's easy to buy the wrong one. It's worth the price! Have fun!

review_title: A Fun Game for Family or Friends
review_description: Once you read the instructions and get use to the game play, which is simple, this is a nice game. There were six of us playing so we followed the recommendations and had two teams of two people. Using the team concept is required when their are over 3 people playing, as you have only three colors of chips. Teams are made with  every other person around the table, so each team gets two chances to form a sequence. Each chip has two side. One is plain and one has some white writing on it. You use the plain side up until you make a sequence then you turn the ones making the sequence over. I mention this as I wish the writing was a bit bigger and whiter. A minor thing but a suggestion. I would definitely recommend this game for a family or group of friends.BTW, 4 Stars is my highest rating as I do not "love" things. When will Amazon change the highest rating to "Excellent" rather than " I love it"

review_title: It works great, I always take mine to parties and other ...
review_description: Everyone loves the Jumbo Sequence Mat.  I already had one, which My husband had put between 2 pieces of flexing glass that is about 1/16 inch thick each.  He laid the mat between the 2 pieces of flexing glass and we use Clear 2 inch, Heavy duty, packing tape, neatly around the edges to hold together.  It works great, I always take mine to parties and other people have done this, after seeing and playing on my board.  It is a little expensive, Our local glass store will cut it the exact size you need.  It cost about $40.00 for the Flexing and You know what the Jumbo Mat cost.  But it will last forever and is really easy to clean and play on.  I got this one for a friend and of course, she put the flexing glass on hers.  We love the game, great game for large groups.  We play teams.

This particular product is a Chinese knockoff.  Took almost one month to arrive from China and was badly damaged in transit..  This set is way overpriced....contains about $2.00 worth of material.  The Chinese did copy the original game instructions pretty well....grammar and syntax are somewhat accurate. This is a classic example of unfair Chinese trade practices that harm U.S. companies.Wish I would have paid closer attention before ordering.  Recommend you stay with the original JAX product:  JAX Sequence-Deluxe Edition.

I love this board. It is large but it is perfect for us older folks. Nice size. It is hard to reach if you have short arms but that doesn't hinder the game at all. I highly recommend it for older people. My friend had the small version and we had to strain to see it. So, I thought I will buy this just to see if it is better. It had mixed reviews. I say BUY IT...

I love the bigger board.  I was able to get the folded creases out of the mat by placing the mat face down on my ironing board, placing a t-shirt over the fold, spraying a little water on the t-shirt, and ironing it on the low silk setting.  It came right out and did not damage the mat.  Of course, I will not fold it in the future.  However, when we first opened the box, we were hit with a very strong chemical smell that was nausiating.  Yes, this was before I ironed it.  The toxic smell has lingered for hours, and we finally put it in the garage to air out.  Hoping that we don't have to return it because of the smell.

review_title: Very nice product. Nice table top board game
review_description: We play the game with friends a couple times a week. It is a game of strategy and visual acuity. Very nice quality soft vinyl table top playing mat. There are several complaints about the ridges where the mat is folded. Simple solution - lay it out flat on a hard surface and lay a warm damp towel along the fold and gently rub the towel along the ridge. Also let it lay flat overnight with a couple books on it. Worked great for me.

review_title: Great game but Mat light and won't lay flat
review_description: The game itself is great, lots of fun.  However this is the second one we purchased and the mat is thin and doesn't lay flat like the older thicker one. one. Disappointed.  Will try ordering the one in the tub, perhaps the mat is heavier and  thicker.

review_title: This is the size to get
review_description: Every time we play Sequence with friends, they want to know where we got this big size. If you are over 65,definitely buy this size. We have found people who don't like playing cards or games, really enjoy playing Sequence. It's easy to learn and you can talk while you are playing.

review_title: This sucks as the heavy mat you can never get to ...
review_description: This sucks as the heavy mat you can never get to lay flat and the chip slide all off the ridges as the mat has to be folded multiple times to fit in the box and never flattens out. Bad design. They used to make this mat in a tube which was much better as rolled up but they discontinued it....dumb.

review_title: Playing board is not a board
review_description: I bought the box version of this thinking I would get a foldable board with it. Instead I got the flimsy one folded up inside.... it stays creased and makes it very hard to sit chips on where it is folded up. If I wanted that kind of board I would have bought the cylinder package version.... atleast that way it wouldn’t be folded.

What a bummer. The box arrived crushed. A sturdy box is a must when the game has lots of pieces (cards and lots of chips). The mat is merely a folded piece of felt with a light printing of the usual sequence board. I’m not sure how well it will flatten for game play, since it is folded in the box for storage. I’m a big Sequence player and was really looking forward to having a bigger “board” for larger family gatherings. This product does not meet the standards of the original sequence game. Very disappointed with the purchase, especially for the price.

I rated this low because I really don't like the vinyl playing board. I looked all over for the hard board Jumbo Sequence game and just can not find it anywhere. I wish they would go back to making it. I would buy it in a minute. This vinyl never lays totally flat thus making it hard to keep the playing pieces in place. I am a little disappointed with this set.

We love playing Sequence.  It's a great board game...very easy to learn and fun for adults and kids.  Everytime we play this game peoplego out and buy it!!!!  We bought this for camping and we had 8 adults all sitting around the table playing this summer.  We play in teams.Once you learn how to play and get better it can be very challenging.  This is by far our favorite board game and makes a great gift too.This is the larger "mat" version but you can get it also in a smaller board game size too.

Because the card mat has been folded in a box (an admittedly large box), the mat has a crease right down the middle.  We've tried to flatten out the crease by leaving the mat out at night with heavy books on it.  That has helped, but didn't completely eliminate the crease.  The edges of the mat turn up a bit, as well.But I love the game and we play it often.

On the regular board, people who have a hard time seeing find it difficult to find positions for their plays. I always tell them to follow the suit they want to play, until they find the card they are looking for. There are two sequences of each suit.On the bigger board, the cards are easier to see making the game more challenging as people can find their plays easier. This makes the game more fun!!! As the person with the best eyesight is not always the winner.

Gotta have this classic card game that involves strategy. The best art of the game is that you can play with as many as 8-10 people. This version comes with a cushioned board which will likely last for a long period of time. Please do not buy any version of the game that does not offer a cushioned mat (board). Go buy this! I am not happy with the price. I think this should be priced at $29.99 and NOT close to $50. I gave 4 star considering the value for the price. Overall, very pleased with this product. Would be a great gift for any teenage or adult birthdays.

I am pleased with the game but for some reason, didn't expect the board to be an actual mat - I though it would be a larger sized board.  It is a pain to store as if you keep it folded up because it will always stay bumpy, so I keep it opened all the time and draped over the back of a couch!!

I had the Jumbo Sequence round version for a while and while it was really nice and large, it was a pain to store. Its in this big jumbo round cylinder and it was always in the way. If you tried to stick it in a cabinet it took up so much room and it would be the only thing on that shelf.Now this one is perfect. Just as big but folds up so nice and neat. I have a little OCD about things being out and messy. A couple people mention its hard to flatten, but I haven't found that to be the case. The one in the round cylinder was harder if you ask me. It was always popping.If your on the hinge about the two, trust me, you'll love this one much better. I gave the jumbo one in the cylinder to family.

We bought the original game with the cardboard playing board.  And we have used it for several years.  Because all of us are aging, we bought the larger soft playing board.  It is much easier to see and use.  Recommend  it but I think it is way overpriced for what it is.  Just the same, it is a nice quality and makes playing more enjoyable.

review_title: The game should come in a tube...
review_description: The game is great, but it comes in a box, which is unfortunate. The board should NOT be folded. Folding caused it to split. Ours came with a tiny tear in it due this this....which kind of stinks - seeing as how we paid $50 for it.

review_title: Enjoy the larger board and larger chips. One disappointment soft board not lay ing flat initially
review_description: This is a fun game we play often with friends. We had the smaller game which was difficult to play with four on a regular size table. The bigger game board was a good size but difficult to keep smooth which made placing the chips flat difficult. We purchased an acrylic sheet to place on top to hold it flat. That worked perfectly but it wasn’t cheap. Also the cards in our smaller game were a nicer quality so we changed them out. Everything works great now. We enjoy this game with friends.

review_title: Awesome-- especially for those who struggle with the original.
review_description: We LOVE Sequence, and recently introduced my grandparents to the game. They loved it too, but sometime struggled to make out the "cards" on the opposite side of the board from them. I purchased them this set for Christmas, and it was a huge success! (So much so that I'm considering buying one for myself and retiring the original version)

review_title: Love the game but I think the packaging is too ...
review_description: Love the game but I think the packaging is too much. I think all Sequence canvases should be packaged in a cylinder with the cards and chips. You have to keep the canvas rolled in order for it to lay mostly flat on a surface so once you open the box, you can't put the canvas back in the box since it will be creased which means you are just using this oversized boxed for two decks of cards and three bags of chips.

I waited a long time to receive the Game.  Way over a month.  When it was received the box was damaged. Very disappointed.  Not with the money.  Also the game board was felt material and not like plastic

Birthday present for my 73year old dad.  He loved his original sequence, but he and my 76 year old mom found the board a little hard to distinguish without their glasses.  Sometimes they would make embarrassing errors with the old board.  This one is fun for all ages, and makes it easier on them!  Now, they play with my kids as much as they can!

Great game. Love that it’s jumbo size. Easy to play in large groups. The mat comes folded in the box. We keep it rolled up in a PVC tube and put end caps on it. You can also use a large cardboard tube. The company also sells a version that comes in a large tube but wasn’t available when I needed it.

Very Disappointed!  First of all, it took almost 3 weeks to arrive.  Secondly, the game mat is made of some kind of cheap fiber.  Not at all what I was expecting.  For $36 I was expecting a quality game mat.  This game is being returned.

review_title: GREAT FAMILY GAME FOR ALL AGES!!!!
review_description: FANTASTIC GAME FOR ALL AGES.BEST PART IS THAT THERE ARE NO FANCY OR COMPLICATED RULES TO LEARN.  BUT, DONT BY SMALL VERSION. JUMBO IS THE ONLY SIZE AND IT FITS PERFECTLY ON A CARD TABLE.  IT IS NOW THE FAMILY GAME OF THE BROWNS.

review_title: A Extra Large Ton Of Fun.
review_description: Friends of ours turned us on to this game so we decided to purchase it for ourselves.  This Jumbo Sequence Game - Box Edition with Cushioned Mat, Cards and Chips is truly Extra Large and fairly easy to work with as long as you have six foot arms.  None the less the game of Sequence is still a ton of fun.

review_title: jumbo sequence in the past and future tense
review_description: We played the regular version at a local cafe/club downtown and had to make it ours.  I got the jumbo version, very fun to play and big enough and small enough to go where you want to.

review_title: Mat doesn’t stay flat and it’s overpriced, you are paying for the mat not the pieces,
review_description: Too overpriced $50 too much when a regular is $13 all you need is the mat and mat doesn’t stay down, you are really paying for the mat and like you can find a bigger one for less I kept it, all the pieces are the same as the cheaper ones. At least improve on the mat pls.

review_title: Way better than the regular version.
review_description: So much better than the regular sized game that you can buy in the store.  The chips are color coded on the “sequence” side so that you can easily see a sequence on the board.  So much easier to see the playing board.You do need to keep it laying flat somewhere or maybe rolled up, to avoid all the creases from being folded up in the box.

review_title: Great strategy game for the whole fam
review_description: This game is so much fun!  We got this as a gift for my grandpa after he played ours and dropped a not-so-subtle hint that he would like this game for Christmas.  He was so excited to play it with the grandkids.  It really is a fun and challenging game that takes strategy skills and paying attention to either block the other team or make your own connections.

review_title: Love sequence, eyes are not what they used to be.
review_description: We love the game,  our eyes are not what they use to be.  this really made the day.  love the extra size. The only thing,  I wish is the price would be lower.  this was extremely pricey compared to the normal board game size

Definitely an excellent purchase. Just wish we could flatten the vinyl play mat faster. We'll figure it out. Played four people in 2 teams was really fun. Not just all luck, some fun strategy can be developed.

review_title: Dangerous Off-Gassing with this vinyl mat!
review_description: This review is not for the game itself, rather for this particular jumbo game. The vinyl mat that is the “board” had terrible off-gassing. We had to put it back. The chemicals coming off of it were HORRIBLE. The sequence game is great, but I would NOT recommend this particular one. The regular board game is the way to go.I’m sick of Amazon items coming from toxic waste dumps!

Loved the smaller board version thought we would get the bigger version for those older eyes. Love everything about the game other than the material the board is made of. Some sort of vinyl that doesn’t go flat which makes it harder to place the chips. Putting heavy books on it helped some but not completely. If the just made this in the same material as the smaller version it would be 5 stars

review_title: This is the perfect size to play this game
review_description: This is the perfect size to play this game. We had the smaller version and it was hard to see. This big matt makes it easier to see. The only drawback is that the matt is folded so it stays that way and the chips don't sit perfectly on it. But if you can roll it or leave it out that would go away.

review_title: Excellent fun easy game for young and old alike
review_description: This game is very easy to learn and a lot of fun to play with young AND/OR older folks. It can be played with 2 to 12 persons individed into two or three teams. It uses two STANDARD decks of PLAYING cards which can be easily replaced when desired. The BIG playing board is easily read and can be stored by rolling it into a tube form and securing it with rubber bands or a tube that's typically used for architectural drawings.

Love the BIG numbers ! We played this on the smaller board and had trouble seeing where things were , but not on this board . Soooo glad we bought this . What a fun game . Play with the Grandkids too .
but you  draw cards and can only play on a spot if you have that card or a wild card in your hand. The idea is to get five spots in a row. My wife beats me most of the time.
It was on a rug and everything was written in Arabic. Have the plactic mat jumbo and couldn't be happier

The recipient complained that the numbers are blurry and gave them a headache.  The vendor was great having replaced the first game received because the box came in damaged.  It might be best to order a set where you can determine if the numbers are blurry..

review_title: Necesito un set de cartas, el juego es divertido, pero las cartas no tienen calidad
review_description: Muy divertido, excelente para mantener la familia unida y divertida, "la calidad de las cartas es mala y no hay re emplazo para adquirir" Deben suplir set de cartas para re emplazo
Having a hard time getting the mat to lay flat. This a really fun game to play.

....it makes for a quiet evening.  It's surprising how quiet everyone gets because of the concentration on where to place cards.  There's really not any interaction with your guests, but it really is a great game.

review_title: fold out board is a mess to try and play on.
review_description: The creases in the plasticized cloth rolled up board, especially the main one in the middle, rise up above the board so that it's hard to play on. It sucks in that regard.

review_title: This is like the cheap Chinese version of the game board
review_description: This is like the cheap Chinese version of the game board.  Works fine, just doesn't look as fancy.  I bought it for my mom.  She loves it, but it makes me dizzy and confused.

review_title: A D20 disguised as a strategy game.
review_description: Tsuro gives the illusion of being a strategy game but ends up being completely random. My lunch break game group tested this theory  by playing a 4th hand randomly, only turning the radomly selected tile orientation clockwise when it flipped up as an illegal (suicidal) move. The randomly played hand came in 2nd place out of 4 when 3 other players were legitimately playing with forethought and strategy.That being said... some people in my game group found the game fun despite its randomness as they were able to "turn off their brain" to play and games took around 5 to 10 min to complete. Others, myself included, found it as boring as rolling a D20 after the 3rd or 4th game. I quickly sold the game to one of people in my game group who liked it.This is probably a good game with/for kids. However, if you are looking for at least a small degree of strategy, you would likely want to avoid this particular game.If you really like random games, exploding kittens is a far better option than Tsuro in my opinion since kittens doesn't feel as repetitive as quickly.

review_title: Really fun, quick, family game that is easy to pick up and understand quickly.
review_description: Tsuro is a tile laying game where you're trying to stay on the board as long as possible.At the start of the game you set your piece at the edge of the board and with each tile you lay on the board you follow the lines on the board. The only rule really is that you can't purposely make yourself go off the edge so if you have a tiles you can lay that would keep you alive then you have to play that tile.I've played this game with my 5 years old and my 10 year old and they both love it. It's not a hard game to pick up so if you're looking for a game that the whole family can play I highly suggest this one.

I saw this game on Wil Wheaton's "Tabletop" web show and was immediately hooked.  If you haven't seen it already, go there NOW. [...]The premise is that you (and up to 7 other players) are dragons, flying around the board.  You place a tile on the board and place your dragon on one of the lines printed on the tile.  You then move your dragon along the line to the end of the tile.  Everyone else does this on their turns.  On your next turn, you place another tile adjacent to the one you played previously, so that the lines of the two tiles line up.  You then move your dragon along the new line until it terminates.  The winner of the game is the one who stays on the board the longest.  That's it.While it sounds boring and simple, the game has some strategy involved.  The tiles drawn are random, so it's very possible to draw three tiles that ultimately throw you off the board; or could throw an opponent off.  You must plan ahead to ensure that you don't get put into such a position.  However, there's not much use in planning more than 1-2 moves in advance, as your opponents' moves will (near the end of the game) greatly affect your plays.With more than 4-5 players, the game would get hectic very quickly.  I've only played with 4 people, but it was still really fun.  The first 4-5 turns are relatively boring, as the other players' tiles generally won't interact with your own.  It's when you begin linking tiles that things get really interesting and unforeseen connections are made that win or lose the game.The game plays out (with 4 players) in about 10-15 minutes, so it's a great game to break out while waiting for the rest of your group to arrive.  It's also a nice break between longer games like Settlers of Catan or Lords of Waterdeep.  Simple, fun, and quick.  Can't ask for much more!The production value of the game is quite high as well.  The tiles come on ~2mm thick, plastic-coated cardboard tiles.  The playing board is also of similar quality.  The "dragon" pieces are plastic, which disappointed me a little, as I thought they'd be stone or some other "higher quality" material.  But they're fine as they are.  I can see this game lasting a very long time.  My only real complaint is that there's no frame into which you could play the tiles.  As such, they tend to slide around on the board a little as the interior pieces are played.  Having a frame of some kind to keep the pieces lined up would be nice, but is more to satisfy my nit-picky personality.Two enthusiastic thumbs-up for this one!

My husband and I first played this game when we were visiting friends in Ohio. They are big "board gamers" so whenever we go up to see them we play a bunch of games and figure out which ones we want to purchase for our home game library.They hadn't played this game yet either so we all learned together, which took all of three seconds. The game, though very simple, is surprisingly fun and tricky. We love how you have rethink your strategies and plans as others come into your paths and how now two game experiences will ever be the same.The game itself is absolutely beautiful, with great detailed artwork. It is really well put together. The board, the pieces, the card tiles, even the directions are just so pretty and delicate looking we enjoy just looking at the game. We quickly bought this game as soon as we got back home in Florida and have played it many many times since.We love that so many people can play at once so no friends get left out when we have a crowd. We call this our "starter game" because it is so simple and easy to learn, even the least experienced gamers can catch on and get in a gaming mode with a quick game of Tsuro. Even though we plan to only play one game before starting a more involved and lengthy game our guests often request that we play a second or even third time because they enjoy it so much.

review_title: Wonderful game for family and light gamers
review_description: This is a great board game to play with children and with friends who might quite not be into board games. It's a game that is easy to set up and take down and with only a few rules to learn. The object of the game is to be the last one standing. During your turn, you decide on a tile to place in front of your stone. Your stone follows the path of tile until it reaches the end of the tile. It could essentially move forward, left right or even backwards. Other players place tiles down in front of their own marker, taking care to avoid paths that could lead them onto the edge of the board or into another player's marker (these are the losing conditions). The game is easy to learn but becomes quite intense as the space on the board fills up and there are only so many decisions left before eventually all but one players falls of the board.It's a great light game that is both elegant and beautiful. Th

review_title: Always picked by my 6 year old for game night.
review_description: My kids love this game. Its extremely simple to learn, so it's my 6 year olds favorite.  Basically you take turns placing tiles down and having your game peices follow the path. Other players tiles can affect your path and change your destination.  Last player to exit the board, wins. You can also lose by running into another player. The game plays quickly for us when all 4 of us are playing, and we play 2-3 rounds at a time, before moving on to a different game choice.The kids love it because it's simple and you can quickly play it over and over again. As an adult, I can only play it so many times in a row, and probably would choose something a bit more mind stimulating,  however it can be competitive if I were to play against just adults and trying to doom their peices.My 9 year old likes the game enough to play it happily, but also asks for other games after 2 plays. My 9 year old and I love splendor.Tsuro player peices are plastic and the cards are thick cardboard.My toddler and 6 year old also play with it by putting all the tiles on the board and pretending they are roads or railroads and first to get to the dragon piece wins- although that's not a real game, they are entertained by it.Overall this is a fun family game and I reccomend it to those with younger kids (I have 3-9 year olds). The game is fun enough for my entire family, hubby included, and it will be well loved for years.

review_title: Poor Quality Components Ruin a Good Game
review_description: UPDATE: I did reach out to Calliope about this issue and asked for a replacement. They requested a photo of the bar code on the box in order to facilitate my request. I did so and shared my contact information.  It’s been 6 weeks and I have heard nothing. My game is unplayable. I can not recommend buying any Calliope games due to their lack of quality control. Huge disappointment—I wish I would have returned it to Amazon the minute I opened it.ORIGINAL REVIEW: Really poor quality. I am so disappointed with this product. I have played this game virtually via Steam and absolutely loved it. But the quality is terrible. Not worth the price I paid at all. The cardboard tiles have very rough edges and most are chipped and cracked on the corners. Additionally, the art work on the tiles is so washed out that you can barely see which lines are which. They included a catalog of games which is on extremely expensive card stock with glorious full color photos. If only they’d spent that money on quality components. Game is fun, but the tiles are uncomfortable to hold and will degrade with only a few plays. I will not be buying another Calliope game ever and will tell every gamer I know to avoid this one. Waste of money. I feel like Calliope should either refund my purchase price or send me a reprint. Do not buy this game!!

UPDATE: I did finally receive a response from customer service on 3/9/20 after originally reaching out on 2/21/20. They did offer to send me new tiles but I’ve already returned the game at this point. I’m adding an extra star since they were willing to replace the tiles for me but I still feel the response was too delayed.TL;DR: easy & fairly fun game that’s simple to learn but quality of game pieces is less than spectacular.The long version: Here’s the thing- I love the concept of this game. It’s quick to teach and to play, and easy for those used to less involved strategic games to learn. This was the reason I purchased, to have something that’s not your standard Hasbro game but is easy enough to play with friends and family who don’t play as many or as complex of games as we do. i really wanted to love this one.But..The first time we played it, we found so many quality issues with the game tiles. Tiles were cut way over the printed areas, leaving discolored and/or white streaks that should have been part of the excess cut away and disposed of. This also means the paths are not centered on the tiles as they should be, so they don’t all match up when placed next to one another. Probably half our tiles were like this, making gameplay a bit confusing as you had to pay careful attention to paths to make sure you stay on your original one. There also seemed to be an issue when the tiles were cut, one corner on many of them appears to be separated almost- the decorative layer chipping off. See photos for examples of all the issues I’ve described.I reached out to the company, Calliope Games, via the customer service email listed on their website. This was a week ago. My ideal resolution would have been the option to have new tiles mailed to me to make my game playable and presentable. To date, I haven’t received so much as an automated response saying my message had been received and I would hear back in # days. I feel a week is more than reasonable to expect a response from a company that has any consideration of their customers at all.I can’t in good conscience recommend this game or any other from Calliope Games as customer service is nonexistent and the product has quality control issues that affect gameplay.
