I (27M) was going on a trip with eight friends from NYC to Costa Rica so i decided to get this game after playing it with a group of friends. At first I took out the game and tried to explain it to a couple people who all ignored me so i decided to corner one person and start playing solo with her. Eventually one by one the others in the group came over and started playing. By the end of the trip we would go out to the bars and arrive home to all circle around the table at 3AM to continue playing coup until the sun would rise. It is an amazingly captivating and versatile game that becomes addictingly fun. The only downside is that when you get really good everyone tries to kill you as fast as possible every game...but that doesn't mean you can't kill them first ;)

This is a fun game with a unique lying mechanic. My wife and I never lie in real life, so neither of us are good at it. When we play this game, I try to lie, and she never lies. She beats me every time.I usually beat her at every other game because I'm better at strategy, but she beats me at this because she's better at telling the truth than I am at lying.It's not fast paced, but it's a very quick game.

This is a great hidden identity game. It is a bit complex in strategy but is certainly an enjoyable challenge once you get the hang of the rules and the people you play with. I would say that this is a game where you learn through failing a couple games first and catch on so be prepared for that. The packaging is quite nice and is small enough to viably carry around. It is not much bigger than a set for UNO. Despite having nothing to lock it, the box stays shut too. Great game for those who find strategy games a good challenge.

This is a fun game for 2 to 6 players. The players each get 2 cards, representing a character (ambassador, duke, captain, contessa, assassin etc). These cards are face down and each of them represents a life. When you lose a life you flip a card. When you lose your second life, you are out of the round.The great thing is that lying is possible (and encouraged :) ) and you can claim that your face down card is whatever you want. If you are not called on it, the action goes forward. If you are called on it and you were lying you are punished by losing a life. If however you did have the card you claimed when challenged, the challenger loses a life.The gamemoves quickly so those who get knocked out are not idle for long. It's short and sweet and you can beat the game by being honest if you want to and never lying to anyone. The game is totally worth the money.

review_title: I would expect it to be better quality.
review_description: The tiles were not uniform and letters all over the place.  The board is defective.  I wrote a complaint to Hasbro and they claimed this product is no longer in production and wondered if I purchased from a third party.  With paying a premium price, I would expect it to be better quality.

review_title: Bring back the Scrabble Deluxe Edition Game (Amazon Exclusive)
review_description: Absolutely hate this scrabble deluxe edition game.This scrabble is cheaply built, split away during games. Plus you have to lug around a big  box. Tell me Hasbro, this newer deluxe is far worst than the previous and how come you cant store the items inside the other Scrabble deluxe.  This Scrabble Deluxe is failure. Go back to the previous version.  I had purchased the Scrabble Deluxe Edition Game (Amazon Exclusive) in December , Amazon please bring back  Scrabble Deluxe Edition Game (Amazon Exclusive) which was better. You could store all everything inside the bottom of the game. And clean up was quick and easy.

review_title: I would recommend purchasing another version with a lazy-Susan type of revolving ...
review_description: The playing surface is made of two pieces of molded plastic that connect with two pull-out plastic hinges.  When you turn the board so your opposing player can see the letters, the board comes apart all the time and you have to fix it.  The design defeats the purpose of buying this version of the game.  I would recommend purchasing another version with a lazy-Susan type of revolving mechanism.  The game itself is a classic, but this particular version of it is annoying to deal with.

This was by no means a deluxe edition.  It is very cheaply made with an awkward method of connecting the two halves of the board.  The two halves were not even.  It‘s not a turntable like previous deluxe scrabble editions - the two halves of the board have wheels, instead.  Not a dealbreaker, but not smooth rotation.  The pieces were highly irregular as well, all different shapes and sizes, some patterns not printed in the center, and one piece was just straight-up broken.  Even the manual was poorly formatted and confusing.  I would feel slightly ripped off at paying $20 for this cheap plastic garbage, much less $40!  From what i can tell, all the Scrabble editions made by “Winning Solutions”, “Winning Moves” and “WS Games” are all very cheaply made and overpriced.  Returning it and ordering one of the earlier deluxe editions that were made 20-30 years ago.

This is VERY poor quality - so bad that players can't really enjoy the game.  By no definition is this "Deluxe".  This is nothing like the classic products made and sold by Hasbro (or whatever company had it some years ago).  The price is completely unjustifiable.  The materials are all very cheap, and feel, sound and play that way.  Again, players just can't really enjoy the game, because of the distractions attributable to poor quality (such as the board always coming apart).Older versions are available and better, even if used.  You might find them on Amazon, or you can find them on other large auction sites.  If you require a new version, do your research and try to get a look at an opened product before you buy, even in a retail store.  There are older wooden versions, and other better-made plastic and cardboard versions.  If you want the true deluxe, you can find the 'Scrabble Deluxe Classic [or Wooden] Edition' here on Amazon and elsewhere.  It's much more expensive, but the quality is there.  If you want to spend about the same as this product costs, you'd do better to find a slightly used older version, including with wooden turntables and wooden trays and pieces, on an auction site (or maybe on Amazon).

review_title: the board itself is not a good quality nor are the tiles
review_description: Not sure what I was expecting for the price, but I would not refer to this as "deluxe".  I already had a deluxe board and tiles, and was looking for a more transportable set. While the ridges on the board hold the tiles, the board itself is not a good quality nor are the tiles. there doesn't appear to be much quality control in printing and cutting the tiles.  The letters were not always the same color tone nor were the letters centered in the tile.  I gave it to a friend, as she has children that are learning to play the game.  It is not a set that will last a long time if used frequently.

I bought this after having only the classic Scrabble for a few years. I love Scrabble and wanted a nicer board to play when family comes over. They have a very nice board that sits on a lazy Susan and looks very nice.  I was hesitant about this particular model after hearing about it's quality, but the product I received is fine. The letters are all okay and none are broken like other reviews. The letters are also pretty center.  However, they are not as high quality as what another nicer more luxury set would offer.The board itself has a colorful design rather than the more elegant design of past deluxe sets.Overall it's not as nice as deluxe sets in the past. It's okay for the price point, but one day I would like to upgrade once again to a $100+ board when I can justify it.

review_title: Good but not great. Still worth buying.
review_description: Pros: Not being on a lazy susan (turning table) but instead having angled wheels makes the game board lower to the table which I like. The raised borders work well and the letter pieces stay in place. The way the board hooks together in the center is easy.Cons: pressing the middle of the board makes it cave in a little. The fact it doesn’t snap together but lay in place is neither a good or bad design.  The cardboard box is the carrying case. Not a lasting design and kinda cheap. The wooden pieces aren’t all printed center and that bothers some people. I personally don’t care.Overall: I think it’s good for the price but not great. It’s built well enough for just home use but travel is iffy with a cardboard case. I’m satisfied with this purchase.
We love this game and the quality of the board is very good. Awesome purchase.

review_title: Disappointing way it is put together. I have an ...
review_description: Disappointing way it is put together.  I have an older version of the "Scrabble Deluxe Edition which is one molded piece of plastic that you just open up.  This one, when you open it, the board is in two pieces that often comes apart or sticks up in one place.  This has been "dumbed down" in assembly excepting for the price.  I would not get another one.

review_title: The "carrying case" is a handle attached to the game's cardboard box.
review_description: The game itself is fine.  However, I bought it because the product listing said it came with a carrying case and my plan was to store the game in the carrying case aboard my sailboat for rainy day or evening fun in the cabin.  Once I received the game, I realized they just attached a handle to the top of the game box then called it a carrying case.  Had I known the case was just a cardboard box (which is not a good way to store things aboard a boat, for obvious reasons), I would not have bought this.

review_title: the craftsmanship is incredibly poor. It's clear Hasbro really reduced quality in order ...
review_description: This edition is in no way deluxe, the craftsmanship is incredibly poor. It's clear Hasbro really reduced quality in order to increase profits, the older versions of the game have much better tiles, a board that is more sturdy with an actual hinge and handle, and nice amenities like little drawers to hold your tiles and racks. Even the printing on the board is low-quality, with many smudges in the ink. Hasbro should be ashamed and embarrassed to sell something this low quality.

I personally never played Scrabble but have heard and seen it plenty of times. Played it with the family one day and less than a week later we have it ourselves and enjoy it everytime.Product is great and the box acts as a case to carry it where you need to. Wooden pieces feels light and sorta cheap but we are not that picky about it. Set up is truly quick and smooth. Simply pull the small hinges out from one side of the board and connect the other. It would be nice to have some type of lock with it so you wouldn’t have to keep it on a flat surface. We played on carpet and it still spun fine, just remember that my carpet/floor may be more leveled than your own. It did separate a few times from one hinge. Once you finish spinning the board just reconnect and continue. If we were on a flat surface then this wouldn’t be an issue. Board grids fit each piece slightly loose but I expect it to be like this.Overall, it’s worth the buy. Would recommend this to anyone. Price could be another factor but I feel this will last a very long time if taken cared of. Why the 4 stars? Cause if Hasbro could add locking hinges so it prevents or lessen the chances of separating during the game then it would be a well deserved 5 stars.

review_title: Hasbro please just sell us a round rotating board like tournaments
review_description: Bought this on sale, would not have been happy at full price, but I’m fine with it on sale.As others have noted, the tiles are printed unevenly (how difficult could that be?), and the board sometimes comes apart during play if people aren’t gentle turning it - especially on my grooved wooden table. It’s hollow plastic so also rattley on such surfaces.What annoys me the most, however, is that Hasbro refuses to sell a *circular* game board like they use in tournaments, which is ideal. With a rotating square board (or worse, rectangular like this one, for reasons I don’t understand), people tend to move their tiles too close during play and they have to move them again for rotation.I would pay good money for one of those tournament boards, although I do understand they are impractical to store for most consumers.

review_title: Deluxe-o Oh No! Not entirely what you pay for.
review_description: The letter tiles are made of wood; however, the tile holders are light, bendable plastic. These cheap-o tile holders are not depicted on the cover of the box which I later deemed deceptive.  Your letters can easily be knocked off the plastic rack due to the lack of weight.  There goes your game plan. For the money, I think the tile holders should be made out of wood as they used to be and as you might expect.  I would keep the game if wooden tile holder replacements were provided and I were allowed to simply throw the nasty plastic ones away without having to go to the PO to return them during this pandemic.

What a disapointment on this product. I am returning it. There is nothing of Deluxe about this product: Tiles are non uniform in size and printing is so off from the centre that seems to be made for a prototype!!!  The joint betwen the two sections is too lack of engineering design that is just a shame.There were some good references / reviews for this products; so, I took the chance, but I think those were from the designers or the very same vendors. I realistic price for this item in a school rifle would be $8. That may be a rip off though.

review_title: This is a toy version of scrabble!
review_description: I wish I could give this game less than one star. I bought this game as a travel game and was surprised when I got it that the case was as bulky as it was. So, I made a fabric bag to hold all of the components.  I didn’t examine the game when I first got it but I was so disappointed in EVERY component when I sat down tonight to play for the first time. The tiles are cheap and the printing is in no way uniform. The clips to hold the two halves of the board together are completely ineffective and the tile racks are not level. This is a giant waste of money!

review_title: The construction of the game was far under par to what I expected.
review_description: For the price that I paid for this Scrabble game I expected far better. I guess in today’s standards it’s to be expected but I remember the one my mother had which the board was a sturdy cardboard the tile holders were wooden and the tiles were a finished tile. This one has a decent board kind of flimsy the tile holders are very thin plastic and the wooden tiles are just cut pieces of wood not finished at all. I would not buy this again as a gift myself.

review_title: good features for a good price
review_description: I had a REALLY nice Scrabble set I bought years ago, board made of wood and on a turntable. I say had because I lost it when our home flooded from tropical storm Harvey. I wanted another one that could be rotated, but unwilling to pay well over $100 for one. So this one is the next best thing. And it has ridges that keep the letters in place too. Nice set for the money.

review_title: Overall, great version for the price
review_description: I got this as a gift for my mother-in-law. I like the price point, the grid lines for the tiles and the rotating board. My only real issue was that there was a lack of uniformity in the title size. 1 or 2 of them were shorter than the others. Not a huge deal except that it bothered my OCD and, if there are only a couple, it tips your hand to the other players because they can figure out what tile it could be if they've played with you before.

I wish that, in my haste to get a turn table Scrabble board, I had taken the time to read these reviews. Doing so would have spared me considerable disappointment when I opened the Deluxe Scrabble and found just about the cheapest piece of manufacturing I have ever seen--especially at the price point. The tiles are featherweight, for starters, and drop off the table unnoticed (I can so attest). The red plastic trays are appalling. The font used on the design of the board looks like it's designed for the preteens, at best. And, finally, while it's true that the board does turn, it involves both hands to send on to the partner without clattering. I will give the board one star, but only because of past, now questioned, loyalty to the game itself. Awful.

Divorced a few years ago and she took the Scrabble game.  Yeah, I know....but at least I got the dog!It was a solidly-made, turntable board.  I've searched for a suitable replacement, and found this.  Priced as a deluxe game, I expected it to be very similar.Not even close.  This is cheap plastic and the board is two pieces that click together.She can have the dog, I want that game back!

review_title: Fortunately was able to return for full refund
review_description: I had to return this. It was SOOOO cheaply made. The board wouldn't even fit together as much as we tried. Fortunately was able to return for full refund. Very very plasticy.

review_title: Previous edition much better! Buy older edition on Amazon
review_description: Board comes in 2 pieces that do not securely fit together. Does not come with hard case for travel like the previous edition. I'm returning this edition and puchasing the previous edition which is still sold on Amazon.

The quality of this is just exactly what I was not looking for, the tiles fit nicely but the feel of the board is just so cheap. If you want to use this board frequently it's just not worth it because the board does not snap together and stay as one piece for very long. I dont wan't to spend over $100, but this feels like a durable cheap board. I'm looking for something more permanent, I sent it back.

review_title: Not bad but far from good
review_description: Somewhat disappointed in the quality. Considering it is the ‘deluxe’ edition, it leaves a bit to be desired. Overall build quality is low.. the plastic is flimsy and the wooden tiles are of greatly varied quality. My mother has a version with a proper swivel base and better quality material from the 80s. Not bad, but far from good.

I was disappointed in this product. It swivels and that’s what I was looking for, however, the board has to be put together. It comes in two halves that you put together but they do NOT lock in.  As a result when your playing the game and turning it, it comes apart. This is extremely annoying.  Outside of that I’d say it’s ok.

review_title: Cheaply made, board comes in halves, wouldn’t recommend.
review_description: Board sucks...comes in two halves and it rests on a little hook-like clip but doesn’t even secure. Rolls nicely but if you’re not careful it comes unhooked. Not sure if I’m doing something wrong but it’s not ideal and the letters aren’t even wood...they’re plastic with printed letters (not engraved like the old days) with cheap little plastic letter holders. Not worth the money if you ask me.
Good game for kids and adults

This game is a piece of junk.  No part of it is deluxe.  The plastic is cheap and thin.  The print on the letters isn’t even centered.  The “carrying case” is the the cardboard box it came in that has a handle.  I can’t believe they are selling this garbage for $50.  It should be $10.  Still wouldn’t t buy it at that price.

review_title: Poor design, does not stay together.
review_description: Poor design. The board does NOT stay together. It was advertised as the "newer model". Its terrible.  But the Deluxe one with the drawers.  This one is going back!

Love the ease of assembly yet the board tends to separate on one end if not careful. Also the letter holders are a light plastic prefer a little heavier or wooden. The case is cardboard with handle but sturdy. Prefer a tin case instead for fear of it wearing out sooner. Otherwise it’s a nice set.

This is a great product! The turntable glides nicely to turn to each player. The game board itself has indentions for the tiles so they don’t move around like the traditional board. The only complaint I have is that we had to order 3 times to get a box that wasn’t smashed (shipping box was in perfect condition).

review_title: I was very disappointed with this product when it arrived
review_description: I was very disappointed with this product when it arrived.  I was expecting something of much higher quality and substantial for the price. The tile trays a small and of poor quality plastic, the board itself is in two pieces with poorly designed plastic clips to hole the two sides together.  I was expecting a regular turn table attached to a single board.  The package was in pretty poor shape as well and looked like it might have been returned before, it looked battered and if it might have been sitting around in a shop or warehouse for a very long time.  I will be returning this product and searching for something more substantial for the price.  This is my first review of a product and I was very disappointed
Like very much the "Deluxe" version; big, clear board, nice ridges to "lock in" pieces.  All in all, good value for the board quality and design.

This is one of the beat versions of Scrabble you will find, don’t bother with the expensive “Deluxe” edition it’s way overpriced and cheaply made. This one is great value and not a bad price and has excellent features

I remember the older version of "deluxe scrabble" and this sure isn't it. It doesn't have a base to swivel on (but it does rotate ok if you're on a hard surface) and the letter tiles are low quality. They are lightweight and seem cheap. Not like the older ones -- which I remember being smooth, glossy, heavy, and rounded at the edges. This will certainly work, but I'm disappointed by the quality.
Made for ease of access, the rotating board, but otherwise not any different from other versions of scrabble.  Only downside is putting it back in the box which can be a little bit of a hassle.

review_title: Not what I thought I was getting...
review_description: Instead of the deluxe version with the lazy susan, this is a weird design where the board splits in half and has wheels underneath. I was also disappointed in the "cheap-looking" quality of the letters (not varnished, inconsistent sizing) and the cheap plastic tile holders instead of the wooden ones most sets come with.

The quality of the pieces, including the board itself is terrible! The plastic is thin and cheap, the board doesn't hold together well and the printing on the tiles themselves is uneven and even the font is inconsistent. I am extremely disappointed and angry at having paid for this product! The best part about it is the carrier box, and the fact that the tiles actually fit into the squares on the board. It's definitely an embarrassing gift to give anyone.

Very nice set. The board rotates and translates easily. Unlike the original flat board that allowed the tiles to migrate about when you bump it, this board has molded recesses that hold each tile perfectly.  It makes it more difficult to put the tiles away at the end of the game, but it's worth it. Love it. Great value.

review_title: not the game or board expected
review_description: I have a Scrabble Deluxe game made by winning moves and I thought when looking it closing on line the 4 corners scored quadruple points which my game has.  I wanted to get one just like it for a relative and was disappointed that the one that came only got triple points for the 4 corners.  The one I got from Amazon seems to be put out by Hasbro and isn't as much fun as the one I have with 441 spaces and 200 wood tiles.  So was disappointed.

review_title: Great improvement on a old pastime game
review_description: This is a pretty good edition of an old game. The board keeps the tiles neat on the playing field. The board moves effortlessly for players to play. The case is made of cardboard and would need reinforcing to last for some time.

review_title: Grids help keep tiles in place.
review_description: We love the grids.  And the tiles.  However it is difficult to turn on a card table sized table.  I am in a group who plays weekly for 2 to 4 hours.  We all have drinks and snacks on the table as well as a score pad.  Please reduce the width of the board.

Best game ever for all ages.  Get your mind thinking and the best way to pass time with family. I most enjoy coming up with new words, keeps my peeps on their toes. This deluxe version can turn so your able to really see the board. Worth every penny I spent.  Timeless game for all to play.  Once again, Scrabble, enough said!

review_title: This is the worst board I've ever played on
review_description: This is the worst board I've ever played on. For being "deluxe" it sure feels cheap and it bends in the middle so if the surface you're playing on is even slightly uneven you run the risk of the board splitting mid-game.
One of my favorite games. This addition has the rotation assist with a turntable. Plastic squares keep letters in place. Fun for all ages.

review_title: I like the fact that this scrabble game is compact but ...
review_description: I like the fact that this scrabble game is compact but when I ordered this one it looked like the one I ordered last year that fold up and is it’s own carrying case. This one is in two pieces that doesn’t stay connected when turning and the paper box is its carrying case

review_title: for the price wasn't really happy with the quality
review_description: for the price wasn't really happy with the quality.. it comes in 2 halfs which come apart very easy. the grooves that hold the letters are vert shallow and work so so.. the word holders are just cheap plastic, it came with no score pad.. i remember when i was a kid i got a really nice all wooden scrabble game and for less money.. nowadays they just produce cheap plastic remakes and the price is higher for profit i guess. stinks.
Love this set!  Got for my 9 year old grandson and we’re enjoying it several times a week. Plan on taking a cross country trip via train this summer and we’ll be taking this along!

review_title: Suffers the same play-test issues of the other Betrayal games
review_description: I have only played a couple of scenarios in the new Betrayal at Baldur's Gate, so you might take this review with a few grains of salt.First, I'll start with what I really like.The new characters all have a special power, like a spell, or ranged attack, or re-roll mechanic. This gives each character a bit more uniqueness and adds to the already high replayability factor.The D&D theme is well done in terms of the scenarios, events, flavor text, etc. I wasn't sure a thematic mashup of Betrayal and D&D would work, but so far, so good. Unfortunately, you can't read through the haunts without spoiling them, so I don't have enough data to know how well they fit the theme. However, in one play test, the haunt was all players versus the game. There was no traitor, and working together to beat the boss monster gave a familiar D&D feel.I like the way the buildings and streets combine to make a large "ground level" map, with a smaller catacombs level. I also like that each level has its own draw pile. In the original, a critical room can often be accidentally "buried" at the bottom of the draw pile because of the way the draw mechanic works. This does not occur in the new version.That said, one of my biggest complaints with the various Betrayal games (the original, Widow's Walk, and now this one) is that the scenarios do not appear to be play tested very well, if at all... or even well edited in some cases.How do I know?We almost always have questions about the traitor powers/actions... and not minor questions, but key issues with the way the powers are worded that make the haunt rules overly ambiguous.My wife and I are veteran gamers. We have played all the Betrayal games as well as other traitor-mechanic games like Shadows over Camelot, Battlestar Galactica, Dead of Winter, etc... The design challenge with the Betrayal games is that every scenario has slightly different mechanics for the traitor. Because of this, the game designers need to be extraordinarily detail-oriented when writing up the haunt rules.Due to the age of the original Betrayal, haunt clarifications can sometimes be found online, but not so for Widow's Walk or Baldur's Gate, so you are on your own to interpret the rules as written.For the hero group, the group can generally come to a consensus after discussion. However, the traitor is usually on their own to interpret any potential rule problems or vague wording, unless they want to give away their secret powers or win conditions.I have yet to play a haunt that hasn't had an issue where the text was not entirely clear and required some (varying) amount of interpretation. In almost every case, a single sentence (or two at most) could have cleared up the confusion. A good editor should have caught these ambiguities, but I have the distinct impression the the designers did their own editing... or if there was an editor, the editor was only looking for grammatical issues, and not in-play rules ambiguity. A play test of each haunt should haven eliminated most of these ambiguities.All games have some amount of rules ambiguity, but it is more pronounced in the Betrayal games simply because there are some 30 to 40 different haunts that all may have different issues, and you are not able to know the haunt rules in advance without spoiling the game.This has been a big problem for me in that any win or loss is tainted by the "Hey, did we play that part correctly?" discussion after the game. It often takes away some of the shine of a win, or adds to the frustration of a loss. I don't mind losing. Losing a competitive game can be lots of fun. But I hate losing when it later becomes clear that an incorrectly interpreted rule may have changed the whole scenario or player strategy.As a non-spoilery example, one of the haunts had a big monster with some smaller minions. The minions came out first, and the big boss a couple turns later. In the haunt, it appears to state that the minions go away once the boss monster comes out, but a sentence or two later, it implies the exact opposite. Also in the same haunt, the text appeared to imply that the boss monster may be able to attack more than one character given a certain condition, but it didn't explicitly state it. We rules that the minions stayed and continued to attack, but the boss monster did not attack more than once. That seemed to be the balanced interpretation, and we won the scenario... but we may not have one if the boss monster were allowed a second attack. So the victory felt diminished. Given that we had not just one, but two rules clarifications required for the haunt, I was a bit disappointed in that particular scenario.Don't get me wrong. I don't dislike the game. If you are a fan of the other Betrayal titles and you like D&D, you will almost certainly enjoy this mash up. However, my recent experiences with poorly worded haunts has tarnished what would otherwise be a really fun experience.I give it 3.5 stars. It will go up to 4 stars in the future if I encounter fewer haunts that have the same play test problems.

review_title: Very fresh take on the original.
review_description: My boardgame group has loved my Betrayal at House on the Hill for years.  They welcomed the addition of Widows Walk.Then I introduced them to Betrayal at Baldur's Gate last night.Most of the mechanics from the original games work exactly the same.  There are some nuances that are different though.  Haunt rolls are changed so that now you roll dice equal to the number of omens revealed and once someone rolls a 6+ the haunt starts.Each character has special abilities now rather than just just being better in a certain stat.Rather than upper floor/ground level/basement the map progression is now buildings/street/catacombs.  This isn't as straightforward as it looks.  The doors are color coded to let you know what type of tile you are entering.  (Rather than 1 large pile of tiles you keep each type separate in this game)  Sewer gates/stairs go down into the catacombs.  This leads to a very interesting board layout as the street winds through buildings and the catacombs lay separate.Difficulty level seems slightly higher than the original, at least in the couple rounds we have already played.My only con to the game at this point is that some tiles feel like they are labeled incorrectly.  Buildings that feel like streets and vice versa.If you liked betrayal at house on the hill you will like this.9.5/10

There was lots of thought and design that went into this game - it's remarkable in some ways, but falls short in others.OVERVIEW: Betrayal at Baldur's Gate is a Dungeons and Dragons themed version of Betrayal at House on the Hill, with only 3 meaningful changes: 1. There's a minor tweak to the rules governing when the haunt is triggered, 2. The players' characters have built-in special abilities, 3. Instead of a three story house, you're playing in a two story city (streets&buildings on the base level, and underground catacombs below).STRUCTURE:Like the original Betrayal at House on the Hill - the game is really 50 games in 1. It's a semi-structured dungeon crawl game, where each player explores a map that will never be the same twice. You survive light encounters, find items, and attempt to boost your four attributes so you can face whatever challenges are revealed when one of the 50 potential haunt scenarios gets triggered.ACCESSIBILITY:The learning curve is slightly high - but new players can learn it quickly by playing with someone who understands all the rules. The rule book for the game is probably 20-30 pages.FLAWS:Three big ones: 1. The box does a poor job organizing all the pieces of the game, so the flow of the game is constantly getting snagged while you have to sift through lots of indistinguishable little cardboard tiles that correspond to unique events in the game, 2. The outcome of the game feels too driven by random chance, and not enough by the skill or strategy of the players, 3. Betrayal at Baldur's Gate is not compatible with Widow's Walk (the expansion to Betrayal at House on the Hill).TAKEAWAY:This game is a good fit for 3-6 players that want to engage in a highly imaginative, narrative-driven game (could also be played in 2player variant if each player uses two characters before the haunt triggers). There's high replay value because the map/characters/items/haunt scenario will never be identical. However, the flow of the game is fairly choppy, and the outcome of the challenges presented by the game are too skewed by chance rather than skill.If you like the idea of this game, original Betrayal at House on the Hill is probably the better investment, because you can add the Widow's Walk expansion. But if you like the Dungeons and Dragons theme and aren't terribly interested in getting an expansion, you should opt for Betrayal at Baldur's Gate

review_title: I broke the game. 10/10 would recommend to anyone who would do the same in my position.
review_description: Played it for the first time during a weekend away with some friends. The setting we obtained (as there are multiple scenarios) was one of our party members had turned into the vessel for a goddess of water; the goal being stop her from flooding the mansion and subsequently the town. I had chosen a dwarf and had lost some intelligence from equipment obtained so I was unable to fulfill ANY of the tasks that would prevent this disaster. In true Leeroy fashion I opted for a different solution, which was to murder my wife by relentlessly pursuing her over the next 3 turns. I survived 3 life or death save rolls and was able to bring the monster to peace before anyone could even complete a single objective.This was a problem as we could not determine whether or not what I did was technically legal and if anyone really won the game, as the rule book states the demon uses the vessel as their method of navigating the game, but does not seem to anticipate anyone jumping the gun in the first 3 turns to fight something with ludicrous stats... and beating them each save. Without a vessel, the game was unable to proceed and no clear indications as to whether I broke the game out of sheer luck and ignorance.TLDR:I broke the game my first run through. Had a blast doing so, despite the hour long debate that followed with the implications about what a horrible person I was to murder my own wife instead of saving her. 10/10 would recommend to anyone who would do the same in my position.

review_title: If you like Betrayal and House on the Hill and you love Fantasy or Dungeons and Dragons or Forgotten Realms, this is a winner.
review_description: This is a great spin on Betrayal at House on the Hill.  It is set in Dungeon and Dragons': Forgotten Realms city of Baldurs Gate with a horror twist.All of the original game's Haunts and Omens and Items and Events have either been twisted, re-worded or replaced by ones that fit a fantasy setting.The biggest difference is that you are exploring a city, not a a house.  So it is set up in "2.5 layers".  That is to say, before you had Main Floor, Upper Floor and Basement.  Now you have City, Buildings, and Catacombs.  So the way they connect is similar = door to door, but you keep three stacks of areas, and pull for a color coded door (instead of a lit window with text). This works fine with one exception - there are "wide" alleys that can connect to normal sized doors.  And well, that just looks odd... but it works.There are 2 or 3 less "empty hallways" in this game tile set, so most every room has an Event, Item, or Omen.The Omens are fun, some of then quite clever or creepy.  The items are very DnD, and typical of what you might find (including a humorous 10ft pole).  And the Events are brutal and rewarding and entertaining as in the original game.

review_title: Nice theme change and update for Betrayal.
review_description: I will say I loved the original Betrayal at House on the Hill so this review is largely biased. I haven't played this a ton because my group played a lot of the original so we are on to different types of games but I will say the Fantasy theme suits this game very nicely.I will mostly talk about what is different from the Original + Expansion. There are only 2 levels instead of 4 (expansion adds 1) which I think is a positive change. Its much easier to fit the board on a table when there are fewer levels. I like that each character has its own ability along with the change of stats. It makes each character feel vastly different. The few haunts I've played have been really fun but its hard to compare haunts if you haven't played them all. The haunts have at least fit well with the theme so far.Note: Every betrayal game has HORRIBLE inserts. I almost feel its necessary to replace them with your own. I built my own for the original + expansion and I bought a wood one for this version. It vastly increases setup and ease of gameplay. If you buy the original + expansion it will not fit in the same box without removing the insert. I recommend trying the game and if you like it buy a new insert.Overall if you are trying to decide which betrayal to get I would probably recommend this one over the Original + Expansion for mechanics alone but I would go with the theme you think is most applicable. If you have a fantasy group get this one but if your group isn't as fantasy geared I would buy the original. The original theme is simply a haunted house which is familiar to everyone.

I love the original Betrayal at House on the Hill and I was a bit wary of this, thinking it would be the same game but with minor reskins. I really like this game though and they have made enough changes to make it feel different.1. Instead of building a haunted house, you are building a city. You have the street level where you have various alleys and streets, and you also have building that can become interconnected. The other level is the catacombs. You can drop through sewer grates to escape into the catacombs. Overall the map feels very different from the haunted house map and that is enjoyable.2. Each of the 6 characters have a special ability that they can use (like the Rogue can move through occupied areas without suffering movement penalties) and that gives each character a more unique gameplay.3. The theme feels different enough to not just be a reskinned version, as dungeons and dragons is a well established lore.All in all, get this game if you're a fan of Betrayal at House on the Hill, if you're a fan of Dungeons and Dragons, if you're a fan of both, or if you're just looking for a fun game to add to game night.

review_title: Not as good as the original
review_description: This game is ok. It doesn’t have the fun factor of the original. There is something about this version that is less appealing. When we played this game at my game night not a single person really enjoyed it. We all decided that we will just keep playing Betrayal at House on the Hill instead. My friends play D&D so I was surprised no one was into it.I think that the idea of the game and the execution is good, it just wasn’t for me and my friend group.

This game is awesome. Heavy-duty printed cardboard tokens and room tiles, and cool plastic cast character pieces, in the shapes of the characters themselves. Game play is about an hour, a little more depending. It's super fun, especially when the haunt begins!! 2 modes of game play, starting play, and the haunt, once it's revealed. One player (usually) turns traitor, as chosen by the game guide. There are 50 different haunt scenarios, so no two games are alike for at least 50 game plays! Need at least 3 players though to play. I bought Betrayal at the House on the Hill first, and loved it so much I bought Baldur's Gate, because I used to love playing Baldur's Gate on PC. Seriously, you need to buy both of these games. You won't be sorry!! Plus, they'll make more when they know they're popular!!

We loved betrayal and have played at least a dozen games with various people and seen a lot of the different haunts. Baldur's is made by the same company, and has very similar rules. Less horror scary, more mystery feeling. There are also a couple minor rule changes to help with Betrayal's weaknesses, but overall, it plays the same. We have no issues playing Baldur's one night, then Betrayal another as they are still different games with different haunts and such. I'd recommend buying both.

The second I saw that there was a variation of Betrayal (one of mine and my wife's favorite games), we had to have it! I am SUCH a huge fan of the first one and we play D&D every week. Do you need to know anything about D&D to play this game, absolutely NOT! You can never have even heard of the D&D game before and this is STILL an amazing board game! Definitely one of the BEST BOARD GAMES! We learned it within 3 minutes of playing! Super easy to play! Hopefully they come out with even more variations. And for those of you that are D&D fans, why is bad stuff always happening to Balder's Gate? Like, at a certain point, you should move no? Seems like the worst possible city to live in the D&D cannon. It's like if you lived in New York in the MCU universe... just sayin'

Hark ye, adventurer! Embark not on this perilous quest lest ye be of stout heart and of sound mind and care not if thine circle of friends betrays thee bitterously, ripping thine still beating heart from thine chest and squashing it, casting it to the earth, and dancing about on it like a heathen’s foul and perhaps naked ritual to the Lord Bhaal himself. Turn back whilst there is time! Before the tendrils of temptation reel you in and in so doing steal your very soul. Back, I say! Back! Fly, you fools! Abandon hope all ye who enter at Baldur’s Gate...Tl:dr. This is legit the best game ever. Be prepared to make and lose friends. It’s that good.

A great Betrayal game. Wish you had more time to explore as the game is very omen heavy. If I would complain, I would have asked for more tiles, more useful player abilities, and a better balancing to the omen mechanic. Plays slightly shorter than normal Betrayal in our experience.

review_title: Let the haunt continue at Baludr's Gate
review_description: If you have play betrayal at haunted house on the hill and huge dungeon and dragon fan then buy this game to combine both worlds together.Super easy to learn game if your familar with betrayal at haunted house with few minure tweaks. Me and friends loved this game and are trying to do more with our other games.

The only negative thing i can say about this is the figures are made of plastic. The staff being held by one stays bent because its really thin.Otherwise this game is really fun. It scales better than the original game haunting of the house on the hill. When you have 5 players, the game feels like its not just automatically stacked one way after the haunt. They did a good job adjusting these.

review_title: This is the perfect game to add to your collection if you are ...
review_description: This is the perfect game to add to your collection if you are a fan of cooperative fantasy tabletop games.  Set in the Forgotten Realms (Dungeons and Dragons) city of Baldur's Gate, your party uses their special abilities to explore (build) the city while you investigate a growing evil.  Avalon Hill did a great job of capturing the ominous feel of their first Betrayal game and infusing it into a new world of possibilities.  Many of your favorite D&D villains and traps are just one unlucky dice roll away.  A few minor changes were made to the original game's rules that have made this version play more smoothly than it's forerunner.  The marriage of survival horror and fantasy roleplaying is flawless.I took "Betrayal at Baldur's Gate" to a game night with my Dungeons and Dragons group last week and it was a HUGE hit!In the end, it was I who had conspired to lead my hapless group of friends to Baldur's Gate...and I killed them all.............

So fun! If you love the original Betrayal game and/or also love D&D, this is a great upgrade. Some of the rules have been altered or simplified for smoother play and there are lots of new elements added with each character in the box! I loved exploring every tile, as the art is stellar. Also has some exciting new scenarios that have been both challenging and entertaining. Definitely won't regret buying, if you're interested!

The game that's never the same. I'm in love with this game. It's one of those games where you have tiles instead of a board, so the map is different each time, and the scenarios are different each time, so it does not become monotonous. Highly recommend this. I will say that it is more fun with at least 4 people. If you play with 3 people, then the game will often get skewed in one person's favor at some point, but still an awesome game. I wish there were a digital version as well!

I'm a newb at the betrayal games, but I've played this a couple times and it rocks. After being the wizard (with magic missile), playing the "not D&D" betrayal game felt very bland. It may be that I just really like the flavor better, but good enough that after a couple plays I had to have the game for myself! I'm yet to be the betrayer, but it seems pretty cool either way.

review_title: Betrayal has never been so fun
review_description: This is my go to board game for most small groups. It is better, albeit slightly harder than House on the Hill. The main difference is the location, the character's special abilities, and the quality of the pieces are much better.I would highly recommend this game. The varying haunts are great, it is not a hard game to learn, and the thrill of having a chaotic ending is amazing.

review_title: The first playthrough was fun, and a pretty fresh take on the original
review_description: As a fan of the original game, and Baldur's Gate, I pre-ordered this version as soon as I heard it was available. The first playthrough was fun, and a pretty fresh take on the original. There are a couple tweaks to the gameplay in this version and they were well received in our group. I wouldn't recommend this version to people who don't care about Baldur's Gate or D&D, but if your interest it piqued I say go for it!

review_title: He keeps saying he loves this one because the scenarios are better balanced than in the original
review_description: I bought this for my husband. We play the original Haunt game with friends all the time. He keeps saying he loves this one because the scenarios are better balanced than in the original. I'm not a D&D player, but you don't need to be with this game. It's very similar to the original haunt game, so if you enjoyed that you'll enjoy this one as well.

Same as Betrayal at House on the Hill but with a little twist. Great and fun game. In this game you have to explore a Castle, during the exploration someone will become a traitor and the game will become a one vs all game.If you liked Betrayal at House on the Hill, you will definetly love this one.
Fun interactive game that gives you vague enough rules to give you direction but allows you to adjust for who is playing with you. Make sure you have plenty of space because the board it can get big.

review_title: Great Game made Better with DnD
review_description: We loved Betrayal at House on the Hill and we love DnD, so putting the two together is fantastic. The Haunts are fresh and interesting, the special abilities of the characters give it a DnD-like feel, and the artwork on the board is intriguing and detailed as ever. Creepy, exciting, and difficult, this one is a great take on such a good game.

review_title: High Replay Value, Hard for the Heroes to Win
review_description: This game is an improved version of Betrayal at House on the Hill, adding in some new elements, and bringing some Dungeons and Dragons references to the table. Great game regardless of your familiarity with D&D, but clever for those who are acquainted with it. The one downside to this game is that it seems harder for the heroes to win than Betrayal at House on the Hill--and that means the heroes lose quite often. Lots of variations, cool new powers for the characters, a game with high replay value for sure.

review_title: We have always loved the predecessor "Haunting of House on the Hill" the ...
review_description: I "LOVE" this game.  We bought this game for a friend as a birthday present.  We have always loved the predecessor "Haunting of House on the Hill"  the improvements/upgrades they made to the game play for this D&D version is excellent!  Each character has a special and unique ability, small tweaks have been made to prevent the instant haunt that could happen in Haunting of House on the Hill, as well as a few other minor changes.  The D&D theme for this game is very fun as well if you're a fan of the genre (and even if you're not).  I highly recommend this game to everyone!!  Re playable numerous times with a different experience every time!
1000000 times better than the house on the hill counterpart. It’s like someone too house on the hill and playtested it more. It’s a smoother game and easier to play.

review_title: Feels the same as the other with a slight twist.
review_description: Great game. Almost seems the exact same as betrayal of house on the hill but has a couple of add-ons not enough to feel like an entirely different game. The size of both are almost the same. Overall even though almost the same as it's spooky counterpart it's a great and fun game if your bored of the other and want a slight change

This game is great! It is especially fun for 4-6 players. I have played this and their other game Betrayal at House on the Hill a ton of times and have never played the same game, there are so many different scenarios you can get! If you are looking for your next go to game buy this or Betrayal at House on the Hill, you will not be disappointed!!!!

Everything you know and love about Betrayal, now with 100% more D&D! Basically a new skin of an already great game with new haunts! My D&D crew loved it, and friend who had never played betrayal or d&d before was asking about it the day after!

review_title: Cleaner product, still a few minor issues
review_description: Let me preface this by saying that I play/own the original Betrayal and the Widow's Walk expansion and absolutely enjoy them.The quality of the board pieces and tokens is still fairly solid. The sliders for the character cards seem to fit much better than the ones we have for the original Betrayal. Some of the Haunts are still written in a mildly ambiguous manner, but we worked through those issues as a group and house ruled them.  All in all, I'm giving the game a 4/5 because it still needs work in clearly writing out the haunts.

If you enjoy Betrayal and Baldur's Gate/Fantasy/D&D, you'll enjoy this game. This is a re-skinned version of the horror board game and introduces little besides a non-trivial special power that each character can use. The "Haunts" that I've played so far have been fairly even; they're probably more balanced than the original, but YMMV.

My boyfriend and I bought this game after playing Betrayal At House On The Hill It's a great twist on the game -- we enjoy the DND-ish elements and the special abilities each character has. Definitely would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys Betrayal!

The packing could have been a lot better, as the game itself seems to have been stabbed in the back during transit, but there was no damage to the contents and the game itself is great. The plastic clips actually clip onto the character cards (unlike in the House on the Hill version) and the figures are painted surprisingly well. Gameplay is also great. For those of you familiar with House on the Hill, it's exactly what you would expect- the same game, but with more of a heroic fantasy feel, and with the odds stacked a little more in favour of the heroes than the traitor, at least from the three times I've played it so far.

review_title: I actually think it is better than the original betrayal but that might be my ...
review_description: I actually think it is better than the original betrayal but that might be my love of Baldur's Gate causing a bias coming through. Everything from events to items and locations have been changed and now the characters have abilities and none of them are "crappy." All of the abilities are useful in certain situations.

A fantastic fantasy/D&D variation on Betrayal at House on the Hill. Many new ideas, such as the unique character abilities, add some refreshing flavor. Story-immersive, quick to learn, and every round you play is totally unique. Great to have this as part of my game collection!

review_title: Good for fans of the original or those looking for a Betrayal game with a different theme.
review_description: loved the original Betrayal game, but found myself never playing it because it always seemed like a halloween game. This seems like betrayal but year round. If you liked the base game, you'll dig this. It also does a great job with explaining the rules if you're familiar with the base game.

review_title: So much fun. Don't let that fact that there are 3 ...
review_description: So much fun. Don't let that fact that there are 3 rule books intimidate your friends. It's pretty simple once you start and 2 books are just the many ways this game can go. One for the inevitable villain and 1 for everyone else.Don't read those until you play them, much more fun that way

review_title: Baldur's is Worth Gettting Even if You Already Own House
review_description: Great game. Ironically, a group of friends and I played it the other night for the first time instead of our weekly Pathfinder game. We ended up with the haunt in which your character is actually a DM running a D&D game! Hilarious!This game is very similar but so much different than Betrayal at House on the Hill. Baldur's has enough elements that it feels like a Fantasy RPG, while House feels like a classic Horror game.

If you play betrayal at house on the hill this is an awesome addition! It’s a stand alone game so you don’t need both. Also if you’ve never played the previous game you’ll still love this one. It’s a map building dudgeon game that’s perfect for groups.

review_title: Very well made game and fun for big groups of people who like this sort ...
review_description: Very well made game and fun for big groups of people who like this sort of thing. Highly recommend watching a video play through before purchasing if you are not familiar with it, as it requires a lot of setup and has a very steep learning curve for those new to it.

review_title: Such a great game! Betrayal at House on the Hill was ...
review_description: Such a great game! Betrayal at House on the Hill was my gateway game into modern gaming, and this one just plays so much better in my opinion and increases the fun of the original! I bought it for a gift, but man would I like to buy it again for myself sometime!

The game is well thought out, and a brilliant sequel to Betrayal at House on the Hill. Maybe if there were little baggies or more compartments to organize all of the different pieces so I can spend less time digging through the chips, or sorting at the beginning of the game, that would be good. For anyone who has never played before, be ready to spend hours playing the game. Also plan on playing with people who are ready to pay attention because there can be a lot to keep track of.

review_title: Great game and always a new experience
review_description: Once you play through the first time it is easy to play and the rulebook makes the game simple to follow.  The adventures are fun and it gets everyone around the table involved.

Bought this for a tabletop night me and my boyfriend did with a few friends a while back and loved it. My boyfriend wanted this game for so long and finally gave in on the price and it's now a staple for our game nights!

review_title: Great fun for D&D and BatHotH fans.
review_description: Finally got a chance to play this today, and our group enjoyed it. Love the D&D flavor to the setting, even if it makes the game feel less scary. Great if you are looking an alternative to standard BatHotH.

review_title: Great game. Very similar to betrayal on the hill.
review_description: Great game. Very similar to betrayal on the hill. Cleaner game play.

Great updated version of Betrayal. It is a shame that it is not set in a horror setting anymore, but it did fix up a lot of the rules and the D&D setting is also fun. I can't wait for Betrayal Legacy to come out!
This is a great family game!  I recommend playing the original first but you can step right into this game!  My family loves it.

review_title: You want bonding and laughter, this is it!!! Great family and party game!
review_description: You want bonding and laughter, this is it!!! Great family and party game! Everyone had tears running down their faces from laughing. We've got a cabinet full of games, but between this and Catan, we're set for the holidays after dinner.I added pictures below to show how cornflakes transformed into Bob Marley, raggae ghost. ;)

review_title: Fun, just consider buying more markers ahead of time
review_description: This game is a lot of fun, it's a great party game that helps people get acquainted or you can tease your long time friends with. It's fun for 2, maybe 3 rounds a night but realistically that's a decent amount of time if you're not comparing yourself to the serious board game people. I first played it a year and a half ago and someone had said that it's a "great game but you could easily make it yourself" I brushed this off because it's true of a lot of board games, where the maker of the game  shoe horns in unnecessary items like a timer, board or buzzer to make it a more complete package (even though these things have no effect on the fun of the game or could easily be replaced with an app) Anyways I brushed this off, I didn't want to take the time to make my own white board rolladex and recreating the experience with spiral notebooks, pens and a word generating app would feel too cheap. My problem is that out of the box two markers didn't work, and sharing markers really slows down the game, I felt throwing in an extra couple markers to make up for drunken misplacing or them being DOA would have made up for the $30 price point. Again this game is fun, it's low stakes, quick game that's a great icebreaker. I highly recommend picking this up, just consider buying extra dry-erase markers (maybe with finer points)

We love playing games at our house and enjoy a pretty wide variety of game types. I saw this game and bought it based on the good reviews. I had expected it to be similar to "Win, Lose, or Draw," a game I used to enjoy playing in the past. Unfortunately, this game was not nearly as fun, and really more of a dud for us and our guests. It doesn't initiate any communication/interaction between players, except at the very end when each person goes through and explains their boards. No one really seemed to enjoy it and passing the boards around got old quickly. The game can also get back-logged easily, while some players wait for others to finish drawing. We didn't like any of the proposed scoring methods, so we opted not to keep score. All and all, the game is okay, but needs something to make it more engaging and fun to play. I'd recommend watching a YouTube video of gameplay before deciding whether or not it's something you'd enjoy.

review_title: Huge, Huge hit with my family, LOVE this game!
review_description: I bought this game for Christmas and it was a huge hit! No fighting! No winners or losers, just rip roaring fun! The more players, the more fun! Our group was made up of 7-8 people ranging from ages 10 - 80 and even the teenagers liked it! The more sarcastic or snarky their guesses, the more fun for everyone!  We are not a raucous group, but at times we were crying we were laughing so hard from silly pictures and guesses in this game. If you have a competitive family and often have individuals leave or quit because someone is "cheating" or thinks it's "not fair" then this is the game for you! Because each turn builds off the person to your right, there is no pressure, no competition, and no down side. The worse you can draw, the better it gets! Play a round or two if you don't have much time, or go round and round for hours!! The only complaint I would make is that the 10 year old didn't always understand the word she got, but even so, she could pick another card. My niece brought it to her friends house to play and the fun continued on and on....

I purchased this after playing it with several co-workers. It's honestly a great game that works well with a wide variety of people. The instructions are fairly easy and the fun is looking to see how people interpret your original drawing. It's best played with a large group of people, as the more drawings and interpretations you have, the wilder and crazier the guesses can get. You can play it with less, although it can sometimes be hard to keep up depending on the crowd (and amount of drinks). It's also easy to get people excited in the game - I played this while on vacation with my boyfriend's family. I only had about six people playing the first night, but we had so much fun that people came over to watch and during the second night we had eight. We had a child playing with us that was about seven years old and although we had to help him with spelling, he absolutely loved playing because it's something he can play with adults that isn't an out and out kid's game.My only quibble with the game has to be with its point system - it seems to be fairly complicated, enough so that I've never bothered to use it nor have others that I've played with. It's much more fun to just pass around the books and compare everything once it's done. The pads and pens are OK - one of my pens was dry when I received it, but that's kind of par for the course with anything that comes with markers and has the potential to sit around for months in a warehouse. You can use most dry erase markers with this, so it's easy to replace.

review_title: A must-have for your party game collection
review_description: This is one of those games that I frankly couldn't understand what the big deal was the first time I was set to play it.  I have played many party games over the course of many years and I'm generally not a fan of the "drawing" games, so I was prepared to just grin and bear it.By the time I was done with my first game, I was crying from laughing so hard.  This is a great "we're laughing with you" experience.  Sure, winning is great, but honestly, everybody is a winner in this game because it's just so darn entertaining.  This is a wonderful game for getting people to let their guard down a bit, and if you have kids that are focused on whether or not they are winning or losing, this is a game that will help them see you can just have fun.  And yes, kids love this game. It is as kid-friendly as the group of players is.I can describe this as the old children's game "Telephone", with a drawing twist.  But that is a serious undersell.  It doesn't sound like it would be that entertaining, but trust me it is!This is sold in 6, 8 and 12 player editions.  I would suggest that you decide which one to get the same way you buy a tent.  Get it a little bigger than you think you need it.  Once it becomes known in your playing circle, you will have no problem getting everyone to play.

This game is so much fun! It's a combination of the old telephone game and pictionary. Each player has a dry erase marker and pad and every round a word or phrase is picked from a card drawn. You then sketch the word/phrase and pass the pad to the next player. They in turn guess what is drawn. After guessing the pad is passed again and the next player has to draw what was guessed. This continues until the pad arrives back at the original owner. At that point you go through the sequence from the beginning to the end. It is amazing how the word/phrase changes as it makes it's rounds. Wonderful belly laughs for all. This is a great family game and can be played by all age groups.

review_title: Fantastic game for adults and kids...
review_description: We just love this game.  Played it first with adults at a party.  Had a ball.  Thought my grandkids would like it.  They are getting older and it is hard to get them to play board games anymore.  We had three of them over for a sleepover, ages 15, 12, and 8.  They loved the game and we played it for quite a large part of the evening.  They got up the next morning and asked to play it again.  Had some wonderful family time, which gets more difficult the older they get. They are coming for Thanksgiving with their parents and want to play again with them.  Yay!

My family was introduced to this game through a friend, with whom we played this game. We enjoyed it so much that we got one for ourselves. The game is a combination is a combo of pictionary and telephone. It is very easy to play and it brings a lot of laughter, joy, shock and makes the bonding time/family time great. I did not see my dad laughing as hard as he did while playing this game in a very long time! I will definitely recommend buying this game because it lightens up the environment and provides a quality laughter time with your friends and family. Also, for any small team event, I would consider adding this game as an ice breaking game.The game comes with all the necessary items that you need to play the game with, and even if you run out of any of of the items, you can purchase it easily from a departmental store, such as markers, sand timer, dice, etc.I use a marker cleaner instead of the cleaning cloth provided for keeping the dry-erase surface clean and in-tact. I plan on using the cards from other games such as taboo to incorporate variety in words, once we play this game plenty of times to be able to guess the card words. Also, I noticed that they have a "after the dark" edition as well, which should be fun too!! Have lots of fun playing this game!!

review_title: One of the most fun games I've ever played despite some quality issues
review_description: This will leave you in tears of laughter. It's the best game to come along in I don't know how long. Play is simple, and no matter how good or poor an artist players are, if they can scribble on paper, practically anyone in your group can get involved regardless of age. It is appropriate for all ages in that it is clean, but the very youngest children will probably not often  understand the word or phrase they will have to draw if you're thinking of including them. I think children as young as 8 are able to play without it being too challenging; if they get a word they don't understand, tell them to choose one of the words the know. There are some issues with the low quality dry erase markers and the tiny microfiber cloths each person receives to wipe their book clean. If you leave the cap off too long, say during one complete round of play, the marker tip dries up a bit and won't draw. I made the mistake of putting the cap on and giving it a couple of shakes only to have virtually all the ink become deposited in the cap, making a terrible black, inky mess that resulted in throwing out the pen. You'd think they could include higher quality marking pens for what the game costs. Go ahead and purchase some decent quality dry erase markers to keep with your game and throw the original ones out. Don't bother using the tiny cleaning cloths. They will quickly become covered in dried marker residue and not be very effective. Have a box of plain tissue on hand instead. Make sure all the pages in each booklet are erased before putting the game away or the marks will be very difficult to remove and leave behind a faint stain. We only use the timer if there is anyone being a meticulous artist and repeatedly holding up game play. If all the contents of the box were better quality, I would have rated it better for value, but as it stands, the game only gets its material value from the cards and booklets. I still highly recommend this game, though, because it is hilariously fun to play!

review_title: Just what modern time need....pure simple creative fun.
review_description: Simple game to learn and play. Great family friendly game for 4 40 somethings and 2 teens for game nights.  Took a gamble for this for our Christmas gift as an investment with the friends and was not disappointed.  a clue like sportscar that ends up as UFO watching  or spermwhale that ends up as..... well the old story about  a whale named Moby can cause some serious hysterical moments with plenty of tears from laughter.I always thought the old game it was based off of was stupid but knew no one in our families could draw so it would be a fun twist.  would recommend to others.

review_title: An Awesome Twist on the Telephone Game
review_description: Telestrations is so much fun - the bigger the group the better. This game works best when you have 8 or close to 8 players, just because of how the rotation is set up. The game consists of 8 dry-erase drawing tablets and markers, and a set of double-sided playing cards. Each player chooses a card so that they know what word or phrase they are starting with. You draw the item, then pass your tablet to the next person. They guess what you drew, then pass it on. They draw the guess, then pass it on. And so forth until it gets back to you, and you can see how far from your original word that the guesses traveled. This isn't set up as a competition game, but rather a cooperative game. So there isn't a winner, but it is an absolute blast to play. We played with ages ranging from 8 years old to 72, and everyone loved it. It's a nice break from fierce competition on game night, and a fun way to spend time with family.

review_title: Best party game I've played yet, but the markers tend to die fast so make sure you have extras on hand.
review_description: One of the best party games out there, especially if you have a "darker" or more adult mindset, though that's not at all necessary to find the laughs and fun in this game. The only complaint is that the markers wear out somewhat fast and are a bit too thick, creating sloppy artwork and making any sort of small detail-work overly difficult, which is unnecessary in a timed situation, which is how this game is played anyway. I keep having to buy dry erase markers from the 99Cents Store to replace the ones in this box.

review_title: Fun for the whole family (including teens and young adults)
review_description: We learned about this game from cousins - huge game nights with a range of kids through 20-somethings. Everyone is laughing. For some, puzzling out it more fun than the drawing, but it's great to see all the varieties of thought. We got this and immediately played it out of the box - two families - adults and teens. Everyone gets a card and according to a die roll you get an assigned word or term. Depending on the number of players you either illustrate that term, or pass it one. You continue passing the booklets around only looking at the last drawing or guess at the term before you take a guess or draw from the previous guessed term. This is the game "telephone" but done in drawings and guesses at the drawings. Once your little book makes it around back to you, each person shares what happened with their word. It's exciting when the group stays close to the term, like "playground" and funny when it goes way off track..."bat cave" to Halloween.

review_title: Most Popular Game at our Family Parties
review_description: Tons of fun. This game is easy to learn and produces endless laughs. It can be played with formal scoring, or just draw pics and have fun. That's what we did. Everyone loved it.You're given a word. Draw a picture to describe the word. Pass the tablet to the next person. They have to guess the word based only on what was drawn. They write that word and pass it to the next person who has to draw that word, and so on. By the time it goes around the table, you'll be on the floor laughing at how far off the guesses and pictures have become and seeing where things went horribly wrong. Easy and fun. Booklet pages are whiteboard coated for use over and over. Comes with markers. I'd recommend cleaning with whiteboard cleaner before they go back in the box so they don't stain.

If  Pictionary had a baby with the telephone game, you get Telestrations. No drawing skills necessary. Using dry erase markers  levels the playing field for both artists and non-artists alike. The box says for age 12 and up, but if you can read you can definitely play this game. My 7 and 10yr olds love playing this game.You will definitely want to use the wipe cloths provided to clean the books every time, otherwise the piles from your fingers will ruin the markers. We learned that one the hard way. And if you forget to wipe out the whole book baby wipes work just fine, just make sure the pages are dry before writing on them.This is, now, one of my family’s favorite games. It makes us laugh so hard that our belly hurts afterwards.

review_title: A Game to make you pee yourself laughing!
review_description: This is one of our friends and family’s favorite games. No one really cares who wins because it’s really just laughing so hard you cry! I didn’t think we’ve ever played this game without crying laughing. It’s definitely better if you have a lot of people playing so we bought the extra game pads but funny with even 6 people. It’s like playing a drawing version of telephone if you played telephone with someone who barely knew who to speak English! When people here a drawing game they get scared and I always tell them the game is so much more fun if you can’t draw!

I saw this game when a friend posted a picture on instagram playing it. I was immediately intrigued and came to Amazon to read reviews and promptly knew I needed this game. We have so much fun playing this game! We all laugh so much we are in pain every time we play it.  I definitely recommend getting the 8 player version. In most stores you can only buy 6 player but the extra couple players can really make a difference with the end result. My entire family enjoys this game so much I keep it in my car so that we can play it wherever we are. I even have several friends that have bought the game since I got it, and it is often a requested game to play. My 9 year old niece loves to play it so it is also a good game for kids, as long as they can read and have basic understanding of what things are. I only have two slight complaints. 1. The markers quickly dried out and I had to buy new ones. 2. The lamination on the books is not the best quality and is peeling a little. That being said I still absolutely love the game!

So since I bought this game we have played several times with different groups. Played at girls night out with the ladies, played at a family gathering. It's great for all ages, we had kids from six years of age to adults 70 years of age. Its super easy to play and not a lot of thinking involved. There's no score keeping (unless you want to) no beginning or stop time so you can play one round or 10. The more people the funnier it becomes. Think telephone and Pictionary all in one. It's our new family favorite and we bring it out for all group gatherings.

I wish I bought the 12 person version of this game, but it was released after I bought the 8 person. The best part of the game is at the end of the round going through all the pictures and guesses and making fun of your friends and family for their poor guessing and drawing skills. I do find that when mixed with alcohol people can have a REALLY hard time following the process. I find myself having to constantly direct people on what to do. Like "Flip the page, pass the book, read the words, now draw" etc. But that isnt the fault of the game, its my brain dead family of drunks that cant follow along.

My family loves this game! We have the 12-player version and have gifted this version several times. My mom had a stroke and is cognitively disabled, but she is able to play this game with us since it is so straight forward.This spiral-bound pads in this particular box were a little wonky. The holes for the spiral were punched with too much of a margin. There was too much of the paper inside the spiral so it was impossible to flip the pages. I took the spirals out and trimmed each page. Tedious but solved the problem.

review_title: Super fun to play and very easy to learn
review_description: This is a super fun game, and a perfect one to play when you are to "shelter in place." This is a very easy game to learn: directions are printed on the whiteboard booklets that are passed out to each player. Because this is based on Telephone, booklets are passed around as each player tries to guess the drawing. Laughs abound when the  original booklet is passed back to the original player. The only downside is that the markers do not last all that long, so plan on having extra white board markers in your cupboard.
