In the traditional game it's only on the end of the spokes.  This quickly made sense to us, because kids wouldn't be able to play for 2 hours.  Our game was about 35 minutes.All the kids wanted to play again the next night, so it's a win!

review_title: Perfect edition for a family with young kids
review_description: Whole family enjoys it, kids questions are a tiny bit hard for my 7 year old but he can get enough to make it a game.  10 year old and the grown-ups enjoy playing it as well.  We wanted a trivial pursuit game and this edition hit the spot.

review_title: Fun family game - kid questions a little hard
review_description: This is a great game to play with the entire family.  I got this for my 10 year-old niece for Christmas and we played with an 8 and 10 year-old and 4 adults.  It was really fun!  I only didn't give it 5 stars because some of the questions for kids were still too hard.  Some of the adults didn't even know the answers.  We started skipping some of the really hard questions so the kids didn't become frustrated.  However, everyone enjoyed the game.

This is a FUN game! I played trivial pursuit when I was a kid and could NEVER get any of the answers right so I bought it for Christmas for my kids and the questions for kids are so age appropriate! Adult questions are still tricky but this is a fun family game!

This was purchased as a gift for my sister and her family.  She has three kids, ages 7 to 13.  Her kids have all raved about the game, they love how it has different cards for the kids, although my 13 year old nephew always wins because he's the "oldest kid" and seems to have all the answers.  On game night this week, they decided he now has to use the adult cards.It's a great addition for family game night and I plan to buy it for my family as well.

I can play this trivia game with my young grandchildren- 8 and 10; and we all get the right level of difficulty for our age. Everybody comes away feeling smart and getting smarter. My only reservation is that we need more cards!

This is a fun family game in the style of regular Trivial Pursuit.  You can play this game as teams or individuals, and the concept is simple for younger kids to follow.  The game comes w/ adult level cards and kid level cards.  Though the instructions say to pick a level and stick to it, you can change the rules and play both if you'd like.  We have chosen to play as 2 teams and start w/ the adult level cards.  If the kids feel that the question is too difficult, we give them the option to choose a kid card instead.  Changing the rules a little has made this game very adaptable for younger kids and adults to enjoy.
All of these cards have been cut wrong. All the words at the end of the card are cut off and you can't read the full question.

Bought this for my Mom because she was substituting in a class with age groups from 9th-12th. She said it was way too easy for the older students, but great for the younger groups. It's family edition, so we were hoping some would be more challenging... but still a great way to keep a group of kids occupied while the teacher was out!

This is such a great game! I love that they have different cards for kids and adults. I think it keeps the game a little more even.  My 9yo son asks to play with myself and my husband at least once a week. Added bonus - I always learn something new each time we play!

review_title: Fun, faster paced Trivia Pursuit for the family
review_description: Bought this as a family gift for Christmas as my 10 year old son enjoys games and trivia. It is similar to the traditional Trivia Pursuit that I remember from my youth but it has been modified to speed up the game a bit. There are 2 sets of cards, adult and kids, although some of the kids questions are rather difficult. They do often have the answer given as multiple choice so that helps a bit. I do wish the sets had more cards to them because I could see getting through these quickly if the game is played frequently.

review_title: Such a great option for family game night!
review_description: This game is awesome.  its has kids questions and adult ones.  Although I'll admit I use the kid questions and my kid uses the adult ones lol.  We love to play this game and it teaches us at the same time.  Definitely recommend!

review_title: Not true to the Trivial Pursuit brand
review_description: I love Trivial Pursuit I was so excited to purchase this to play with my son. I have always loved the challenge of the game. The kids cards are too hard for any child under 12 and the adult cards are ridiculously easy. This is not what a true Trivial Pursuit fan would enjoy.

I bought this as a game for my 14 year old son, 11year old son, husband and I could all play. This was the perfect choice! It was fun and easy to play and learn. The questions were relevant for adults and kids and it was just a good game

The questions are up-to-date. Many of them give multiple choice answers to choose from. This may be good for younger kids, but too easy for adults. You could always agree to forgo the answer choices for the adults though.

review_title: Too easy for everyone in the family
review_description: Sadly this was too easy for the kids and adults. All the questions seemed to be on the same level and the kids got bored because it was too easy. We went back to playing our version from 1980. It is really hard for the kids, but they like it better!

Fantastic family game!  I love playing games as a family - so much better than sitting around watching tv.  Follow the age guidelines though - the kid questions were definitely above the heads of my younger ones.

We had a blast with this. I have always loved Trivial Pursuit however the rest of my family never could get the questions. With this version, the whole family can enjoy. It is also a wonderful addition to homeschooling.

review_title: For most ages.. fun and fast.
review_description: Fun game but we have burned through all the cards already. Unfortunate, that they don’t have an additional pack available. We use different cards from other trivia games because we have all ages in the house and it works well. Otherwise, you end up giving hints to the younger players 😝

review_title: Great for my kids and helping build confidence
review_description: I love playing trivial pursuit and have enjoyed having my kids be able to answer questions that aren’t so intimidating. Now that they aren’t so intimidated by the questions they answer many of the adult questions.

I love Trivial Pursuit and the fact that I can now play with the whole family is great. The age appropriate questions are truly so. And I love that my kids are getting to use their brains and have fun

review_title: An Amazing Update Over the Original
review_description: Dominion had me hooked when I first played it. It is an incredible and fun game. After 8-years, the designer has gone back and removed some of the weaker cards. By replacing these cards Dominion is even more enjoyable than it already was. Someone new to the game should start here with this Second Edition. The removed cards really won't be missed and what is added really improves things.In addition to removing and adding cards, the treasures and victory cards now have artwork which is awesome. There is a trash mat to put your trashed cards on. Cards have improved wordings to avoid confusion. The rule book has been revamped and is easier to understand. Also, instances of he, his, him, etc. have all been replaced with the gender neutral "their."As a huge Dominion fan, I can't recommend this second edition enough to someone planning on giving this game a try. And, hey, if you have all the expansions, there is even a separate upgrade pack you can buy with the 7 new cards. So, you don't have to buy the game all over again.

review_title: Good improvements to a great game!
review_description: Dominion is one of my favorite games! I have played literally hundreds of games of Dominion and still find it to be very enjoyable.I am happy to see this second edition as it demonstrates that demand for this game is still pretty high, and the changes they made in this edition all seem to make good sense.Especially if you don't plan to get any expansions, I think the new edition will stand on its own even better than the original.CHANGES IN THIS SECOND EDITION1) 6 Kingdom Cards (sets of 10) from the original edition have been removed (Adventurer, Chancellor, Feast, Spy, Thief, Woodcutter)2) 7 NEW Kingdom Cards have been added (Artisan, Bandit, Harbinger, Merchant, Poacher, Sentry, Vassal)3) Artwork on the "base cards" has been updated (Copper, Silver, Gold, Estate, Dutchy, Province, Curse).4) The Rulebook contains some clarifications and wording improvements.5) Some of the original Kingdom cards have been reworded to be more clear and precise. (Three cards received minor functional errata: "You may" has been added to Moneylender, Mine, and Throne Room)While I'm sad to see Adventurer and Thief removed in particular, the new cards are fun and I am looking forward to playing more games with them. (Of course, since I still have the originals, I'll still be mixing them in at home anyway :) )I think the new base card artwork looks nice, and is an improvement from both the original edition and the current "Dominion Base Cards" set. (Rio Grande Games has said that future printings of the "Base Cards" set will use this second ed. artwork)You can see the new rulebook and card text on RGG's websiteAlso, if you have an original edition and only want the 7 new Kingdom Cards, there is an "Upgrade Pack" available that contains only the new cards. I thought that was a pretty great thing for RGG to do, as it basically gives original owners a bonus "mini expansion".

review_title: I own almost all the Dominion stuff, should I buy this too?
review_description: You should know a couple of things about me:I have all the previously released Dominion games and expansions.  Including the promo cards.  The only thing I am missing is the "Base Cards" set.I wondered, like many of you, is it worth it to get this after having all the rest?  Well, I think yes.  The base card artwork has the best of both worlds in my opinion.  Nicer pictures/designs but still has the large numbers printed on them.  This is what kept me from the "Base Card" set.  Where the copper had a nice picture of copper coins, but no giant 1.  This adds those on top of the coin art.  A nice touch.  The new kingdom cards should be great.  Realistically, once you have as many cards as are available across all editions, I don't think 7 more is going to make or break the whole experience.  But they do seem interesting to play with.The trash "mat" is a bit of a disappointment. I'm a type A person, and didn't mind the trash card.  The mat is a thin cardboard type, but much thinner at first look than the mats in Seaside or Adventures.  The edges of the mat stick up a little bit at the top and it doesn't lay flat.However, the cards are nice and flat.  My set of Adventures is a disaster.  The cards bow so badly they barely fit in the tray.  The rest of my card sets are fine and this is no exception.  The printing on the cards seems to be a little more refined and better color than my other Dominion set.  I purchased the first edition last November, so it's not all that old.As for packaging, some of my Dominion sets came with some crazy damage to the plastic tray and inlay cards.  The inlay card for this set was in the rule booklet, so no damage there.  The card packs bounced around some and ripped and dented the tray a bit, but it should still hold the cards. I do like how the inlay card was protected.  A couple of my other expansions had the inlay card damaged and ripped to the point that some serious tape was needed to keep it somewhat whole.If you already own the 1st edition would I recommend this set?  If you were going to buy the upgrade pack, I would say just get this whole set.  You will get the Trash mat (kind of cool, see issues above) and the new base cards (very nice as noted above, and those can wear out a bit since you use them every game).  You also get the rule book.  Which is NOT included in the upgrade pack.  Also, then you have the clarified wording on a couple of cards, which I don't think matters much, until it matters in a game against an 11 year old.  If you are worried about the duplication of much of the game, take out the discontinued cards, keep them for yourself for posterity, and give the rest of the game away to someone to introduce them to the game.I don't share this view on the Intrigue upgrade.  I don't think it worth it to replace the whole box there.  Just get the upgrade pack and deal with the missing rulebook.  But this one, I think it's worth it.I didn't get paid for my review, I paid full price for this and all my Dominion games and cards and enjoy playing them with my son.  Also, I think this is my first review on Amazon, but wanted to help my fellow gamers out on this one, since the game is familiar, and there is some information out there, but maybe not quite enough.

This is the best deck building game EVER!!I am in my 20's and have only recently been introduced to deck building games, and instantly fell in love.DOminion and the DC Comic deck games are my favorite, but Dominion provides a larger variety because the cards used change.The game its self comes with several possible versions of the game.For example, the game is plaid with several action card decks to draw from, but Dominion comes with twice as many action cards. So, no game is exactly alike. The rule book comes with various options of which action cards to play with for certain kinds of games.This game is dynamic!I first played Dominion at a bar with board games. After a few times I fell in love and bought this second edition. The cards are beautiful, more colorful than the first edition. (I attached some photos to see to see the cards)It says that the game can be played in about 30 minutes... for me it takes closer to an hour with 3 players. It also probably depends on what type of game you play (which actions cards to choose to play with) But because we are still learning, maybe we go a little slower, constantly re reading what the action cards say/do.At the end of the game, who ever has the most victory points wins.

Dominion may have its haters, but I am not one.  This is an EXCELLENT game if you are a new gamer, new to deck building, or just want something a little lighter (but still thinky) to play.  The lightly medieval theme can be a plus when you're playing with people who don't like fantasy, sci-fi, etc.  (Those people can be very hard to please.)  With the variety of cards available, you can tailor the game to your audience and always keep things fresh.  Want a lot of interaction and back-stabbing?  Play with Witches and Militia and other attack cards.  Want a peaceful game?  Play without attack cards.  Want a longer game that encourages people to build up a huge deck?  Play with Gardens!The possibilities are seemingly endless, especially if you add in expansions.  The game in itself is fairly easy to teach if people can remember A-B-C-D.  You play an Action (one only), then Buy one card, then Cleanup and Deal your next hand.  If you're lucky, you'll play cards that give you +1 Action or +1 Buy, allowing you to play more actions or buy more than one card.  The order in which you play your action cards can require strategy, as you want to ensure that you can play as many of them as possible each hand.  New players may need to reveal their hand for their first few rounds to get advice, but they usually catch on pretty quickly.

review_title: Great 2 player game, very replayable, not hard to teach.
review_description: This is the best two person game I've played since Splendor. (Also great with up to 4 people, but who am I kidding. I'm not that social.) I love that there are a billion expansions should we get sick of the set of cards that comes with this base set, but with the ability to change out action cards to make the game different every time, I'm still not craving new cards after about 30 runs.It's also easy to share this game with friends. Even those non-hardcore board game friends will pick it up relatively fast. The only downside is how intense the game setup looks, it can scare people off to see 16 piles of cards covered in text on the table.

review_title: BEST GAME EVER!!!  Brilliant! Fun! Good for 2, 3 or 4 with equal amount of fun
review_description: We just can't play enough of Dominion!!!!I don't understand why it's not the number one game all around.It is BRILLIANTLY thought through.The card storage: brilliant!The combinations of game cards sets so you can play what seems a different game every time: brilliant!The game mechanics:  brilliant!The complexity level:  just perfect!!  Not a dumb game, but not one where you need hours of learning before you can play... a new player can be up and going in < 5min instructions and fully in the game, playing, trying strategies, fully immersed and enjoying it from the very first game!Card artwork:  very nice!Balance of strategy and luck:  perfect!Good to play with 2 player:  VERY GOODGood to play with 3-4 players:  VERY GOOD!Good for adults:  Amazing!Good for 12 years old kid:  Amazing!The fact that there are 8+ optional add-on sets of cards that you can get, making this game a seemingly ENDLESS sets of combinations which makes the game feel like a new game every time.  The mechanics remain the same but the cards and their values and attributes can be different depending on what set of card you use to play.I can't recommend this game enough!Background:  We are a gaming family.Our best games this year have been:  (we got many many more but these are the very best).And now, Dominion is probably at the top of our list!  Raiders of the north sea  Azul  SplendorEnjoy!

review_title: What a fun game. Never-ending play possibilities
review_description: What a fun game.  Never-ending play possibilities.  I made "placemats" with "A" (action), "B" (Buy), and "C" (Clean up) spaces.  I also added "D" (discard).  And I drew a space for the "deck".  This made it easier to keep everything in order as we learned the game.  After we learned how to play we don't need the placemats but we still use them.  Our friends enjoy this game also and we play it again and again.  It did take a little time to learn it, but once you play it once, you'll enjoy it so much more after.  Follow the suggested layouts first to get the hang of it before playing random layouts.  This game is just awesome.  Take the time to learn it and it will become a favorite.  Not for small children although my 8 year old grandson plays it ok with just a little help.  I would say 10 and up would be more appropriate.

review_title: In Pandemic times, this is a great family game
review_description: In Pandemic times, this is one of the best "family" games. I taught my 8 year old and he was able to understand the simple game mechanic (it has been used in many, many other games, e.g. Marvel Legendary). It's a short game, that kids like and is challenging enough with enough variation that it won't be the same (especially with changing the cards). Only caveats with playing with kids is 1) they have trouble shuffling, 2) cards will get sticky. The rules of the game are simple, but the font and directions in the rule book are harder to read. (Compared to other similar games). I suggest you watch a video on how to play. There are an insane amount of of expansions. I suggest Prosperity, because kids like playing with lots of money. Enjoy!

review_title: Great game; excellent replay value; easy to learn, moderate to master.
review_description: I am a moderately serious board gamer and have a monthly group at home (serious) and a weekly lunch group at work (somewhat casual). The first time I played this I immediately purchased a set for myself and have regularly played it. It's pretty easy for new people to pick up, although they're unlikely to win until they've played a few times to understand useful strategies. The ability to pick a set of cards each time you play gives it a really high replay ability, and you can tweak the sets to get your favorite balance. Tons of great expansions. If you pick cards that don't have any inter-player effects you can finish a game in under an hour, which means this is part of the rotation for my lunchtime game group at work. Even with a bigger group and inter-player interaction cards it will definitely finish in under 2 hours; we frequently play two rounds with different sets of cards. It also travels well because you can pick out a set and leave the box at home.

review_title: A great game that everyone can play!
review_description: We have gifted this game more than any other. We routinely give this to friends particularly friends with kids. We have taught kids as young as 9 and adults as old as 85. The game is easy to set up with no complicated board, rules and pieces. It can easily be taught while people play which alleviates boredom and short attention span problems. There are multiple possible choices of games which makes it great choice for an evening or a complete family vacation. And play moves fairly quickly with most games ending in 30-60 minutes. Everyone loves this game. People learn the game and the basic big money strategy quickly. We often give people expansions as well with Prosperity and the duration cards from Seaside being favorites. I highly recommend this game.

review_title: This is a GREAT card game
review_description: This is a GREAT card game. Very fun. Its very difficult to find a good game - either board or card - that my wife enjoys playing however she really enjoyed this!Works great as a 2 player or a 4 player game. This is not a "long" game and as a 2 player you can get through this in maybe 20 minutes? As a 4 player maybe 30-45?That is always what tripped me up, I would strategy around a long term game and card combos and now we have played 20+ times and my wife has won almost all of them.This is a good one, Id recommend it to people who like "strategy" games mixed with a faster paced card game. Glad I bought this!

review_title: Great game, excellent design, will want expansions quickly
review_description: This game was very easy to learn, especially for someone familiar with deck builders, but good for beginners too. The game is balanced, well designed, and the packaging is excellent. My friends and I really enjoy the game, and it quickly became one of our favorites, but the number of combinations of cards is a bit limited in the base game, so it didn't take us long to feel like we needed the expansions to keep the game interesting. That said, we'll definitely be buying the expansions and continue to enjoy the game.

review_title: High quality game with good improvements from the first edition
review_description: This is a fun game that is very modular, it can change a lot from game to game.  It can be a bit hard to learn a deck-building game if you have never played one, but this is pretty approachable entry level game.Die hard fans may complain about the new edition removing some of the old cards, but the old edition always had about 6-8 cards that none of my friends ever played with because they just bogged down your deck and didn't add much to the game.  The cards in the second edition are mostly the same, but several of the low-utility cards have been replaced with more versatile cards.

review_title: For the newbie and the pro gamer
review_description: Bought this for my partner who is a big gamer...all the games! This has become his new favorite game.I on the other hand am not a gamer and I love it. It was easy and quick to learn. It helps that for once it's a game I stand a decent chance of beating my partner at!There are multiple ways the game can be played so you won't get board of this game after 1 or 2 rounds. I enjoy the "random" game which makes it even easy not to get board of this game.

review_title: Great strategy game kids and adults can play
review_description: We love this game! We really enjoy strategy games and think falls into that category. It does require flat table space. But it can work for a wide range of ages. We play with our 9yo and he gets it and keeps us with us just fine. Great thinking game. Could team up with younger ones if they struggled but it's not that hard. It's just too win you've got to out strategize the others, and have a bit of luck, as there is some chance involved. It ranks up there with Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride, 7 Wonders, and such. Great game.

I thought this was a marital aid. Turns out it's a card game. A super-fun card game, but careful: If you're stuck in your panic room with your spouse, best to limit it to a game a day. We were on an average of fourteen games a day, and let me tell you, it's hard to respect your intimate partner after ninety-five back to back games of Dominion, especially if you only stop to sleep, phone the police and frantically negotiate with the team of international jewel thieves laying siege to your panic room while they try to get you to give up the combination to your jewel safe.Great game, though. GREAT game.

review_title: Dominion is actually a fun game
review_description: Dominion switched to their website from Tabletop simulator removing it from the game entirely.Now you have to use their junky website and some sort of subscription based garbage.  An hour of frustration later trying their new site and we're back to using the actual board game in person.

review_title: Quick games and appropriate for two people - perfect for date night in!
review_description: This was a Christmas gift from my parents. A very fun game and one of my favorites of the genre because it can be played by only two people, so my husband and I can play a quick game just the two of us whenever we want. Generally games can go fast so you have  the chance to play several times in any evening but every once in a while you’ll get stuck with a set of cards that makes for a never-ending game. We’vd Played several of the expansion packs too and love how they really do add variety to the game.

review_title: Surprise! 62 years old and I love this game!
review_description: My son got the first edition for my daughter (adults - 30 & 28, respectively). We like intelligent games and just-pass-the-time games. This game met ALL our likes, along with being able to change the game because of all the option cards.  It's a little complicated to figure out at first, but there are LOTS of YouTube videos that help one get started.  This second edition has some common cards with the first edition, but also has many that are a complement to the first with some additional strategy ideas. It also has MUCH better instructions. Anyway, when we all get together, it is something we almost always play!

review_title: Fun game and complexity can be adjusted
review_description: This is a fun game.  It takes a bit of effort to learn and it's best to play it with someone who knows what they're doing and you'll get the hang of it quickly.  There are quite a few cards to manage throughout the game and you can adjust just how complex you want to make it when you play by adding or removing different sets of cards.  It's less complicated and more fun than games like 7 Wonders.

We had played this before and really enjoyed it so we decided to invest in our own and it has been great. We taught up to 6 family members who had never played how to play and they loved it so much they went and bought there own. When we played it we never stopped at one round of the game but played up to three a night. The rounds don’t take forever. Going to be buying an expansion pack or two

I played this game one weekend with my mother-in-law and she became hooked. It's really competitive, very fast-paced, and nothing beats stringing together a series of card combos (on the flipside it sucks when an opponent does that haha).If you don't want to devote 1+ hours to a board game then this is the game to pick. It's a deck-building game and since there are a near infinite amount of card combinations, you don't have to play the same game twice. It's customizable and you're able to attune it to your group's need.Worth every penny.

Pros: High replay-ability due to the many different game set-ups which are possible.  Easy to teach.Cons: I don't like the artwork.  It has some cards with abilities that I do not ever like to play with.Final thoughts: If you love deck-builders, this is a must-add to your collection.  If you're trying to figure out which deck-builder you'd like to try first, I suggest Star Realms (my favorite game) or Ascension.

My family is just learning to play Dominion, and we are having a really good time together. The game is easy to set up, and it goes by fast, and it's fun trying to learn how to make a strategy out of each new configuration of cards. I would buy this again for my family, and I would also give it as a gift.

review_title: Well rounded game with near endless replayability
review_description: The game is designed to be replayed indefinitely. It has the mechanics of a deck builder with the conscious strategy of some other very robust economy games. That being said, it's still remarkably easy to learn, and once you are at the table with people who are familiar with the flow of the game, start to finish is normally no longer than about a half hour. Overall, this has become one of my favorite games of the past five years.

We played this game and loved it so got it for my bro who loves new games too and it was a big hit with him and the family. Depending on the kids age and comprehension, kids 9 and up could play. Love how the game can be different every time with the many different card options and with the option to buy more. It’s easy enough to understand to have fun the first time you play. Not certain on how the directions read because our friends explained it to us. It is a lengthy game and I believe without the expansion packs only 4 players which is a bummer for our big family- but teams make it more inclusive. Definitely a great buy!

First off: this is not a collectable card game. Everyone has access to the same supply of cards; it's what you choose during the game that makes you stand out. I've always been intimidated by the collectable nature of these kinds of games, so to get a complete set and get to play one was a great experience. And we've  kept returning to it, since we started playing in March. Fun game and easy for the kids (and wife) to pick up.

review_title: Fun game, product quality could use some work.
review_description: This is an excellent game, but I'll use my review to talk about the construction quality.# Pros #* High quality outer shell on box.* Cards are well made, thick cardstock. They can take a lot of abuse.# Cons #* Card wrapping is poor, a couple of the decks were already partially unwrapped in the box, causing them to acquire some scuffs on the edges during the UPS ride.* Inner plastic molding designed to hold the cards is cheap. It was bent and broken in several places, but manages to do its job after I bent some edges back to their original place. I'll probably be looking for something else to store the cards in.

review_title: Great game and fun for everyone.
review_description: Love this game, it is one of the best Deck Building games on the market that I have played. This edition is great for starting players with Dominion as it has everything you need to start building your collection. So far my wife and I love it and cant wait to get the rest of the expansions going forward. Beware if you or the people you play games with are competitive it can ruin friendships to be sure.

review_title: My wife and I love board games
review_description: My wife and I love board games, and decided to give Dominion a shot (after playing a few times way back in college).We really like that you can use different strategies depending on which cards are in play. The game does feel a bit unbalanced when there are 4-5 people playing - the Province cards go way too fast and people tend to snowball.I have read that the expansions make the game even better, but would say that the original itself is super solid and has a lot of replayability.

Dominion is my favorite game. I love that you can play it with 2+ people. The rules are always changing. This base set was the first I purchased. I can't compare it to the first edition but I heard this one is better and I can definitely recommend it. I've since purchased two additional expansions, and will likely continue to purchase others.

review_title: Extremely fun, would recommend for new or veteran gamers!
review_description: My husband and I recently bought this game after reading several awesome reviews, and we absolutely love it!The premise is simple: you start off with a lousy hand, and then spend your currency to purchase useful cards that come back later in the game, so you are constantly thinking forward to how certain cards will help you in mid to late game. As well, the game goes rather quickly, so you can play two to three games in about an hour. The game comes with a lot of variability in drawing decks, so each time you play, you have to switch up your strategy!Overall, great game for two to four players!

This is a great game and a great revision. I have played both the 1st and 2nd editions and prefer the 2nd edition. I like the look of the cards in the second edition better and I like the new additions of cards that it comes with. To get enough cards for more than 4 players you will need to buy the base cards package. The Intrigue 2nd edition does not come with the extra base cards anymore, but is less expensive.

This game is great! It's easy to pick up as a beginner to deck-building games. I read the rules and was able to explain the game to my friends quite easily. Each card is simple to understand, but has so many good interactions with other cards. There are many different strategies you can do with a single starting layout, and many different starting layouts.One criticism I've heard is that it's like playing solitaire, but I disagree. Even without taking attack cards into account, you are competing with others for limited resources, and I know that the actions of the other players definitely influence my own actions.I've only played around 10 games, but I have a feeling I'll be playing this game for a while after this.

The box is arranged in a way that allows for quick set up.  At the end of a game, you just sort out the different cards and they are easily put away.The directions are good, but I suggest finding a YouTube video that explains how to play.  The game itself offers a variety of different action cards.  This makes each game different and must be played with a different strategy.  The variety also keeps the game fresh where some games get old or monotonous.

I bought this game for my fiance for Christmas. We're really into a game night, so I wanted something new to add to our shelf. After just one game, he said it's probably one of the most fun games he's ever played.Ready to play straight out of the box, the game takes some time to learn, and the cards are always different, so you do have to take a second before you play each time to review what each card can do, but the game is so versatile. We've played it with several other people who really liked it as well.If you want a game that you won't get tired of, this is a safe bet.

review_title: Anyone Can Learn This Great-Quality Card Game
review_description: This is easily one of the best card games I’ve ever played. The rules are straightforward to learn and it’s a great game for people who are new to the more “complex” genre of board games. What makes this game awesome is that the rules don’t take long to learn, but I’ve learned that strategies for playing are near endless. It is truly a fun experience to play this version of Dominion with both experienced and casual players. (The base game is really all you need to fully enjoy the experience, although I know the expansion packs can be a fun bonus)

Bought this for my son for Christmas and he really likes it. The whole family actually likes it. We've already played it 6 or 7 times this week. We like the fact that you can switch the cards you use every game so yo can really have a variety of different games depending on which cards you choose to use. It does take longer than 30 minutes however. Our games have lasted anywhere from an hour to an hour and a half, which is still reasonable. I'm not sure how other people are playing in 30 minutes? Regardless, it's a very fun game.

review_title: Great Game, Moderate Variation, Extremely Teachable
review_description: This is a great card game, with some appreciable variability that ensures entertainment for many plays. Easy enough to teach new players, but variable enough in strategy for seasoned players to find complexity in the strategies available. Can't wait to buy the extensions.

We LOVE playing Dominion, especially with expansion decks.  Fun to play with the family.  Games can be played quite quickly, so you can play several games in an evening and every game is different.  Strategy definitely comes into play as you have to buy action cards or victory cards and keep track of your opponents purchases.  Recommend playing it the first time with someone who has played before.

review_title: Really enjoyable game with good replay value
review_description: I played Dominion with a couple of friends, and I decided that I had to buy it for myself! There are enough ways to change things up that even after playing quite a few times, there's something new each game. I haven't gotten any of the expansions yet, and I could probably stay happy playing the base game for the foreseeable future.

This is one of my favorite games! I like that you can play with as few as 2 people. Kinda confusing to explain how to play but we always just walk anyone new through a round of two and everyone always gets it right away. I love how there is multiple ways the game can be played.

review_title: Perfect! Everything you need to start playing!
review_description: Love this game and such a fun easy game for two players. Set up is fun and learning what cards work really well together and am already deciding what expansion packs to get so we can play with more than 4 players!

review_title: Fun game, difficult to fit in box when sleeved
review_description: Great game. Perfect introduction to card collecting games for casual gamers, but with enough competitive vibe for advanced players.Only issue is that it impossible to fit all the cards into the box when sleeved. I leave a few coin cards out to fit everything.

review_title: Great game. Glad I took a chance on it.
review_description: I wanted a game to play with my friends that was similar to Magic the Gathering but without the expense of buying boosters and cards. This game is exactly what I was hoping it would be. Perfect for the adult that has a adult obligations restricting their time but still wants a strategy card game for game night with nerdy friends.

I borrowed this game from a friend for my wife and I to try it out and see if we liked it and wanted to buy it for ourselves! we love it! It is a great deck building game with close to infinite game combinations so it can be different everytime. This is also a great two player game! Get it already!

Dominion is an amazing deckbuilder. This is the first deckbuilder I have ever added to my collection and it opened me up to more. The game itself is easy to set up due to the organizer that comes in the box and is fun to play with 2 players and even more. The game could be quick depending on who plays and if someone knows which strategy they would like to follow. Easy to learn, easy to set up, fun to play, what's not to like?

review_title: Phenomenal Game for Nerds that played Magic...
review_description: The game is a great card stacker game. If you played magic or others. This is a expandable game that levels all players to the same chance and cards and strategy and luck to stack your deck to achieve victory points. This game manufacturer is awesome, I complained missing cards, they sent me what was missing and a bonus deck! No hoops just response and tracking. That is awesome!

review_title: The whole family loves this game.
review_description: My family and I love this game.  It was introduced to us thorough some friends, and now we all play together.  This particular copy we bought as a gift, for another friend who joined us and also loved the game.  Our daughter was about 8 when she started to play...she didn't get all the strategy at first, but she still really enjoyed it.  It takes a little bit of effort to learn how to play, like all games, it's better if someone teaches you while you play, but it's fun and varying each game.  Lots of fun.

This game makes for a nice change from regular Monopoly with the game being both team-based and focused on territorial control over pure wealth.Players form even teams and go around the board claiming free tiles, stealing them from other players, or locking them down by cementing control. Team members share money and properties. The game ends once all properties have been claimed and one team has the majority.The game itself goes pretty quickly with properties bouncing back and forth and having spaces that take a player to the nearest unclaimed spot. As players share resources, discussing strategy is important as to stop overextension (as running out of money can start a brutal chain reaction). Out first game stayed rather even to the end, with it ending with a score of 9-7, a llama victory.Where the game really fails is organization. The components include character pieces, dice, a property deck, 2 chance decks, a set of control tokens for each team, and some money (in two denominations, $100 and $500). To hold all this, you're given a basic bankers try for the standard monopoly game. This means besides the money, which only needs two of the slots, nothing fits right. And to further top it off, you can't keep it in the tray as the box is too short to allow the cards to remain upright in the slots, forcing a person to either throw everything together (either in the tray or loose in the box) or have a box that is unable to be closed all the way.

Super cute! You are divided up into teams. Instead of buying properties, it's most titles like "Most Fluffiest" to win game. The tokens are plastic Unicorn and Llama pieces in pastel colors. It's an Amazon exclusive so maybe that's why it's pricier than your average Monopoly board game and why I took away a star. Fun for young and young at heart!

Cute and colorful is the only good thing I have to say. This game is pretty confusing. We played 2 times and quit early both times. Adults and children were all very frustrated both times. We are a board game playing family. The rules need to be made CLEAR.
It was missing parts. My 7 year old was very upset when we tried to play it during family game night. Don’t purchase from this seller.
What’s not to like?

This is a really fun game. I'd say it's best for ages 7+ The were a few things that weren't explained well in the rules, but we were able to decide the rules ourselves and move on with the game.  Compared to original monopoly, game play is faster and more competitive, players are sorted into teams, and there were lots of laughs as chance cards include fun ways to get ahead or bring the opposing team down. We found that if teams aren't even there's a slight advantage to the team with fewer players, as their tokens will pass Go more frequently. I think next time we will modify by using the same number of game pieces per team and having the odd person out choose between the teammates tokens on their turn. Overall we enjoyed the game a lot and will definitely play often.

It’s kind of a weird version of monopoly. I mean, I’m not sure what I expected since it’s llamas vs unicorns. My daughter wanted it for Christmas so I (I mean Santa) got it for her. The game goes fast so I don’t feel like I have to pull my hair out trying to finish the game.The game ends when all the “properties” are bought. But the properties are properties like the original version, they are traits. Traits like “Coolest Room Decor” or “Most likely to Save the Day”. So you can “buy” and collect traits, but that also means you can take traits from other players. Each trait switches hands super fast. At first I didn’t like it because I kept thinking of them like properties from the original monopoly. But you just have to think of them as traits because that’s what they are. Think of them as the “Most likely to ...” from the high school year book. If you aren’t popular one week you’re not cool anymore and the next person gets the glory.

review_title: Not Regulation Sized Cheap Representation of Monopoly
review_description: I was disappointed in this product. It is not regulation sized. The player pieces are cheap plastic, and the 'hotels' are simply cardboard rectangles with pictures of rainbows. This may suffice for children ages 5-10, but certainly not for teens or adults. (Yes, even adults like llamas and unicorns).

review_title: Loves Unicorns and/or Llamas.... this game is for you!
review_description: My daughter is into both unicorns and llamas and was delighted to receive this game. We have played a few times so far. It is easy to learn. Similar, but different to monopoly. Such as you are not buying and then adding houses/hotels. You work with only two values of money versus the multiple in Monopoly. I like how it is simplified so children can be the banker and still keep things moving at a decent pace. Lots of opportunities to incorporate math and reading into play. Encourages team building when you have multiple players. Provides positive attributes and relatable content for purchasing such most huggable or best room decor. My son played, but at five he tired easily and had no interest in finishing.

The product box came damaged extensively in an undamaged Amazon box, which means it was damaged before shipping. It was “punched through” to the inside playing piece container. The game itself was not damaged. I used gorilla tape to fix the box so pieces wouldn’t get lost. The game play is fun for the kids. Kind of silly but hey it keeps them entertained. 2 stars for the careless nature in which I was sold this item.

This version of Monopoly is quicker than standard Monopoly and you're divided into teams. The team approach makes it easy for younger kids to get in on the Monopoly fun without having a clear understanding of the game. If they can roll a dice and count, they can play! The rules are a bit different than monopoly and money only comes in 100s and 500s. It is a simplified, but fun, version of Monopoly.

It's Monopoly! Daughter is pleased as peas, I mean, seriously, its Llamas AND Unicorns!Only thing we weren't aware of (our own fault for not reading more about it thinking it was, well, Monopoly) is it is team based. Not an issue but, wasn't expecting to kind of having to learn Monopoly a different way.Daughter loves it and already dragging her cousins from every corner during Christmas holiday to play.

I got this for my 5. -9 years old think that it would be like the good old monopoly with a little unicorn flair , however the way this particular game is set up it doesn’t help kids learn about money and/or real state. It’s useless as a learning game and it’s not even fun with the modifications made. Now I’m buying the older version of monopoly

review_title: Room for improvement but overall a light fun family game
review_description: We're all about the family games in our household, this one was added at Christmas for our 10 yr old children. The game play itself has some of the traditional Monopoly game play (chance, free parking, pass go, go to jail, etc) outside of that the game play is very different than the original, and much lighter (good for younger kids). The only reason I didn't give this game 5 stars is due to some of the rules not being clear (for example, one of the chance cards lets you move any player from the other team to the space you're on and they must follow the rules of that space... but it doesn't say what that looks like for Jail, if you're in jail and call someone to that place are they just visiting or do they go to jail with you?) Just a few little things like that - overall though, we had a lot of fun playing this light game as a family.
This was purchased for a birthday gift.  It arrived promptly and in excellent condition.  Recommend this for a child's present.
Box is totally smushed! This was a Christmas gift

We bought this game for our daughter and niece for Christmas. They both loved the game! We've played with them as well. Super easy to learn. It is a game that doesn't take too long to play as well. It was fun for the whole family. My daughter is 9, but my husband and I and my 16 year old daughter enjoyed playing it with her. Would definitely recommend.

It’s not quite the typical monopoly but still the same concept. We didn’t used to be able to play monopoly as a family because I would end up flipping over the table or throwing things (😂) but we haven’t had that issue with this game. My daughter just LOVES how adorable it is. I think it’s an amazing purchase for family game nights with little girls.

review_title: Difficult to learn and more of an icon game for older kids.
review_description: This game was pretty confusing. And NOT for an odd number of players because you don’t take turns around in a circle. There are two teams and you take turns by a llama player going then a unicorn player going. So odd number of players is weird. And it’s very difficult to get all the way around the board and you don’t start out with enough money to buy the trophy spots. Do not recommend for those under 8ish.

review_title: Most confusing rules and game is stagnates  nice
review_description: This game so confusing. You can play with just two players but it makes no sense. Best with 4+ players, however it still makes no sense. The team llama and team unicorn makes it difficult to understand how do you gain money? So weird to win. Tributes are not rent...not sure whats going on with this version. I am at a loss for words

review_title: Novel addition to family game night
review_description: I’m still not sure if we’re playing this exactly right, the directions could be written better, but it’s fun and cute for the kids. Nothing overly special about the bells and whistles, but it has enough added whimsy to give game night a bit of flair. Our whole family likes board games so it’s a nice, novel addition to our collection.

Positives; only need two players, lots of dumb jokes, llamas and unicorns, very colorful, and easy to play.Negatives; takes really long to play, kids get mad when their qualities get bought, and there's some serious trash talking going on with the chance cards that can make for sibling attitudes.

This was a Christmas gift for my 8 year old granddaughter.  She specifically asked for this one.  We have already played a couple of games.  What fun!!  It is not nearly long as the original Monopoly game.  It is basically short sweet & fun!!  I lost one and won one.  Easy to learn.  Fun to play.

I have  5 year old and 7 year old daughter, and they love this game! It was very easy for my 5 year old to learn, and it is helping my 7 year old build critical thinking and strengthen her adding skills. The game breaks you up into unicorns vs llamas, and we find it better to do one adult and one child per team. The game board is smaller (8x8 instead of 10x10) and it’s claims that the game ends when all spots are purchased, so it it a shorter game to keep the littles’ attention. Would definitely recommend for a household with kids

review_title: Research the Rules of the Game Before You Buy
review_description: Definitely not what we were expecting when we got this as a game for our family. Not the easiest to learn and follow which makes it not much fun. We ended up making up our own rules as we go. And it’s a good thing we did because if not the game would be sitting in the cabinet collecting dust.

Kids loved it, we were also able to play a faster game thanks to the teamwork and fact that the game ends when all places have been landed on instead of bankruptcy. Only complaint is that the colors are all similar and it can be a little harder visually for us older folk.

review_title: Would recommend, neat verson of monopoly
review_description: A bit pricey but the game pieces are indestructible metal and the game pieces are made of thick cardboard. Easy to learn to play as long as you read the directions as it is different from original monopoly. The game makes money easy by only having $500 and $100 bills. Is a combo of cooperative play AND competitive play.

review_title: Children’s version, terrible chemical odor after opening
review_description: Not a complete monopoly game, this is a children's version and is missing multiple aspects of classic monopoly such as railroads and utilities. Also only comes with $100 and $500 bills. Also reeks of chemicals for weeks after opening. Would not buy for children!

review_title: Fun, entertaining, and can be played in less than 30 minutes
review_description: This is a fun family game.  It's a quick game, but fun and something new to play.  We play an extended version if we feel like playing longer where the game ends when all spaces have three tokens on them (versus ending the game when the last space is "bought").  Definitely recommend!

review_title: cute game that requires team work
review_description: I like this version of monopoly. I purchased it for my 7 year old and it's very fun. I wish there was more denominations of money to make it more challenging, and it would be nice to have a team or individual player option. (Right now it's only teams). Overall 9/10.

This game is so fun to play! Easy to learn and play. I played with my little sisters age 8 14 and 16 and we all had lots of fun! This isn’t long like normal monopoly so it’s perfect for younger kids or people who hate the commitment monopoly takes!

We play this with my sons, ages 6 and 8, and we all love it.  Includes the aspects of Monopoly that make it fun, but it's way less complex and doesn't take hours to play.  A board game that kids and adults both sincerely enjoy is itself a rare unicorn - highly recommend!

Loved this game! It's a simplified version of Monopoly, but not so simple that we (age 44 & 50) didn't enjoy it.  Note: the unicorns and llamas play in teams,  so it's a good version for 2 people. Or 4 or 6, but 3 or 5 people would be unbalanced teams.

review_title: My 8 year old granddaughter loves it.
review_description: We have played on original Monopoly board with my granddaughter since she was 5. Of Course, relaxing the rules. She loves this Unicorns and Llamas game. We think Monopoly helps build strategy. And really like that she isn't in front of the TV

review_title: Llamas eat candy, Unicorns poop rainbows
review_description: This version is amazing. It’s a great bridge between Monopoly Jr., and regular Monopoly. It’s engaging AND doesn’t last forever! Plus who doesn’t love a little llama/ unicorn competition? Very cute family game.

My family loves Monopoly and we get all the different ones that come out. I gotta say this one might be the cutest one they have made!! My daughter who is 7 just fell in love with this game. If you're looking for a fun game to play with the whole family you should pick this one up.

We got this as a gift for my daughter who is obsewith llamas. Little did we know it would be a family fun time for all. Easy to follow directions, team play AND competition, positive messages... yup. Major win.  LOVE THIS.

review_title: It is one of the best purchases I have made for my family
review_description: I am a die hard classic Monopoly player, so I was a bit hesitant to purchase the Ultimate. It is one of the best purchases I have made for my family. We have played this almost every night since we got it a week or so ago. We love it!! Only wish more players could play at one time but other than that it's amazing!! The speed of this game gives you a chance to play multiple rounds. It's fast, fun and a nice change from the classic. Never thought I would ever say that!! Thanks for making our vacation that much more fun!!!

Love it. Colors are great, all the pieces were there and the directions are the same as regular monopoly with a few twists. Great game but should be for kids of 12 years or older, it is not as easy for younger kids to catch on.

review_title: More fun than I thought it would be
review_description: This game is so much fun. It is shorter than the original Monopoly and longer than Monopoly Jr. It had its own similarities to both the original and junior versions but with its own twist, too. You play as teams. Each team can be made up of only one person. We usually have the odd man out be the banker.
Pretty fun game.  The same basic gameplay as old-school Monopoly, but played with "teams" of Unicorns or Llamas.  Much quicker gameplay than regular Monopoly game, so kids shouldn't lose interest.

Awesome. Was fun for all the kids (2, 4, 6, 8) and not boring for mom. Instructions are super easy to follow, and the art is cute. 10/10, highly recommended. The only downside is that the kids want to play it multiple times per day!

review_title: Cute game, takes awhile to finish though!
review_description: Great game, super cute my 8 year old loves the idea of llamas vs unicorns!! It's basic Monopoly but I feel the introduction of the ability to take back properties makes the game go on FOREVER. Even more so than regular Monopoly. 🤣

review_title: Fun game for the whole family
review_description: My sons bought this game for their sister's 7th birthday. The three of them (10yo, 8yo & 7yo) have enjoyed playing together several times. The game is easy to learn, fun to play and appeals to my daughter's girly sensibilities.

I got this game as a Christmas gift for my daughter, thinking it was just a unicorn/llama version of normal monopoly. Completely wrong, it is such a strange version and is nothing like the normal game. Very confusing and not very much fun to play.
This is honestly the weirdest monopoly game I’ve ever played the rules are nothing like the original game not even close. My daughter played it once and hated it.
Very similar to Monopoly. Only you have types of unicorns and llamas rather than properties. Played all day with my 7 year old granddaughter who asked for it for Christmas. Such fun!

My granddaughter and I played this the other night and we had a blast...It is not like other Monopoly games at all, so know that going in bit my granddaughter, who is 9, and loves Monopoly games still loved this one...Younger kids could play this one easily, bit older kids can have fun too...
My granddaughter wanted this for Christmas and was thrilled when she opened it last night. When I called after getting home last night - they were playing it and having a ball!!
I ordered this as a gift for a 7YO granddaughter.  She enjoys playing the game and the 5YO sibling is able to play with a little help.  The adults enjoyed it also.

Its pretty small board and it doesn't come in a box like a board game. I am giving as a present and its a pretty lack luster presentation for a gift. If you are buying for yourself and just need a tiny board this is for you.I will probably return because of the presentation.
Cardboard pretty much. But for the price not bad. I like that I can paint/color the planchette.
small but good quality
This product is awful, it's a thin piece of wood with abad quality image on the front. It doesn't even come in a box and it feels really nasty and cheap. I will be returning, honestly don't bother.

It's a very pretty design, and still fully functional, however the presentation isn't that good. The design is quite blurry and low quality, and although I wouldn't mind keeping it, I personally would pay £3-£5, not £10!
This is awful it isn’t worth £10 don’t buy I could make it myself better ! I want my money back

review_title: very expensive for what it offers !!
review_description: I think it is Much over priced for what it containsFirst : very small box , with (folded and crumpled low quality map) from paper which even cannot be flat on ground by itself , we need some objects on the corners , the map has just numbers on it , no names or any geographical beneficial information , so it is a waste by itself , imagine a geographical game with bad MAP ?!!Second : most of the facts are useless and non important , what the benefit to you to know how many neighbor countries with Bhutan ? why you will Know how many meters is the highest point in Marshall islands ?!! why any one will learn such nonsense ?!!these are non beneficial facts , instead of giving informations about economy or touristic attractions , or famous people  or main language spoken or any thing useful , they give you ( highest point elevations , area ...?!!) just solid dumb facts that you can find better in google and never needs to memorize them or know them at allthe game itself contains some good points and some silly pointsthe main good thing about it , that it contains almost all countries !! and that's itSo if you want  flashcards about the world countries ( flag , capital , area ….etc ) , then here we go , you have it for such high price !!

review_title: Everyone wins from what they learn.
review_description: For first game with an 8 and 11 year old, I took out only the 22 North America cards.  We played with 7 cards each.Before starting, I did a quick overview - how many continents are there?  Can you name them (Oceania was less well known than Australia as continent name) ?  How many countries (wow - LOTS)?  Then looked at the 4 facts on each card, pointing out what M (million) and K (thousand) meant.  Looked over the map.  They were ready for the entire set by the end of the first small game.  We briefly looked at a map of the world that showed the names of all the countries.  Biggest take away for 8 year old - how really tiny countries can have enormous populations.  If I move to using the challenge facts, I'll start small again - beginning with North America.Their mother told me that night they couldn't stop talking about the game.  Everyone wins from what they learn.

review_title: Good, fun learning tool -- just add your own tweaks!
review_description: Our family recently purchased The World Game. This review reflects us (three adults) having played it several times.We'd say it's fun in a learning-is-fun kind of way. The cards are well made, and included with the set is a map of the world of good, sturdy paper.One of the nice things about the game is that you can modify play in a variety of ways. The rules as provided, while fine, need not limit how you want to approach learning about other countries. For instance, we initially began playing with a mix of cards representing countries from all over the globe...pretty challenging unless you're already good at geography, which we are not (yet)!So instead, we'll work on countries one continent at a time.But that's just one example of how you can do your own thing.Also, we've noticed that the game's creator listens to suggestions from players. He fulfilled the wish of one online commenter by sending a pdf of countries in alphabetical order with their corresponding numerical designation on the game's map. We got that list when we purchased the game. And actually, we made our own list too, arranging the countries in numerical order so we can immediately find the name of any country on the map. Another addition we intend to make on our spreadsheet is primary languages spoken (data we will obtain through our own research).So, obviously, there are lots of ways you can expand on The World Game if you like. It is a cool little learning tool.

I’m a huge geography nerd and wanted to try this game out to see if it could challenge me, and I absolutely loved it! It’s a great study and learning tool if you really want to refine your geography skill. The game itself is quite fun and I loved that you could play with pretty much anyone regardless of how good they were at geography with the use of game styles that can be altered per person, for example my gf is not good at geography so I would only ask her what continent the country was at, inversely I’m good at countries but am not so good at capital cities. Like this we had a very fair game where I was beat. Liked it a lot and would recommend it especially as a learning tool for geography teachers and professors. I would also say that they should have an expansion pack for physical geography and such, which would make the game even more challenging!

review_title: The geography flashcard set I was looking for
review_description: First, the product is solid. Great design, well-crafted, and sturdy. The cards themselves are durable and high quality, and the foldable map insert is designed well.Second, the game itself is fun and made such that you can play a 5 minute game or for hours. I've played it with my 9-year old nephew and my parents. You can make it as competitive as you want.But as a geography trivia nut, you don't need anyone else to play the game to enjoy it. The flash cards are just fun to flip through and quiz yourself. It's a great learning device and fits the bill as exactly what I was looking for.

review_title: Helpful supplement and fun for kids
review_description: I bought this game to supplement my middle schooler's understanding of geography and the larger world. She loves the Top Trumps card games so this was an easy sell even though it's "educational" and not just for fun. There are different ways to use the cards to help give your child a better sense of the world and geography. I've found the game to be a great jumping off point for conversations. She asks to play it so that's a good sign! I gave it four stars instead of five because it'd be nice if there was a bit more information about the nations on the cards. There were also a couple of errors with the numbering and the nation's they match up to on the world map.

review_title: What a great way to learn about the world
review_description: I bought this game for my 8 year old grandson.  He loves it!  I had to buy another copy for myself so that I can study and be able to play with him (and perhaps reawaken a few old brain cells).  We visited Temple Square in Salt Lake City, UT, where the young missionaries serving as guides all have a flag on their name tags showing where they are from.  My grandson was able to recognize all the flags...even Siberia!...and amazed us all.  Upon returning home I ordered a second set for myself.

Our family has found this to be a very informative game. I like the quality of the cards and map that comes with it. I recommend splitting up the continents first with younger children to not overwhelm them.

My 9 year old is hooked on geography. He loves these cards and its games. Cards of good quality. There are at least several ways to use these cards one of which is plain old flash card method. Each card shows flag of country, country name, capital city and country facts. Card info corresponds to a map included with purhcase. The games offered vary from a sort of "war card game" where a player chooses a fact they think will trump other player's cards to idenitifying country by flag, continent, etc.We paid 25 bucks, which is a bit steep in my book, but everything seems to be getting more expensive these days. As mentioned, product is of good quality and its hard to put a price tag on stirring a child's fascination to learn. In this respect, priceless.Highly recommend

If you want to introduce a level of entertainment to your household while actually learning something then I recommend this.  It was humbling to realize that I really didn't know my geography... until now.  This is a fun way to learn and to keep your mind active.  It's money well spent!

review_title: Decent game for teaching basic geography to kids
review_description: Simple game with cards representing all the world's countries. Definitely don't need to know tons about geography as you will learn as you go. But, the game is pretty simple and could be a lot more interesting if there were facts in addition to population, land mass, continent, highest elevation. It's fine for kids learning basic geography. Not sure it will hold most adults' attention for long.

Not enough built in aspects to make this game truly a learning experience. You can easily play a whole game without ever looking at the map.  A master list of numbered countries would also be helpful. Unfortunately, I doubt we will ever play this expensive game again.

This is one of the best educational board game!  I have bought it to my 11 years old son, to extend his geography knowledge and sense of the world. It really helps him to orientate on the map and have better understanding of countries location.It also gives knowledge about population of every country and flags. After playing a couple of times he can name the good number of countries by their flags.It is very good for adults too - you will refresh your internal geography  database and even learn something new.Pros:Very good polygraphic quality of every piece - cards, map, box.  The box is very solid - you won't break it even if you step on it. Every picture is very colorful and bright. Cards are thick and also look sturdy.The game itself is very interesting and enjoying. You gonna learn a lot playing any variant of the game.194 cards with flags, capitals, population, highest point and number of neighboring countries.Detailed, well marked colorful map for easier navigation.Cons:Nothing come up to my mind

review_title: Great learning game for any age!
review_description: This game is Awesome!  Basic game is like the game 'war' played with real cards, but the information on the cards makes it a challenge and takes strategy to learn the countries in play and how they relate to each other.  My daughter (10th grade) and I are in a race to see who can memorize the capitals and flags faster (194 of each).  I think she would have enjoyed this at any age because there is enough chance in who gets what cards so no ones' feelings are hurt, but enough strategy that there are possibilities for increasing the odds of winning.

This is not a game we bought for kids. My spouse and I bought it to complement our collection of other board and card games, for something different for us to do sometimes.  If you want an occasional 5 - 10 minute distraction and learn or be reminded of country names, location, and flag then this could be fun for you too.  When we see a country in the cards we hadn't thought of much before then sometimes we follow up and look up on wikipedia to see what other generally interesting things we could learn about the country.

review_title: World card game is very versatile
review_description: We played the world card game with kids and found it very easy to adapt it to  8 and 11 year old children. If you play with other adults, you can simply make it more difficult. You end up learning a lot about many countries and have a lot of fun together doin it.

It’s basically a small deck of cards with (4) facts like area, population, highest point and the total amount of neighboring countries.  It doesn’t even list the neighboring countries.  The cards do show a flag and the capital.  I wish I realized it was a deck of cards and not a “board game” as advertised in the title.  For the cost, I would have expected more of a Trivial Pursuit type board game and not a deck of playing cards for the most part.  It’s certainly not worth $30.  I honestly wouldn’t pay more than $10 for the cards.

Haven’t really played it as a game per say,  but my son LOVES these cards! Somehow I received 2 of these (and was charged for both-which was Very expensive!)- but I returned one and they sent me a refund w/o problems. It was worth the hassle to see my son learning so much about the different countries. There is quite a bit of extra info on the cards-( not just flags!).

I bought this game because I really like geography and I saw that this was a fun way of practicing and learning facts about all the countries in the world. The cards are very informative; stating facts about every country. In addiction, they include a map where are the countries are clearly labeled which could form part of the game if you decide so. I’ve played this game with my friends and every time I keep learning more and more about flags, capitals, and locations of all the countries all around the world. If you want to start to learning about the countries in the world, or just like geography in general, this is one of the few games that make geography really fun. I highly recommend it!

A great game for geography enthusiasts, or to help kids develop and interest in geography. My son loves this game, but when his cousins play it with him we modify it slightly so that he doesn't just give them the flag challenge all of the time (because that would give him the advantage). It increased his cousin's interest in geography and they had a great time playing the game. When I play, I learn something each time. You really can't help but learn! I love this game and am glad we purchased it.

Not the sellers fault at all, my only complaint would be that there are no multiple choice questions for those not completely familiar with world geography. My 14 year old destroyed three college educated adults as he is a geography and history buff. For us old timers (45) we need something to jog our memory. All in all a great game but could use this one improvement

This is a great game aimed at expanding one's geographical knowledge. I am a huge geography nerd and wanted my family to enjoy learning about the world like I do, and this certainly did the trick! The facts and flags shown for each country help players learn new things with every round. This is an essential must have for any geography enthusiast and anyone who wants to learn a little bit more about the world around them!

review_title: It's a great way to learn geography
review_description: My family has game night every Sunday.  I wanted a game where we could learn something as well.  This is a fabulous game!  We had so much fun playing it.  We had a globe on the table so we could find the country and learn its location.  This is a great way to learn geography.  Highly recommend!

review_title: Good game, my kids have learned a lot
review_description: This is a good game but it has a few major flaws. There are some countries that can never win the challenges because they are smaller, have small populations, and low elevation. I think this game would be better if it also came with a dice that had high/low/ least/greatest or something to even the playing field for the smaller countries.

review_title: Game isn’t suitable for younger kids. Not interesting to them
review_description: Find this game suited more for teens. My kids (7 and 9) didn’t enjoy it much. Also eye opening how little they are being taught in school. I grew up in Europe and we had a much better grasp on geography in general. Will definitely try again later, but not much interest at this time.

This game is daunting at first but once you get the hang of it it's really fun. We use it for homeschooling but find that we're not really reasoning the information on the cards, especially for the countries/capitals that are harder to say. However, as with learning it, in sure that will come the more we play.

review_title: Valuable for anyone who wants to up their geography game.
review_description: I appreciate how educational this set is! I carry the cards around with me and study them when I have a moment or two. So much of my geography memory has gone missing and I need to recapture it.I bought a set for my father too. He loves maps, geography and all things political. He incorporates history lessons into his version of the game.
I homeschool my son and I tutor his homeschool group-I will use this game to help my students learn their geography!

i love this game! it’s so fun and there are endless ways to use the cards and map. my only complaint would be that they should’ve included “official language” as a fact but overall it’s a very fun and educational card game! highly recommend.

Love the way this game is designed,very user friendly,travel size so it can be taken during vacations too! I feel that the current generation kids do not get exposure or opportunity to learn about the world map,continents,counties,capitals,flags etc. This game met my criteria 100% and my girls love it and we love to play this during our family game nights!

Super compactly packed (HUGE bonus for us!), there's even a world map folded up in that little box! Several games you can play, it includes every official country, and I love how the countries are categorized by continent (especially the way some countries, like Russia, that are really in 2 continents, actually portray this instead of just picking one).

review_title: Wonderful world game! learn about geography and countries! LOVE
review_description: Amazing game to learn facts about countries (including their capitals, location, population etc). Cards are good guality and well made. Map.is really fun. So many way to play it. We do battle with older ones (or guess the capital or neighbouring states). We guess the location, spelling or do battles with younger ones.  It has all the UN recognized Member States! A fantastic game and a great gift for friends! box is great quality and well made.

My 10 year old daughter and I played this game. One way to play is similar to War (the card game). We didn't do any of the challenges, but we had a blast! I would bring up little bits of trivia and we had fun locating the countries on the map. I highly recommend!

review_title: Great, Easy Game for the family
review_description: We were looking for a geography style trivia game and found this. It's great and very easy to play even for our 7 year old. Our 9 year old has learned a few of the flags from smaller countries already too!

review_title: My High School Geography Students Love This Game!
review_description: I bought this game as a fun Friday activity for my students. My class consists of students in 9th-12th grade, and they all truly enjoyed this game. There are several different approaches to the game. We started off easily with the students just locating the continent of each country. After they had played several times, they were finding the precise location of each country and coming up with new twists on the game.I highly recommend this game!
Got it as a gift for a 5th grader for Christmas, and he loves it! Pretty interesting game but he likes to use the cards as flash cards to help him study and they’re a huge help.

I have some doubts about the rules for the challenge mode. As far as I understood when is my turn I can call a challenge and I have to select the player who will present the challenge.When the challenge end all the benefit or lost will be just for the selected player or for any other player who can answer the challenge.
