Regarding the person who choose the select person there are no benefits and in one case ( if nobody answer) he will lose a card. SO my question is why a player should choose for a Challenge mode.?

review_title: Fun game for the family! Love it!
review_description: This has been such a fun game to play. My 9 year old chooses this game every time for family game night. I can’t believe how many countries he has learned all ready. This has been great to have with school closures.  My 7 year old can’t read the words very well, but still enjoys playing it sometimes.This game is so fun that I would even play it with just adults. It’s simple and yet has some strategy to it. And you really start to learn a lot about different countries.

We bought this game to help our kids (ages 14 and 9) work on geography skills. When it arrived we ordered a pizza and opened up the cards. It didn't take long to figure out the game and the kids were both able to pick it up quickly. We had fun and all learned as a family which was much better for the kids than sitting at the table studying a worksheet. The little one has been having a blast reciting information and showing off her new knowledge to anyone who will listen. We'll definitely be playing often!

review_title: Fun even if you don't know your countries
review_description: A fun game - you don't need to know where all the countries are, but you will learn if you want to win!  It says to play with 20 cards each, but we play with 10 and and have only ever finished a game once.  It's like war - can take a really long time to play all the way.  Can be played pretty easily without a table.
What a great little game.  It was easy to learn, fun and as an added perk ... educational.  I can see many hours of playing with this game in our future.

review_title: Not really a game but learning tool
review_description: It's more a way to learn about the countries of the world than a game. There are a couple of ways to play with the cards with varying levels of difficulty. The game part isn't really the focus though.

review_title: Versatile game can be played at many skill levels
review_description: I really enjoy this game. There are many ways to play it for different skill levels. It would be a great tool for anyone who wants to improve their geography knowledge. My partner and I are just a couple of nerds trying to expand our knowledge to be better at playing Jeopardy. It's a lot of fun just to expand your mind. :D

review_title: Kids liked to play it even though it was a very new game to them
review_description: We got this as a lockdown game. Our kids are 11 and 8 years old. We play this as a family. It is a play way method of learning. Initially it was just who has more cards. But gradually we were able to recognize the capitals, flags and population. 1 country's card has highest peak of 11 ft. So kids were amused and we started exploring more about it on internet.Only thing I would have wished more is that the cards had few readable facts on them.

I bought this for my stepson who lives maps, and he thoroughly enjoys it as a game and more.  We use the cards as flash cards so he learns the flags and other information, and he will put the cards in order by continent, or by number.  He’s pretty geeked about it.  He lost a country card, so we contacted the makers and they sent us a replacement card, so I’m very happy with this purchase.

review_title: amazing way to learn for your kids ...
review_description: this is such an amazing way to teach your child ... my son is 7yrs old and we are literally playing this every night. mom, me and kido all of us enjoy this... love it.....

I bought this game to use as flashcards to learn all the countries and some general information about each one of them. It is better than what I expected. The quality is great and I loved the box and the map. Everything is just the right size and very colorful. Great idea for an educational gift!
The rules are not very good but once you invent your own rules it becomes a really fun game with lots of replay value and constant learning.

review_title: Great Cure for Boredom and Xenophobia
review_description: This has been the best gift of the COVID quarantine so far. Our first grader loves learning about all the countries and seeing their flags and finding them on the map. The variety of "facts" for each country means we can create challenges that level the playing field between kids and adults. Country-by-country COVID case counts add some salience and an easy connection to current events for the  young ones.

review_title: Wish I had this in college!
review_description: A really fun way to learn modern geography.  I wish I had this while studying the subject in college!

review_title: Best game! Don’t let it intimidate you!
review_description: One of the best games ever! Don’t let the amount of pieces in the box scare you. If you’re not good with following directions on paper, watch some YouTube videos on how to play. Once you get the concept, you’ll want to keep playing again and again. The expansions are so much fun once you play a few rounds of the standard game. I strongly suggest playing a few rounds without the expansion so you can grasp the concept of the game before adding in new rules. It will be much less complicated that way. This game is great regardless if it’s 2 players or 5...the more players, the longer the game play. Everyone in our group has different strategies and everyone has won at least once...so what works for one, may not work for another or what worked for someone during one game, may not work in another game. This is one of our top games, though, and we’ve played a LOT during our game nights with friends.

I played this game without expansions at a friend's house for the first time.  I had previewed it online and discounted it as too simple and boring.  I couldn't have been more wrong.  The game is high in strategy, easy to learn or teach, and high replayability.  The expansions aren't necessary but are well worth the price for the big box.  With a random layout and using  zero, one, or both expansions, it's never the same game twice.  It plays extremely well with all player counts.All of the components are very good quality with one exception.  The cardboard money doesn't seem to hold up really well.  I recommend just getting metal coins.  This is such a minor flaw that it still gets 5 stars in my book.In short this has become one of my favorite games, and gets to the table more often than just about any other game I own.

Looks more complicated than it is.  Plays smoothly. It's a light, collect and deliver type game with a unique movement aspect.  Personally, it feels comparable to Genoa without the bidding. Standard, decent quality components.  The board with all expansions takes some space and set up the first few times can take some time.  My husband and I recently bought a bunch of board games that can play well with just 2 people but also sometimes three or more and I'd say this fit the bill.  Chose this one because the expansions come with it.  Great deal!

If you plan on buying at least one expansion, the Big Box is a better value. The game itself is fun and fresh, thanks to the variable board layouts. I was also impressed with the quality of the pieces; even the coins are made of thick cardboard.

review_title: Istanbul with 2 expansions all in one
review_description: We were so excited to expand our playing from basic Istanbul with the two expansions.  We are finding having all three great for opting to scale down for teaching beginners and challenging ourselves with the whole package.Shipping was fast and found reliable.

Warning- this game is addicting! It was a little overwhelming at first with so many pieces, but’s it’s easy to pick up. Lots of tutorials online, the app version helped us learn all the rules quickly. We love that the game needs only two players to play! Between this game and backgammon is pretty much how we spend our quarantine weekends.

review_title: Great game but poor quality control
review_description: I'm not sure how I should rate, because the game itself is a very good euro games. HOWEVER, the first package that came was damaged, both the shipping box and the game box. The replacement was better, but after our first play and we were putting things back into the box, we realised that the box edge was damaged. I'm not sure whether this is the fault of manufacturer (is the box not sturdy enough?) or seller (did they store it improperly?), just a word of warning.

This is a great game.  The expansions make it THAT much better.Unfortunately, the box arrived damaged (see photos).  I wouldn't normally down rate for something like this, but I have seen other reviews stating the same thing.Amazon, as usual, has been great.  They immediately sent out a replacement.  If the replacement is good to go, I will adjust my rating.
Easy to learn. Best with 3 or more, but fun with only two. Tons of replayability.
This game is fun, easy to learn and is different each game giving plenty of variety. The expansions add another level to the game that intensifies the fun.
Great game

review_title: Fun but I would make it more simple by bending some of the rules
review_description: Love the drawings, the game takes long to learn
Great game! That's why I bought it!.Box was slightly damaged but I'm not here rewewing packaging.
A great game. A great time. Super accessible for it's weight of game.
Great game.

Istanbul, ganador del Kennerspiel des Jahres es un excelente euro medio, realmente recomendable; este big box trae sus dos expansiones siendo excelentes para aumentar la estrategia del juego y el precio de lo mejor — es como si compraras el juego base y por muy poco más (100-200 pesos) obtengas las expansiones (o que compres las expansiones y te regalen el juego base); es una excelente compra, ya sea que estés explorando  en juegos de mesa ( y hayas jugado unos cuantos) o ya tengas recorrido en ellos. Si tuvieras dudas, puedes comprar el juego para tus dispositivos (iOS o Android) y por poco dinero comprobar la mecánica y dinámica del juego para animarte (o no) a comprar esta versión que vale cada Lira!! (Peso).

We have owned Istanbul for quite some time and when we found there was a version with 2 expansions we jumped on it. Basically cheaper and more convenient to have it all in One Big Box. The standalone Istanbul is one of our favorite on our boardgame nights . Have only played this once and can't wait to get the chance again.
Muy divertido. Alta rejugabilidad, ideal para todo tipo de jugadores. Juego de colocación de trabajadores muy interesante. Con gran variedad de mecánica! Lo ame!
Item shipped quickly, arrived in perfect condition. The pieces are very solid, colourful and durable. Can't wait to play it!
Everything arrived as described. Nice quick game once you get the rules under your belt. A+++.
Es uno de los mejores juegos!
This product was well worth the money, it is heavy duty cnstruction and will last years

review_title: Same gameplay, not the same pieces as original
review_description: I bought this for my daughter for her birthday with fond memories of my own pretty pretty princess game from when I was a kid. Mine had a jewelry box and the crown was round, this has no jewelry box so pieces aren’t contained at all in the game box, and the crown is the cheap plastic tiara kind attached to a headband. And in my original game the black ring had a slightly different shape than the other rings (made it feel more sinister!” In this all the rings are the same except color. All in all if I didn’t know what the game used to be I probably would have loved this, but I was disappointed in the changes since my childhood. My daughter on the other hand loves it just as much as I did when I was little!
Other then the crown which seems like it might break any minute, it's great! Super excited about having the game again for my girls.

This was my absolute favorite game growing up in the 90's and now that I have a 4 year old I of course bought it for her. She LOVES this game and plays it daily. Unfortunately, it is not the same game I grew up with and after less than a month  the board has already broken. There is no case to store the jewelry in so it is just kinda lose in the box (the original game had a case to store jewelry, a mirror on the lid, and you could store the crown around the outside of it. ) The earrings are the worst and the little clip repeatedly falls off. Durability wise it's awful but the game itself is still pretty much the same.

I’m so upset my kids were so excited for this because I really want to return it!!! Two pairs of earrings broke just by opening them for the first time. I literally have to put tape around them while I play with the kids. They do not make this game like they used to when I was growing up. The material is Awful not durable at all. I am so upset with this purchase and would love to return it!!!! Save your money and don’t buy it! Your better off making your own! It doesn’t even come with the blue case with the mirror like it used to!

This game was so very much fun twenty years ago for our daughters.  They both played it, dawn to dusk for a very, very long time!  They enjoyed it thoroughly and always got it out to play when other girls came to play, or they could convince the family to play "Again!".  We were careful to keep track of the multiple jewelry pieces when we went to put the game away.  Not having all of the pieces is how our copy began to be used less and less.  We did find a few children's jewelry pieces to substitute as a few of the originals were lost.  Our girls loved it and when I bumped into it recently, I purchased it for our granddaughter.  I'm hoping she'll love it just as much as her mom and aunt did!

My son being the youngest out of four kids followed by two sister and a very much older brother. Loved playing this game with his sisters. I remember playing it as a kid which was one of the reasons I bought it for my girls. They all love it.

UPDATE: every single earring broke. I’ve repeatedly fixed them and some have permanently broke. Not worth it. I DO NOT recommend purchasing this - jewelry is poor quality. I had the original game from the 90s; this game fails in comparison. Most importantly, the plastic is really cheap and the earrings broke after first use. Every color earring clip broke. It does pop back in (which I’ve done several times) but it’s very disappointing. The crown also seems like it won’t last long. My daughter loves it so we’ll keep it. But I wouldn’t spend more than $5 on this (I regrettably spent more).So, would I recommend it? Yes if it’s $5. If it’s more, don’t waste your money.

So much fun to play with my granddaughter!  It brought back memories of playing with my daughters!  We even brought it to the assisted living where my family member is and played it with the residents, it made them so happy!  I really love this game!

review_title: (almost) JUST LIKE MY CHILDHOOD! *Not exactly like 90s version
review_description: I bought this for my 1990s kid nostalgia:In a nutshell you all have a necklace, earrings, a ring, and a bracelet. There's one crown to fight over and the "bad black ring." Whoever gets all their pieces including the crown (and without the black ring) is the winner.I got this for our daughter on Christmas because it was a game I loved as a kid. The board and all the pieces of jewelry looked the same...Except for the main piece: The CROWN! I was quite disappointed in the cheapo Dollar Tree looking tiara they through in there instead of the pretty crown from the 90s version. And this game had no round, bejeweled jewelry box either. Be prepared to just lay all the jewelry in the center.Bottom line--its the cutest little game for girls/kids/whatever. It played just like the original! HOWEVER if you are buying this for nostalgia purposes, be prepared to be a little disappointed in the crown and missing jewelry box. I don't know if they wanted to go a cheaper route or what, but our tiara broke pretty quickly. If they make more with all the original pieces I'd buy another!

My little nieces love this game! It's been a favorite since it arrived as a birthday gift recently. The jewelry is simple enough that even a 3 year old can put on by herself. The spinner sometimes takes a couple tries to go, but that's the case with pretty much all game spinners.Small pieces - requires supervision, but there's no reading required and nothing has broken yet!

review_title: It's not the 90s but it works!
review_description: If you enjoyed the original board & pieces from the 90s, this newer version is sure to disappoint. I miss the mirror jewlery box that you'd decorate with stick-on jewels, and the built-in spinner on the opposite side of the mirror (there's nowhere to put the jewlery other than on the board, and no mirror, and the spinner is a separate piece). I also miss the round crown with the stick-on jewels (but the tiara is cute), and the circular shaped board with the classic illustrations, and how the jewlery box and the crown fit in the center of the board (they instead drew a circle on a square shaped board). That said, it's the exact same game from the 90s, and the jewlery, other than the crown, is the same. It was gifted to a 3 year old who absolutely loves it and will enjoy it just fine. I still think it is a rip off version of the classic, cheaply and lazily made, but I'm glad it exists again!

review_title: Disappointed in the quality of this revival of the game pretty pretty princess
review_description: I was so happy to buy this present for my daughter for her birthday. Unfortunately the earrings broke the first time we tried to open them up. I know this is a throwback version of the original game but my family had an original game for about 10 years and this one purchased here lasted Not even through one game round. I am sadly disappointed in the quality and if you’re familiar with the original game it has a different crown this one is cheap and will break easily. I wanted to return it but unfortunately I missed the return window but it is not worth the money or the time because it’s hard to explain to a six-year-old why her earrings clip on earrings are broken and she can’t be a pretty princess without them

I used to play this game when I was younger and it was my favorite! About 5 years ago, I saw it in a store and decided not to buy it.  Then, as my daughters got a little older, I thought they would love it. I looked everywhere for it but couldn’t find it anymore for less than $70! I happened to see it on amazon a few weeks ago and snatched it up real quick to give to my daughters for Christmas. I am soooo excited to play it with them!

Got this for my niece, it was my absolute favorite board game as a little girl, we played it to death! Unfortunately this game is not exactly the same, it's been tweaked a little and the biggest difference is the jewelry box and crown. The crown is not a little tiara, just not as great wish they would make it the same way! Anyways, these kids don't know it any different and Im sure she'll love the game.. plus a great price so its good enough!

So happy to dee this game come back!!! It is a perfect first game for 3 and  up!! I have loved this game for years, and  have given many as gifts. It was discontinued for a while and I was so sad about that.  it came back just in time as now I have 3 year old grand daughters to introduce  it to! The challenge is to make them understand that it is a game and  the jewelry is part of the game and must be put back in box snd only worn while playing. If not the jewery will be all over the house and the game will not be played again. That's why it needs to-be 3 and up!

This brought back so many memories and was awesome to get to make new memories with my daughter. She absolutely loves it and even got her daddy and brothers to play as well! You know it’s a good game when everyone wanted to play it again and again!!

review_title: The kingdom is lost, as is the crown
review_description: My game didn’t come with a crown, which any self-respecting millennial can remember is essential for a quality game of PPP. I feel my chance at the throne has been thwarted. The land will go to ruin now, I have lost all parental authority over my spawn. Pray for me.Update: it wasn’t obvious at first but we are also missing the purple jewelry. I don’t know how this happens but we are a family of four and even my husband would like to be a princess, but he now cannot. All is lost.

I purchased this game as a Christmas gift for my four-year-old niece for Christmas 2019. I have memories of my sister receiving this as a gift when we were young, and the game is exactly the way it was back then. My niece loves her Princess Game, and while she may be a bit too young to truly understand how to play so far, she just enjoys playing dress up with as many of the jewelry pieces as she can fit on her. Her parents are avid board gamers and are looking forward to helping her play the game, and I'm looking forward to seeing how my brother-in-law looks in a tiara.

review_title: I’ve been looking everywhere for this!
review_description: I was the kid who always ran around in dresses and jewelry and in the past 27 years, the only thing that changed is that I’m older.I had this game as a kid and bought for pure nostalgia. It was my favorite game. The jewelry looks exactly like the original. The only difference is it used to contain a small tray bin for the jewelry and the crown. The crown is actually better now. The old one fit very awkwardly and the new one is a standard plastic tiara.I bought this for parties with my girl friends and replaced all the jewelry with sparkling 1950s jewelry and a flower crown. It’s still fun.

This brings me back!  While I never had the game as a little girl, my friends did.  It was the game everyone wanted to play during sleepovers and many fun times were had.  I was telling my girls about it and how much fun it was and was stoked to see they had a new version out.  The only disappointing thing is that the round case in the center (with the mirror on top that the crown fit around in the original version) is not part of the new version.  It certainly takes some of the nostalgia away.

This is such a nostalgic game for me, as I played it when I was younger. Sure it's not the exact same as I remeber but its the same concept and very similar. When I seen it, I had to have it for my daughter, something we love to do togther and my mom loves seeing her granddaughter playing this game we enjoy sharing this memory!

I was so excited to see that this game is back in production!  It was a favorite in our family in the 90’s and I wanted my granddaughters to get to enjoy it.  It is such a cute game for 4 - 8 year olds.  As with so many things, the quality is not as good.  My main complaint is that there isn’t a jewelry box to put the jewels in for the center of the board.  That was disappointing.  However I’ve already purchased 2 of them and plan to purchase another for my other granddaughter.

review_title: Fun, easy game I played as a child
review_description: This is the game I remembered as a child and wanted to have it to play with my daughter. Its so easy to play for her. We love to have Daddy and her big brother play too, which adds to the fun. The jewelry is cheap, but srves is purpose. The crown, I'm afraid, will break easily, but its the kind of crown you can buy at a dollar store. Im considering if switching it iut with something of better quality, just make it seem more "regal".Overall, definitely a great purchase?

review_title: Cute game for little girls! Great gift!
review_description: Super cute, but simple, game for little girls. My daughter was gifted this game and she loves it, so we bought one to gift to a friend of hers. She loves playing and dressing up with all the jewelry. It’s a very simple game but that’s appropriate for her age (she’s 5). My only minor complaint is that the pieces don’t seem super well made, so we might have to replace it after awhile, and the game wasn’t exactly cheap. I assume the original 90s game that this is replicating was more sturdy.But overall, would recommend.

review_title: Fun game but not made well
review_description: I loved this game as a little girl so I bought it for my daughter. It’s definitely not made as well anymore. The clasps has already fallen off 2 of the earrings before we even opened the bag they were in and 1 earring the clasp is so loose it isn’t usable. I would try to exchange it but I’m sure they all have the same problems, they’re just made very cheaply. The set my sister and I had back in the 90s lasted for years.

Was so excited to find this game for my nieces. HARD to find and up until last year, it was extremely expensive. I am stocking up on more for gifts! Loved this game as a little girl and I'm thrilled to give it to the little girls in my life! Just like I remembered.

Wahhhhh!!! Any girl child of the early 90’s who spent hours daily in a closet obsessively playing Barbies will remember this glorious game! I checked every few years to see if they were remaking it once I became a mom myself, but it was always a rare sighting on eBay where the going price for an original edition was in the hundreds. Yikes.Then suddenly, could it be? Hasbro has reissued the game with all the simplicity, glorious plastic jewelry, and glamorous fanfare I remember. The jewelry seems roughly the same in quality, but the game pawns are flimsier and the spinner and board are made out of pretty lightweight cardboard. My two year old snapped the board in half the first time I coerced my sons into playing.BUT I DONT CARE. If you know about this game, you understand why it’s so thrilling to play it again, 25 years later, with a few white hairs peaking out from under the fabulous plastic crown.PPP for life.

I bought this for my daughter for her birthday and she absolutely loves it! I username to play as a child and thought how cute they still make this! It would be nice if they had something to store all the pieces in after you were done playing. You have to put them back in the box or the little plastic bags which were provided.
Perfect gift for my niece. Bought this for her 4th birthday and I know she will love it. I grew up playing this game with my sister, it brings back great memories.
Crown is very small, too small for my 2 year old. Also, does not come with a jewelry storage container like the original game. Otherwise, my children love it!

I was so excited to buy this for my daughter. She loves it but it is fairly cheap quality. It wouldn’t deter me from purchasing again due to the fact that’s it’s nostalgic for me and she adores it! Overall, happy with my purchase even if the board is a little ripped already.

review_title: Identical to discontinued Cinderella one, except the princess
review_description: My 6 yo has a speech delay and has played this game(the Cinderella version) w/ her therapist. She loved this game so much, she kept asking me to buy it. The Cinderella version has discontinued and is being sold at premium on Ebay. This version is identical to it, except there is generic princess, instead of Cinderella. My daughter has no problem with it and still enjoys the game.
I bought this game for my daughter’s 6th birthday. She and her younger sister love playing this game. Even her brother has played the game with us. Birthday win for Mommy.

As much as I love this game, both old and new, I was sad to see there’s no jewelry box. That’s my only complaint. The crown looks different from the original, but I remember how easily the original broke and my mother having to fix it with tape constantly, so maybe that change was for the better. I’m excited to play this nostalgic game with my daughter when she’s a bit older!

I grew up with this game. A neighbor friend and I would play almost every single day, if not multiple times a day when we were little girls. My 5 year old daughter is such a princess, so I bought this for her for her birthday (or maybe I secretly bought it for myself, haha) and she absolutely loves it!!! She plays the game allllll the time!! Get this game for your little princesses!!

review_title: Daughter loves it, but it's cheaply made
review_description: I wish this game was better made, even if it meant it was more expensive.  My daughter LOVES this game and wants to play it all the time. I appreciate that it is short and easy for her to play.  However, the items are very cheaply made, particularly the crown and earrings.  I am considering buying separate toy jewelry to replace it all at this point.

Loved this game growing up! It was the first gift ordered for my daughter this Christmas. We are now playing the game. My heart is slightly crushed for the pink pawn is missing. I will put stickers on the extra blue.

Were you a fan of this magical 90s board game, wanting that wonderful nostalgia to bestow upon the next generation of little princesses?? Then please...DO NOT BUY!!! Poorly made and no where near the same! I luckily still have my original Pretty Pretty Princess game that I had the pleasure of introducing to my 8 year old niece who fell in love with it!! I thought I had scored when I saw it available and bought it within seconds. Once I gifted it to my niece, the immediate disappointment of broken jewelry pieces, and not being able to look at herself in the mirror with all her hard earned pieces of jewelry and the royal crown were a huge let down! Speaking of crowns, the one that comes with this game is a joke!

review_title: Glad it’s back- not as nice as original version
review_description: So glad the game is back! My daughter loves it. However, like many board games today it is very cheaply made. The board is thin, playing pieces flimsy, there is no longer a plastic jewelry box to hold the pieces in and the crown is a super cheap plastic tiara. I would personally rather pay a little more to have a higher quality product. If you have never seen or played the original version these things won’t bother you. It still gets 5 stars because it has brought our family hours and hours of enjoyment. Perfect for any girl who loves princesses, dress up, or games that get mom and dad to look silly in a crown and plastic jewelry!

This was a childhood favorite of mine I looked all over a year ago to buy it for a friends daughter I couldn’t find it anywhere online cheaper than $60 . When I saw this pop up on my amazon for this price I jumped on it . My husband thought I was crazy because our daughters are not even one but I don’t know when it will be this price again !

Got this for my 5 year old because I remember playing with my bestfriends when I was little.It is super easy to play and it is quick too. We added rules sometimes to make play longer (i.e. of you land on a space for something you already have, you have to out it back. There was also the crown is the last thing you can get and must have everything before you can get it)Anyway, the only thing I wish it came with was a container for the jewelry,  the Disney princess version had one. Oh well, that's what a zip loc is for.

review_title: Poor Quality, Good Game for the family
review_description: Love this game for my daughter certainly brings back those childhood memories of our own.I am sad to leave 2 stars because 3 earrings have broken, and the crown broke. The earrings break when little hands are trying to handle them theirselves. The box is a little awkward to put everything away and my daughter snapped the top off the crown trying to put it away herself.

review_title: Not the same game! If you’ve played it before, you’ll be very disappointed!
review_description: NOT THE SAME GAME. It’s very deceitful to call it the same, it’s not the same game. Disappointed for sure, as are my girls who’ve always loved playing it. Not happy.
I gave this sweet game to my niece for her birthday and she was thrilled. She's into games but was just turning 4, so it's the perfect game for a princess to incorporate games and dress up!

review_title: Same game from when I was a kid
review_description: This game is exactly as I remember from being a kid and my three year old daughter loves it! The crown is different from what I remember, but in a good way, as it seems more durable and fit on my adult head. Other than that,  it's a great simple game that's exactly as I remembered from when i was a kid.

Bought this in the 90's for my first daughter and was happy to see it was re-released and bought it for my second daughter. Within 3 times of playing it the ear rings started breaking and not because of her. The adults broke them trying to get them to work. Fun for kids, but very cheaply made!

I use to play this game when I was young so when I saw it re-made I bought it for my daughter. Kinda disappointed the jewelry is made really cheap including the crown, it feels like if u bump it to hard it would break the earing latches as cheaply made and break very easily. I remember this game being sturdier now it’s super cheap

Purchased for my daughter after she played the original Pretty Pretty Princess game at a relatives house. After searching for the game, the original one can only be purchased for $100+I love my daughter, but c'mon, paying that much for a board game sounds ridiculous. So I found this one on and it is everything the original game is. Everything is included except for a small storage container that the original one has to store so the jewelry. But that can easily be purchased at a dollar store.My daughter loves the game and the pieces are pretty durable considering her playing this game daily.

review_title: Wonderful first game for 3 year old plus kids.
review_description: I remembered this from the past, and bought it to teach a 3 year old how to play games like this (and Candyland).  To my surprise the visiting 6 & 8 year olds wanted to play it too.  A bargain and fun for all.It is always funny when some adult big Man strives to become the Pretty, Pretty Princess.

I bought this for my adult daughter.  She had this game when she was a kid.  Because I have found so many pictures of her playing the game with her friends,  cousins,  grandmother,  the cat...  I decided to get her another one as a surprise.  She was as excited this year as she was in 1994!

review_title: Possibly the funniest kids game I've ever played
review_description: I review about 1 out of 50 things I buy but given how expensive games are and how hit or miss they can be, I wanted to come on here and give this game two giant thumbs up. I got this for my youngest daughter (10) for Christmas but we never ended up playing it before our older daughters went back to college. It's set up like apples to apples so you should have at least 4 to play. This weekend one of our girls came home for spring break and we took advantage of having 4 people at home and I'm really glad we did. We laughed for hours and played 6 games in a row, which is a miracle for us. We have all girls and they loved this but I can see how this would be an even bigger hit with boys. Lots of bodily functions mentioned on the answer cards with plenty of hilarious questions to take full advantage. The only thing I would say is that your family has to have some appreciation for bathroom humor or you won't enjoy this game. Its not a game you bring out and play with other people unless you know them well.

I bought this as a gift for my sister, BIL and their four kids for Christmas. I wanted something fun and easy to play with a large family on game night. My nieces and nephews are 10, 12, 14, & 16 yo. While the youngest seemed to like it, the older ones got bored with its attempts of gross humor quickly. While it aims at being appropriately inappropriate, it just seems cheesy. - like the cards try too hard. I wish I would have picked something else.Most appropriately inappropriate for kids age 6-10yo who still find this potty humor funny.

Got this to play with the family over Thanksgiving because I have enjoyed playing Cards Against Humanity with adults before. The group consisted of two adults (one early 30's, one late 30's) and two kids (boy 11, girl 9). It was clear to see the difference in humor between the adults and kids, but that did not stop any of us from laughing our heads off. We must have played for a few hours, honestly I am not sure because we just kept going and going, laughing more and more. There were small giggles, loud laughs, unstoppable laughs, and literally tear induced laughs. This is a definite keeper for our family gatherings. Can't wait to play it again!
Kids (12 & 14) enjoyed it. 14yo took it to camp and said others enjoyed it also.  If you don't appreciate crude/potty humor, don't buy it.

review_title: I TOOK A CHANCE...read to find out...
review_description: This was a gift for my sister's grandchildren. She took it to Holland and they LOVED IT. I saw pictures and the adults were acting like kids maybe even or more than the kids. Hard to tell. My sister was a little leery but she is not converted...I don't have the OK to send the video, but trust me, it was goofy!
This game is great for families with young children.  My kids ask to play a lot!

review_title: One of the best family games we’ve played
review_description: One of the best family games we’ve played!!!!!!  It’s so easy that all ages can play.  We all laughed so hard!

review_title: Family* fun card game (*may want to review cards for your family)
review_description: Bought this for my family and then another for a friends' son's birthday because I thought they would really enjoy it, too. If Apples to Apples is too tame and Cards Against Humanity is too much for your family this is a great middle ground. As with CAH, you may want to review the cards prior to play to determine whether you think they are appropriate for your family and friends considering your personal opinions, age of players, etc. Simple game to pickup (especially if you've played either of the others mentioned). Can be played rather quickly or for quite some time if you want to make a night of it and not get bored. No expansion packs that I've seen but I'm sure if you wanted to you could mix in cards from other games or even make your own. Lots of fun!

Thought this would be a great way to kill time with my family during this vivid quaintine. However I hate some of the cards are vulgar like talking about farts and vomiting. Not funny just gross parents shouldn't be ok with that

Bought this for my brother's family as they have 3 kids stuck in the house for the foreseeable future. It arrived early on a Sunday (way to go Amazon!) My s-i-l called last night and said it was a huge hit. Laughter to the point of tears, and fun for all the kids, 9, 10 and 13. She said lots of poop jokes, but they all loved it. Great stress relief, I'm sure. She described it as Cards Against Humanity for kids, which I also saw in the reviews, so probably a good description.

Yes, this is a rip-off of cards against humanity, but one that works for and appeals to kids.  Like the original, it is irreverent at times (if your child likes bodily function jokes as much as mine do).  The whole family had a great time with this on a long road trip.  It was our go-to game and the kids couldn't get enough of it.

Absolutely the best family game I’ve found for our family. We had family members between the ages of 4 to 65 loving this game!  I wanted a game to play with the entire family during thanksgiving. I was looking for something somewhat clean, and silly, but not too silly that the adults would hate it. EVERYONE loved it!  By the end of the night, my 8 yr old nephew loved it so much he was begging his parents to buy one for him.  And the next day, my 4.5 year old son was asking to play it again at breakfast.  It’s definitely a keeper and I highly recommend it to anyone with kids. The big cheese dance is genius.  I don’t know how this would work with 2-3 players, but it’s great with 4+ players especially of multiple ages.

My 7 year old loves this game. She does need help playing it, since her reading isn’t on the same level as some of the cards. It gets lots of laughs and is very PG. The potty humor answers always get the biggest giggles. If you are an adult this game isn’t as hilarious or entertaining as Cards Against Humanity but this game is a good clean version. There are no expansions for it yet but I may buy a competitors version and combine them to get more variety as we. Have played several times and have almost gone through all the cards.
Some cards were more adult, we pulled those out.

The cards never seemed to match grammatically with the blue cards, it was difficult to find cards that would work (verbs and nouns not matching, not working with the blue cards, etc).  Very disappointing- just buy apples to apples you'll be better off in the long run for sure.
Lots of fun with the kids.  They are 10 and 8 and had an absolute blast with this game!  Any time a friend comes over we pull it out to play.

review_title: This is a super fun game to play even for adults
review_description: This is a super fun game to play even for adults. So far we've only played with 4 players but it would be more fun with multiple players. Easy to learn and it can be played quickly. Kids love it.

I don’t really like learning new games... I prefer to play the old classics that I grew up with... but I read the reviews and figured I would give it a shot. Oh. Em. Gee!!! So darn funny!!! My three boys (ages 4,7 and 10) were busting up laughing! Lots of opportunities to say “butt” “farts” and “poop” lol. We played for hours... we almost went through all of the deck of cards. It takes a lot to entertain all of my kids... Fortnite is about the only thing I have found that keeps them all entertained and playing together nicely.... until this game. So much fun! So funny! Definitely pulled our family together.

This game is easy to learn--everyone understands the rules after just one round, which is why this game-play format is so popular. This is a fun game to play with younger school-age kids. They need to be able to read. Lots of poop and fart jokes are included. When we played with another family, kids over 12 weren't nearly as entertained as those aged 6-11. We went through beforehand and cleaned out a few "inappropriate" cards (this is standard practice in our house). With these cautions, I do recommend.
This is a copy of the better original version of “Kids Against Maturity”.  This game is okay for kids under 8.  Easy to learn but kind of boring.  However it is good clean fast family fun

I have a 13 year old and a 9 year old who have opposite tastes in everything. It's really difficult to find something they both really enjoy doing together. I have really loved watching them both crack up laughing as we play this game. We leave ours sitting on our kitchen table or near by. It makes for fun dinner time games. They literally want to play it every day!

review_title: Fun to play, but cards are hard to shuffle because they are not cut evenly.
review_description: Fun game to play won’t the family, makes you laugh. Our cards were not cut properly on the sides so they are harder to shuffle, which makes it frustrating.
Enjoys enjoyed the game, bought for a family night which we still need to do! However my kids have played with friends and enjoyed it. Ages 12-14.

I gave to a friend who has 5 kids ages 17 down to six years old -She sent me a small video of them playing it- they truly  ALL were belly laughing, even the dad!!!Great game for all ages quarantined or not!!

review_title: Low quality. This card game attempts to bring "mad lips" to a " board game" forum.  EPIC  FAIL
review_description: Low quality. This card game attempts to bring "mad lips" to a " board game" forum.  EPIC  FAIL

My 9 yr old daughter likes the game. I personally think it could have been designed better. A lot of the answer cards don’t match well with the fill in the blanks. You have to alter the answer for it to make sense. There are blank cards for writing your own answer, which I guess helps with this situations but you don’t always have a blank card in your hand. I think they should also provide a dry erase marker for the blank cards. We don’t really play the game correctly  because you need 3 people. We just draw and take turns matching up questions and answers.

My child wanted to play a card game she has heard us adults playing. I won’t name a brand but it’s very similar to that adult card game with black and white cards. It’s very kid based. Funny, silly, gross KID humor. My 5 year old gets the biggest kick out of it.

One 12yr old, a 16yr old and three adults.  We laughed and laughed.  It was funny.  The only reason for the 4 stars is that it didn't seem as funny the second time we played.  We began to recognize the cards and the answers were not always funny.

review_title: but thinks that Apples to Apples is boring and lame
review_description: I bought this for my daughter because she's still a little young for Cards Against Humanity, but thinks that Apples to Apples is boring and lame. The game is fun and sometimes a little gross, which makes it perfect for tweens and young teens.

This is a great kids version of Cards Against Humanity. My brother is 8 and loves it, although some of the words used are slightly beyond his reading level at this point. Not a big deal - we just explain them to him and pick a new card. The challenge cards are a great addition to keep children entertained by the game!!

review_title: It's okay , still worth it for my son's sake he enjoyed the first round or two
review_description: It was okay not as funny as I'd expected . Some were good and my son giggle but I tried to follow along . It was alright but it does get old quick , we tried mixing things up but idk . Alot of people seemed to enjoy it I guess I just wasn't as blown away or have a difficult humor to touch lol
If you love CAH as an adult and are looking for a game to play with your kids, this is it!!  Great silly fun

review_title: Fun game and better with more people. Anyone who can read can play
review_description: Great game for my son and for the whole family to play. My son thinks anything having to do with poop or pee or anything gross is funny and this is perfect for him. He is 5 but a great reader and helps him learn to decide an answer given numerous cards to choose from. Very funny game

A great game for fans of Cards Against Humanity. My kids have a lot of fun playing it. However, the cards don't always make sense. There aren't enough nouns which makes it difficult (especially for kids) to come up with an answer that makes sense.

review_title: Try it! Must be able to read to really play
review_description: This game was fun for me. My kiddos were mixed in ratings. They weren't getting that it is supposed to be absurd and however each person interprets each thing. They will grow to it. I feel like it is good for a laugh and for some perspective.

BUY THIS!  My kids and I laughed so hard when we started playing this!!  It’s good clean fun!  My daughter and her friends played this at her slumber party with 10/11 year olds. I think kids of any age who are able to read would enjoy this!
This game becomes boring quickly. The answers are ridiculous 3 different age groups played and we really didn't like this game..

I bought this game for my 7 year old niece and she loved it!  We all played the game a couple of times now and have had so much fun.  This game is great for any age.  There are a lot of cards and we have not had the same card twice.  The cards are so funny.  Great game!
I haven't played this yet, but our children were up for hours playing and laughing with their cousins one evening. That's a win for us!! :)

I didn't give this 5 stars bc I don't think it is perfect, but my kids really enjoyed playing this game.  One can't read but with a little guidance was able to pick answers and had plenty of giggle fits as well.

Bought for 8 year old grandson. We had so much fun playing! Good for reading and the humor is perfect for his age and the adults playing laughed as well! Some “potty humor” but not offensive. Feel this is good for ages 8-12. Older than that would probably think it’s “lame”.
This is such a fun game to play with the kids! My boys are 7 & 9 , we laugh so hard playing this game and it was very easy to explain to them how to play.

We got this and another one very similar to it at Christmas.  i like this one bett3er.  There are butt and fart jokes, but they are a bit more tasteful than the other game which is downright raunchy.  We have played this twice with players 8-65 years old and everyone had fun!

My 6 year olds love this game! It’s like apples to apples but sillier. There are a few cards I don’t think are appropriate (butt crust) but we just take them out. My kids always ask to play this game and we are always laughing a lot.

review_title: Oh my STARS, we've never laughed so hard!
review_description: We ordered this for our little boy (9 y/o) for Easter. First time out of the box there was so much laughing, some of us had to get up and walk away from the table. Second time, it was almost unbearable, we were laughing so hard. We haven't had that much non-electronic family fun in forever! GREAT family game! If you don't have fun with this game, you need to see the orthopedist, because your funny bone is broken!

We just gave this to our granddaughter for her 7th birthday. We're playing now with the whole family, including our 10 year old grandson and the giggles are the BEST! We're already on our second game and the kids are enjoying it so much!!!

review_title: Stupid version of Apples to Apples
review_description: Don't waste your money on this stupid knock off.
A good game for the family and gatherings
This was a Easter gift for a grandchild, under the suggestion of the parent.  It turned into a lot of quality family time during the evenings and during the Covid health emergency shut down.

review_title: Great for younger kids too. Good gift
review_description: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my nieces and nephews. All the ages of kids could play together, with the younger ones pairing up with Mom and Dad. My sister can be strict with manners but she loved it and said it's a great game.

Not only does it include an electronic banking system (which is faster and efficient) but the game's rules are modified. For example, there are no hotels, and each purchased property gets 1 house. The rent increases any time any player lands on the property. Instead of Chance & Community Chance Cards, there are Monopoly Cards (basically the same as the former) and Location spots that allow you to pay to move to any space on the board -- you can go to a property you want to buy, a property you own to increase the rent, or move to a space near Go so you will collect on the next turn.Whereas the original version took me and another player 2-3 hours to complete, this version took about 50 minutes on our very 1st time!I love this game and this version, and definitely recommend it. The rules are straightforward and the electronic banking system calculates everything for you.

review_title: If you like the old Monopoly you might not like this new one.
review_description: My kids (12 & 14) were so excited to get this game for Christmas.  I have to say that it has it's positives and negatives.Pros:* much, much quicker than the old game.  Takes about an hour to play.* much harder to 'cheat' as the computer does all the work for you.Cons:* Only 4 players* takes the learning of 'math/money' away from the player.* hard to tell who has the most money unless you are the 'banker'.  wish everyone had their own banking controller to see where each player is at financially.* when you 'mortgage' your properties to pay a debt to another player the other player automatically gets your property.  I  wish you can still hold on to it but just not collect 'rent' until you paid for it again. Or at least it should go back to the bank until someone lands on it to buy it.* Way too much work to keep track of how many houses are on each property at any given time.  The houses move as people roll the dice on the board.  Maybe there could be pegs in the board to keep them in place.* no more Railroads or Utility companies.* the player's "bank cards" are cardboard.  One of ours is already bent.  These really should be plastic as they are used for EVERYTHING!* you no longer have to buy houses for your property.  When anyone, including yourself, lands on a property that is owned it automatically increases the rent.Interesting concept but needs a lot of work.  I gave it 3 stars because my kids love playing this game.  I would have given it 1 star.

review_title: It is one of the best purchases I have made for my family
review_description: I am a die hard classic Monopoly player, so I was a bit hesitant to purchase the Ultimate. It is one of the best purchases I have made for my family. We have played this almost every night since we got it a week or so ago. We love it!! Only wish more players could play at one time but other than that it's amazing!! The speed of this game gives you a chance to play multiple rounds. It's fast, fun and a nice change from the classic. Never thought I would ever say that!! Thanks for making our vacation that much more fun!!!

Its a shamed, i bougth it for my son and it never works, the electronic unit doesnt recongnize the cards, and didnt make the sounds( car,plane, ship, helip) i did reset the unit, but it didnt work for me.  Just the beep and a  0 appears, i placed the cards and it didnt do anything. So we have buy a bunch of pretty unuseful cards.

review_title: A fun change but not as good as the original
review_description: A lot of fun but very different from regular monopoly. Games are much faster and you dont have to think about how much money you have or buying houses. The game automatically does it for you. In regular monopoly you need to own all the same color to build but this moves your property up levels regardless of how many people own the same color properties. We find ourselves playing the original monopoly much more often than this.

review_title: Very fun and a great addition to regular Monopoly.
review_description: It took us a little bit to get used to how this game works. But, once we figured it all out, it was really fun to play! It's different than your standard Monopoly. But, the game moves along faster and you don't have to keep track of your money and such. It's really pretty fun! It doesn't replace standard Monopoly. But, it's a great addition.

Hated this version!!! All the fun is lost when you have to futz around with the scanning device. We have played the other version with the credit cards but this one is different. The cards are cardboard and the game pieces are cheap plastic. There are only 4 game pieces which is weird. The scanning device screws up a lot which basically stops the game till you read the manual and try to solve the problem. Annoying. This version has no railroads or utilities either which is strange.The device ends the game for you which is not fun either. Basically a no go in my opinion.

review_title: Would like traditional Monopoly with some of these rules to shorten timeframe.
review_description: I can't decide if I like this or not. On one hand the game plays much faster than traditional Monopoly, but on the other hand when playing with younger kids it hard to avoid confusion having to do everything through the handheld device. I think I'd prefer these rules to shorten traditional monopoly but with a manual/human banker. This seems like a novelty that wore off quickly the third or forth time we had to try and undo something on the handheld. At one point it froze up on us and so the game was just over...

I didn't mind that this game wasn't like the old Monopoly.  I thought it might be easier and fun to play with the bank card machine, but it was a mess. It was annoying to keep swiping the cards, and if you didn't do it in the right order it got all screwed up. Everything went downhill when we realized the machine wasn't keeping track of who owned what property, and I was VERY careful about which card I swiped when a property was purchased. The money wasn't right either. Payments for rent weren't showing up on the accounts. Also the houses fly everywhere if you're not careful with the dice because there is nothing to hold them down.  I thought this would be easier and more fun to play, but it just caused a lot of tears and frustration. I do not recommend this game.

There are so many versions of Monopoly, and we always add a handful of house rules when we play...This version however, with the electronic bank that keeps track of each player's account as well as the cost of rent on each property, really simplifies the whole thing. You just tap the property card, then tap the player's credit card, and rent or purchase price is automatically deducted. The chance cards add some fun changes, plus there are location spaces on the board where you can pay to relocate anywhere on the board, which is very useful. There's no trading option (that we could tell) and we didn't have a chance to try the auction feature.All in all, it was fun, more simple than our usual Monopoly games, and I actually liked using the electronic gadget rather than paying "cash" and making change all the time. The little house pieces are completely wasted in this version, and should have just been left out since the electronic device keeps track of every property's price. A different marker system for the board would be useful, since the houses bounce around and don't stay where they're supposed to be.

Plastic piecesNo railroadsNo community chestNo chanceDont get to buy houses.The "bankers box" died after several laps round the board even though they were brand new batteries before we started playing this game for the first time, shut off resetting the entire game' and apparenrly for no reason because it turned back on with all of the game reset..... im returning this.Dont waste your money.

review_title: Too modern not as fun as original
review_description: This game was okay. The modern aspect of it with the banking card seemed cool which made me want to buy it but once I played it was confusing to figure out and I just felt the whole game I was just tapping my card on the unit rather than the original monopoly I'm used to where we exchange money and are more interactive and into the game with physical money. Taking away the physical money was a mistake. With this version it seemed a little boring as an adult and I didnt feel like I was actually playing a game with buying and selling property, rather just sitting back and tapping a card when it was my turn. It took the whole fun out of counting your money and buying property. Way too modern for me. Some games are supposed to be left as classics. Stick to the original if you ask me.

review_title: A faster game for Monopoly lovers...
review_description: My kids are board game Fanatics... the problem is they like to play all hours of the day including right after I get home from work. 😧  I'm all for a good board game but traditional Monopoly game tends to be a 2-hour + game.  This is an introductory four player game with easy to follow instruction & traditional visual elements. What I like this version is the physical money is gone ( cuts down on the cheating!) clean up is a bit faster and its little bit more organized to set up (ALL THE LOST PIECES! 😭)Original Monopoly has been a little tricky for my 7 year old to understand.. he gets bored after about 30 minutes and I'm usually stuck finishing his side of the board. This version has a credit card to use  and is all electronic . There are some sound effects and he is very excited to swipe his card to collect his $200!  An average game Monopoly ultimate banking takes us about 45 minutes to an hour which is awesome when you're dealing with small children who have a short attention span. I definitely recommend this game for kids who are eager to play Monopoly but feel overwhelmed by the multiple pieces, money management as well as event cards. This levels the playing field for all players so that everybody feels like they have an even chance to win, not just the hardcore Monopoly strategist.

review_title: Faster, cooler, but only four players.
review_description: So this is a pretty good game, and actually it doesn't seem to last as long as normal monopoly because when you land on a place you either have to buy it or auction it, the money is kept track of with the little computer card reader provided by the game.  It keeps track of everything, money, properties, how many houses on each property etc.  The cards are rather fun (no community chest cards, just chance cards) and when you scan the card(s) it does all the guesswork for you including taking money from one player in order to pay another player. The property rent prices are STEEP...for example if you land on Atlantic Ave, ( I think) and it has five houses on it, rent will set you back around $1300.  But don't worry about not having the money to pay, if you don't just scan your card and it will deduct the amount you owe the other player as well as you having to sell one of your properties to pay the difference.  It keeps track of who owns what properties, so there is no cheating when it comes to the bank and how much a player is supposed to pay, etc. There are no utilities or railroads, instead, there are 'location' spaces that enable you to pay $100 to move to any property in order to buy it.  Get out of jail now costs $100.  Overall it's a good game, the only thing I have a complaint about is that it is only a four-player game.  I was super disappointed when I saw that because we are a family of five so someone either has to sit out, or double up with another player.  Like I said, great game and I'm glad Monopoly has evolved from the initial game which last entirely too long.  It would be nice to have more players.  Another good Monopyly game is Monopoly Speed.  It literally last 10 minutes so you can play multiple times without getting too frustrated.

Game moves quickly and electronic sounds are funny; however, there is no point to the houses and it doesn't make a difference if you have 1 or all of the properties of a particular color. Also, it's hard to keep track of how much money you have unless you constantly look at the electronic monitor. The 1-5 "levels" on each property should have ridges to hold the houses (just as markers) so you know which level rent the property is at and so the houses don't shift all over the board when you roll the dice or when anything moves.  It's fun, but not as fun as the original. Easier to play and less challenging. I just bought properties, sat back and collected rent as players landed on my property and as rent increased when I landed on my own property. There is also no "free parking" pot of money. The challenge cards are pretty funny.

review_title: Classic game with a new twist!
review_description: Actually this is a nice edition, it is a good digital assistant when it comes to playing the part of the banker!  It keeps track of many of the tasks which in previous versions were done manually.  It makes a perfect gift as well!  Classic game, new twist!PLEASE NOTE: If you appreciated this review please give it a “thumbs up/like” your helping me to continue to give honest/unbiased insight into products I’ve used and you may have questions about. Interested in a product but don't know enough about it and would like it reviewed? Please let me know and I'll see what I can do... Thank you 🙏

I purchased this monopoly board game for my ten year old daughter and I to play together.  I thought for her first monopoly a digital would be so much easier.  However; after messing with it several times I realized the instructions were not as easy as we thought.Once we finally learned how to use it, it became my daughter's favorite game.  She much rather play with this one than the original one which I also purchased after this one because we were struggling on how to figure out how to play it.  I think overall;  I recommend this item because once you get the hang of it you can play more than one round of game because it goes a lot faster than if you were to  play the regular traditional monopoly game.The machine that adds up each players money, properties etc is so convenient and easy to use now.  It keeps track of everyone money and therefore makes the game go by faster and accurately.  I am very pleased with this purchase.

review_title: bit of a learning curve but lots of fun.....
review_description: There's a bit of a learning curve at first but once you get the hang of it, there is a lot of fun to be had. The family gathered around for a day of board games and this was one of the new ones we tried. I like the fact that the bank keeps track of everything. Each player is assigned a card and matching token, and once you start buying properties or paying rent to others the bank adds, subtracts, and keeps track of how much you're worth and which properties you own.  No more trying to calculate how much rent is owed or how much change to return. For those who like the paper, this might not be their cup of tea but I would still suggest giving it a try. My dad is 82yrs young, and an avid monopoly player from back in the day and even he loved it. Oh by the by, always remember to compare prices when you have the chance, I bought this here from Amazon.com because it was the best price compared to stores nearby.

review_title: nice but not the traditional game
review_description: I bought this as a smart game for my kid, although it is nice to play and faster than the old fashion game it have been losing most of its peculiarities regarding the concept of investments, market value, negotiations and growing a business. everything is managed by the electronic unit and leaves no room for negotiations, while the rent adds up every time somebody steps in your property instead of when you upgrade it investing money in it.Have been very upset once I found out all these changes that made it faster but at the same time useless for learning something.

You are unable to know what money you have left in the card, also if you where mistakenly charged twice there is no way to turn back a transaction. It's like what I think buying bitcoins should have felt. Preffer the original and even better the jr versions. Totally not for little kids, WORST OF ALL YOU HAVE A LASER LIGHT COMING OUT FROM THE BANKING MACHINE POINTING YOUR EYES ALL THE GAME WHICH I SINCERELY BELIEVE MIGHT BE PERJUDICIAL FOR THE EYES NOT TO SAY FOR THE KIDS EYES. WASTED MONEY

Was hesitant to buy this game...since I knew my kids would make me play it with them ;)  it’s actually a really fun game for the whole family. Still mononolpy fun- but different and faster than the original. Very happy with purchase! Would buy again and recommend!!

I originally thought I was buying the original electronic banking version of Monopoly, but this game uses various cards that have different scan images that are used to scan on the infrared little scanner box that comes with the game. It is confusing at first but a great idea. I think there is still some work that needs to be done to improve this version of the game because it should be quick and not as complicated when playing the game. It is very easy to forget to switch a player when scanning a card to play and it ruins the whole excitement of getting good and bad community chest/chance cards between players.

Con:  No mathematical skills needed (or barely...) as the banking machine does all the calculations.Neat little machine with only three buttons, but with various combinations of keystrokes it does a lot more than I thought possible.Much faster game than the old classic monopoly, which is nice!Somehow, the board feels less cluttered, more straightforward.  Sharp bright colors, bank machine working well, bank cards seem sturdy, playing cards averagely so.  Overall great fun game, even my toddler loves feeding cards into the machine!Another con:  the machine "talks" in beeps and sounds, and for the adult trying to get some thinking done in the same house, it gets annoying after a while!

review_title: A great, quick, and streamlined version of Monopoly.
review_description: There is a lot of fun to be had with this game if you are one of those casual Monopoly players that want a different way to play while also having a great electronic banking unit keep track of all your money and property values for you. But there are some rule changes to some of the core mechanics and other new stuff to be aware of.- You CANNOT trade properties with other players, unless game effects do otherwise.- When in jail, you DO NOT collect rent from others or raise the rent. It is a MANDATORY rule in this version.- There is no utilities or R.R.s in the game. There is a new go anywhere space if you pay 100. Doing this, you DO NOT pass GO.- Event cards replace community chest and chance cards. They vary in different effects.- No houses or hotels can be bought. Instead, you use a house on the property when purchased to track rent levels that increase from other players and even you landing on them. They also increase when all the properties of a color set is purchased, even if it's a split Monopoly. (Ex: Player 1 has two orange and player 2 just bought the 3rd orange. That will cause all the orange properties to go up one rent level. Two levels if it's a solo player monopoly.) and event cards that can also raise or even lower rent.- When in the negative, you sell your properties for face value to the player you owe money to. The rent level stays where it is. (If you owe the bank, it'll remove the rent tracker)- The game ends when ONE player goes bankrupt (indicated by a siren horn from the unit) and then totals up all player remaining money and property values. The highest amount is the winner.Pros- Banking unit is very easy and fun to use. Keeps track of everything really well.- No need for a banker. Everyone can be involved.- Less game components to worry about losing.- Plays quicker than a regular game of MonopolyCons- Device will need batteries (3 AAA) and a screw driver to remove the battery door.- Only up to 4 players instead of the usual up to 6.- Mover tokens are a cheap plastic.This version of Monopoly is really great for those who want to play a quicker game while an electronic device keeps track of everything for them in-game. So for the Monopoly purists, this is definitely not the version for you. But give it a try when you can. You may be surprised.

review_title: No more excuses to not play Monopoly
review_description: I used to always say no to Monopoly. It is such a long game, someone's always whining about not having as much money as someone else, and someone has to do double duty and play banker. This iteration takes most of that out - the game usually doesn't take too long due to the nature of rent increasing just from landing on the space, you aren't constantly reminded visually that your sister has way more money than you, and the computer does the banking for you. There is a little bit of a learning curve - I still have to ask the kids which button to push for certain actions. It is a good conversation starter about how spending money via a card feels different than using cash and how we can lose track easily without a visual representation of how low our account it getting.

review_title: took the fun out of it
review_description: While my grandsons (aged 10 and 12) loved the game, I felt all the financial thinking was taken out of the game.  The challenge of seeing cash accumulated.  I never once looked at how much money I had in the automated machine because it would tell me when I was broke.  In the "cash" Monopoly the fun was in watching the money and actually seeing yourself go broke.  I am sure it is a generational thing since nowadays plastic money is the way to go and no one uses cash.  Better to get Dave Ramsey's game which teaches a more financial side of things.

review_title: We liked nothing about this version. Waste.
review_description: This game is going straight into the garbage. We didn't like the modified rules, the "banking" machine was old fashioned and clunky. This may have been cool in 1995 but this is just silly. We really can't understand why this has such great reviews. The gameplay was never smooth because every 5 minutes, we were referring to the instructions: "How do we auction a property?" "How do we sell them?" Just get the original version.

review_title: Fun. Quick. Does not replace traditional monopoly.
review_description: The positive is that its a good twist on Monopoly that makes the game alot faster and is actually enjoyable with just 2 people. The bad is that the banking cards are cardboard, the pieces look cheap, and the whole game in total looks like a budget knockoff.As far as players who enjoy the traditional game which I count myself as one this will be fairly different than what you'd expect, there is no trading which is a big part of what separated players and there is very little to no strategy instead it's just a luck of the dice game.

review_title: Fun game without the long playing time!
review_description: This was a lot of fun for our family. Our kids are teens and really like the original version so we wanted to try something different. i most appreciate 2 key things: 1- no physical money and everything is digital from money to rent calculation and payments. 2- this game is SO much shorter than the original version. once the first person goes bankrupt it's over and the winner is the player with the most money between cash (digital cash) and property value. worth the price we paid for sure. nice spin on the original.

review_title: Learning curve to play then total blast
review_description: My family was bitching up a storm that I bought the new version. They wanted all the old school back so the pressure was on people! We struggled figuring out how to use the bank card thingy, but a quick you tube tutorial gave us the boost to play. The instructions were only useful for new rules and such.4 of us played over & over & over because it was so fun, quick and we laughed about our competitiveness. I totally recommend. Only downside is only 4 players allowed so we all had to take turns playing:

This was really fun. However, it did take reading the directions a few times while playing to understand how it works. It does eliminate the ability to make up rules which I am sure mine is not the only family who does this. It also shortens the game which is not necessarily a bad thing. We played the first time during Thanksgiving after dinner. The greatest problem with this game is you can only have four players. It would be great if there were at least as many players allowed as the original Monopoly. This is the only reason I did not give it 5 stars.

This is a great game for up to four. If you are tired of the never-ending original monopoly, this is it for you. Games can end quickly, sometimes way too soon and it makes you want to replay right away. No cash handling, special effects sounds and the machine tracking all transactions make this a winner. Does it have any cons? Sure, when it says you have a nasty cough, the sound effect is 'sneezing'. Whoever came up with that? LOL.Great game and highly recommended.

My game was just delivered and I wanted to review the Amazon Wharehouse purchase. ( Not about game or game play). Game was listed as Like New and it is! The box was still shrink wrapped except for one corner, only slightly unwrapped.  However, everything inside was still wrapped and sealed.  If you want to save some money, you can't go wrong with Amazon Wharehouse buy. They always have accurate description about why a product is discounted. You will definitely get your money's worth and in my experience more than that.

The original tended to wear down after a lot of use. I was hoping this one was more reinforced, but so far it is holding together. The parts are fine, I just get confused sometimes with the colors that match between the rent spaces the houses and such.  a little more color differentiation would have helped. and the timing on sleep mode needs to be a bit longer.EAsy to learn: the instructions are there they just a need a little more order.Value for money: $15 need I say more. IT is cheap for a board game with more than tech than the original.

review_title: A Faster-Paced, Perhaps Less Strategic, Monopoly.
review_description: The game is vastly different from the original Monopoly, beware. The design of the game is beautiful with the black and gold emphasis. The credit card system is amazing! Every card in this game swipes, even properties. There is no more community chest and chance but simply chance. All the money tracking is done automatically. The rent system is different and hotels are no longer a thing.

The electronic Monopoly game isn’t really an upgrade. The properties bend super easy, bank cards bend super easy. Game pieces are ugly cheap plastic.If you roll small you could be out of money quickly. Property rent is almost the price of the property not $10, $20, or $50 but rather $200, $300... kids kept landing on my properties and the game decided it was over when I hit $2200 and my 10 year old mortgaged her first property to pay me.

review_title: First of all - I HATE Monopoly BUT.....
review_description: this version is much better than the original. The original would go on and on and on. I just always found it tedious. My son always asks to play Monopoly but I have refused to have it in my house all these years. BUT with STAYING AT HOME, we have gone thru so many games and even taught him some Old Skool card games, I relented to get a Monopoly game. Choose the Ultimate Banking edition to attempt a better game-playing option. I am currently enjoying this one!! It's much faster and easy to play. So far, I'm finally enjoying a Monopoly game.

My son is one of those kids that loves loves loves monopoly.  He wanted this version and the cheaters edition for christmas.  I got this one and he absolutely loves it!  The nice part is that the game goes quicker so you don't have hours or days long games going on.  Once you learn how to do the banking part, it's a breeze and goes fast.  Cleaner since there aren't parts and money everywhere.  I would recommend to anyone!  Very fun!

review_title: The game is worth having fun.
review_description: This game is worth it. Have to say am impress in how the box came in a perfect condition. The parts were all there and the electronic banking works extremely well. The seller and Amazon did a  great job. Thanks a lot.

He played this with friends, and he loved it. We looked in the stores for it but only found it here. I was actually surprised on the price. I found it very reasonable. We have played it many times and the whole family has a blast. Its easy for younger kids to learn and the games are pretty quick. Ours tend to last 30-40 mins.

This game was hilarious. We played it at a Thanksgiving gathering with 20 family members ranging in age from 7 to adults (no age necessary). We never laughed so loud and argued so much about who started singing first. We also argued about whether it was a song or not. Of course it was friendly arguing.
