There was one team that was doing the best due to my partners Dad, she was 7, but his partner was her grandpa and he was bragging about how well they were doing. She said to me, "I don't think Grandpa should be bragging, my Dad is the one that knows all the songs". Out of the mouths of babes. One comment is that we liked the Spontuneous cards so much we were using them more often, rather then just when you landed on the clef. One of just a very few games were you could involve young children, adults, and grandparents and all have a good time. Brilliant game, you should be proud of your invention.

Just buy the original monopoly. There's also another cashless monopoly that's more like the original. The card scanner is loud and annoying. This game doesn't have Chance or Community chest cards. The "location" spaces are a dumb addition. Someone should tell the manufacturers "if it ain't broke, dont fix it." This version is trash. Batteries not included, by the way. And you'll need a tiny screwdriver to install them.

review_title: It took some getting use to.
review_description: This maybe a spoiler... The game is Monopoly so you can't really not like it. This version however did need to grow on us. I bought this for my boyfriend as a Christmas gift. We like the fact that there is no money but all disagreements that people are stealing from the bank are avoided. The special play cards aren't really that interesting and most of them give you the same option to  level up your property which makes the game go by really fast.

Unlike most people, it seems, I have always enjoyed monopoly and it’s ability to bring out the worst in your friends and family. This version is great, too. Not only are you not cleaning up all of the money at the end, but the unit does everything for you. I played last night for the first time after it arrived (yesterday, as well) and it was the quickest game of monopoly I have ever played. Even with reading the instructions, it only took about an hour. For the weak of heart, this version is ruthless and I lost properties due to rent like four times. I would get ahead, then destroyed by rent again and it was a revolving door of “I've got this!” And “There’s no way I could win at this point” until I met my own demise after about six/eight rounds around go. If you’re on the edge, just buy the game. It’s totally worth it.

I bought this for my eldest son. He got onto playing Monopoly with my wife and I (our youngest has now joined) and it has brought a lot of fun into playing games together.This was the next logical step for him, and I know he's going to love this as he has been asking constantly for it.Packaging was in great condition.Here's to many hours of fun!

review_title: Made for older kids, but still fun.
review_description: I bought this for my younger boys (5&7) yes I ignored the age recommendation, and it's a little too complicated for them. They REALLY enjoy monopoly Jr so I thought this would be a great treat, but it went over there heads. That said in a few years I think it will be a hit.

I bought a pack for my girl as the birthday present. Opened it 1 week after. There's no dice or any house which is supposed to be 22 of them. Can't use it as a game set. And also since I bought the game 2 months ago that I can't return or complain about it!  Strongly suggest no buy!

review_title: My 7 and 8 year-old grandsons love the game
review_description: However, I must state my disappointment in the quality of the pieces.  The "men" and the card-swiper are made of pathetically cheap plastic.  One would think it would be simple to exchange the men for any other objects, but it isn't so simple in the high-tech version of the classic Monopoly game.  We'll see how long it lasts.  In the meantime, as i stated in my header, the kids are enjoying.

review_title: Played every week for game night
review_description: This game is amazing! We play it almost every week for game night. It’s super simple to assemble and super easy to learn. Makes the whole paper cash a thing in the past. You can actually finish the game in one sitting instead of trying to count cash and figuring out who wins. The automatic teller tells you who wins and when someone goes bankrupt also notifies you. This product would be an amazing gift to gift to someone. Definitely gift able item. The board game definitely is thick like any other monopoly board games.

I've played many flavors of Monopoly.  I always find the versions with electronic banking to be more excited to play.  I really enjoyed playing this version as it's a bit more fast-paced compared to the other versions. The electronic banking system is very cool and everyone enjoys buying and passing go.  I highly recommend this series ..Lot's of fun!

The actual game board is barely thicker than thick paper. Im not one to complain and write negative reviews. I purchased thinking it would be like the regular thick cardboard game board of my childhood. But they've gone cheap. This board is really flimsy and cheap and isn't even a great beginner set for children, in my opinion, because it won't last long. Not worth the price.

review_title: I would be embarrassed to donate them for a Christmas Toy Drive
review_description: I read the bad reviews and was skeptical. I purchased two boxes for a Christmas Toy Drive. Very very disappointing, I would be embarrassed to donate these the quality is so poor. AND now I am being told that I cannot return them!!They are wafer thin ( like those vanilla wafer cookies) and are made of pressboard. ( Pressman is the brand name)I don’t have a stove or fireplace to burn them in and I live in Florida so it wouldn’t help anyway with heat for the winter (LOL)I did email Amazon about not being able to return them so maybe there is hope.Bottom line they aren’t worth a dollar at the dollar store.

review_title: Not at all what I was expecting, expected a half way decent version, price should be a clue.
review_description: I guess our expectations were a lot higher than they should have been. Saw the box and it was the same box as when we were kids except now it is so cheap. The board sits flat on the table so marbles will just roll off all the time. The board is made out of cardboard that is thinner than a cereal box and it is folded into quarters with a slit down half of it to fold better. This allows for the board to spread when trying to play allowing marbles to go all over the place.Spend the extra money and get a better version, not even worth attempting on this one.

review_title: Smaller than expected, and felt like plastic....
review_description: I was a little disappointed when these arrived today. I bought them for my daughter, who commented on how small they were. I am in total agreement. These are definitely NOT the "large" , solid hardwood dominoes  that was advertised. They felt more plastic than anything, and were a lot smaller than expected. Listen to the reviews on this one folks. Not worth it. The paint job on these were terrible, and nothing like the original Dominoes that I grew up playing with.

It was cheap, so I wasn't expecting more than a cardboard surface and plastic marbles ... the marbles are actually glass, which I appreciate, but the cardboard is so flimsy that it bows under the weight of the marbles. You can still play the game, but don't bump it or they'll all roll!
These were terrible. They arrived splintery. Very cheaply made. They didn’t even send us the black stick. Theyre already in the trash.
The are super tiny and not for adults - spend the extra money and by the professional size. Also, you cannot return them so DO NOT BUY!

review_title: The Board Is WRONG! This Is NOT Pahrcheesi, But A Bad Immitation!
review_description: Besides being cheap and flimsy as other people have said (and the pieces are tiny), more importantly, THE BOARD IS DESIGNED INCORRECTLY; it shows incorrect Safety/Home zones -- and they're colored, so there's no mistaking that.Here's a link for the original board: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00134MJWE/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1. I grew up with this very same board, which is great. LOOK AT THE IMAGE. The picture shows the yellow pieces in the Start zone. There's one yellow piece in the Safety zone, which is to the left of -- and AFTER -- the Start zone. That's the way the game's played!This game presumably has you only go three quarters of the way around the board, because the Safety/Home zone is BEFORE the Start zone.If you can afford it, spend the extra $14 on the REAL game. and disregard this one. You can always keep your eyes on the lookout for a used board....

review_title: They measure 1.72" x .86" x .23"  Good dominos - great for the price
review_description: Actual dimensions are 1.72" x .86" x .23", which is very slightly below (about 1/32 of an inch smaller) than1 3/4 x 7/8 x 1/4.  These are the only wooden dominos I've seen except for a set my parents have had since the 1970s.  Comparing these to those, the '70s set seem a little bit better, as my parents' are made from harder and heavier wood (almost feel like metal), with more defined engraving on both the front and back, and more clearly painted dots.  This Pressman set is more what I would expect a wooden domino to look like if I had never seen "really good ones" before.  And both sets are about the same size, which puts them in a tie for the smallest dominos I've ever used.  And if you want lightweight, these are very light.  The cardboard box is oversized (4" x 6" x 1 5/8") - the dominos just rattle around in it loosely, which detracts from them being well suited for traveling.  You could pack the dominos neatly stacked into a box that is 3 1/2" x 1 3/4" x 1 1/4".  If you made a box like that, this would be an awesome travel set or even a pocket-sized set, which is what I intend to do.  They're nice.  And they are consistent enough that I don't expect to be able to recognize specific dominos from the back unless I were to specifically try to learn that.  I feel nostalgic about them already and am very happy I bought them.

review_title: Pretty much Like I remember but . . . . ..
review_description: Pretty much Like I remember but . . . . .. the cardboard is a bit thinner and the chess and checker pieces are made out of a thinner plastic then they were made with back in the 80's. Like they say, "They don't make things like they use to." But even with that said it is still a good deal. All 3 games in one. And You can't put a Price Tag on Memories. It is PRICELESS. Back in the day I don't know if you could get all 3 games together. I do know that you could get them separate because I remember helping the Park Rec Coach tape the boxes back when i was a L.I.T. [Leader In Training].  When I was a Kid and just remember going to the Local Rec Park and playing, A LOT as well. We were poor and never got one of our own. I don't know if this is the same brand of way back when but it sure does look like it. Nor do I know the price of back then. Oh and the Box is also made of a thinner cardboard as well. But it all good. This is our 2nd one like this because of moving and other people not respecting other ppls things. But we will enjoy this one with care just as much as we enjoyed the other one. The Memories with this Brand New set have already began. hehehe. My 2 youngest Boys that are still home are ages 10-1/2 and 9. This is a total Classic but still winning and filling Our Hearts. <3

review_title: I was disappointed to find that the most valuable stick (black) was ...
review_description: I was really excited about this purchase and introducing the game to my students. I ordered the game over the summer and didn't open it until about 2 months later when the school year began. While explaining how to play the game to a couple of children, I was disappointed to find that the most valuable stick (black) was missing even before the game had even been played. Unfortunately, the return window for the product is closed, and I'm now stuck with an incomplete game.

review_title: JUNK... Woodgrain Clings & Makes This Game Impossible
review_description: The traditional pickup sticks from when I was a child were lightweight, thin, perfectly rounded, perfectly pointed plastic that was really fun to play because you could actually pick up the sticks without others moving. These “new and improved”, ahem, wooden sticks just simply don’t work. Regardless of how well-sanded and smooth they are, it is nearly impossible to pick any up without moving others because woodgrain clings to woodgrain. Mayyyyybe if they were much smaller and lighter weight they would work in wood, but these make the game impossible to play properly. Junk.

review_title: You get what you pay for.
review_description: I bought this item with plans to teach my children how to play checkers, chess, and backgammon. Because the price was so low, I will not be as upset when they inevitably lose pieces. The pieces are cheap plastic, but will easily serve their purpose. The board however leaves something to be desired. It is so thin, that I expect it to be torn after a very short period of time. The board appears to be thinner than standard poster board. Instruction page that comes with the game is fairly acceptable except for the backgammon instructions which are pretty vague. With all of this said, I still feel it will still work for teaching my children how to play all three games, and we will purchase another more durable and expensive set as the get older and more responsible.

I was in NYC recently and visited a Greenwich Village boutique that had a wonderful wall tiled in dominoes. I was completely taken with the look, and decided then and there that I would do the same when I returned home to Tucson. After some experimentation, I chose black dominoes with white dots and began searching for the right ones for my project. To tile the backsplash area of my kitchen, I wanted to use double-nine dominoes for the variety it would produce in the pattern overall. When I began shopping around, I quickly discovered that many of the cheaper imports have no quality control and half the dominoes in any box were unusable, either because they were chipped or because of overprinting. I realized I should just head to Amazon, and found these Pressman dominoes which are absolutely fabulous. They are each the exact same size, and not a single one was overprinted in all the boxes I ordered! While I realize this may not be a traditional use for these game tiles, I couldn't be happier with the results!

This version is exactly what I was looking for. Something inexpensive to help the kids learn how to play. The pieces are thin plastic, so they are light; and the board is a little bit thinner than I expected, but works just fine. Three games for under $10, so again, basically what I figured it would be.

review_title: Deeply Disappointed with how they Bundled this
review_description: As a child pressman checker/chess/backgammon boards were all over.  They were good little starter sets and were made just as well as other kids games.  Alas this is no longer the case.  Here are my problems with it:- The box it comes in is to thin and it has those cardboard sharp edges.- The game board is way thinner than the old ones and seems like slightly thicker than poster board (like another reviewer said).  I looks like they printed a sheet with the squares on it and then glued it to the cardboard. Cheap, cheap.- The checkers are cheaper plastic and not as substantial.  They are easily knocked around.- The Chess pieces were ok and again not substantial so easily knocked over.  My set was incomplete. I was missing a black knight and had an extra bishop.- The board is not slippery so the pieces do not slide nicely.- The board and pieces are made in China.  Not that China makes all bad things, but it appears they bid this out to the Cheapest bidder and it shows.I normal do not write a lot of reviews, but if you are like me and remember the original pressman boards this will disappoint.Hope this helps

My 9-year-old could not move without knocking other marbles over most of the time. The board was too flimsy for his spazzed out hands. While I never knocked any marbles loose, my 13-year occasionally did as well. Unless you have really steady hands, the marbles will roll when you move. It makes it hard to play on this board. Because he moved them almost every turn, I recycled the board after one game making the board a waste of money. As the marbles have some value, I did not rate this 1-star. These are not high quality marbles as expected given the price, so you'd be better off purchasing marbles separately and trying to get a better deal if you are only purchasing this for the marbles. If you are purchasing for the board, good luck. You're going to need it.

review_title: board is folded CARDBOARD/marbles are PLASTIC
review_description: This was a very inexpensive item/You get what you pay for/ Board is made of thin CARDBOARD/ "marbles" are PLASTIC.

I ordered two sets for my vacation rental homes. I liked the fact that it came with three game options:  checkers, chess and backgammon, however the quality is very poor and it wouldn't have lasted long. The box is made of very flimsy corrugated cardboard. The game board is made of thin cardstock and it doesn't lie flat. It's more of a game "card" than a game "board." I would have paid a few dollars more for a thicker and more durable game board and box. I returned both sets. I wouldn't have kept this set for my family, much less a vacation rental. Not recommended.

review_title: I love this game, but regret buying this set
review_description: I was so excited to share my love of Chinese Checkers with my kids, but when the package arrived I was quite disappointed. The "marbles" don't match the colors on the board. The board is just a flat and extremely thin piece of cardboard that barely holds the marbles in place. It is so easy to knock them off. I would recommend spending a little more extra money to get a set you can actually enjoy playing.

review_title: No vale la pena comprarlo de cartón
review_description: Bien ligero pero cuando lo abrí estaba doblado.

Very low quality product. After making an additional search on Amazon, I find a wood board for about the same price. The board in this set is like thick cardstock and holds the folds, so marbles roll everywhere. The board in the photo on the box and in the Amazon listing is different from what you get. All pieces were included, so it gets 2 stars. I recommend a different product.
Please my recommendation is improve item repacking

You get what you pay for! This is a great first set for my 6 & 8 yr old sons. They are loving chess and checkers. Backgammon not so much, but who honestly likes that game? The set is definitely very cheap. It's essentially very thick card stock doubled over. But it's holding up well and i do not regret this purchase at all! We'll get a few years out of it for sure. The boys love chess enough that the next set will be nicer, but this is a great first set without knowing if they'd like chess.

I knew this game set was a budget set wasnt expecting much in quality. I just wanted a few cheap sets for my high school students to play when they eat lunch in my room. It has three games in one. The board is laminated card stock so you have to gentle with it.  Not quality enough to gift, but will work for light game play.

review_title: Do not order this game! Cheaply made garbage!
review_description: Board game only comes wrapped in plastic. The box was damaged. No pieces were missing but the game is so cheaply made it will never last. Please take my advice and buy this game at a store or at least a more expensive one. Do not order this one! I returned it as soon as I got it.

These are the best made pick up sticks I have seen. They are made of strong wood and very colorful. I use these with math facts, vocabulary, etc. Students answer a question before they have a chance to pick up a stick. At the end of the game, math skills are required to find each student's score. This is the number one requested game in my first through fifth grade resource room.  Very surprising with all the technology we offer.

A fun game for when the grandkids visit.  They always ask to play a game of pick up sticks when they come.  I feel it builds dexterity, eye/hand coordination and concentration skills.  I like the sturdy storage container it comes with.  A hit all around, and I'm hoping it helps wean my grandson from his video game addiction!

I purchased these dominoes as a prop.  For my purposes they will work.  I noticed several negative reviews which did make me hesitant to buy, but I decided that for $3 it was worth the risk.  Whether you want to buy these will depend on what you want to use them for.Details:Size: Quite small, ~1.5" x 1" (they are slightly larger than this on both sides, but I don't remember the exact quarter/eighth amounts)Color: for all reasonable purposes, black. This is all right for me, though I would have preferred if the dominoes were the color pictured.Material: It might be wood? through the black paint/stain you can see what looks like wood grain, but they don't Feel like wood. Maybe that is just due to the paint (or what ever they used)?Quality: despite being small not quite as I pictured them these feel like they will be sturdy dominoes. I set them up and they all balanced fine and made a typical domino chain. They do have a quieter sound when falling, which is nice.Back: The back does have the pressman logo on it, so if you want a blank back these aren't for you.Overall: I like them.  They aren't as perfect as I would like, but they are $3.  If I wanted super nice ones I would have gone for the other wooden domino set that costs $30. I posted some pictures so you can get a better idea of what these dominoes are like.

Marbled don't mach the colors on the board. The board will not lay flay no matter what you do.The worst thing is the marbles sit so high up, the slightly bump sends everything rolling like Hungry Hipos, ruining the game. After 5 tries we gave up.

Very disappointed.  Poor quality, poorly constructed, too light. Can't even stand them up to make those domino's mazes as they are too light and poorly cut.  Bought a bunch of boxes for my nephew for Christmas for him to learn Domino's and for him to play with and he cannot even use them.  Amazon was very nice and gave me a credit.

I love Chinese Checkers, but this specific set is awful. The board is foldable which means that one of the triangles is cut in half thereby making the board uneven. It is very easy to knock the balls off in the middle of the game. I would not recommend it.

Somehow I thought there'd be a third set of pieces for the backgammon board. It indicates the checkers pieces are for that, too. I suppose it does nicely about resourcefulness. Smaller and separate pieces would have suited me personally though since we have a different, little board collecting dust. Well, you win some...The chess pieces aren't too bad. A bit on the light plasticy side, functional though and are sized pretty well. They'll probably fall over if you're trying to play in a moving vehicle. Yet for a table game that you simply want to play or teach chess with and aren't worried about "quality," this is for you. Also comes with checkers that do stack (woohoo!) and a pair of dice, plus a list of other games you could try with these pieces. For roughly ten dollars on technically three games to start, I'd say this is a nice deal.The board is durable so it is flimsy, but it's not completely flat either. Cosmetically, a whole corner had a line of white that looked like the paint was scraped off. I'll upload a picture when I get around to it.To recap, a perfectly fuctional chess, checkers and backgammon set. I like the color scheme. On the plus side of being cheap, you could play with this until your pocket is ready for a more 'solid' set.Can't complain. Nothing missing or broken on arrival.[edit 7/14/15 -- Cat keeps knocking down the game pieces when we leave it on the table. So we know now he jumps up there regularly during the night.  Hey, kitty, share your strategy with one of us.

My wife and I are bored and, having watched Grantchester on PBS, we decided to try to learn Backgammon.  We bought this economical set to see if (a) we can learn the game, and (b) we like playing Backgammon.  This is the perfect set for that, plus it offers chess and checkers.  This allows us to decide without spending a lot of money.  If we like Backgammon, we will buy a more expensive set.  Again, this set is a perfect set for those who want to learn the game and play chess and/or checkers.

review_title: Game board will not lay flat because it is paper thin.
review_description: Not worth a penny! You'd be better off printing your own Pahrcheesi board at home. This board is thin as card stock. No matter what you do you will not be able to have the board lay flat. I've had it under heavy books for a week and it still remains warped. The light plastic game pieces cannot stand upright on the board because of it. I want my money back.

We received the game and the box was completely mauled. It seemed they kicked it all the way here. I had to find a way to store the game elsewhere. The game board had some damage to it as well. Not worth it.

I don't know why people were complaining about the size and quality of these. Read the description. Its exactly what it says it is.I needed something that wasn't color so my kids could quickly learn and actually recognize how many dots is what number. These are perfect. I'm actually planning on ordering more so we have a bigger set. :)

After reading some reviews I was hesitant to order this particular domino set, but I'm glad I did. I don't see any problem at all with the weight or size of this set in any way. We bought it for a game to play with grandkids and it will be perfect! Totally satisfied and definitely recommend.

review_title: This is a great way to store a high number of chess sets
review_description: This is meant to be a cheap chess set.  It is definitely made of cheap materials, which is totally expected.  I'm rating it low because something cheap should still be functional.  I ordered eight of these boards to use with students.  The boards all came warped.  They are so bent that they don't function effectively.  We attempted to bend them into a workable flatness, but are not having any luck.I gave it a two star because the pieces are acceptable, and the board does fold down and fit into a gallon bag.  This is a great way to store a high number of chess sets.  That said, I'm really hoping that the boards flatten out over time

We had a lot of fun playing this game Santa brought my six-year-old granddaughter. She was great at picking up the sticks with her little fingers, but adults enjoyed playing the game as well. It’s a great way to practice math skills, too.Although the colors are not uniform, various shades of green instead of one color of green for example, it’s not that big of a deal.

I get that it is cheap, I just had no idea how cheap the quality would be. I was at least expecting normal game-board quality out of the board itself. No luck there, it is just thick tag board. The chess pieces are small and hollow with no decent weighting to them and they have open bottoms. Returning it to buy a better quality set. I would pass unless you absolutely want the cheapest set available. If I saw this on a store shelf, I would have known immediately by the weight and cheap box it came in that it would be an absolute bust.

review_title: Pressman Toys Giant Pick Up Sticks
review_description: I like the size of the sticks and my older granddaughter loves them. I would also heed the recommendation that this is not for younger children 3 and under...the sticks are very sharp and could literally cause a problem if poked in an eye or other body part.  I would have given 5 stars if the sticks were not so sharp.

review_title: Obviously given the price this is a pretty bare-bones set (hollow plastic pieces
review_description: I bought this to use a cheap checkers/chess set to use with a kid I do autism therapy with. Obviously given the price this is a pretty bare-bones set (hollow plastic pieces, thin cardboard, etc.), but it gets the job done. The kid and I managed not to damage the board or pieces (and had fun!) so it'll probably work fine for you if you just need something cheap. Unlike other cheapo sets, this one is actually about the size of a normal checkers/chessboard. Great for broke public school teachers or people without the highest expectations.

I wasn't sure if my wife would like backgammon so I wanted a cheap game to introduce her to it. This is perfect for that. It is a cheaply made game, but accomplishes the goal of learning the game. Now that I know she likes the game, I can look at buying one of the much more expensive models.  I do wish they would have printed a checker board on the back.

review_title: Super thin cardboard makes this game nearly unplayable
review_description: Board is cut to the middle so it can fold into a square.  Board is very thin cardboard which does not lay flat when unfolded. Super cheaply made.

review_title: Works Fine/ Just Handle With Care ❤
review_description: Even though its thin cardboard for the bingo sheets etc. It is a beautiful design. The bingo peices are thick circular yellow plastic which is great. And the spinner is thin so just spin it lightly instead. And works fine and I'm an adult the description says sugested for younger age groups if I remember correctly. Works well for me and I'm happy with it!
This was the cheapest and most poor quality game of Chinese Checkers I have ever run across.  I found better luck at the dollar store.

review_title: Balls work great for Hungry Hungry Hippos lol
review_description: The checker board is flimsy cardboard, I wouldnt buy this particular Chinese checkers if you plan on using it for its purpose. However the plastic balls are great! I used them to replace the balls in our Hungry Hungry Hippos game and they work perfectly! Got 60 balls for $5. Whereas when you try and buy replacement balls made specifically for Hungry Hungry Hippos, it costs $10 for only 20 balls.

Do not and I repeat don't not buy. This game is on a piece of 1/16"cardboard. It is not worth anything and when you move marbles the board moves. This is something that you would get from the dollar tree.

review_title: How difficult is it to validate qty of pieces prior to taking my money?
review_description: Seriously if you can’t hire an 17 year old Intern to count/validate the number of pieces in a box you should not sell these.This is precisely why parents open up board games in the store to check pieces.

review_title: Love everything about it... except the game itself
review_description: This game was definitely made by fans.  The Delorean.  The Clocktower.  The fading picture.  It's all here.  Unfortunately this game is super swingy.  I've played plenty of difficult dice chuckers, from Elder Sign to Pathfinder Adventures, but this one seems exceptionally punishing.The game manual itself recommends that you spend early turns doing side objectives in order to build up extra powers for future turns.  Extra powers=more actions per turn.  The problem is, everything in the game (except for movement) is done with a dice roll and there is a 1/3 chance that you roll a Biff, which not only fails whatever it is you're doing, but also causes Biff to set you further behind.  So in the crucial first turns of the game you can complete challenges and gain 1 to 2 extra actions for future turns or you can fail the challenge, waste your turn, still be stuck with the starting 5 powers, have the trouble card messing up your game because you failed to clear it, AND have Biff set you further behind.Even fighting Biff is a dice roll, so if Biff is causing too much damage and you try to stop him, you can roll even more Biffs.  This can lead to a completely unwinnable situation within the first several turns. I had a two-player game where it ended with the love meter at -4 (the lowest it can go, you need 13-15 to win) AND the Delorean still in the starting space (we did get the 3 car parts at least).  That is not just losing the game, that is elderly grandpa fighting Mike Tyson levels of obliteration.  It was not even close.I've been trying out different house rules to figure out the best way to play it because the theme and components in the game are fantastic.  If you're a Back to the Future fan, pick this one up.  If you're looking for a good co-op game, try Horrified or Pandemic.

review_title: Great concept captures the essence of the movie
review_description: I love this game. Took a few attempts to understand all of the rules (and there are quite a few) but if you're a BTTF fan you will love this.

review_title: You will love this game win or lose!
review_description: I am a huge fan of both Back to the Future, and table top board gaming.  I am no stranger to games that are made out of an existing franchise.  Sometimes it is done very poorly, and sometimes it is done well.  This game does a good job!  When you turn a story into a game. You have to capture the essence, while not making it a boring game.  It can't be too word for word the movie, and it can't stray too far from the source material.It is clever to have Einstein and Jennifer join the group so you can have a 4 player game, and not have it restricted to 2 (Marty and Doc).  Unique abilities with each player make replay a must.  The randomness of the challenges, and perks you can acquire can really make the game a nail biter.  Our first play through it was down the wire.... and we lost!  I still had so much fun.  The board is a very cute representation of Hill Valley, even complete with pop up clocktower that doubles has a dice tower!!!! So well thought out.I love that as you continue to fail your main objectives, the iconic family photo begins to show Mary's family disappearing in a clever way.The components are nice, the Delorean is detailed, the character models are unique.  This game has a great art style that is it's own but pays a good homage to the artistic direction of the movies themselves.AND I CAN'T FORGET The rule book is disguised as the comic Tales from Space featured in the film!Even the board has a nice visual queue when opening for the first time as you get a nice shot of the flux capacitor.All in all this game is fun to play, follows the narrative well, and is a great cooperative experience for you and your friends/family.  Working together is what makes this game great!

review_title: Game of the Year (if you're a Back to the Future fanatic!)
review_description: Bought this game as a gift for my husband for Father's Day. It was a BIG hit and we had such a fun time playing it as a family.It's cooperative, so you're all on the same team working together to get George & Lorraine to fall in love, the DeLorean fixed up and into position in time for lightning to strike at 10:04pm, all while dodging Biff and his gang who are out making trouble.It's super theme-tastic, and we were up on our feet shouting at the dice by the end of the game. SO much fun!!

Theme alone is 5 stars. Combine that with excellent components (also 5 stars) and you really feel like you’re in the movie!Well you would feel like you’re in the movie if the film ended with Marty failing and disappearing out of existence in 1955. Gameplay is a 1 star. It is incredibly punishing for anyone that isn’t insanely lucky (which I’m not). The first play through (2 players) ended with the love meter at the starting spot, the delorean almost to Doc’s house (halfway to where it needs to be to win), and the only accomplishment being that we collected all 3 parts. Our second game (3 players) ended 3 rounds before the endgame when everyone quit because realistically there was no way to achieve a victory - we were just too far behind and every roll just set us back further. I don’t think this game was playtested for balance, and that is a shame because clearly a lot of time was spent on components and theme - it does such an amazing job of honoring the film.Without house rules this game just isn’t fun. We tested house rules like rerolling one biff, or when you acquire a power tile you can immediately use it, which helped the experience.I hope there is a second edition at some point with a rule adjustment, I love Back to the Future and good strategic co-ops, so I want to be able to love this game. Fingers crossed.

What’s not to love about a Back to the Future themed board game? The components are fun, and although it may look daunting to infrequent board gamers because of all of the different pieces, it is not that complicated. We highly recommend the advice of the game makers - complete the opportunity challenges first thing.  You need the extra power tiles and items help, too.  Focus on the love meter and get it moving, and keep an eye on what is coming up on the time track.  It’s true that luck of the die plays a significant role, but efficiency in accomplishing the two main tasks (moving the love meter and moving the Delorean), rolling extra dice (for the wildcard lightning bolt), and active coordination and sharing power tokens in clutch moments, really help. We played three times and won each time, without resort to House rules.

review_title: Back to the Future in a Box!
review_description: Sure, my headline is the most cliche, clickbaity thing you can think of. However, I truly feel transported into the movie when I am playing this game. This coop board game will get you and your friends and/or families high-fiving when you complete a challenge, but flipping the table when Biff comes over and messes you up.The lovely designers of Prospero Hall have knocked it out of the park with this one. I have played Jaws before and knew when I saw this new release that they would do the IP justice. I had just watched the movie a few weeks before playing the game so my Back to the Future fervor was at an all-time high.First off, the game is pretty simple to learn. Your character has several "power tiles" at the start which tell you what you can do on your turn. On all the starter ones, you can either move or use a dice in a "challenge." You'll be running around the board trying to gather parts for the Delorean and ensuring Lorraine and George stay in love before time runs out. What's not to love?Well, good ole Biff is running around trying to ruin your plans. And oh man, if you hated him in the movies, you'll hate him even more in this game. Everything you do, he is there ready to reverse anything you've done. Whenever you do a challenge which typically involves helping George and Lorraine or trying to pick up the parts, you can roll "Biffs" on the dice which will move him towards George and/or Lorraine. When he gets to their spot, he will drop their love on the love meter. You need to keep this high but he will be constantly lowering over and over again.I don't want to go over all the rules, but I'll say for the price, the components are really good. The art on the cards is not just movie stills, but instead are custom images made for the game. I haven't assembled the Clock Tower dice tower since I heard it is a little fragile, but everything else is great quality. Pick this up if you are a Back to the Future fan!
Huge Back to the Future fan! So glad I found this game! It was obviously created by fans of the film. The disappearing photo is my favorite touch :). So cool.

review_title: Great Game! Very Back to the Futurey
review_description: In the last year 2 games have come out that have been affordable, kind of by the same people, and have become my favorite games. Horrified was the first and this is the second. The components are great, rules are explained well, game play is fun and easy to learn, and somehow they've made the theme come alive. The game has you allocating dice to challenges while avoiding Biff who is on the board and moves around trying to take away your progress.Note that this can be challenging, especially for people who do not play a lot of board games. IMO I still think that if you do fit into this category and find it difficult and you keep losing I would hang in there. I believe that the game is so sound and fun that even non-gamers wil get better at it and find winning doable.

When I initially set the game up I had two thoughts. How top quality the game pieces were and how many things there are to set up. I have to admit I was a little overwhelmed at first but the instructions are well written and very easy to understand. It's a lot of fun, challenging and makes for a good cooperative game! Highly recommended!!
Our family recently purchased the Back to the Future game because our son is a huge fan of the movies! We enjoyed the creativity of the game. We also liked that you play and work together as a team.

review_title: So great... except for the clock tower
review_description: Neat game that captures the up and down edge of your seat type feeling which was constant throughout the movies.  The artwork is really great also.  Having watched the movie as a kid it was a neat little adventure “back in time”.My only beef, and thus the four star rating, was the poorly designed clock tower dice tower which is kind of a pain to set up and make use of due to poor design.  Midway through our first game we just stopped using it.  I guess at this price point some corner cutting is to be expected on a board game with this many components but it’s unfortunate something like that is ever noticeable.
Wonderful game which is very nostalgic and gives you a good sense of the plot of the movie. It's a cooperative game to get back to the future and i loved it.

It arrived in great condition, can't wait to play it with my family. Beautiful artwork, love the deatils and especially the mini delorean! Can't say anything bad, but I did order from a different seller at first. Didn't receive, so I placed another order with a different seller and it arrived faster than expected. Please be mindful of who you buy from. That goes for all products though. 🙂

I loved that this game lines up with the Movie so well.  The characters and don't even get me started on the Deloran that comes with the game!  Trying to complete before the photo disappears is KEY!  Fun game, easy to learn.

review_title: Not for a casual board game player
review_description: This game looks great. But I found it to confusing and overwhelming to learn the gameplay. I even watch a few videos on YouTube.  So I’ll just put it on the shelf.
I got this game as a gift for a family member and we all love to play it!
Fun addicting game.
Pretty bummed. My copy is missing multiple components.

review_title: Not only a good Back to the Future Game (finally) - but a great co-op game!
review_description: This game is an absolute blast- let me tell you why.  First off- game is well designed with player powers- and power tiles that turn into dice rolls/allocation or other powers (like rerolling the dreaded Biff dice rolls- or more movement).  The game takes place in 1955- and the kitch-art is awesome- and the look and feel of the game just oozes with theme.  The four main characters to play as are Doc, Marty, Einstein, and Jennifer. (i know Jennifer & Einstein weren't really there in the film- but it works in the game)  They are all super different with asymmetrical powers- and each really lends themselves to securing victory by either moving the DeLorian, helping George and Lorraine fall in love, or scare Biff away.  Cool small opportunity cards pop up over the town- allowing you to level your character up- and the cards bring up some of the best moments in the movie!  This game is a 5/5 for me- but warning - it's not a cake walk! I've won only once out of five games- but when you win- it feels awesome.

review_title: Cooperative is a perfect fit for Back to the Future
review_description: We love cooperative board games. And the theme of this game is a perfect fit for cooperative play. You work together to get George and Lorainne to fall in love and get the DeLorean to the starting spot before lightning strikes the Clock Tower. It's a dice rolling game, so there's an element of luck that makes every game turn out differently.The first time we played, we cruised to a victory. But the next time, we were failing everywhere. And it always has us wanting to play again.See our full review on The Board Game Family website.

review_title: Great cooperative game based on an awesome franchise
review_description: This game was the highlight of 2020!! The cooperative aspect of the game as well as the theme just makes it amazing! Plying as Marty or doc brown and trying to avoid Biff while completing the pieces of the Delorean to make it back in time is just a great premise for a board game! Easy to play ye with enough depth that will make you want to play again and again! Highly recommend this one!

review_title: You may not need roads where you’re going, but you’ll need this game!
review_description: Never played a game that had a group so engaged! Standing up next to the table yelling as we closed in on a win!!!Miniatures are gorgeous, along with the art. Just a fully engrossing and engaging game that is 10000% faithful to the spirit of the first movie!
Gran juego. Fácil de aprender y jugar pero necesitas mucha estrategia y comunicación para no perder. La mejor compra que he hecho en meses. Si eres fan de Back to the Future, este es un obligado.

I ordered the Retro Series specifically because the newest version of the game came with cheap red plastic tile holders and the font on the tiles was different. The retro version looks more or less like the old game, if flimsier, except the tiles I received are the new font, not the traditional font. I paid extra for the Retro Series, feel cheated that it wasn't entirely retro.

review_title: Not really retro. Misleading, and not as advertised.
review_description: I bought this for my 78-year-old mother-in-law for Christmas, hoping it was going to be like her old board that got lost in a move. In fact, I paid $5 more for this than the regular Scrabble game. Yes, it's Scrabble. But it's not like the old game. The board itself is similar, but flimsy. The tile racks are super cheap, a different design and easy to knock over. And the tiles are NOTHING like the original tiles. They are wood, but the letters are huge and thick, and not embossed... just painted on. Yes, it's Scrabble. But it's not as advertised. Why market it as "retro" if it's not the real deal?? Disappointed, for sure.

review_title: the tiles are horrible! Not vintage
review_description: Yes, it has the board you want, the classic, no frills board, but... the tiles are horrible! Not vintage, not nice, not scrabble quality, and that is tragic. The tiles are a tactile and visual part of scrabble. These are slightly off in font and size, and shape. They are also top printed, not the engraved and painted tiles.

review_title: The board is very flimsy and weak.
review_description: The board is very flimsy and weak. It will definitely tear in half after couple of plays.

review_title: It's  technically Scrabble, but don't think you're getting anything like a true reproduction
review_description: My spouse bought this version for the nostalgia factor. There's a big, screaming white notification on the right hand side of the box, letting you and everyone else within 25 feet know that this is "Retro". Hasbro can rest assured, even without the tacky badge, nobody will mistake this product was made before planned obsolescence was normalized.Yes, the tiles are wood, but as others have stated, the board is sub par. It's similar to a glossy magazine cover glued onto cardboard. Pretty standard for a new board game, but disappointing for a product you're spending a little more on for a tactile flashback. On opening, the graphics were already cracked at the center seam. There is no way this board could withstand more than 10 gentle opening and closings without cracking the seam to the point of it needing tape. The tiles are unvarnished with printed lettering. Not sure if that's a feature of the original version. The tile font doesn't look like what I remember as a kid--this version looks more like the lettering in the Agway logo, but thinner. But I may be misremembering.If you're avoiding more plastic in your life, this game is a good choice. But you're not gonna wow any Boomers on Christmas morning with this.

review_title: better than plastic, but not a replica
review_description: Not a good replica, box too big, hard corners on tiles, no embossing on tiles, 1949 edition did not come with a bag

review_title: Just another modern cheaply manufactured thing made to LOOK retro, but really isn't.
review_description: Overall a nice scrabble set - but just "nice", not fantastic.  Just because it sorta/kinda looks retro doesn't mean it really is. As others have noticed, the tiles and troughs are definitely not retro - and the board; while looking retro is definitely not retro in construction.  Just another modern cheaply manufactured thing made to LOOK retro, but really isn't.  Overall it's just a "meh".  I'd rather actually find and play a genuine old set.

When I received the game it was packaged in an outer cardboard box that looked fine so I set it aside to take to camp for all to play. When we got to camp I opened the outer box and the game inside was mangled. I opened the game hoping maybe the rest of the game would be ok. It wasn't. It looked like someone twisted the game board in pieces. Have contacted Amazon to return.

review_title: "retro" is a way to re-brand items rejected during quality control
review_description: During the COVID19 pandemic, I wanted to get my family off the digital landscape periodically. We all play scrabble online, but since we're altogether, we found this cheap board and had it shipped.You get what you paid for. But everything you need for Scrabble is there.The tiles are wood, but the lettering is off-center and the tiles are cut to different sizes.Pay attention to detail, and I'm sure you could feel for letters..The board itself is more like a thick tag board than a sturdy cardboard.

review_title: I liked the smaller box size to place tiles into while ...
review_description: The box is larger and more cumbersome and the board has different dimensions than my 1982 version. I liked the smaller box size to place tiles into while playing the game. Can't use this oversized box as it takes up too much table real estate.  Box and board are now in the cupboard but we're using the new tiles if that means anything.  Save $ just buy new tiles, and if you need a new board...go regular. Nothing special about this set except the "retro" label.

Unfortunately, I didn't open this until it was too late the return.  The board is okay quality, the tiles are poor quality, not the same wood or finish as regular Scrabble tiles and printed (sometimes crooked) instead of embossed.  The tile racks are similarly poor quality.  It is definitely not the quality of typical Scrabble games (even "retro").  We played w/friends, and everyone immediately noticed the poor quality -- different wood, unfinished, and cheap printing.  The board also didn't fold flat, probably won't last long either.

Like many others have commented, the tiles are very cheaply made and definitely not vintage. They are printed in a bold black, not engraved like the true vintage game tiles. Very disappointed as I failed to read the reviews before purchasing

review_title: Love! Great quality for the price
review_description: Very happy with this set! I was a kid in the 70s & the board seems to be about right. I can’t remember specifics, but this jolted me back to 1977 :) the letter squares & holders are wood. For the price, very happy. I purchased a collectors edition from ll bean for my mom about 10 years ago for $100+. That was an amazing made in America sturdy masterpiece. By comparison, this is great for the price! The quality of the board seems to be the same as the 70s. Bang for your buck for sure.
Love this set...exactly like the one we had growing up, real wood tiles ;-)

So, this edition of Scrabble looks a lot like the one I had years ago. My little Scrabble brain liked to see the familiar colors.  It lets me play scrabble.For $15.00 I am not going to cry about it not being made of finely manufactured wood and etched tiles, with a thick brilliantly colored board.I had a turntable edition once too. I would like that back, but lacking a time machine....I will use the one I can afford.

If you are going to sell something and call it retro, it's probably a good idea not to write the words retro on the box and to double the WASTEFUL size of the packaging. I ordered the retro set because I figured it would be compact and no frills but it came in a massive box and was just ridiculous. Very disappointed.

The box is MUCH larger than it needs to be - bigger than the contents.  Letter tiles are thinner and smaller than they should be, don't fit the board right - the company is saving money where they shouldn't.  Make the box smaller.!!At least the price is right.  I would rather pay another couple bucks to match the way it was originally marketed.  We had a set when I was a kid, tiles fit the layout beautifully, felt substantial in the hand.

"Let the buyer beware"  it's my own fault for not looking at the reviews before buying this . This "retro" version is weak tea to the original at its best - as mentioned by many others, the board is flimsy, the tiles are out of very cheap wood, the font is TOTALLY WRONG, and the tile holders ?  None of classic appearance of the originals. The only thing similar was the color of the box  ... and it, too, was sub par.  I'm keeping it as a reminder to "look before I buy."

MY HUSBAND AND I LOVE SCRABBLE , BUT WE HAD MOVED ON TO ELECTRONICS. SO THIS WAS A BLAST WE OPENED IT UP FOR CHRISTMAS AND WE PLAYED IT LAST NIGHT 4 TIMES. THIS IS THE RETRO VERSION WHICH BROUGHT BACK MEMORIES. THIS IS A GREAT CLASSIC GAME FOR GREAT FOR ADULTS AND OLDER KIDS/FAMILY GAME.  ANYWAY WE HAD ALOT OF FUN WE PLAID IT TWICE WITH OUR BOYS WHO ARE 25 AND 20  THEY HAD FUN TO. IT WAS NICE TO PUT THE ELECTRONICS DOWN AND USE YOUR BRAIN. 5 STARS .  WE ALSO BOUGHT THE SCRABBLE DICTIONARY FINALLY BECAUSE MY HUSBAND ALWAYS MAKES UP WORDS . FUN FUN FUN
It does have wooden tiles and tile holders,  but they aren't as substantial as the original Scrabble game.

I purchased this very version of Scrabble (1949 Retro Edition) from Amazon for $19 in November 2019 on a whim. Today (3/31/20) I just was looking to purchase another set for my mom, who lives across the country so that we can play remotely, while both in COVID-19 lock-down. I was shocked and not surprised (in hindsight) to see the price had more than doubled with a range from about $45 to $65 for a single copy, as this has suddenly become a high demand item as so many of us are home bound.  Crazy times.  Wishing you all good health and spirits as we work through this global crisis.

Satisfied with this.  It looks like the board I used as a child 50 years ago.  It was old then. Nothing is made like in the old days but pieces are still wood. Large letters are easy for my weak eyes to read.  Directions are still printed on the inside of the box.  Reminds me of the original game.  Made cheap but so is the price.  Glad they are still producing this.  Eight year old loves this game.

In 1949, games like this were Made in America, by American workers. The tiles and racks were solid wood, with a good heft to them. The board was sturdy and made to last.This "Retro" edition is none of that. Made in China, and everything looks and feels cheap. My forty year old Scrabble set still looks good. In five years, this piece of junk will have fallen apart and be in a landfill.Very disappointing. If you expect "Retro' to signify craftsmanship and quality, you won't find it here. Find the cheapest set you can. Don't waste your money on something pretending to be better.

review_title: Not properly described now stuck with it since it's past return date unless Amazon makes exception.
review_description: Poor description and would like to return, but past return date unless Amazon makes an exception. Please!

review_title: Classic Scrabble with some Quality Issues
review_description: There's not a lot one can say about "Scrabble" in general - it's a great game which has been around for ages.I bought this particular edition for the "retro" aspect.  Unfortunately, quality control is evidently not a priority.  The letter tiles are not uniform, and the game board itself feels as if it will not last very long (folding and unfolding). A big deal? Not really, but it does detract from the experience.

The tiles with the letters were not 'finished' with a coating.  A lot of the game is the 'feel' of the tiles.  With no coating on the pieces, some of the game action of smooth feeling tiles is 'missing'.  That may sound silly but it's a part of Scrabble!  Advertised as a 'retro'  version, the expectation was finished tiles like the retro version had.

review_title: It looks very much like the Old Scrabble
review_description: I gave this scrabble game as a gift to someone I play scrabble with twice a month.  Her old one was falling apart and did not have the directions anymore.  I would have given this game 5 stars but some of the letters do not have the letter written completely.  The old set had grooved or carved letters on the tile.  This one only has printed ones.  Other than that my friend was happy with her new scrabble set.

review_title: Cheap reproduction for too much money
review_description: I bought this "RETRO" Scrabble game for my daughter who was visiting and leaving in a couple days.It arrived a day late (no big deal) but it is a CHEAP reproduction of the "old" Scrabble  game.I couldn't return it because she was leaving.  The letters are printed on the tiles, not debossedl; they look like they could rub off.  The tile trays are made out of pine and look like someone cut them from molding.  The board itself is okay.  There's also a nice velveteen bag for the tiles, but DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY (this cost me $42 on amazon and I really thought it would be a nice gift.) (p.s.  I have never been compelled to review anything until this item!)
Box to game came crushed. It's completely useless. Shipping box was in perfect condition. Very disappointing as this was a gift.

review_title: I love it! I don't understand all the complaints about ...
review_description: I love it!  I don't understand all the complaints about the flimsy board, and how it's not an exact replica etc etc.  It's a basic board game for under $20.  If you want something fancy you can spend a lot more money for the Deluxe or Luxury edition.  No complaints.

Did you know Target sells a terrible version of Scrabble for $40? No? Well now you do. I bought this for like $12 on Amazon and it is the perfect version of Scrabble to purchase. You might as well light your money on fire if you purchase a different version.I bought two more of these to keep at my house as emergency gifts. Who doesn't know words? Who doesn't love a large present? Dominoes is for chumps. Buy Scrabble.
Very cheap material. The board looked used.

It's so nice to play on an actual paper-based game board with wood letter stands and wood letter tiles. Very fond memories for me with grandparents and parents long gone. This is not a fantastic-plastic piece of petroleum by-product that will never break down in the landfills, etc. A real quality "keeper" until it too falls apart from loved use.

review_title: Exciting to play with real tiles again!
review_description: It's fun to play again in real life with my family, but I'm disappointed in the quality of the board.  I expected cardboard, but I didn't expect that it would warp as it did - and in only two days.  We live in the Northeast and it has not been humid.  Just crappy manufacturing, I guess.

review_title: Good value but doesn't feel right to me
review_description: Good value set, however I would have preferred that the wood was either smoother or varnished, the roughness actually produces goose bumps, a little like me touching egg cartons

Paper on game board, as soon as I took it from box, I put one piece of clear packing tape across middle where board folds, to keep paper from ripping. Can't fold board now, but problem solved with ripping. I'm happy.

review_title: A gift for Christmas and after
review_description: After gifts were opened at Christmas, we played a version of Scrabble that was laughable..so I came home and ordered the ORIGINAL one for us to enjoy for decades to come!

Need I say more?This game combined with boggle and hangman helped me read better and be more interested in proper words and use of the same. I can recall long nights with dictionaries out in our large family.Now I have two of my own children and this and other similar games are fun to play!

I could hardly wait for my grandson to be old enough to play Scrabble. Now that he is 8, I checked out the game in the stores and was amazed at the amount of money they wanted for it. Amazon had it for a great price and, of course, the game is made of quality material.

review_title: Not of retro quality.  Don’t waste your money
review_description: Not of the quality you would expect of a retro set and far from the quality of the original.  They don’t make things that last anymore and this game set is no exception.  Overpriced, cheaply made and not worth more than 10 dollars if that.
Love it. I play most every day. Lol. I play by myself. Pit me and u against each other. At 73 its a great brain excercise. I do my best for each side.
I hate this game. I have yet to win against my wife. It turns out I am a poor sport when it comes to this game. Apparently za is a word and she lands on a triple letter score. 31 points. Unreal
Best version out there. Great value. Nice pouch for tiles. Sturdy. This is a well made game that is educational and fun for the fam!
The pieces are wood, But instead of the fine quality maple of yesteryear, the pieces are of cheap pinewood. I wish I had bought an old set from an antique store, or online auction.

review_title: just like the game i grew up with
review_description: okay, i'm a Boomer.  this board, wooden tiles and wooden holders are exactly as they were in my youth.  it's great fun!

Buyer beware, I received a cheap knock-off product.  I actually owned the original 1949 product and this is not it.  Workmanship is poor and materials are inferior.  Tiles are not even of consistent size and thickness and the contents in the box do not match the picture.  If your goal is to play a game of scrabble, this will work, but product is not as advertised.

review_title: Back in time! Srabble retro 1949 forever.
review_description: This product is the best- all details really is a gem.. the best family and friends game . easy to play easy to learn..thanks
I grew up playing this game and was glad to get this version with wood tiles. I plan on using it for many years.

I got the game in a shipping box along other products. The game box was really torn apart and the thin plastic foil covering was not even sealing it correctly. I opened the game to sew if the contents were messed up as well. The game board was messed up and the word tiles werent even included. I asked for a replacement and am hopeful that it was one time problem and the new game will come out perfect.

It is almost like 'the original', which we still have (albeit stained and well worn). The only issue:  the pieces are slightly smaller than the board squares.  Doesn't sound like a big deal until you've played, and played and played and words don't quite fill the spaces you're attempting to connect with.

For what it's worth, I have a B.S. in pure mathematics, a fellowship with Math for America, and I've been a high school math teacher since 2000.I see many parents doing flash cards and workbooks with their child and it makes me a little sad. We all want our children to be mathematically proficient because we know how many doors it opens for their future. However, unless your kid loves flash cards and worksheets, I would try to introduce more mathematical play to them. After all, math is as much an art as it is a science and--towards that end--it's important that they see the connections in math. This game allows them to do that, as well as see some of the visual patterns amongst one- and two-digit products.If you like this game and are looking for other math games, I recommend Prime Climb (for ages 7 - 13, but it's fun for adults, too) and Tiny Polka Dots (for ages 2-9).  If you're looking for other board games that have math, but are more game-y than math-y, I strongly recommend Santorini (similar to chess, but my kids like it way more) and Stone Age (great for teaching division; also, just a great board game).

I bought this off the Kickstarter campaign and wasn't sure what to expect.  To my surprise, this game is fantastic.It's essentially tic tac toe meets multiplication, but damn if it's not fun to play.  I was playing against my 12-year-old son and while I dominated him the first two games, it's been really close since then and he's beaten me too.  There's such a great blend of math and strategy.Without a doubt, I ABSOLUTELY FULLY recommend this game.

review_title: Fun, educational math game for the family
review_description: We bought this game and it arrived about a week ago ~ and LOVE IT.  The board and pieces are beautiful.  We’ve been playing it almost every night since it arrived.

review_title: VIDEO DEMONSTRATION PLUS SPECIAL BONUS FEATURE:  DOGS AT SCRABBLE!
review_description: Main reasons game is worth it:A. Portability and durability.B. Ease of spinning board on a table.C. Tiles remain secure when board is rotated.D. Compact and convenient with built in storage drawers.STAY TUNED AFTER VIDEO DEMONSTRATION FOR A ROUSING AND ELECTRIFYING CLIP OF THE REGIONAL CHAMPIONSHIP ROUND FEATURING REINING CHAMPION WANDA 'THE BOOMERANG' BLUNDERBUSS VS. LONGTIME NEMESIS WAFFLES 'THE WUNDERKIND' WIENER-DOG.

review_title: Perfect version of scrabble! Worth every penny!
review_description: Perfect scrabble game. No more worn out boxes to deal with. Has everything I wanted and more. Excellent quality, love that everything is stored into one piece & perfect for traveling. I included pics below to show everything you get and how easily everything stows away. I also included the fold to show the quality of the strap. It's very sturdy and feels strong when opening and closing. It stays closed without a clip-it's that strong-yet not so strong that it's hard to open. Love that the letters nestle into each square on the board so if someone bangs into the board, they'll stay in place. Of course the turntable is an amazing feature, but it's also on wheels so if you need to pass the board to the other end of the table, it's no problem. I highly recommend this version of scrabble! I have never seen one like this in stores and Amazon came thru with a delivery in 2 days once again. 5 stars all around!

I purchased this game for a family get-together. When the players had assembled around the table someone suggested counting the tiles, before beginning the competition. I opened the SEALED plastic bag that the tiles came in and found one "I" and one "E" missing. This is ironic given that the trademark on the box is "Every Letter Counts." I ran out to a local store and purchased a less expensive edition, if you call $18.99 less expensive, and cannibalized its bag of tiles. It was an expensive competition, at least for me.

Forget about looking at the board upside down or getting the tiles shifted when you are trying to rotate your regular game board! This edition solved the problem!! We usually sit at our kitchen table that is made out of slate with a rustic wood panel across the middle section when playing this game as a family. You can imagine the table’s surface is very uneven. However, this game board rotates on this very uneven surface perfectly! And I absolutely love how each tile sits in its little slot now, so the tiles don’t need to be realigned. I’m a little OCD and it bothers me if you put your tiles down and don’t align them perfectly on regular flat game boards ;) This board won’t let you do that! Also, the little drawers on both sides are very functional.I’ve read other buyers’ reviews about poor quality of tiles. Well, there’s no difference between the quality of these tiles and the quality of other inexpensive versions of Scrabble tiles. Unless you’re used to buying $200+ Scrabble game boards, the tile quality won’t be a problem for you ;)

review_title: Great but the tiles are printed and low quality
review_description: Love the turntable, stay-in-place grid, and how it folds up into a case with storage for the accessories. The tiles however are so poor quality that I ordered an authentic engraved replacement set to use instead. The tiles in this game are printed on, look faded, use a horrible fat font, and some letters are printed much higher than the others.

review_title: Clunky and not living up to "deluxe" expectations
review_description: The game set arrived incomplete with some missing racks, packaging was not damaged and looked like it came directly from the factory. The letters are unevenly sized, it's very easy to distinguish them based on thickness and dimensions. This is not a "deluxe" set - it's clunky and of inferior quality.

review_title: Count your blank tiles before starting.
review_description: My family loves playing Scrabble.  Having the board turn and the tiles protected from slipping out of place is great.  The reason this receives four stars instead of five is that the wooden tiles are not of the same quality of earlier Scrabble games (they miss the varnish).  We learned as we played our first game with the Deluxe Edition that we'd been give extra blank tiles.  This worked to my advantage (we didn't check the tiles ahead of time) in our first family game as I kept drawing blanks.  Finally my daughter-in-law counted the number of words on the board with blanks, there were five.

I have played Scrabble since I was a kid, but sadly, a few years ago, my old set got ruined (I was taking it to Speech Therapy patients in my car - the box got ripped, tiles lost, etc.). I had some friends coming over who wanted to play Scrabble and I had enough points on my amazon.com rewards card to get this for "free!" It is AWESOME! First of all, it has it's own all-in-one carrying case with a handle - no box that's going to be crushed. Two drawers slide underneath the board to contain your tile holders and tiles. The wheels underneath the board work seamlessly to turn the board with ease. The interlocking (raised) board keeps all of your tiles in place! It is awesome! The only negative I can see is that the tiles aren't made of that nice heavier, wood that they were made of in the past, but that's not a huge thing and definitely won't keep me from playing. I say this is SO worth the extra money to get this set over the traditional set! Oh, and I WON! ;)

Absolutely Yes, i recommend!! They brought out their best game designers on this version!  This version is sooo much better and more user friendly than the original version!  This edition allows you to fold the game in half and turn it into a carrying case.  The board has lifted lines, so your letters don’t move around.  And best of all, this board has six wheels so it can be easily turned, allowing each player to save their neck pain for another day!  Ha!  This version has two drawers in the case to store the letter and letter holders.  I recommend this version, 110%! #honestreviewsbysarahlee

review_title: LOVE this set.  Best one for Scrabble.
review_description: I haven't played scrabble in ages, but I thought it was about time my 11 year old son was introduced to it.I got this one so that we could take it by his grandma's when she babysits him every few weeks.It was even better than I had thought.  I didn't realize that the squares on the boards were recessed so the tiles STAY PUT and won't move even when the board is bumped.  That, right there, gave it the five stars.  LOVE that feature.The rest is also 5 star worthy.  The soft bag to keep the tiles in has drawstrings to help keep it closed, and the two storage bays underneath have plenty of room for the holders and the tiles, as well as things you may want to keep to track scores.It folds up easily, sits flat when opened, and even has small wheels on the bottom so you can spin it around so whoever wants can see everything "right side up."Best Scrabble board I've ever seen.

review_title: Great Game Board, but the tiles ruined it for me!! Do NOT give this as a gift!
review_description: This is a terrific game board! I wanted an extra scrabble game to keep at a second location and this looked like a good deal. I love how the tiles stay in place when you turn it to the other player or back to yourself. It has built-in wheels that help it swivel and raised ridges so the tiles don't slip out of place. I hate it with a regular board how the letters slip and slide around when you turn the board, or even place a tile where it touches another tile and they both shoot off at an angle. And it folds up nicely for traveling.What irritated me no end was how shoddy was the printing on the tiles! Given such a great game board, and a medium premium price, you would kind of expect the tiles to be of a certain minimum quality. Now I read the evaluations that mentioned this, but I figured how bad could it be? In reality, and maybe it's just my personality, but when a tile is printed so the bottom half of the letter is on the top part and the top part of the letter is on the bottom part, it is quite distracting. I finally spent about $12 bucks to order a set of tiles separately from another vendor.Given how great the board was, and how disturbing the tiles were, I would have been better served by upgrading further to a more expensive set. However, if you are willing to buy this set for the game board, and willing to use your old tiles or order a new set of tiles separately, it's a good deal. For me, I regret it. Too much effort! And certainly NOT something I'd ever give as a gift!

Well I've been wanting one of these for years... Initially I thought the tiles would be locked into the squares on the board and secured so it wouldn't fall off even if it were turn upside down but that's not the case . The board secures the tiles  but they can still fall off.  I like that it has the two drawers at the side to hold the bag with the tiles and the racks so yo have a lesser chance of misplacing and losing them. The quality of the board is top notch too and I was fortunate to get all my racks and all my tiles. Finally, there's I a lil bonus piece of literature that i think is very useful and that is the pamphlet that comes in the drawers with all the playable two letter words. That is truly a gift.

review_title: The best set if the price is right.
review_description: So you may have noticed there's a Scrabble Diamond Anniversary Edition, and then there's this Amazon-exclusive Scrabble Deluxe Edition which, I might add, is WAY better than the current "Deluxe" edition in brick-and-mortar stores. But you may ask "What's the difference between this Deluxe and the Diamond Anniversary Edition?" and that's a really, really good question.The answer is: Not much.In fact, if you press the stickers on the sides down a bit you'll see that the plastic on this board actually has the logo for the Scrabble Diamond Anniversary Edition embossed into it, with a Scrabble Deluxe sticker pasted over the top of it to hide the previous branding. Yes, kids, this is a Scrabble Diamond board with new stickers.What else is different? The tiles. In the Diamond Anniversary Edition the tiles are black with silver letters embossed into them. In this set, the standard wooden tiles from classic Scrabble are in play. The wood tiles are *slightly* smaller than the black ones, so they sit in the grooves on the board just a little bit less snugly than the black tiles that this board was designed for, but not so much that it noticeable or a problem if you've never played the Diamond version.The racks are the same curved red rack from the Diamond version. The bag is a standard felt-like bag. The manual's actually pretty nice and detailed with some great information, variations on play, and suggestions.So basically, Hasbro mass-produced the Diamond Anniversary edition, and made a deal with Amazon to sell this version as a "lesser" model for a lower price, but the only thing "lesser" about it is the tiles. If you're really a stickler for a complete Diamond experience, I suppose you could buy some black and silver tiles separately for another fifteen bucks, but I don't see the need.I had the Diamond Anniversary Edition (lost it, though) and I have this Scrabble Deluxe Amazon Exclusive edition,  and I'm here to tell you that if you're spending over a hundred bucks for a Diamond set, you're either a crazy collector, or easily duped into paying way more for nearly the same thing. This IS the Diamond board with a sticker on it.So how does it play? It's a great Scrabble set. The board spins by way of some wheels on the bottom (no, not a turntable, actual little wheels) and it's a smooth experience that makes game play easier for everyone around the table (though it likely won't spin on carpet.)  The whole thing folds up for storage, with two plastic trays built in to hold the racks, scorepads, pencils, tiles, bag, and manual (scorepad sold separately, of course.)It's pretty easy to carry around, though I wouldn't call it totally "travel" sized. I wouldn't try to play in a car unless it was a very smooth-riding vehicle and the road had no chance of bumps. For travel it's best to have a magnetic set, which this is not. But for bringing along to places where you have a stable surface to play? Yeah, it's pretty handy.Bottom line: This is the Scrabble set to get if you want a turntable, don't want to spend a hundred bucks, and don't particularly care if the tiles are special limited-edition colors. This will do just fine.Five stars, no question.Update: As another reviewer notes, the tiles with this set are a bit lower quality than the tiles with the standard set. They're perfectly usable. They are all present (in my set, anyway) and the letters and numbers are legible. If you don't like them the easy solution is to swap your tiles from your previous standard edition (come on, you know you had one before buying a Deluxe edition!) or buy another set separately. They're inexpensive. However, I see no reason why most people wouldn't be perfectly happy with the tiles included with this set.

review_title: Glad that I read the reviews
review_description: This version is a really good value in build and design. The board: folds in half and is sturdy with very good attention to detail in design and colors. Definitely a better option than a new flimsy board. Plastic yes but sturdy. The tiles remain in place. And you can turn the board. Retro colors are 50/60/70’s at least to me. Hold off on getting extra tiles, ref other comments as you want to see the board in real life first and perhaps choosing or not another color besides natural.
