The tiles in mine, I do not see as stated in reviews, any defects. Hard case for carry, if you don’t like this, I still think the play board itself is really nicely done with this choice. Glad I read the reviews about the newer one and the retro 1940’s one too. We are inclined to find used games in very good condition for build quality and nostalgia. Other new nostalgia versions are too expensive and do not have the same build quality of older versions. This version is a really good choice for a retro looking one attention to detail and the tiles stay in place. Happy Gaming!

BEST VERSION EVER!Stores in easy-to-open-and-close-plastic carrying caseRidged board keeps tiles from shiftingSmoothly turning turntableLarge print, easy-to-read wooden tilesCurved tile stands have deep enough ridges to actually hold the tilesDrawer for tile racks also has room enough to hold our personal score pad and pencilDrawer to hold tiles (yes, we put them in the velvety bag after opening the plastic package) has more than enough room for everything to fitNOTE: ALL tiles were there!  (We counted, as some previous reviewers mentioned some of theirs were missing.)A huge bonus is that there is no cardboard or pasteboard box—this is perfect for our subtropical humid climate.

review_title: Crap quality, but kind of nice swivel
review_description: The tiles are uneven sizes, the board is pretty crappy quality...but we do enjoy being able to swivel the board around and store tiles in the little drawer. My husband was initially so disappointed in the quality that he wanted to return it right away, but laziness won and we now use this set fairly frequently.  We still don't love it, but it works.

This would be perfect except for one very important thing. The double and triple letters and word colors are the wrong colors!!! This is so important! When you're planning your strategy and you think that you're getting triple for a letter or a word -you discover that they haven't adhered to the regular approved colors and hues for these squares. This happens often until you get used to the coloring of the tiles. Please go back to the regular colors for others who buy this game.

review_title: Don’t waste $35. Buy the old original.
review_description: I’m sending this back!  The ‘carry case/game board’ is ok, made cheaply. I received only 1/2 the letters and they are not the same as ‘ normal scrabble letters’ they are too light weight and the actual letters are painted on. The racks are curved and super thin cheesy in weight.

review_title: Once you have played with a board like this that keeps the tiles in place, you won't want to go back!
review_description: I used to own the deluxe anniversary edition, which I loved. I lost it in a move and have missed it ever since, until I found this version. I had been searching for an affordable version to rival the edition I lost, and this is it, hands-down. The separation between rows keeps the tiles from going everywhere and you absolutely won't regret the extra $$$ for that benefit alone. The rotating board is wonderful for those who like to see the words from their perspective. You do need a smooth surface for the wheels to rotate the board. I like how it folds for storage, which the deluxe edition did not do, as it was more of a display piece. Next to the very pricey alternatives which are made mostly from wood and look a bit more high-end than plastic, this is your best bet for the added features. We really love it, from the preteens to the grandparents and the beginners to the experts!

I initially ordered this for my classroom but we ended up keeping it for ourselves! My mom was always a ginormous scrabble fan and I thought, I'm going to get this for my students because it's spelling practice in a fun way plus you use all kinds of brain power coming up with word combinations. I got the deluxe version because it has those grooves so pieces can't slip around. My only complaint is that this game looks a little tacky. I think the one my mom used to have wasn't as plasticy looking. And that gripe is only because this game stayed in our home and  we are not giant fans of bright plastic. If this had made it to my classroom it would have fit right in :) anywho get scrabble you guys! It's fun for family game night and it sneaks learning in there too.

Bought our first Scrabble game back in the 70's; we used it fairly often through the years.  Never really liked the fact that if you bumped the board the letters would skew. Fast forward to 2019.  Finally decided we'd had enough; I started looking at the alternative setups.  While the travel version had the raised lines to keep the pieces in place, it was too small for our tastes.  Then I spied this one.  BINGO!  It has wheels to let you rotate the board.  It has 2 drawers: one for the "letter sock" and one for the 4 letter "trays".  My wife likes the old wooden letter holders and I prefer the new curved ones, so we swapped out 2 from the old game then gave it to a young married couple.  They are teachers and are loving it.  Just keep in mind that the board can rotate; keep your beverages and letter holders out of the way.

Tiles are crap. Letters do not align, which drives me nuts. Wood quality is balsa like, rough and unfinished. Stamped, not embossed.  Racks are cheap semi round plastic and slide around at slightest touch. Colors jave changed, triple is orange, not red, double is red, not orange.  Have uet to count tiles, but others report missing tiles.

Was hesitant to purchase due to some negative reviews about quality. Comes in a plain brown box. No quality control issues with my board or tiles. All the tiles were present in the correct amounts. All easily readable with some minimal variances from one tile to the other. The letters are printed on the tiles, not etched into the tiles. The board is solid and turns on its wheels easily. The two drawers stay closed when turning or carrying the board (which folds in half, play side in). Easily carried. Room in the drawers for the tiles, the rules, the stands, and enough room left over for a small pocket pad of paper and a pencil. Glad I purchased it.

I was so disappointed when I got my new Deluxe Scrabble board. It's sure NOT like the one they made some years ago...... the board is cheap plastic, smaller super light weight pieces.... the turn table does not turn easily. The letter holder is cheap plastic that could blow over if you breathe on it....I  wish I didn't buy this; if I'd known I would of preferred to purchase a used OLDER Deluxe game.

A must have! I love that the case itself opens into the actual playing board and each letter fits in a groove to prevent shifting. The hide away drawers to store letters and chairs in between games are also a plus for me.  As well as the wheels on the bottom.  This allows each player to spin and view the board from different angles.  So happy with my purchase.

review_title: Great implementation of a classic game!
review_description: This is a great packaging and implementation of classic Scrabble. I love the design of the board.  It is "gridded" with ridges to hold the tiles in place, which is great for locations where there are vibrations (think boat/car/RV). The drawers are very handy for storage, and my favorite feature - the wheels! The entire board, when placed on a hard, flat surface, will rotate easily on the built-in wheels. This is great for passing the turn to the next person and allowing them to read the board head-on. When unfolded, the board is stable and can be picked up on one half without the second half overextending and folding down. The board opens and closes easily, but stays closed when it needs to and there's a built-in handle for carrying. My one complaint, but barely worth mentioning is that it is a bit bulky. Not great for travelling on a plane/train, but great for RVs, boats, or just going over to a friend's house for a game.

review_title: The rectangular size is a bit cumbersome
review_description: I did not like the shape of the board in use. Although it spins quite well, the oblong shape doesn't work well on square tables. I am also not to crazy about the curved tile holder and the cheap plastic it is made from.On the plus side, the tiles hold in the groves well and the unit opens well and is easy to transport. I als like the two trays to put the tiles and trays in.

Build quality is not great.  I can see this breaking if dropped once.  However, the board is nice.  The chip inlays make it nice and clean rather than the chips being everywhere and constantly fixing them.  The trays are cheap just like the board, but they are curved.  Overall this is maybe a 15.00 product, but the concept is nice.  They are definitely ripping people off on price.  I would not buy this again or recommend it, unless they dropped the price.  I’m taking stars because the build quality is horrible considering the price point.

My 11 year old daughter started playing Scrabble at school. She loved the game and asked to get one at home. I wanted one where the letters would stay in place.  I remember the boards of my youth and one small bump sent everything sprawling across the board.  This has the spaces for the letters to remain in place. The storage areas for the letters and individual player letter holders is a plus.  The only thing I'm not a fan of is for the quality of the board, the trays for the letters aren't as high a quality.  The 'old school' wooden trays were better.

review_title: Broken “N” tile tapped to outside of tile bag
review_description: I ordered this for my daughter as a surprise after she started playing scrabble last week in the cabin we stayed at for vacation. Ordered it so she would have it the day after we got home. It arrived today and we immediately opened it only to find that there was a “N” tile tapped to the outside of the plastic bag all the tiles were in. The “N” tile has a corner broken off and it was taped to the bag to keep it together. I got out counted all the letters hoping it was just an extra piece for some reason but it wasn't. So now if anyone draws that tile everyone will automatically know that person has a “N.”

review_title: Highly recommended for all scrabble players!
review_description: Super fast shipping & arrived in perfect condition!It folds and opens without a hassle and the drawers open and closes smoothly without a problem, also the board rotates with the wheels in a circular motion. I think it's perfectly designed. However, the drawstring bag, that stores the tiles does come open on its own. But for me, that's not an issue because it stores in the drawer anyway. I like that it's colorful also!!

I bought this set for my mom and she absolutely loves it! All loose pieces fit nicely in the compartments under the board. The rollers make it perfect for multiple players and when finished, it folds in the middle providing handles to carry it without loosing any pieces. The letters on the tiles are bold and easily read. Small grooves in the board keep the tiles in place. A felt bag holds the tiles which helps when table space is limited. I choose this over the wood set because of the negative reviews and it was a lot less expensive. Would definitely buy again.

review_title: sometimes the older design is the winning design
review_description: I noticed that this was recently updated and the newer version had mixed reviews to say the least.  I chose to buy this version, the older design and find it to be perfect for us.  The board is well built with a sturdy hinge system as well as conveniently mounted drawers to hold the tiles and tile holders.  It folds up to a small enough size to make it easy to pack for trips away from home without sacrificing precious cargo space.  The tiles are digitally printed so yes they could be improved as they may fade over time, but for now they will do.  I'll say recommended for 50 points.

review_title: Tiles kept in place, but when board rotates, it will knock over tile racks at natural distance.
review_description: One major flaw is that the natural distance the tile racks are placed near the board, where you think rotation will not knock them over... is actually too close.  It's just a really bad design flaw that wasn't needed.  Further, the clips that hold the contents on both sides of the board don't hold until they are slid all the way in... when you think it is hinging on, it is not, and you'll let go and it will drop.  It is really, really bad design.  In both cases, it signals that you can act in one way, to be slapped in the face later.  Functionally, everything works, but it's not elegant by any means.

I am a life-time Scrabble player. The colors of the DW/DL, TW/TL squares are different! That alone was reason enough to return this game. But I also did not like the curved racks which are very light weight, and the unevenly cut letters. Very poor quality.

review_title: The version to get for Scrabblers!
review_description: Really there isn't anything NOT to like. It's an old school Scrabble board incorporated into a 21st century kit style, ready-to-play board that stores all the necessary pieces, rotates, and secures the tiles in place inside the slots on the board.If I were to gripe about anything, it would be the price, or perhaps the plastic tile holders---indeed the entire plastic case/board. But if people are paying it (including myself), it must be worth it! It's certainly better than a cardboard box and board that wears over time.If you like Scrabble, this is the version to get!

Case is light and easy to carry, uncumbersome. Love that you can carry it anywhere and it keeps everything orderly inside the little drawers.  Just two things I'm not crazy about.  First, the red plastic racks are plastic and a bit short, which are perfect if you play with 7 tiles, but if you also like to play with 9 tiles, the racks are too short.  Also, the bag that holds the tiles.  It's a a bit small and the fabric is thick and rough so it does does not close properly when you pull the cord, so the tiles tend to fall out of the bag.  The bag also does not have Scrabble printed on it, which tends to be a nice touch.

review_title: Very nice scrabble game. Liked it so much I bought a second one.
review_description: This is a very nice design for this scrabble game (ASIN: B00JMCJGZC model # 16807F01). The board is hinged in the center and folds open to play. Since there are so many other reviews about it here on Amazon I'm not going to go into a lot of details about it. I will say that it really spins smoothly on the wheels built into the bottom and when folded open to play the board is even and works well. The tiles drop into ridged spaces for them so they don't move around when the board is bumped or rotated. It all folds up into a neat package when done with the tiles and tile holders going into two drawers on the sides of the board. It was a present for my grandson. I liked it so much I just ordered a second for my wife and I.The main reason I'm reviewing it at all with so many other reviews already here is to warn others about a similar version that is absolutely terrible.Do not be fooled by the "there is a newer version of this game" which points to the "Scrabble Deluxe Edition Game" in a red box ASIN: B00IFWSO94 Model# A8769 also by Hasbro. That version looks very much like this one BUT the board is two separate halves that "fit" together. It is also supposed to rotate and lock the tiles BUT the rotation is poor. The two halves don't line up properly with one half slightly higher than the other and in the one I got both halves were bowed. One bowed concave and one convex. What a mess. I had to return it (and was only given store credit...grrrr). In fairness I did NOT get that one at Amazon (why not is a very long story for another time).

This set is compact, with all of the necessary parts (tiles,holders) stored inside the frame of the board. It works well on a flat surface and is easy to rotate. The tile squares are recessed to hold the tiles in place.  It's a bit too big to use in a vehicle unless you have an RV and it must be placed on a flat surface if you want to be able to rotate it.  Also, the tiles can fall  out if it is bumped hard enough.  But for home or indoor use it is a great way to play Scrabble without having the tiles slide around.

Absolutely everything you could wish for in a scrabble set. No cardboard box to tear or accidentally drop all the pieces out of because there are drawers in the board for the tiles and tile holders. Lazy susan wheels make it super easy to rotate around for each persons turn even though my table is rustic and not perfectly smooth. We are loving this scrabble set, all you need is a scrabble dictionary and you’re ready to play!

review_title: Underwhelmed by the quality for the price
review_description: I love the game but have always owned the least expensive cardboard box with the simplest board. I decided to gift myself a deluxe Scrabble Game and suffered from sticker shock. For the price I was expecting the board to be sturdier, heavier quality material. I like that it spins and the I like that the grid on the board keeps the pieces in place but you get that with most Deluxe editions. I would recommend spending a little more money on a higher quality or stick with the good old fashioned simple box game.

review_title: good size, great storage, easy travel
review_description: Things I like: I like that is has small raised grids so the tiles stay in place better, that is has 2 storage drawers and the bag of tiles and racks fit in them, that is folds up for easy storage and has a design that makes it easy to carry, that is has printed on it how many of each letter are in the game, and the little wheels on the bottom are just a nice little feature. We played it at my Mom's and my SIL liked it and ordered one for herself while we where there. Really liking it :)

As silly as it sounds, I waited a long time to buy a scrabble board. I wanted the perfect one. This wasn't on my list of "perfect scrabble boards", but my husband showed up with it one day because it was on sale. It isn't the most beautiful board out there (not an eyesore either), but it is pretty much perfect. It met all my criteria and more (except that it doesn't match my decor, lol).It spins well, the tiles stay in place perfectly (even when spinning rapidly), it is compact, and everything is so extremely easy to access when the board is set up, the tiles are easy to read, and it is all self contained. It also holds shut magnetically so there aren't really any pieces to break. I just love it, and can't recommend it enough. Many of my family members have been impressed with all it's "features", I'm thinking of giving it as a gift to a few of them. Not really anything that could be improved except the color if you're being really picky.

review_title: The way scrabble should have made the game years ago.
review_description: PROS:ConvenientStores all related items in 1 light portable packageBeing able to spin the board along with the tile indents mean you can move the board to get a different perspective without messing with the gameCONSNot all tiles were uniform  Some letters are centered on the tile, some are at the top of the tile and some nearer to the bottom of the tile.Again... the tiles seem to be made much cheaper than they used to be in the 80s when I started playing.

I got this new scrabble board because a letter was missing and a couple of letters chewed on by a dog. Tired of playing knowing what those letters were. I bought this for my husband and myself for our anniversary. We really enjoy playing scrabble. We had a very old board, etc.  We have played several times already and love that the letters stay in place. Like that it easily rotates and very nice that it folds up and everything has a nice spot. Will be great to take on trips also. Really like this Deluxe Edition

Fancy Scrabble™ does it all: locks tiles in place, spins to face each player, prevents even the most OCD family member from picturing your gruesome death as you clumsily move their perfectly-placed L tile to the left of its space,...etc etc.But seriously, I hope you to enjoy this revised board game as much as my family has.

review_title: Easy to pack, carry, and use.
review_description: Scrabble's fun. But you can get scrabble in so many forms these days, that my five stars are for the packaging here.- The box has compartments for the tiles and trays. This makes packing things up easy.- The folding behavior opens up to a nicely-aligned board that feels cohesive  - no big gaps.- It has wheels to allow the board to spin when in use, so everyone can get the board "right side up" when it's their turn.If you want a scrabble set, this is a great one to pick up.
Terrible quality. Not “deluxe” at all. Cheap plastic material.

We had this game and enjoyed playing scrabble with it. Ou granddaughter was married about a year ago and had very few games available for entertaining company like us older folks soo we bought this for her and we are sure she and her husband will enjoy it.

A nice scrabble set.  Very heavy for it's size. The board is nice. Folds in half, and has storage under the board for letters and the trays. the whole thing rotates on the wheels at the bottom of the board.The letters are wood and printed with a nice readable font. Very nice scrabble board!!

Great game ....love how simple it is but a lot fun too.....easy to pick up and play ...came very quickly...but unfortunately i was disappointed because the box was badly damaged on arrival which is a real shame :( ....would of given it 5 star elseQuick update ......i was contacted by the seller about the damaged box which was obviously damaged in transit so not his fault just a bad delivery drivr .But he has very kindly offered to send out a new box which is amazing service from a small company...very impressed....will definitely be buying more of there games ...this one is very cool love it

Bag of Dungeon is a fun hack and slash dungeon exploring game with accessible rules and depth to keep it interesting. No two game is the same and can be played solo on your own or with up to three others.The website has free expansions you can print out to extend the game further, with three additional character sheets (plus a blank one if you want to design your own), skills and agendas for rewarding secret styles of play.A fun game with high quality tiles, cards and wooden Meeples. Highly recommended.

If, like me, you found D&D a little to intense and confusing, but want to get into RPG board games, then this game is for you.Simple gameplay - This game strikes the perfect balance of easy mechanics but with enough layers you wont get bored.Quality - i'd never purchased a kickstarter funded product and was worried. I needn't had, its sleek and with fantastic RPG detail.Replay-ability - Solo, multiplayer, cooperative, competitive its got them all.Allthough the gameplay is easy to pick up the game evolves as you go, and you can adapt it as you wish.It even has story/mission/objective cards to throw in later to spice things up. I've yet to deafeat the game so will be going back for more.Its worth the low price. Highly recomend.

The game is great fun! High replayability in minimalistic style, easy to understand rules and a perfect intro for tabletop D&D.I replaced the heroes and monster tokens to painted miniatures to have a better experience with the kids and they loved it.

-5 stars plus 20 temporary starsThe title is Bag Of Dungeon.You need to escape a dungeon. To win you must escape WITH the ring. The Ring Of Creation appears when the last tile is placed. Each turn you need to move, battle, use some items, and make the dungeon with APs (Action Points).My most favourite thing to do is (drum roll please) SLAYING MONSTERS!!!!!! My fave item is The Blade Of Death. I created The Blade Of Death (NOT with The Ring Of Creation LOL) with the spare item tiles. Spare item tiles are tiles to replace worn-out items/monsters or… create your own! If The Blade Of Death is your only item +6 to battle roll. If it is your last item (inventory full) +11 to battle roll.I wouldn’t change anything about the game. I love the game as it is so there is nothing I don`t like. It`s a good game because…you…can…kill…a…DRAGON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!- S. aged 7 &11/12

Written and designed by two very talented guys. Great for playing solo too and as a co-operative game. I cannot fault it especially as their are updates and extras available free from Gunpowder studios website. Fantastic.

I bought this game mainly for a one player dungeon crawler game. Once I saw the free extras you can get from the gunpowder studios; extra characters, magic items etc I thought the price reflected what I was getting and I wasn’t disappointed, the game is easy to play yet can be challenging and there are extra quests on scrolls to use where you have to rescue someone, escape the flood and there are 8 others.Best thing is that it doesn’t take long to set up and the game won’t take too long to play. I’ve enjoyed using my old Heroquest character figures and I love the mixture of monsters which you fight as you pull them out of the bag.

Such an easy game to get into and a lot of fun. Wander in and explore, collect loot and get out if you can get past the dragon who wants his ring back. You can solo it, co-op or all for yourself. Good bit of fun and great for kids getting into board games like my 10 year old son.Some newer rules online at the makers website which explains a few little things better but apart from that a good game.
On the face of it a lightweight dungeon crawler, in reality encourages a range of strategies within a rule set that is easy to grasp; an excellent excample of well-crafted design.

Always looking for the perfect little dungeon crawler.  May have just found it. Easy to set up, portable,easy to learn rules and quick to play with good replay-ability in like literally all the other dungeon crawlers out there.I have played it a number of times solo and love it.  So does my wife as it also takes up so little space again unknot gets.

This is a brilliantly simple game with some complex bits you work out the more you play, has excellent mechanics and a sense of unknown leading to excitement or dread depending on situation. Extra features are free to download on the website and add more to your game.

Fantastic game! Kept me busy during Covid19 lockdown. Played it solo and still yet to beat it, having tried probably 10-15 times. I love how it's different every time I play! I love how most games last 30-40 minutes so it's no big deal if you die.I've never played D&D before but I think this is the perfect entry point to that kind of thing.Brilliant quality tiles and great fun! Buy it!

I wanted a game i can play in a short amount of time yet still create a narrative about the adventure. This game provides that. The first couple of games the adventures didn't survive the beings in the tunnels, but on third try they managed to work their way out and escape with the ring of confidence, I mean creation.
Very enjoyable game which is great fun to play. Never the same dungeon twice in a row and rules are straight forward and easy to learn. Would definitely recommend.

Brilliant game, nicely done. Nice and easy to pick up and play. A great introduction and alternative to D&D. Instructions could do with a little refining as it’s not entirely clear with certain rules in the gameplay we came across. Would benefit to play with someone familiar with D&D but not necessary. Thoroughly enjoyable and adventures will always vary from one to the next so will never be the same.

Played a couple of times already and we haven't won the base game yet.The monsters are surprisingly difficult to beat and the luck factor is huge.Easy to learn, quick setup and most importantly it fits nicely in the small box.Hopefully there will be expansions to this :)

A fantastic game, the basic rules are simple to learn, my 6year old daughter knows them verbatim.The extra rules and online expansion sets are excellent and add to the game very nicely. I can not recommend this enough.
Amazing  game!!  Good quality.  Quick to learn. I played 3 games in a row using 2 of the characters.  Each was totally different. A great dungeon laying system.  Easy to take anywhere in its own bag!
Great gameQuick and easy to learnCan be played solo, competitive or co operativeWould recommend for anyone any age

Really good little rpg game. Great for kids and adults. Played several times now with my son and we both love it. Great if you are looking to introduce anyone to dungeons and dragons type of games. Easy to set up, learn and quick to play. Hoping for expansions for this.
Great little game, even played it with six year old-although he always wants to run in and kill the dragon on his own!
I bought this for my son for his birthday and he was really delighted. I would also like to say at how pleased I was withthe speed of the delivery.
Ideal fun for the family. My 10 year old loves this. It's also a good way to slip in some stealth maths with adding to dice rolls!
Great game and great support on line for your questions on Board Geek.
Great old school style dungeon crawl.
Awesome game. Loving playing it
Fun game. Easy to play. Quick to learn. Convenient size. Good quality
Good game for one person on lockdown
Brilliant little game that is easy to learn and will give you (and your friends) a different adventure every time it is played. I am looking forward to the next game this studio releases.
AAA+
Great game, no set up as you go it as you go along. No 2 games are the same
Great little dungeon explorer easy to pick up, fast play and handy enough to take anywhere.
Played it once as a family better than expected
best to be played with people that are a bit familiar with fantasy D&D type games.
Good introduction to roleplay
Super simples Spiel was Spass macht .

Tolles Spiel , die Original Regel ist nur auf Englisch, aber gut zu lesen. Nach zwei Testspielen findet man Spass .Eigentlich nur ein Manko, dt. Regel ist nur über Homepage zum runterladen, nicht in der Spielpackung dabei.

I have 2 kids who have the mental capacity play this game....relatively...a 9 and a 6 year old.  While, at least one of them, aren't great at forming new words with the letters given, with some help, he does a pretty good job overall.  It's a great little game to play as a family and I like how they can stack tiles and change the words without always having to add new words.  My only qualm (and this goes for most games in general) is you would think the game would fit back into the box right?  Well, it does but it's a bit bulky and the lid doesn't go on all the way.  If the box was made like an inch or 2 thicker, it would t be a problem.  Otherwise, great game!

review_title: Surprisingly good rebuild of the one I remember
review_description: I was hesitant to get a newer version vs. jumping on eBay and getting an old one from the 80s/90s (whenever it was). This is actually a great build of the product and it's a fun alternative when you are used to playing Scrabble. We like word games and this helps break things up in a logical, familiar and fun way.

My husband and I have been playing almost daily games of upwards for more than 25 years.  I wanted to replace the tiles since the letters have become hard to read after repeated use (and sometimes washing).  Unfortunately, the version that was the same large tile design as our current set only had 64 tiles rather than 100.  I got this 100-piece set not only because of the quantity of tiles, but because they were described as interlocking.  Unfortunately, the tiles are small and really hard to stack because they have four small pegs which have it fit into holes.  The stack of five tiles tips over frequently while trying to fit the pegs into the holes.

Very different strategy compare to scrabble. Much easier to play for kids as words tend to be simpler and shorter. 7 year old mastered very quickly and loves it. I wish some letters like Z and N looked a bit more distinct from each other as hard to tell them apart. Otherwise, fantastic game.
Such a fun game. Similar to scrabble but much more fun to play!

I’ve enjoyed playing this game for years, and wish I had the old version of it bcuz it was made better. My dislike is totally cosmetic; and I admittedly have a low tolerance for this.  The board is supposed to spin somewhat like a lazy Susan however, it’s cheap plastic and is more than I want to tolerate. I put the board on an actual spinning lazy Susan. The Upwords label on the face of the game, popped out almost immediately. I glued it in and it came out again...leaves a hole open in the box if you can’t make it stick. I finally used shipping tape to keep it in place.

This game has a ton of potential to be fun but they didn't really invest in making the board scoring interesting, like scrabble and the board is too small for challenging words.  And this thing is sooooo cheaply made that you spend half your time just trying to keep the tiles on the board and turn the thing without everything flying off.  The plastic is very, very thin and cheesy.  It has a ton of potential but they should have invested more quality in the product and made it more expensive rather than to cheap it out.  I wouldn't buy again and I'm not sure we'll be playing it much.

I used to play this gave over 20 years ago and have talked about buying it again for a long time and finally did. The game itself is great and super fun. We are Scrabble players so this is a nice change. The turntable and game board is kind of cheaply made. For anyone who had the original this is no where near as high quality. The biggest complaint I have is tiles of letters that look the same when your change the orientation are not marked. For example M and W or N and Z. You cannot tell them apart so we had to mark ourselves. The game itself is very fun and for $17 well worth the hours of play you get out of it.

review_title: great for all generations - great for families with different age groups,  or just several friends
review_description: Much easier and less stressful than Scrabble -- does not rely so much on luck and all skill levels can play.  It's fun and also fast -- great for kids with limited attention spans.  I recommend that each parent and grandparent have a set in their house.

review_title: You can play this game alone or with others.
review_description: I purchased this to vary my daily routine during quarantine and keep my mind stimulated. Playing alone can be very challenging and kept me busy.
Better than scrabble.  Fun, encourages thinking. I've been looking for this game for a long time. Glad to have found it so I can play it with my friends!

I was never really a fan of scrabble, but I figured I would give this game a chance to play with the kids. It's an easy game to understand, and you don't have to have read the dictionary to have a chance of winning. The addition of stacking letters to change words already on the board made this game that much different and more fun to play than scrabble.
Me and my 7 year old grandson plays this all the time. He love looking up the words and learning different words to increase his vocabulary. I recommend this review!

We bought this game to play with my dad who has Alzheimers. He is amazingly good at it and it is still challenging enough for all of us who play with him.  As a former teacher, this would also be a great game for students to help learn word patterns.
This game is so underrated! Absolutely one of my favorite board games.
Played the first night we got it. Pretty good experience and challenging enough for everyone without being too tough for the younger kids. Great family time game.
Good product
Perfect family game!

review_title: Children who like board games and are old enough to read will thoroughly enjoy this game!
review_description: I bought this as a gift for my 7-1/2 yr old grandson and he loved it and we all enjoy playing Upwords with him
My daughter's new favorite board game!

review_title: The game is not easy but once you learn it’s fun
review_description: This game is challenging but fun too!

I had an older version of this and I liked the way the tiles went on the old board better, but it didn't swivel and that's a nice feature.  It easily turns for the next player to be able to read the words right side up.
We can’t stop playing this game. It’s so much fun. Hours of entertainment.
Fun family game.
It’s like scrabble. This board is not that large but you can stack on top and that is the point. Small kids have a hard time understanding that it’s okay to stack letters on top of others
Great game
If you love Scrabble, you’ll love this too! It’s slightly different with the rules but keeps the players engaged and thinking! Great for vacations.
Love this game and live that the board spins so everyone can see.
Love this game!Thanks for your great service!
Arrived as described.

review_title: A fun family and party game
review_description: Similar to Scrabble but a little easier, making it appeal to more people
Great family game for all ages an vocabulary levels
Great game for my 9 yo to increase her spelling skills
Great family game for older elementary ages and up!  A lot of fun and new twist to scrabble!
Playing games with my residents @ work♥️We all enjoy this game and scrabble😊
My kids love this game.
Was given twice the amount of listed tiles for half of the alphabet, while missing all tiles from the other half of the alphabet. Making the game not able to be played
Love it
Luv this game.
I like the game.
Bought as gift ..
Fun game
Fun game
Fun for whole family!

review_title: Feels a bit cheap, but still plays well
review_description: I picked this up for my kids to help learn to spell. My wife and I used to play the actual game regularly and our old one was missing a bunch of the letters.This is a new design and I am mixed. It is nice to have a rotating board, but it feels a little cheap. It hasn't broken yet, but it feels like it might break fairly easily.I liked the older design of letter fully covering the previous letter instead of this model of setting a letter on top. This works fine but you have seat the letters a bit more carefully than the older design.

review_title: Rotating Board is a great update on the classic
review_description: I grew up playing Upwords in the early 90s. We had an old grey board. I remember we always had to carefully slide it to the next player to avoid the tiles falling down.This new updated version of Upwords fixes the problem of falling tiles for shaky hands and makes it easy to rotate the board. The tiles have perfect sized holes to sit on top of each other and not slide off. The lazy susan spinner on the bottom of the board works as well as a plastic spinner can. Sometimes it requires two fingers to spin (one to hold the base and one to spin), but most of the time you can spin it with just a flick of one finger.I wish the box was just a little big bigger. When you store it away, you have to disassemble the spinner from the board, turn it upside down, and then put all the tile holders and pieces in it. If you pack the board away as is, the box won’t close all the way. It’s not a deal breaker as that only takes less than a minute to do.Overall, I definitely recommend this for fans of word games.

My family absolutely loves playing Upwords. It is a cool spin on the game Scrabble allowing you to build words up, which means the words are ever-changing and growing upwords. It is fun and easy to play. My only critiques are minor. Instead of a nice drawstring bag for the letters, they give you a plastic Ziploc type bag. Also, some of the letters look very similar and it hard to differentiate between them (such as Z & N or C & U). If it weren't for these minor things, this game would easily earn a 5-star rating from my family. It is a game we will be playing again and again. It'll be a big hit for a logophile (word lover).

review_title: Classic family tabletop game for word nerds. A fun way for scrabble lovers to mix things up.
review_description: As a lifelong  Scrabble player who hadn’t played UPWORDS since childhood, I was excited to try it out again with my daughter. While it’s still a little advanced for my first-grader, I think she’ll be good to go by the end of the school year.If you’re a Scrabble player playing with non scrabble players, you’ll probably need to take it easy on the two-letter Scrabble-centric words to keep the play fun and competitive. If you’re playing with another Scrabble player, play is double fun because you can really stack up the points with parallel plays. It’s hard to let go of the idea of premium tiles, though! But I love expanding my options instead of being constrained by the existing game board. It’s really fun!There’s even a solo variation if you want a real life word game solitaire.The board has a sort of lazy susan apparatus that locks in place at each quarter turn, fine if you’re playing with 3 or 4 players, but annoying with two, as it jostles the tiles if you turn it at all forcefully past the click. And the little plastic novelty UPWORDS logo thing pops out of the box almost immediately, so either tape it in or count on losing it and having a rack-sized hole in the box.

review_title: LOVE the new and improved board and tiles
review_description: We are word nerds and already had three copies of Upwords when this came up to review, and I was about to skip over it when I noticed that it has a new rotating board.  I had to try out the new board.The rotating board is great.  It doesn't have a lazy susan underneath the main board, but it functions in a similar manner.  The board easily spins, and it locks down in the four cardinal positions.The tiles have been updated as well.  Instead of having a groove around the edge of each of the letter tiles to allow stacking, now the tiles have four little divots on top of the tiles and four little posts on the bottoms of the tiles.  Tiles can still get knocked over, but it doesn't happen as much as it does with the original style tiles.The new improved board is amazing.  We haven't played Upwords in years, and since getting this new board this week we have played the game about five times.

review_title: Fun game, fairly easy to learn, but poor quality of pieces hampers enjoyment
review_description: Pro:- Fairly easy to learn the basics, though some of the scoring can take a bit to get used to- Immediately appeals to scrabble fans (and there are a lot of us!)- Individual tile holders are well-made- The ziploc bag to store the tiles in is a nice touch- And thumbs up on the lazy-susan functionality of the boardCons:- A great many of the pieces have unpleasantly sharp edges ("Ow!"); it's clear these were cheaply manufactured and/or cut.  Be prepared to trim or sand down the sharp nubs :(.- Some letters can be challenging to disambiguate, particularly the N vs. Z.- Instructions provide helpful examples, but could use some wordsmithing / optimizing to make things more clear.

review_title: The best chess set of this type and price range on amazon.
review_description: I've been trying to find a Chess set that is a balance of good quality and a good size for a while.  It seemed either there was only cheap junk out there or really expensive kits.  After many pages of amazon searches, ebay searches and review reading i settled on this kit.It's nicely sized and the pieces are great quality with nicely carved features.  The board is also good quality with a solid locking mechanism for when the unit is stored.The only con i can think of is that all of the pieces(chess & checkers) need to come out when playing as there is no retaining strap for the pieces.  This is extremely minor and not really a problem for me, but i figured I'd mention it.

This A&A Wooden Chess Set is attractive and well made. It is ideal for giving you a complete chess experience. There is ample room to store the chess pieces when not in use and the board opens into a nice-size playing surface. The set is just the right size for carrying with you or storing in a convenient place. When the board is fully opened, the two parts fit snugly together. Chess players will love the lockable feature of the box.

This is a fine chess set. Gets the job done. I do wish the pieces had a bit more weight to them, though. My main complaint is that the bottom has a finish that gets all over whatever the board is resting on. We put it on our new couch and we’re so upset when we finished our game and saw that there were black marks where the set was sitting. Just be sure to play on a surface that won’t stain!

review_title: Very nice chess set - for the price
review_description: This set met my expectations, with a couple of exceptions below that I consider minor for this price range.  I'll try to post pictures later, but since I bought this as an early gift for my daughter it is currently hidden.  I especially like this size!  The pieces are light, but I don't mind that for play and for travel of course that's a plus.  Also, since we intend to play a fair amount, I was not too worried about detailed craftsmanship or aesthetic value of the set.  If you want perfection, you can easily pay over $100 for similarly sized house of Staunton pieces, so this set, for this price, is a good deal.  The squares are 1.5".  Now for the exceptions, so perhaps the seller can take note:  one of the white pawns has an irregular head, which isn't a huge eyesore but is noticeable up close and I would have expected that any quality inspection person paying attention should have replaced that one.  No idea how automated manufacturing has become, but even then this looks almost like a lathe error and should have been rejected.  Second, the finish has a couple of noticeable flaws:  the brown finish on the king stands apart from the rest of the pieces, which, in itself doesn't matter in terms of color but the fact that it is a little off compared to other pieces is just noticeable.  Almost like it is spread too thin or something.  Last, the edges of the board:  I like the softer edges for both carry feel and general rounded look, but there should be more attention paid to the finishing touches during sanding to make this edge smoother.  This would eliminate the difference in look and feel while preserving the finish, which soaked in deeper due to roughness and left it looking dry.  Again, these are minor things but when the rest of the board looks amazing it stood out to me.  The inlaid wood squares look fanastic, and everything is tightly flush.  Overall, it is a nice-looking set and I expect to enjoy playing on it.

review_title: Good Quality and Made to Travel
review_description: SolId quality , especially for a travel friendly chess set.  This also includes checkers. Loved that all pieces are stored in velvet bags inside so not just a jumbled mess when opened. Case latches securely so it doesn't fall open when on the go. Was very satisfied with this set. Quality was very good,  not super fancy though, so if you're looking for a set to display in your home, I'd go with a more intricate model. Very well made for travel, or for a kid's set, however.

Perfect size for easy travel, beautifully constructed, pieces are very detailed. Exactly what I was looking for. And for that price is a win win.. ordered October 27 and arrived October 30, just 3 days super fast, earlier that expected!! Very happy with this purchase..

The dovetailed corners on this set were a clue to its quality. I was not disappointed. Everything is finished well, fits together well, and works well. My picky 17-year-old grandson was very happy with it as his birthday present. Now he has a set he can carry in his backpack so he can play games with classmates. I highly recommend this set.

review_title: This product meets and exceeds expectations.  No mo agonizing on iphen chess app..
review_description: The chess pieces are nice and thick, with thick bases.  They are light but stable, which makes the board more portable.  The board looks very cleanly made and the joinery is nicer than standard diagonal butts.  It even comes with a tote case to protect the board surface when you stick it in your backpack to take to wherever you intend to go.  A note to the manufacturer: let the finish dry an extra day (although it is probably summertime where this is made and the humidity it higher now than in wintertime) or run an extra fan on it so that the checkers pieces are not as tacky and don't stick.  They popped apart easily using a butter knife, so no harm really.  Humidity seems to be the cause of this effect and an extra fan is the solution.  Overall, I like the way the pieces look, the board looks, the interior arrangement of the pieces, the tote bag, and the speed of shipment and delivery.  Way to go Licok Warehouse.  Now I can play chess without the agony of a tiny iphen screen board that causes me to accidentally misplay pieces every so often.

I bought this for my daughter who loves chess, and she loves this set. It includes a bag for the board, a chess and checkers board, chess and checkers pieces, Extra queen for each team, little pouches, and instructions. My daughter is now always nagging me to play with her. I would totally recommend this.

Some company in China that manufactured this chess set has real pride in their work. The joinery of the woodwork for the board is flawless. Each piece is well detailed. It comes with a protective carry bag.  I don't know how they produce something like this for such an affordable price. This is a lifetime quality game board that can be handed down to future generations. It has chess and checkers included, with two extra Queens.

I’m learning how to play chess but I don’t need a big board because I have no space to storage it. This chess set is lovely, it’s small(but not too small) and light, and the surface of the board is very smooth. I would give it a 5 star.

Craftsmanship of the board and chess pieces is excellent. Easily transported a large enough to enjoy playing. When using the board the checker pieces need to be removed from the carrying case so that the board will set level. Excellent value for the price. Good for beginners and experienced players that wish to travel.

review_title: Broken rook- pieces must be removed from slots to use board.
review_description: All the pieces must be removed if you want to use the board for a game. So if we want to play checkers we still have to remove the chess pieces so the board will be flat. Also- our rook arrived damaged and had splinters- not safe for kids.

I was looking for a chess set for my son and this has exceeded my expectations. Not only does it come in excellent quality but also carries extra queens for the pawns promotion. Great checkers and chess set, nothing too fancy or simple. Includes slots for the pieces as well, so everything remains organized and tidy.

The wood tones and build quality is pretty good for the price.  This set has become our family go-to set mostly because of the size.  But the nice thunk when placing pieces on the wooden board is an added bonus!
Everything about this set is just Nice! Nothing too fancy, but the overall feel, and quality of craftsmanship is on that level you would "want" a nice chess/checker set to be.

This chess board is awesome! Very well built, better than I expected. I've taught my daughter to play on this board, and we have decided that this will be our family chess board. We've even etched or names on the inside! GREAT PRODUCT!

Beautiful wooden chess set, have it in my living room on a coffee table. Gonna play chess with my friends when they come over. The wooden color goes with my living room so well. This wooden chess set includes checkers as well so I think that’s pretty impressive, overall really liked it.
Although its larger than most traveling sets, the quality and precision of the board and its piece keeper are just awesome!  So fun when its easy to play!

review_title: Great price for the good quality
review_description: Perfect size for traveling, beautifully constructed, Exactly what I was looking for and my little boy couldn’t wait to opening it! Great price for the good quality!
This is well made. The wood board is very smooth. It’s big enough to place on the coffee table as a decoration, but for my children it’s not good for traveling since the pieces has no magnetic force.

review_title: Good starter set to learn on
review_description: Good set for the price. Pieces are a little on the light side, but still nice. The construction is ok, the board is little uneven at the seem when unfolded, but still ok for the kids. Overall this is a good set for the kids to learn on.
Our first set was damaged and the seller immediately shipped us a new one. Lovely set and great customer service! I would buy again!
Ecactly what we wanted. Beautiful looking set.  Nice Chess pieces. Perfect size. Exactly as described! Well worth the money. Would make a fantastic gift.  Love the travel bag!

I need a small chess set for my kid, especially for travelling and tournaments. The design is very convenience and easy to put into kid's backpack. The real wooden broad is heavy enough and stable. The checkers has good feeling. Overall, that's a good gift for a chess-lover kid.
Missing pieces!! I am really shocked. Totally worthless as a chess board. Missing a couple of pawns but has extra queens.

This board has a seamless finish and I was happy with how it feels after opening. At first, I was nervous the board would fall apart--since the board functions also as it owns carrying case--but I was impressed with how strong it holds up.A great board for beginners and those who simply love the game :)

This was purchased for my 11 year old for Christmas but the set is missing a Knight and has 3 queens for the dark wood size. I would love to know if I can get the extra piece without sending this one back.
This is nice !  Perfect size. Made from nice wood. Great carry bag. Protects the board for travel.

Nice chess set for the price. Pieces are easily recognizable and large enough to handle easily. The wooden board that folds into a carrying case makes it convenient to store and for travel. Purchased a second set as a gift.
We bought this for our 10-yr-old grandson. He loves it! The wood pieces are beautiful and the case is beautiful.

When I first time bought this product, I found there was a missing pawn. I request a return, and Amazon asked if I need to exchange another one. I of course need another one. I returned the one with missing pawn to Kolh’s and get the new one with complete pieces at the next week.My son love this chess set. It include checker also. Good deal! Highly recommended.

My set had a piece which was warped so that is disappointing. To much hassle to return. Additionally, the checkers that were included in the set were fused together and had to be split apart which resulted in damaged finish on multiple pieces.
Great starter chess set for little kids. My son loves it. He almost asked to play with him every day. Worth the money. Going to buy another set for his friend too.

The texture of the wood grain is very good. Each piece of chess piece is very comfortable to polish. I bought the magnetic one for the first time, which is better than I expected. My son likes it very much
Compact, but not too small. Nice finish and shine. Made a great addition to my classroom!
Fun fun funExcellent qualityNice packagingNice chess piecesWill recommend

review_title: Missing parts, but would be a nice set if all there
review_description: Missing a bishop. Not what you want to find out in Christmas morning. Unhappy boys on Christmas morning make unhappy parents.

Overall a really beautiful and well made product. Good for travel, but you do have to remove everything inside in order to play a game. Not really a terrible inconvenience, but worth noting. Sturdy pieces. Smooth board and secure closures.

It was much better than I expected, a really nice wood set. It looks good, the board lies flat, and the board closes up nicely with all the pieces inside. Everything good with this seller and with this product.
Purchased this set to replace my old chess board that is a bit small. Like the material used and the size of the board. Not a fan of the foldable design but could be useful if traveling with it.
Beautiful and functional, but very easily scratched.
great quality, especially for the price.

The set is nice, but it’s not like the picture.  The picture shows each individual piece stored in it’s compartment, but they gave me a bag for the pieces to be stored.  This was the main reason why I bought it.
My kids began to learn this ancient game couple weeks ago. Bought it for them, they love it so much—Great quality chess set, smooth wood, nice craft! Perfect gift!
Love the board  but you can’t play chess while the checkers are in the storage spot in the board.

A very stylish set! Pieces were great in size and very well made.  However, part of the board started to lift up some not a huge deal because some heavy duty glue will fix it but it was noticeable and a lil disappointing especially because it was a gift to my dad.
Great set, very pretty and good quality in construction. Exactly as described
Check mate
Plastic casing that holds the pieces was cracked in shipping. Otherwise, a good quality set that will last a while.
This is a large size board 22 inches and pretty well made so it should hold up. Much better than the 12 inch smaller boards
Super easy to play! Kids love it so far, and gives them something else to play while we are at home during the pandemic. Good quality too!
We saw this game advertised on Facebook and went here to look for a better deal.  This game is SO MUCH FUN!  My kids love playing it and it provides tons of entertainment for family gatherings!

review_title: Great competitive game for children and adults
review_description: Bought for the grandchildren. They enjoy playing and so do the adults.

A fun game to have around when hosting various age groups. Kids and adults can play! Make it more fun with high energy music or encouragement from the entourage. One of our guests ordered one before leaving our party!
Fun game. However some of my pucks came broken. Trying to get them replaced.

review_title: Great cheap alternative to the original version
review_description: Great cheap alternative to the original version.

review_title: Super fun and easy to learn!
review_description: Bought this to have as one of the tabletop games for our wedding and this is super easy to learn and a blast to play!  The only drawback is that I wish it came in a case and had a little bag for the discs, but we used an empty crown royal pouch and it's doing the same job!
Extremely boring pointless game. The “large” board is very small...what a complete waste of money. Way overpriced!!!!!
Gift.  Wasn’t as sturdy as I thought for the price
Really good! Really a good way to bond with family
Tried to return the item, would not allow me too. It’s an extremely pointless game.

review_title: Buy it you will love it
review_description: We love the game we even made it a adult fun game by playing for shots
This game was perfect to distract my grandsons. Only wish I have is that it folded up somehow.
Horrible / grandsons said no one able to shoot thru slit - too small
All ages will love this game! So simple to learn and fun to play!
The family lives this game!
Great game for kids and adults!
Super fun! We have both sizes and enjoy playing! Fun for the whole family!
What I liked about this game is that you can take it camping and my kid and I loved to play this when not swimming in the lake.
Was a hit. Easy to play and addicting.
Easy to use. Fun for both kids and adults
Fun game for 2 when you’re stuck inside or even outside lounging!
Love it! Fun game, easy to play!
Great game. High intense action at the palm of your hands literally.
easy to learn and play, fun for the whole family!
Excellent

We purchased this after we saw it on Tiktok. It's just a great fun family game, and one that children and adults both really enjoy playing together and I can honestly say that the two of us enjoy playing it as much as our child. My son get excited when he almost get rid of all your pucks each time!

review_title: Yes, more women, but also racist caricatures
review_description: I ordered this game for my ESL students to help them practice speaking. I remember the original version having next to no women, so I was glad to see an updated version of the game. Yes, this new version actually has equal numbers of men and women, but the fact of the matter is that the African-American faces are so grotesquely caricatured that I feel as though I have traveled back in time. It is unbelievable that a game I purchased in 2018 has a drawing of a minstrel show character as one of the people. Either I am going to draw new faces for all the characters myself, find new face cards, or throw the whole game out entirely. I cannot in good conscience recommend this game for anyone, and I strongly suggest that the creators reconsider their whole framework for what is acceptable. Unbelievable.

review_title: They say you can't go back, but evidently neither can manufacturing quality...
review_description: I know this falls under the "Surprise to No One" category, but the build quality of this game is Far Far Below what it was 15 years ago. The game pieces often get jammed when you try and flip them down.  The game pieces often fall off when you try and push them down.  The game pieces often don't want to move when you try and push them down.It doesn't seem like this would have been a hard thing to reproduce, to give that satisfying clack when you flick the back of a tile, but oddly the game isn't very much fun to play when you can't emphatically knock down the Whos that you have eliminated.I used to play this game with my cousin for hours when I was much younger, and this was most certainly a disappointing walk down memory lane.

review_title: Flip-down faces are on thinner card stock than "before" and fall out easily.  Probably done to save 5 cents per unit.
review_description: The flip-down parts used to have a thicker card stock.  Now it's basically paper, so they fall out easily.  Still the same game, still fun to play, but I'm betting the design choice to use cheaper paper was to save 5 cents per unit.  Thanks, Hasbro, you've ruined another relic from my childhood.

I was really hoping to get a lot of use out of this game but it's in a million pieces. The cards fall out and the plastic flipping pieces are constantly breaking off. Also, while I appreciate that the company has added diverse characters to the game, the kids have a hard time telling who's a girl/guy at times, and describing skin tones. Don't waste your money!!!

I had a lot of fun using this to make my daughter a Disney Princess theme Guess Who! We actually did a couple themes to switch out! I love how it looks but there a few things I didn't love about this version.1. The pieces are very cheaply made and are hard to get up. The one we have from my childhood is built much better. Additionally, all the people come up when you flip it over.  With this one you have to manually flip most of them and the flaps constantly catch awkwardly and have to be fixed.2. The slots are a lot shorter and fatter in this version so printing off special versions took some tweaking. It is also harder to see some features like eye color. It was easier to see in the original size (for older version I printed off).It is still loads of fun and worked for us. I just wish it was more like the older one. My kids still think it's the coolest though!

Overall my kids enjoy playing this game but unfortunately it's been remanufactured in a cheap manner. A lot of the characters resemble each other and some are hard to tell what they are exactly. I miss the old-fashioned version of this game

review_title: The quality of this toy has really gone downhill since I was younger...
review_description: My kids love this game, but the flip pieces are so cheap that they are really difficult to put up and down and the boards just feel like they are going to break in to pieces any time you handle them.  The gameis the same amount of fun it used to be, but I highly doubt it will last very long before we end up having to toss them due to breakage.

review_title: Awful - you get what you pay for
review_description: I guess I should have been prepared to get what I pay for. The construction and execution of these plastic game boards has dimisinished since my childhood set of guess who. The cheap plastic molds aren’t fitted well together, and it’s constantly getting stuck. It’s like the flippers get off track and don’t want to go down, or pop back up. It’s sad how cheaply made this is. If I would have known how terrible it was going to be I would have continued shopping to find a used older edition from years ago.

review_title: A great update on an already wonderful Classic!
review_description: Have so many fond memories of the travel version of this from when my brother and I used to play during long road trips, flights, etc. growing up! So, decided it was a perfect complement to add onto a variety of other games/activities my wife and I gathered up ahead of our nieces (ages 4 & 7) coming over for the weekend.The game has been updated a bit in the last 25 years in that it no longer is so narrow in how faces/people are conveyed. There is far greater diversity; eyes, hair (color/style), and other aspects of profile are no longer limited to "conventional" norms.Obviously, at its core, this game is a great play of guess-and-check, but as an adult, my appreciation is rooted more in the way it specifically opens up the way my nieces approach problem-solving and working through logic considerations to make each turn count!  You could clearly see the learning taking place from one round to the next as both girls started to think a bit more about the field at large rather than focusing on single traits at random.  This was far more evident in the 7 versus 4 year old as we partnered up with each to help, but both responded quickly relative to their respective ages and had a blast doing it!

I like how the game transformed from being racist and sexist to more diverse- more people of color and equal amount of women (considering that Jess is a female) - this is an achievement, even though I don’t understand overly-cartoonish characters,but Hasbro also re-modeled the board. The retailers keep advertising a classic 3-row board, which actually has been discontinued and Hasbro switched to a 4-rows version, also SMALLER, which I find more difficult for a child. Classic version had 3 rows. Why did Hasbro need to fix something that wasn’t broken? The seller also needs to update the pictures, because what is pictures is not what you’re getting.Can Hasbro just keep the quality and artwork but just add diversion? That’d be great.

I work in the schools and bought this game to replace an older version that was falling apart.  I could not believe what I saw when I opened it.  The images of the black and brown people were horrifying.  There were a couple that looked "normal" however, some of them were terrible caricatures.  Facial features were grossly exaggerated.  I WILL NOT use this game with kids. I called Hasbro and informed them of my concerns.  They offered to send out another product of equal value.  I feel like anyone who is appalled by this game needs to call the company.  It should be changed.

I was VERY disappointed with this particular model of the Guess Who? game because the cartoon-like faces are not the same as the more realistic faces in my friends’ games. I would not have purchased this game if I had known this model was different. The cartoon-like faces in this particular model have 5 different shades of skin tone. It is difficult to distinguish one face from another. Also, one of the faces looks like a “black face”.  This particular model is racist!!

review_title: Terrible-Do not buy this game, find the old version.
review_description: I used to love to play this game when I was a kid, so I ordered it to play with my own kids. I just received it today, and I already dislike it and am very disappointed. The first issue is the face cards and the fact that I had to put them in the holders. Then to top it off, they constantly slide out! It’s really annoying and I just don’t get why they made it like that, the original version didn’t have this issue at all. My other complaint, like others have mentioned, is the way they have portrayed the minorities. I’m glad they added more women and diversity, but they went about it all wrong. The black characters are very unrealistic and to be frank, pretty offensive the way they are portrayed. I’m really disappointed in the remake, if I knew about either of these issues prior, I wouldn’t have supported the company by buying this product. I’d actually rather have the old version. Very disappointed and frustrated. They’ve taken a great game and childhood memory I wanted to share with my kids, and essentially ruined it. My son is excited to play it, he loves board games, but it really just gets me more and more frustrated and angry the more we play with it. Hands down worst purchase from Amazon.

I don't understand why the quality of this game is so poorly constructed. The hinges feel like they are certain to break, because they get twisted and stuck. Also the drawings of the characters with darker skin are awful...seems racist.  Can't recommend!!!

review_title: cheaply made, faces constantly sliding out
review_description: The pictures are a pain to put into the slots and they don't stay. They constantly slide down or fall out. Makes the game practically unusable. The pictures are also very weird looking, for example my 5 yr old couldn't understand the eye colors because they didn't look like what they were (ie, brown looked yellow)

review_title: Super fun game, awful quality product.
review_description: I have fond memories of this game as a kid and have had lots of fun playing with my own children.  I just wish the quality of the game was a little better.  I'd pay a few more dollars to not have to fix all the tabs every single time we flip it up and down.  They are always stuck and it's just a matter of time until they start breaking. :(

review_title: Need to glue/tape faces into their holders
review_description: I like that the characters are a little different than what I remember seeing when I played the game as a kid. They are more diverse, instead of having the vast majority of the characters being white.My main complaint is that the cards that you put into each of the holders easily fall out when you are putting the pieces up or down, or when you are taking the game out of the the box. I'll have to glue them in place so I won't end up losing them.Also, I use this game with elem. aged students, and they have difficulty opening the box and getting the game pieces in or out of the box.

review_title: Not like the game from the '80s
review_description: The game itself is a good game, but the craftsmanship is quite poor. The plastic tabs get stuck up or down and are difficult for young kids (for whom the game is designed) to operate easily; the depictions are small and somewhat dark making the facial details difficult to see. The original game was much nicer in quality and with the clues that could be used. It is nice for the game to include different skin tones, but it limits asking for other clues. This basically comes down to skin tone, gender, hair color, hat. I'd recommend a wider selection of face cards and let families choose which ones to use in the game with their family. As kids advance, easier face cards could be swapped out for those that would require more scrutiny (if the drawings were a tad larger and easier to detect the details.)

We were gifted the original Guess Who and my six year old son noticed two things: there are only a few girls and no people of color. We promptly looked for a better one and found it.Also, this version is sturdier which is an added bonus.

CHEAP! Flimsy plastic and the pictures are not attached. Your must rip them out of a sheet and place them in the plastic frame yourself which they fall out of. Also, the box contained a baseball card?? I’m guessing it was a return and they didn’t bother to QC the product before sending it back out. A shame we’re stuck with it since it was a Christmas gift and past it’s return window.

review_title: They dont make things like they use to....
review_description: Ugh!....The paper ppl keep falling out! So let me get this right; after each time u play you have to stick the people in ALL over again????!!! This sucks! Way to time consuming. Plastic pieces keep getting stuck. Waste of money! I know my kids are going to destroy this.

review_title: Middle schoolers still like guess who!
review_description: Got these for my classroom for fun FriYAY. Who knew middle schoolers would still love guess who? It's fun to see kids still being kids and finding such joy in little games like guess who. I remember playing this as a kid and wondering why there were only 5 women in the whole game! Well look out all you equal rights types because there's women AND African Americans now. That's sarcasm btw because what's up with no other races being represented? Big sigh. But it's still a great game and helps with logic, expression, and grouping like things.

review_title: Not really the classic; must hot glue to be able to use
review_description: We bought this because we wanted the style of art from the classic version. (We have the new version as well, that has the big cards with vehicles, food, and sea life, but don't like the style of illustration. They are hard to tell what things are, especially the vehicles. And the smiley faces on inanimate objects is unnecessary. Also, we wanted to have people, which are not included in the game we already have.) We are disappointed because: 1. The cards fall out constantly. Every.single.time the door goes down, the card falls out. Impossible for kids to manage and ridiculously frustrating. We fixed it by hot gluing each individual card into its slot. While this took about 30 minutes, it made the game actually playable. 2. The illustrations aren't really the classic version. They are okay. . . better than the silly vehicles in the new version, but still can be hard to make out. It is just weird how they chose to design it. Shadows and shading just make things hard to see. Overall, after we glued in the cards, it is fun to play. But, the new design with the big cards is much smarter. But, the illustrations on these latest games leave a lot to be desired.

The quality to the game is terrible; the thin cardstock with peoples faces on them fall out of the holder at the slightest movement! Who wants to spend 10 minutes carefully arranging pieces of paper so they don't fall out before playing a 5 minute game? Definitely look for an older version of this game, because it is a fun game! - But the new version is worthless.

So it's been over 30 years since we played this game and there is one character that we are unsure of it's a male or female. We chose male. The plastic is very very cheaply made. They don't slide down or should I say flip down as smoothly. I wouldn't recommend buying this. I would try find an older version if possible.

review_title: The game you know and love, but not the quality you remember
review_description: A good thinking game for kids.  They do need to know some letters at least even if not able to read so they are able to make guesses and confirm other people's guesses by at least spelling out the names on the cards.  Main downside here is the materials are noticeably cheaper and thinner/flimsier than I personally remember.  I generally think most product are trending in this direction but it's worth noting. You'll have to take a little bit more care to not be rough with these. The plastic is thin, the faces are little thin cardboard you insert.  It's a little disappointing but doesn't affect gameplay and I'm okay with it given the very reasonable price.  I'd rather have two flimsy board games for $20 than one sturdy one for $10 honestly.  The $10 price boosts it to 5 stars despite the craftsmanship.

Was so excited to get this for my six year old!  I’ve had it in my cart for a while now.  With a 3 week break from school stuck in the house I figured this was perfect timing to order!  I put it together and we played a few games before bed.  My 6 year old picked up on it quickly and kicked my butt two times in a row! It was a blast!

Classic Guess Who game! The only reason why I took a star away is the quality. Craftsmanship of these newer games has gone downhill. We own many classic games that have been “updated” and all of them fall short in terms of quality.For this game, the board games are all around flimsy. At least half of the yellow card holders are difficult to position upright when you want them upright and sometimes they don’t flip down as easily as you’d like. Often times they come out of socket when propping back up and have to be popped back in.I would still recommend this game, as well as other classic games (Connect 4, Battleship, etc) that have been updated, but know the quality is not like you remember!

review_title: They love trying to outsmart me when we play
review_description: Purchased this to play with my grandchildren.  Wanted them to learn to be observant and see similarities  around them.  Being an educator, it gives me a chance to work on skills that will help them later.  They love trying to outsmart me when we play.  I'm glad this age old game has returned to make learning to be strategic thinkers  fun.

review_title: Bummed with the quality. Game is fun and amazing for all ages
review_description: I would like to start with the positives..This game is a CLASSIC! A must have in any kid friendly house! My 5 year old all the way up to my 11 year old and myself enjoy this game! It’s an amazing way to spend time together and have fun.What I Very much dislike is the quality. It’s SO BAD. Like gone down hill since I used to play this as a kid! One of our boards(the blue one) works well, it’s flip pieces don’t get stuck. However red sides pictures are constantly falling out, the little yellow picture holders on the red board are always getting stuck and never flip back easily. It’s so much of a hassle to play this game. I’m really bummed the quality in the boards are so cheap and flimsy.This would be an amazing game to gift if the quality was better.

review_title: Not the best lesson for kids
review_description: The concept of this games is okay in that it encourages kids to use their voices. This is particularly relevant for the kids who have difficulties speaking. However, perhaps instead of people the cards should have pictures of animals or cartoons. Otherwise, it's conditioning kids to look and categorize people by appearance and nothing more.

The game is fine. Arrived on time. No complaints about the game itself. I do however have a complaint about Amazon. This game comes up when you search for travel games. THIS IS NOT A TRAVEL VERSION OF THIS GAME! I wasted $10 on a game I can’t put in my kids’ carry on bag. There was no misrepresentation on the part of the seller and had I read more carefully I wouldn’t have ordered it but I’m still annoyed.
