Spin the spinner, remove the fruit based on the number of cherries that the spinner stops at and move on to the next player.
Really don't know, grandkids Christmas gift.
Easy to play. I wouldn’t want it any smaller than this one. My husband and I are very competitive and we were playing so fast:) Pretty fun, even for adults!!
The game looks like fun, but mine came with only 9 disks. I don't want to return it, but would like another disk.
We used it for entertainment. It's exciting! My grandson (10) really loves it. We did challenges with each other. Love thus game!
Fun with grandkids
Our family is having a blast with this game.  it is so much fun
Very nice, good quality, better than my expectation. A good toy for family party and outdoor, my daughter enjoyed it.

This toy for my kid to play with me, she has fun with me. Light weight and easy to fold up  to take everywhere. My kid tried play, she is first time to play with it. She had a good time. I’ll get more games for her to play with me, kid always want me to get more game to play with her. We have so fun.

So it seemed like a normal Tuesday evening. I had tacos, topped up the fuel in my truck, and headed home where my package sat waiting for me.I figured since it's from Hasbro it should be fine for the kids to play with so I handed it of to them after the unboxing and proceeded to take pleasure in popping the bags of air that came with it.It wasn't ten minutes later I hear screaming and the dog is barking. I rush into my kids room and see this shadow crash through the window. My dog has blood on his fur and the board is on fire!I pulled the curtains closed cause we all know sunflower colored drapes keep demons at bay and then turned to my kids. "What did you do?" I asked. They said they just wanted to talk to Santa and let him know what they wanted but my kid isn't the best at spelling (or doing chores for that matter) and I guess they maybe summoned Satan, or maybe just a demon.I don't know but I do know that you should take precautions when playing with board games. Whether it's making a circle of protection around you for Ouija, or not letting your snotty uncle play Monopoly with the family. Either way, please be careful!

However If you do use the ouija board be carful, do it right, follow the directions, don't taunt any of the negative spirits and play at you own risk. May God Be With You All!

Always a good time classic and the poltergeists in our house now make it never lonely.

The lights flicker on and off and the power blinks..because of the breakers in the garage, I OWN AT PLAYING THIS GAME.I scratch their bedroom door and tell them to listen to their elders and the kids believe the ghost.All because I bought a game on Amazon..

This is great. Bought for paranormal investigations, but soon after my daughters and nephew an niece got ahold of it one night everything changed. Honestly I don't care who believes me. We hear footsteps every night at 11. We've had lights an tv come on an off in the middle of night when sleeping. I decided to buy motion sensor camera an caught a orb manifest from my bedroom an came down hallway at what time? 11pm you guest it. Last night me an my wife fell asleep on couch an around 11:45 I woke up to this glowing white figure standing over my wife, it's like I was paralyzed by this entity. Soon after it floats off down hallway and I hear 4 steps when no one was awake. I began yelling trying to get my wife awake , but she would not wake it's like she was in a trance or something after shaking her repeatedly she finally wakes up. That's the first time I've seen a spirit an it spooked me. I have played ouija before when I was 16 now 31 so it's been awhile.  My mom a house is still haunted from it, I had my bed shake uncontrollably twice an the second time a witness was with me. Not counting seeing shadow people an many other occurrences that my family encountered. WARNING ⚠️ PLEASE BE CAREFUL AN READ UP ON THE OUIJA BOARD BEFORE PLAYING THIS IS NO TOY.

review_title: Great if you want poltergeists and to lose your dog
review_description: Arrived in perfect condition. Played with some friends and it didn’t seem to work. Days later however my house is now haunted by the ghost of what I believe is a very angry Trump supporter. I’m living a real life poltergeist situation. While watching cnn one night my tv turned off. Also one of my closets has become a portal to the otherside.  I hope I can save my dog who now barks from the ceiling now. Great buy if you hate CNN and your dog and don’t mind losing a spare room.

review_title: So far not believing the hype with these things
review_description: Hi there. I am a practicing pagan of 16 years. I have read my fair share of books on this subject and have practiced many rituals in my time. I have studied shamanism, necromancy, elemental witch craft, and Wicca. Spanning cultures anywhere from Ancient Egypt, to Native American, Norse, Gaelic and Asian. My primary practice summed up is: Necromancy using Ancient Egyptian magick with a strong Wiccan base. I also use Tibetan singing bowls, and Native American smudging rituals using an abalone shell with sage. This cleanses your space of spirits and negative energy.My fiancé and I gave this board a go last night. I had my candles lit, positioned correctly, my necromantic spirit guide/skull, named Michael setup (See The Witches Book Of The Dead by Christian Day)- I even had Frankincense and myrrh incense going in front of the skull. We opened the conversation and proceeded to ask questions. I am not unfamiliar with speaking with spirits, it’s what I do. But the board was dead as a door nail. We had a moment where the candles began to flicker rapidly out of nowhere, after asking a question. That was about it so far.I realize these things can take several tries. We are going to try again around 3AM sometime. And we will try again after midnight as well. I have had more reactions from a candle alone than this board. Maybe our altars intimidate spirits. My god of choice is Anubis after all, and his job is to guide spirits to the underworld for the weighing of the ostrich feather vs the heart. We have seen entities in our apartment before, as well as items disappearing and a few poltergeists - I saw my shoe levitate off of the shoe rack and propel itself forward once. So we KNOW spirits have been here, and do pass through here.The board itself is rather small and flimsy. It seems to be made of cheap cardboard like material, with a cheap print of the ouija board glued around it.If we continue to get zero responses here, even under the next full moon, I may try taking it somewhere else to try it. I deliberately left the ouija board out unattended last night, and absolutely nothing happened you guys. No spooks, no curses, no stuff thrown all over the place . Just nothing. So I am skeptical (even against Christian day) that these are a viable means of communication with the dead.Mind you, I was an atheist for three years recently, so I am critical when observing supernatural phenomenon. I employ that analyzing process to my rituals, so no subconscious “BS” takes place. I feel like a lot of people on here are just moving the planchette themselves and are going through the subconscious motions that scientists use to debunk ouija boards.That being said, I can tell you I have in fact seen ghosts, I have seen entities and creatures with my own eyes that are definitely supernatural. And until I see or hear something as concrete as what I have already seen in my lifetime, I won’t call it a successful session. Wish us luck.Update: nothing happened over the full moon. Nothing at all. Honestly this board is further increasing my skepticism that any of it is real at all. My past experiences could have been over active imagination, crumbling under stress, lack of sleep. So many things to be honest. I am walking away from this board an atheist. Lmao
Talking  to the dead has gotten easier now.

I was excited to share my Ouija experiences with my granddaughter and ordered this for Christmas. There is a "board", granted, and a "planchette": a piece of cardboard and a piece of plastic. Period. Aside from the fact that it's probably worth about a dollar, the planchette is so lightweight and flimsy that it's difficult to use. Very disappointed.

I thought this game was just a fun goofy game. I happened to be in the room, while 4 teenagers were playing, over Halloween weekend. Two of my dead family members came through, spelling out words that I would only know, the 3 kids controlling board had never of known these things about them or me. Lets just say I was crying and totally a believer in communicating with the dead through the Ouija board.

I dont believe in the supernatural or god blablabla our culture have made bad vibes with this which i feel when i remember i have it lol and its a super boring game after you forget what to "ask it" super fun with friends scare the shit out of them still gets boring after a while tho, duh u move it yourself but it feels like its moving by itself cause all off u r interacting with it theres a scientific study on how this works but just bring bad vibes still not real just how the world views it, btw made by Hasbro. Humans and their imagination smh

6 days after I bought this my cat who I loved like a child was brutally hit by a car! So I covered it in salt and sage and burned it! I knew better but I was drunk on whiskey when I bought this! Don’t do stupid shit people!!!!

review_title: A legendary tool made with cheap plastic and cardboard.
review_description: You'd think with such a legendary product with a storied history, Hasbro could at least offer a thin wood version rather than a cheap cardboard mat wrapped with a printed paper label and a white diecast plastic planchette. I mean, it's a game, but it's really not, know what I mean? There's a legend here, and the board should feel legendary. Ouija is labeled as a game for "children 8+" but this is not a toy to be monkeyed with. Several people have experienced very scary things with the symbolism even this cheap rendition may render. We do paranormal investigations on a TV show, and this board simply won't present well. We found a very old wooden one in a graveyard! Working on cleansing it and will use that one instead. This cheap one's getting burned. So disappointed.
Poor quality rubbish. Seams stop the planchette from moving.

review_title: Super cheap board and not worth the price
review_description: Super cheap board and not worth the price. Maybe 10 bucks but not the 20 something I paid for.

I bought this last year for my best friend who lives 10 hours away... I never visited his house since buying it but whenever we were on facetime sketchy things would happen like footsteps from upstairs or shadows and random sounds.... He wasn’t scared so I ignored it... until I went to visit. He would leave me to go work and really weird stuff was happening, tv downstairs came on while I was upstairs, the PlayStation controller would skip around the show or movie that was playing on the tv when the controller was off and most importantly the door would fly open at random when it was closed and locked. WHILE I WAS THE ONLY ONE HOME. I chose to ignore this stuff and one day while putting away the sheets I opened the closet that the game board was in and I promise this closet was about 30 degree colder than the rest of the house... so yeah I guess you could say this is real.

Works perfectly, once blessed and energized we were able to talk to several spirits and communicate with them. I purchased this board after contacting a demon with my original and being in need of a new one. True usage is not for the faint of heart but, will work perfectly as a spirit board.

Then my kid started dabbling into the witch craft and got me excited; maybe they too would becomea Satanist like me. So for their birthday I thought this would be  a fun surprise. It went over well, no contact was made with anything the first try, but when done with their cousin they made contact with Zuzu. Thank goodness after the three hour stand off with the demon we were able to retrieve the cousin's soul and close the connection.Fun stuff couldn't recommend more

I actually bought this because I believe ghost where in my house 🤪 my sister hated me for getting it because we live together,anyways , I never thought it was going to work because once it arrive I was playing with it,yes alone ,so it wasn't  working. but by night fall the planchette began to move and man was I freaking out . This is definitely the version you want if looking for a Ouija board. After reading others reviews I went with this one. This is exactly what I wanted and great quality. It did/does work.. Well!  I use as directed. It feels as though a magnet like pull is spelling things to you. Its wonderful.  Have fun but be careful. Everything out there isn't something you may intend to contact.

review_description: Thanks for the Ouija board my cousin loves it

this was a huge kick at our halloween party. kids loved it!

The board was fine.  It is a regular board with a plastic planchette.  Nothing too fancy.  I was using it as a haunted  house prop.  The board is a bit smaller than I remember it.  I think the smaller size is to prevent a crease from forming if it was folded and still kept in a regular board game box size..

review_title: Sturdy Ouija Board @ a fantastic price.
review_description: Item arrived well packaged, no bent or crushed corners thankfully.  We haven't been able to use it yet unfortunately because finding the time lately hasn't been easy with work and life in general.  The board feels well made, and sturdy - not flimsy.  Abide by the rules and you will be fine, if not good luck and God speed.  Was exactly what I wanted, a well made simple Ouija board.  Once I use it I will update.

review_title: Just like they sell at the store
review_description: Fast shipping.  Daughter opened portal to another dimension, but without it we wouldn't have known our house was buried on an  ancient Indian burial ground.  Thanks to quija we are now honorary Apache Indians!

Well, no spirits took the bait. I sat on the floor with it for hours trying to talk to the ghosties but none came. The planchette remained unmoved until I got bored and started moving it around myself. If you're looking to buy to actually talk to ghosts, I dont reccomend. If you're just trying to get a gift for a horror loving child, sure.
Cheaply made, not very proud with this purchase.
Our board must be defective - no matter how many times we try, the dead won't answer us.  But it freaks out my very superstitious mom when she comes over so that is always fun.

Literally some of her friends wont even come over if its in the house and dont even get me started on the parents opinions! But I think its a good purchase...just watch who you tell about it! 😉

review_title: Pay the extra few dollars and get this version!!
review_description: This is the original version of the game you are looking for. The cheaper addition is not a “build the trap as you play” like the original. The trap is good quality and works great. This is a great game to play with the kids.For the all reviews of people saying parts don’t line up, or cheaply made... they are putting the game together wrong... or letting their nostalgia of this game go on a much higher level than it really was! It truly is the same game.

review_title: This is nothing like the old classic Mouse Trap game you played as ...
review_description: I rarely post reviews on Amazon, however, I felt I had to do it on this item.  I'm an engineer and found it appalling at the lack of precision that these cheap plastic parts were made.  This is nothing like the old classic Mouse Trap game you played as a child where things actually worked and pieces were made of thick sturdy plastic!  This whole game is built around things fitting together crisply to make the game work.  One bent or poorly molded plastic piece and the game is essentially junk.  My recommendation is to look for an older used version on eBay.  This was junk and returned the same day I received it...where the part labeled "thing a ma jig" snapped onto a post that was angled instead of straight, making the second marble not fall properly.  Junk, junk. junk.

review_title: Everyone enjoys watching the mouse trap do its magic.
review_description: The Amazon exclusive version of Mousetrap is the game we all know and love. Mouse Trap pits 2-4 players against each other as mice trying to navigate through a complex mousetrap. As They build the mousetrap by moving their mice across the board. They also try to collect cheese cards, which allow them to move other mice to cheese wheels which is the bait for the trap. Once the mouse trap has been completely constructed, players can attempt to capture each others' mice in it by setting off. the trap if the trap doesn't malfunction, the mouse is captured and out of the game. The winner is the last mouse who avoids being trapped. The mouse trap Parts are highly detailed and good sturdy quality. Box and game board are good quality.

review_title: Rube Goldberg also wrote the instructions.
review_description: Fun game to play at least once or twice but doesn't lend it self to much repeat play with older kids.  However It is fun to play with the mouse trap pieces for a few times.  Instructions are as complicated as the mouse trap but generally straight forward.  Although game is for 2-4 people we successfully played it with 5 by adding an extra piece.  Game is definitely  more fun when players  that have mixed level of mechanical ability.  Game relies on  functional assembly of the trap and  malfunctions add some excitement to game play.  It is not a game to just hand over to small kids as there are many small parts.  It is better to have an older game runner (adult or teen) that can interpret the rules and instructions when playing with younger children.

review_title: Great buy if you wish to re-live the frustration of your childhood!
review_description: Well, this is still the most frustrating game ever made! Congrats Hasbro for successfully selling the worst game ever made, a second time around!!!I purchased it for my son (in hopes the game would be better this time) and after finally getting it set up, it failed, and failed, and continued to fail. The course will not successfuly work!!! The marble at the top of the course will not roll forward no matter what we try. We even tried various tricks found on YouTube to make it work (tape over the marble hole, adjusting the "helping hand") and it has continued to fail and frustrate.So, if you want to re-live the most frustrating game of your own childhood, and pass this painful memory onto your children, go ahead and spend the money!I'm give 2 stars instead of 1 only for the fact that I was able to spend well over an hour of quality time with my son before it turned into a crying, frustrated meltdown...my son was pretty upset too!

review_title: Every bit as good, well-made and fun as the original
review_description: The plastic pieces haven't changed since I was a kid (with the exception of the mice). This is extremely well made and the board accommodates the plastic trap pieces very snugly. Treat this gently and it should last for years. Our boys are 10 and 5 and both enjoy it very much. Family night favorite. Who can resist setting up this trap and setting it off?

Most adults think this game is kind of cheesy (hee, hee), but kids love it.  I am a child therapist, and I will sometimes use it to assess kids' small motor coordination, among other abilities.  If your child is a builder, I would get them this game - they will rate it at 5 stars, which is why I gave it 5 stars!

When I purchased this game, I was not aware that it was used. I have purchased used items before, but the seller was always upfront. I would not have been as upset if it were not for the fact that one piece was broken off inside of another piece. The game would have been completely useless if it were not for the creativity and expert troubleshooting of the entire family. We were able to remove the broken piece, used a Dremmel tool to drill into the two pieces, insert a piece of metal from a paper clip and gorilla glue them together. My 7 year old grand daughter would have been devastated if we had not been able to play the game. In the future do not sell games with broken pieces. Another family might not have been fortunate.

I remember playing this game when I was a child and when I saw it again I just knew I HAD to have it, and let me tell you, it is every bit as awesome as I remember it being! <3For me, everything about this game is a fantastic thrill-ride! I have a blast setting up the contraption every time I open up this box and even more-so when we get to playing and see all the pieces working one after the other.If you've never played this game or have ever considered it (whether as a kid, for kids or just to relive those nostalgic times), I would definitely recommend this game. And actually, when it comes down to it, this is also a pretty educational game since it teaches kids to follow instructions as well as what it takes and how it feels to construct something themselves. Although, just make sure they are supervised during play since there are plenty of tiny pieces that could become hazardous in the wrong hands >_<

review_title: ... at once and this is my 4 year olds favorite! We did break a small peg on the ...
review_description: We bought several games at once and this is my 4 year olds favorite! We did break a small peg on the bottom of the slide the very first time she took it apart but it still works so I didn't exchange or anything. We've playing 20 or more times since with no issues so I'm hoping it will hold up to wear.Update: A year later....We now have too many pieces broken to play the game which is unfortunate because it was their favorite. I don’t really want to buy another one and encourage cheaply made toys. Wish they made a stronger version, I would pay more for it...

I have a very active 7-year-old boy and wanted to find family games that might keep him interested. Santa brought us this one and oh. my. word. It is perfect.My older sister had this game when we were growing up, but I didn't actually remember much of the actual gameplay. I didn't read the game instructions at all first. We popped open the box, dug out the assembly instructions, and pieced the whole game together first. I think it took 30 minutes or so. Then, I read the instructions and saw that you're supposed to build as you play the game. Oops. However, in hindsight, I'm actually really glad I made that mistake because by the time we actually played, we understood where everything went and were sure we had all the pieces. Plus, it really built up excitement for my son. He got how the game worked, and so he put up with the actual gameplay purely because he loved building and setting off the trap repeatedly.Therein lies my only gripe. He insists on setting off the trap every. single. time. one of us lands on the space to set it off, even if nobody is on the space to get caught, and it takes a couple minutes to put it all back together. For him, this is the absolute highlight. He delights in setting it off. For me, and my mom brain... it was initially just more work. But, again, I have never seen him so happy and so engaged in a board game in my life, so I kind of learned to delight in those moments too. He and his 10-year-old sister have now happily slaughtered me repeatedly.Other reviews mention the quality... we didn't have any issues and the pieces are as I remember them.  This will be in our collection for quite some time.

review_title: Fun game! Set up is Finicky.
review_description: This game is so much fun! Just like I remembered from my childhood except for the colors of the board. Overall the contraption works, the only problems I had was with the stairs and the slide (the ball would get caught between the stairs and slide and you had to push it to continue on). I think the placement of the stairs and slide was a little off. The slide also wouldn’t stay all the way in the piece it connects to either. Also be warned The blue piece that the ball hits has to sit just right on the ledge or it won’t work.So it does really work but Is a bit finicky. I would not give this game to any child who gets frustrated easily.

I loved this game as a child.  As an adult with two children, I'm extremely disappointed in the quality of this game.  The ball rarely makes it through without help.  The pieces don't line up right and there are parts that the ball never actually trips (the upward hand for example).  The kicking foot you can't install the parts exactly or it misses the cup.  You have to slightly twist the way they're sitting in order for the foot to make contact.  It's a real bummer when you are trying to show a  6 year old how to put things together then explain that they can't really put them together "correctly"There seems to be different versions of mousetrap out there, the parts look different.  This particular one, I'd steer clear of.

I rarely give low ratings, but this game deserves it. I bought this for my children with some old memories of playing when I was a child .. was disappointed right from opening the box that everything was plastic, and clearly of the cheaper mass-produced type. As we struggled through the first game, our enthusiasm kept going down .. from looking unsuccessfully for the rubber band that was supposed to be in the box, to scrambling to find another piece that we finally discovered in the garbage as it looked exactly like the throwaway plastic pieces that held the other cheap plastic parts.When we finally got to the point in the game when the mouse trap was built and someone finally hand to turn the crank ... nothing. The plastic parts had shifted on the board. So, reassembly and then I held the board down on the floor as my daughter turned the crank .. to watch the metal ball careen down the too-short track and in 2 seconds trip the trap.We put the game away, and went back to Monopoly.

Really like the game. Just 1 gripe... The turn crank board spot... It's unclear on how this is played. Do you spam cheese on 1 turn or use 1 cheese once per turn or are you forced to move from that spot once you don't spend any cheese. The directions for this spot are horrendous.But other then that... The game is well made. I had no problems with any of the pieces and worked 100% of the time (15 trap triggers).

review_title: They love it! We all like to play it together
review_description: I had this game as a child and the kids got it for Christmas this year.  They love it!  We all like to play it together.  The only thing that prevents me from giving it 5 stars is that the part of the trap that is shaped like a hand on a pole and is meant to knock the ball further down the track does not work very well.  It can be very frustrating for the kids after numerous attempts to set it.

Why are board games made with such lousy quality today?!?!  I feel like all board games are cheap and have gone down hill in this age.  Do manufacturers not realize KIDS play with board games so should at least be made with some durability for a game that is supposed to be played over and over again?  Plastic pieces cheap and flimsy.  Doesn't exactly match all the cardboard pieces.  The little ball and cage with boot also does not work well and needs some assistance most of the time to even work properly.

review_title: One of my favorites as a kid.
review_description: This was one of my favorite games as a kid. As my kids are now old enough to be into games I wanted to share this with them. I bought it and it showed up and it was time to have fun. But you have to build the whole thing. Halfway through I realized why this was my favorite as a kid but why my parents never wanted to play. It is a pain to put together and it take forever for it to end. It is still fun and my kids think it is great but it is not on the top shelf where little eyes can jot see so they don’t ask for it.

The instructions read like stereo instructions. You have to take all the pieces apart from a plastic mold and it's very unclear about the pieces that you should have. We started one night and thought we had all of the pieces but could not finish setting up. Unfortunately, we threw 2 pieces away that were still attached to the plastic mold and now the game does not work.  We didn't realize this until after trash night and the pieces are long gone:(

Kid loves it. Learn to build. It can be a little frustrating the first time - at first, I thought the game was shoddily constructed - the pieces wiggle around in their base a bit, but later realized this contributes to the chance element of whether the mouse trap will capture the mouse when it’s triggered

This was one of my favorite's from my childhood.  The anticipation of turning the crank, watching every little mechanism to see if it was all going to work and hoping the trap doesn't come down on my mouse!  We got this for our growing family of 4 for Christmas and the kids (3 and 6) love it!  So happy to be able to play this with them. Hours of fun!

Had to separate all the plastic parts and one of them broke in the process. You have to set the game up every time you want to use it, and it’s a pain. Also our crank doesn’t connect with the stop sign which is supposed to get the whole thing started so I have my son pull back on the stop sign. He’s amused. I’m not.

review_title: This is one of the best board games for kids and adults
review_description: This is one of the best board games for kids and adults. Unfortunately it is made so poorly that it doesn't work properly. It is overpriced and needs to be made sturdier so kids can enjoy playing it without always haveing to put pieces back together.  I never had this game as a child but those who have say it was made so much better and actually worked. I would be happy to pay a higher price for a sturdier version of the game because it is so much fun to play.  I am returning it simply because it doesn't work.

So, like others have stated, there seems to be something missing. In my case, the middle blue hand (box pictures show it there) is missing, and 1 piece of cheese. How is 1 piece of cheese missing from a factory sealed box? Anyway, the missing hand didn’t affect the gameplay and the granddaughter had lots of fun. 3 stars due to missing parts.

I remember playing  with  this  game as a  child It was. My favorite,  my two cousins  and I would play.all day, I met thought  I'd see it again! It looks sturdier  now. It took first place over operation, which  was my main game, in elementary  school I had already decided to be a nurse!  All the adults in my FAMILY  we're  military and were in korea  at the end. I heard so many stories  of human brutality.  And yes I am a nurse!

review_title: Really fun game, your not wasting money promise!!!!
review_description: Hi I'm 10 years old and I love this game it is my 2nd favorite game its  really easy to learn too. Its so exciting to see the mouse get trapped!and I had so much fun building the trap WARNING **** THE INTRUCTIONS JUST HAVE PICTURES , but you can read it still. For example it doesn't say " put the shoe behind the stairs at this angle it just has the picture. It didn't  disappoint me I loved it not just for the kids but its also good for the whole family.

We ordered this guess my sons birthday. Bee opened it up and started building, only to realize it was missing the 2 marbles and rubber band needed to make the whole thing work.  We tried substituting 2 marbles of our own, but they are too small to do what's needed.  Not sure I want to go through the trouble of sending it back.

I had this game when I was younger. My son saw and add for it and requested for Christmas.  This product is actually good quality compared to a lot of other toys/games they make these days. But never as good as they used to make them. Lots of fun to play!

Our game arrived completely busted. Clearly this game was stepped on several times. We’ve spent the last hour trying to glue the pieces together and it isn’t working. We have a 5 and 3 year old so you can imagine the devastation of telling them they can’t play. Really disappointed

review_title: pretty frustrating our only alternative is to maybe tape the ...
review_description: mousetrap pieces fit very loose on the board and if they're not lined up just right the marble won't connect from one piece to another so we're left constantly adjusting the pieces because the marble gets stuck or the man won't make it into the bucket or EXC... pretty frustrating our only alternative is to maybe tape the pieces on to the bottom of the board and leave it built but then what fun is that.

I can't believe I spent money on this POS... the crank doesn't work and the boot has to be swung manually to make it kick the bucket (I had to bend the pole it's on to even get it to be close enough to kick it). It constantly fell apart each time we tried to add more pieces. I put this away after 1 day of frustration and my son hasn't asked to play with it since.

review_title: Not as fun as we had hoped
review_description: We didn't really get how to play the game and if were playing it right, then it's really no fun. The directions are not clear how to put the board together but once it's set up, it's fun to play the balls through a few times and then you're bored.

I always wanted to play this when I was younger but I never could because the older kids "didn't want to set it up". Now, as an adult, it does not live up to the childhood hype. There's pointless cheese pieces you collect and it never seemed to end because once you get to the end of the board you rotate between the same six spaces. I can see how as a kid it may be fun- maybe- but this wasn't a fun adult game and I still love to play Life and Monopoly. Monopoly Junior even.

This was purchased to teach the grand kids how to play.  I guess when we had this game the parts were made better.  But this is still a fun game for the family and the kids love to turn the handles when completed.

Upon opening Mousetrap on Christmas morning, I helped my (overly excited  11yo) grandson begin to set it up. He couldn’t wait to “play the retro games, and other presents” I purposely bought. We were 1/4 of way into the setup, and couldn’t find 1 part. Everything that came in the box, along with directions remained on the table. It was not there. Bottom line, the piece that was not included, and an attempt at a facsimile was not to be. He reassured me it was “ok” when it was not, instead of.returning the game et al, it ended up in the trash.
A lot of pieces, so a young child will need help building the mousetrap.  But my grandson loves this game.  He wants someone to build it with him multiple times.

We loved this game as kids and wanted to give it to our grandson.  He loves the game but gets frustrated when the trap comes down at the wrong time or the boot won't lock down.  It is not the same quality toy.

Loved this game as a child, I am now 61 years old, so having a 7 year old granddaughter was the perfect time to share something Grandma once played with.  She loves it.  And I am so thrilled the new version is not all distorted from the original.  Too many old games are resurrected in such a way you can barely recognize them.  Good job Hasbro!!!

I have read some reviews that say this game doesn't work properly- I am not sure what's going on with theirs, but my son(8 years old)can put this together perfectly and it traps the mouse 99% of the time. The goal of this game is not to put it all together at first, but to do so as you move throughout the game one piece here and there. I have had ZERO broken or flimsy pieces. We have taken it apart and put together multiple times with ZERO issues. The thing works like a well oiled machine. This game was for my 8 year old. When we received it, it took me to my childhood. Worked like a charm as I remembered it- Great game.

I loved this game as a kid so I decided to buy it for my younger sister for her birthday. I was disappointed that the game box came damaged. There was a giant crease on the side where it might have gotten smooshed in transit. The game pieces were all there which was nice. Might need to replace the rubber band, it looks old. Can't wait to build it with her!

I remember this game from when I was a kid, we had a lot of fun playing it again as adults! I think many of the pieces wouldn't hold up with kids playing with it, but it seems like it will last for us "grown up kids".
Do not waste your money. Such a cheaply made product didn’t work correctly right out of the box. Do yourself a favor and buy a different game for your kids.

Very confusing. There are A number of versions of the instructions. My six-year-old had to study a few YouTube videos to get the concept. It’s cheaply made. Not happy at all. My six-year-old has converted the game into something different for his enjoyment. I would not recommend this game.

review_title: Perfect addition to our "Force and Motion" unit!
review_description: I played this as a child and loved it! I still do! This was a purchase I made for my kindergarten class during our Force and Motion unit. We watched videos that demonstrated the Rube Goldberg Machine, so this was a perfect hands-on opportunity for choice time! For my class, I had to assist with set-up the first couple of rotations of students, but they caught on quickly. It was really fun for them, even if the board didn't always get set up exactly like the pictures on the box! ha!

review_title: The "mouse trap" doesn't work well or at all
review_description: The game looks fun, is colorfull and board is displayed well. The problem for us is it simply did not work.  After a dozen attempts at getting the mouse trap to reach its final course it failed everytime. The board was properly installed and the directions were followed and rechecked multiple times. At least my son can use the board pieces for toys. Its frustrating to buy this game and it not function properly.

review_title: They dont make it like when I was a child
review_description: Pieces do not work or fit together properly, which is the main point of the game play.... very disappointing for my children!! They dont make it like when I was a child!!
My 7 year old son wanted this and actually bought it with his own money. Thought it was difficult to set up but he did it with brother (13 yr old) and they still play with it after months!

for one, it was missing pieces and looked as though it was all used before. Pieces were already broke free from the packaging frames, just seemed like this item had been returned already. The entire game board has slots for the trap pieces and they were all wrong and backwards on the game, most ridiculous thing i have seen. Returning this asap.

I have great things to say about this game! THe great thing about Mousetrap is that it's more than a board game. You can build the maze gradually, following the manufacturer's instructions, or you can simply assemble the maze and use it as a toy. My son is 7 and we built the maze together yesterday. He wants to keep it assembled in his room and is busy integrating all his other toys into the maze.We worked together to build it (he has more spatial sense than I do...it's not that a 7 year old CAN'T do it, it's just that it takes two people to figure it out together). So it was a great exercise in teamwork.I have read reviews that the materials are flimsy and not sturdy, but I disagree. The pieces are made of thick, durable plastic and cannot be bent or easily broken.Best. game. ever!

Bought this ( the bad reviews ) because my grandson really wanted it. He loves it and my daughter doesn't mind playing it with him. With help his 3 year old brother can play without it getting frustrating for everyone.

I received this game as a gift, since anyone who knows me also knows how much I love a new Clue game.90 — 95% of this edition is exactly what Hasbro has already been selling for 2 years now (linked in the comments below): an attractively updated Clue game featuring the new suspect Dr. Orchid, and a return to the classic board design (after spending the better part of a decade with a scaled down, modernized board, this is certainly a welcome feature). The biggest draw to this edition comes from the inclusion of fully sculpted character pieces (already available in international editions of Hasbro’s Cluedo games, but woefully absent from our North American Clue games, which were saddled with the generic pawns Clue has featured for decades). These are a fun aesthetic upgrade from the prior edition’s pawns.The next big new thing is, clearly, the card-revealing mirror. This replaces the solution envelope of past editions with a battery operated magic mirror to reveal the Who, What, and Where of Mr. Boddy’s murder. It’s a sturdy chunk of plastic, but is it worth the price tag on this new edition? Not at all. Hasbro hasn’t even bothered to integrate the mirror into the narrative of the game. Where, in the house, is this magic mirror? Why does it know the solution to the crime? Players will have to be creative, or just suspend their disbelief a little more while playing the game.It’s too early to tell if this is meant to replace the previous edition as Hasbro’s standard offering for Clue players, or if it will be sold alongside the “analog” version as a deluxe alternative. Most players will be fine sticking with whichever edition of Clue they’ve been playing for decades. Anyone in the market for a new edition should use their own judgment to decide if fancier playing pieces & the gimmick of the mirror are worth paying almost 2x the cost of the original Dr. Orchid edition.Pros:-Character pieces-Larger box-Some integrated storage within the box for tokens & mirrorCons:-Board/cards/notepad must be stored under the box insert, with no way to secure the cards from scattering inside the box-No batteries? No mirror effect for you-Bonus deck still limited to just 9 cards while the international editions have 29 in this deckNeutral:-The mirror will draw in younger players, but is otherwise a very half-baked “upgrade” which doesn’t justify the MSRP

I came across this item by accident. I mean I'm a huge Clue fan and buy any official board game that Hasbro makes. But this one did not come up on my normal search. I stumbled across it and instantly added it to my shopping cart and bought it. The magic mirror is basically a blank until you push the button and a light inside illuminates the 3 cards inside revealing whodunit. The playing pieces are not little small nubs but rather human shaped in their respective characters. The board is the same as the 2017 version with Dr. Orchid. All in all the magic mirror is a nice touch and I look forward to Hasbro making more versions of Clue. The other reviewer is 100% wrong. Getting tired with the crappy reviews. Leave it alone!Hasbro if you're listening: Clue Master Detective a 2018 or 2019 edition would be nice! There are a huge number of fans that want a new updated Clue Master Detective!

review_title: Overpriced for what it adds to the basic edition also available for $10 less.
review_description: I paid $10 for this game when it was on sale over Black Friday. Except for the “card revealing mirror”, and character figurines instead of generic pawns, this is the exact same game as the original, square, under $10 edition also available on Amazon. The card revealing mirror certainly does not justify the price. The character figurines are definitely a step up from the original edition (from which they were omitted, despite the Cluedo edition including them), though $10 is a pretty steep price for some little plastic figurines.Combined with the mirror gimmick, it may be worth it to make the game more interesting for kids, as evidenced by some of the comments here. However, I can not recommend paying $20 for the exact same game which Hasbro continues to sell for only $10. The less expensive version is also in a smaller box for storage, while the larger box doesn’t really improve the way then prices are stored and protected, they still roll around inside the box, unlike the Cluedo counterpart which has plastic compartments.All things considered, this is an edition with some extra bells and whistles, which may, or may not be worth the added expense for you. That said, if you can find it for the same price as the original square version, as I did, then you should buy it instead — it’s well worth it for the character figurines. Though the mirror falls squarely into gimmick territory, it might be a fun addition for young children; but some of you, like me, may find yourself wishing they’d included the good old fashioned paper evidence envelope as well.

review_title: Not very good condition as it siad it was.
review_description: I bought this used very good condition but this is definitely not very good. Had I known that the box was so damaged I would have spent an extra dollar or two to get the brand new one. But when it said very good condition I assumed that all the pieces wind be undamage, including the box which holds all the pieces. As you can see from the pictures is ripped and looks absolutely terrible....I will have to find a different box to store it because when you open it, the sides of the box just want to fall apart.

review_title: extra cost for mirror thing is not worth it.
review_description: Using the mirror thing damages the cards and creates marks on the cards so that anyone that has played it before will know who has that card.

I played Clue when I was a kid and it is nice to be able to play again with my own kids.  We also have the classic version that still has Mrs. White, but we like this version too.  The mirror is gimmicky, but cool for the kids.  We use the characters from the original which we think are neater because they are fully painted, but the ones in this version are fine.  Not much else has changed except the addition of Dr. Orchid, so it is the same great game.  I recommend this game to families.  It still has the nostalgia factor, but updated for the younger generations.

I purchased this game with a revealing mirror. Yes, its additional $10, however kids love the mirror as it LOOKS COOL. Taking 1 star out from this review is mainly due to the fact that mirror slots are very tight. As you keep on inserting / removing cards from it, cards starts bending on corners. So after sometime, you may know which card is what. Tried loosening screws on back, however slots were still tight. I might have received the defective one, however this still does keep us engaged playing with it.

review_title: Oh the memories - I love this game!
review_description: Bought this boardgame as a small gift to my niece and nephew as they went through a boardgame phase. It definitely brought back some of my childhood memories since I played this when I was younger too. I love that it was a good mix of old and new. I was able to pick up on it again pretty quickly, but there were small changes like new characters and they even updated the card reveal method from an envelope to a cool light up device. I thought that was really interesting. Just don't hold the device up to direct sunlight though because you can still see through it a bit. Other than that, it was a lot of fun playing and it's great that it's a family-friendly game.

As serious players over the years... We really liked this version!The figurines are very useful, specially if you use the rule of bringing the suspect to the room they are "suggested" (they were always kinda hard to find with the typical Sorry pieces).The mirror looks cool, but sometimes the light let's you peek the cards inside even though it isn't on. Therefore it ended always turned upside down haha. We didn't mind at the end, since it makes no effect on the gameplay.The best part overall... this version brings again the best board ever! Also, the Clue cards bring extra variation, which let us play faster and with every type of person (specially when mixing adults and children).In other words, this is one of the best versions out there! The figurines, the board and the cards are well enough for giving the 5 stars. The unhuman-colored figurines and the mirror could be better, but make no effect on the game.Thanks!

Bought this as a gift for a 14 year old who had never played Clue before this summer and he enjoyed it. I like the updated pictures and board and the magic mirror was lots of fun. Our favorite part is the pawns are people shaped and color coded to match the characters they represent, so that was fun. If we didn't already have 3 different Clue games I might have bought one for myself.

This was one of my favorite childhood games and it's so fun being able to play this with my 6 year old! The key for him being able to play independently is that he's able to read. He doesn't quite understand the strategy part of it yet but he can follow the basic process of elimination. The board looks pretty similar to the one I played growing up. There is a new character (Dr. Orchid). We all LOVE the magic mirror feature. It just makes it a little more fun that flipping over the winning cards.

I actually despise this game lmao but my daughter (11 years old) wanted it for Christmas so we got it for her. She wanted the DVD version and in my rush to get all the gifts I thought this was the one because of the magnifying glass on the front, I thought it was a DVD but that's my fault for just glancing. But she's still happy and we play it and it's great.

Cool update to the game. Similar to the original with a few improvements. Pawns are in the shape of the characters, instead of a confidential folder there is a mirror that shows the cards with the push of a button. They also added a few alternate ways to play if you want! Love it.

review_title: It's clue, but I absolutely hate the card system it comes with.
review_description: Just don't use the cards it comes with, b/c they completely ruin the game.  You can figure out the answer in 2-3 turns if you use the cards.
I purchased this as a gift for my 10 year old son. He loves it, and we have been playing it over and over. The mirror addition is great! It adds a bit of fun. The game came in great condition.

review_title: Great game but did not receive “new” game.
review_description: Game is great but box came with a tab opened and odd looking and a corner of the box was ripped. So not “new”. The dagger piece was also missing from the game so that was disappointing but all in all a great game to play with friends and family.

I was so happy to find the “original” Clue game on Amazon.  My granddaughter wanted the original game not one of the many versions out on the market today.  Fortunately I found it on Amazon which made my granddaughter very happy.
We bought this after watching the movie - It's such a fun game for the whole family! Even my 5 yr old learned quickly and was able to play with minimal help by herself. Would highly recommend!

I gave this as a gift to my 9 year old grandson and it was a hit.  I have the game in my home that I play with my other grandchildren, also 9 and 14 and we play it often for hours.  I love the upgrade on the just purchased game as it includes a box with magnifying glass to reveal the clues in contrast to the old game of Clue that has just an envelope to place the clues in.  Makes a great gift!
My 8 year old loves this game! She especially loves that the mirror reveals the results.  It is a little hard for her, but she gets it enough to enjoy playing.
Love the hologram thing to reveal the killer. We throughly enjoyed this and like the upgrades... we had the retro game before so this was very nice to have.... the pieces are actual people.
My son asked for one gift for his birthday and that was the board game clue. I purchased it months in advance just to find out it had no cards. I will have to re-purchase.
The kids in my family love Clue and the youngest (10) caught on quickly. The addition of a new character, the revealing mirror and I think a new room too is fun.

review_title: Borne out of Boredom During WWII Air-Raid Blackouts
review_description: This is one of the classics. The game was first manufactured by Waddingtons in the UK in 1949 so it has really stood the test of time.  It was called Cluedo in England and Clue in the United States.  Definitely not a mindless game which is why I have always enjoyed it.  Purchased it for a game tower for a fundraiser.  Packaged well and enjoyable especially if you like murder mysteries.
Its just like the original but they changed some of the names for some reason but its still fun and our families Quarantine Friday nights.

Bought this for family game night, mainly since this is my brothers favorite movie.  Directions were easy & we had a blast!  This is slightly different from the original but it’s still a great game we can play over & over!
I purchased this for my granddaughter for Christmas and it is GREAT!!!! She has a lot of fun playing it with her family and friends!!! It has some very nice pieces included with it.
This game is an upgrade from the old clue game. It was really easy for my kids to grasp and it shipped really quickly.
I prefer the original version ofthe game.

review_title: same game with a new addition
review_description: Just love that mirror addition to the game. Makes it that much more fun to play with friends. Perfect addition to our game nights with friends.

Very hard.  My kids are almost in middle school and this game was hard on all of us to figure out.  We pretty much made the rules up as we went as it relates to the secret doors and dice.  We still have fun playing it but figuring out how we played was a pain.

review_title: Not quite the original version but it work
review_description: Comes with a little magic revealing mirror, kinda cool, but it's not the original Clue game you remember playing as a kid. Arrived with perfectly sharp box corners and on time- yay!

review_title: The Classic Whodunnit Brings Families Together
review_description: The classic Clue board game. Great for families and inclement weather weekends ( especially in a dark, stormy night). Gather the family, put away the phones and settle in for some quality time together.
Great classic borad game. I love it around the holidays to bring people together. I played clue my whole live. It’s fun for everyone
Bought this for my nephew who just turned 9 because I loved this game in college. He loves it and enjoys playing it.
Family clue night is always fun! Loved this game as a child and love playing with the kiddos

review_title: Wasn't sure what to expect of this new version
review_description: I was apprehensive of the new version, my daughter had requested the oranigal clue as a family gift.  However to my delight,  my daughter and grandsons, are enjoying this new version...
This is a slightly different take on the classic Clue game.  It is fun for the whole family from 10 year old granddaughter to 71 year old grandpa.
Best present ever - made me best aunty ever!Should have bought two:-)
This is a super fun game to play and comes with the instructions which explains very clearly how to play the game. Great for any age group of friends.
My kids love this game and the "hidden viewer" makes it even more exciting.  Fun new addition to a classic game.
Great price on a classic game delivered to me in 1 day 😬 what else could I ask for?
This game is a must have classic! So much fun for the family. You also learn a lot about your family when they don't want to give up a card!  😂
Great game. I have been playing this game since I was a child and now my kids enjoy playing it. Easy to learn

review_title: A classic game that is always fun.
review_description: Clue is still a classic game that keeps you guessing.Great family fun!

review_title: No Need to change the game!
review_description: We love Clue but missed that this is some new jazzed up version. I’d find the original!
Decent quality for the price!!! I liked it!! and my daughter too!
This game was recommended to me. I am very glad I bought it. It is challenging but also very very fun. Brings much pleasure.
Love it . Really took clue to the next level .

review_title: My young adult daughters, Clue fans, approved of this version.
review_description: I ordered this delivered to a destination Christmas. My young adult daughters have fond memories of their favorite game. They loved playing it during Christmas and were happy with this version.

The pokemon card packs were all tampered with, weighed, resealed. One was legit cut open already.They absolutely pulled out a nice card and replaced it with a basic non-holo.Do not buy this if you are expecting any pokemon booster packs.  Just get the basic board game.

It's not a good 3 person game. It might not even be a good 4 person game.This game is a lot like scattegories, only instead of being unique, you want to be only kind of unique.This game would be great for HUGE groups of people.Did I laugh? Not very much.Was I entertained? Not very much.Did it take skill or talent? Not very much.My boards haven't fallen apart yetIt's cheaper at Target.tldr: This game is only good for large groups and don't expect it to be a huge hit.

I was surprised by this game. It was really fun and super quick and easy to learn. It’s great for all ages and can be learned and played quickly without tons of concentration, which is great when you have a house full of kids. The concept is easy, but you’ll be so surprised at how differently people think. We enjoyed it and would recommend it.

I bought this game as a group gift for my nieces & nephews (all adult) for Christmas.  When I gave it to them they were so very happy and we rounded up their teenage children and all sat around playing it.  Everyone loved it.
This is a great game if you don’t want to hover over a board moving pieces. We all sat comfortably on our comfy couches and chairs and really had a great time playing!

I played this game at a friend’s house a few weeks ago and loved it, so I ordered it for our family get togethers.  We played it last night and had so much fun 😁 It is easy to learn and interesting to hear what other players come up with.
This was a fun game to play with family.  It was fun to see who you think alike and who you thought you would think alike and didn't.
Loved the game! Great for all ages
Great kids game!

Blank Slate is a fun, enjoyable game that is easy to play.  It is great to play with friends, family or both.  It is also a quick game for those that don't like longer involved games.  I would have given it a 5 but I personally like a game with more  strategy which this game is more of one of chance.  It being one of chance makes it a better pick for large groups, games for parties and those you just want to have fun without having to be strategic.  We played it once with family and I bought it immediately.  Highly recommend it.

This game reminds you of 'Eye to Eye' which is by far the most popular game in my extended family. Why? Because the rounds are quick, the rules are simple, the connections between players are unpredictable and rewarding, and you don't have to 'invest' hours and multiple plays to 'get the idea'. Some of us are not into the deep game playing strategies that require deep involvement and considerable attention; we just want to socialize and have fun conversations . This game meets all the expectations for something that does not require time and space to set up and can be played impromptu with anyone. We played 4 player, 6 player  at a recent family vacation an appreciated the ability to just pick it up whenever and wherever circumstances allowed, teens and kids loved it too; no prep. Awesome!

If you haven’t added this game to your game night set your missing out. We took one to the family cabin where we play a different game every hour or so and we haven’t been able to play any others since. Hands down our favorite family(kids included)  and adults only game too! Be the hit of game night and bring this I promise you won’t regret it!

We have family game night usually once a month. I searched Amazon for a new game to play with my family and Blank Slate came up in the search. After reading several 4 and 5 star reviews, I purchased the game. Received the game on time, and played the game Saturday. My family and I had the best time, laughed a lot! It was amazing how 8 people could come up with 8 different answers:)

This game sounded like it would be lots of fun but, unfortunately, we all thought it was kind of boring.  We had 5 people, ages13 to 72, playing.  The first few rounds were fun, but then it just kind of dwindled down to Blah.  Sorry :-(

Super game and great fun for a group. We played it several times over the holidays in a group of 8 people. It never got boring, held everyone's attention, and was quick to learn. The game is well designed so everything you need is right there with a scoring panel that makes keeping score a breeze. Awesome!!

I picked up this game as a Christmas gift. It’s made an appearance at several game nights with various attendees, and everyone has enjoyed it. The younger players sometimes were confused by the finer points of the game, and we did have one non-native English speaker who had a tougher time coming up with the colloquial expressions others chose, but I think both these factors would vary by your audience. All in all, a winning purchase.

review_title: Fun and easy to learn even for someone who doesn’t like think-on-your-feet kind of games
review_description: We played this with friends over Zoom video and it was so fun, we bought it the next day! It’s super easy to pick up, family friendly, and can be as silly or serious as you want.I am personally not a fan of quick on your feet games and I loved it. I didn’t often feel put on the spot or rushed.The game goes quick, but it’s so fun, you’ll want to just keep playing!

We played this at our family Christmas party.  It is a lot like the Match Game on TV.  We had a great time and everyone enjoyed playing it.  Requires no special skills to play.  We had about fifteen people playing it.

review_title: Super easy to pick up and play
review_description: Got this for my dad, who has no patience for games with complicated directions. It was a huge hit! Super easy to play, reusable slates so there's not a lot of pieces or loose paper to keep track of, and it worked well with a group that ranged from 4-6 people over the course of the evening. My parents plan to use it at their church game night, as an easy thing that all ages can play.

Everyone loves this game.  Everyone!  And everyone from young children to older adults can enjoy the game in different ways at different levels -- together!  We have lots of games, but guests always ask for and prefer this one.  When we play this noncomplicated game, fun people and great conversation remain the focus.
This is a fun game that the whole family can play.  However, the slates came apart after using several times.  Had to be glued back together.
Played this at Christmas with all the family.  Plenty of laughs and a fun time.  Easy to learn. Easy to play

review_title: Great game! Best with more players!
review_description: It’s a really easy and fun game!  Best with more people. Even family members who typically don’t enjoy party games liked this game!

review_title: Not even close to being fun
review_description: We play games weekly with friends and family and the reviews looked so promising but this game is not that much fun. The boards are cheaply made as other reviews have stated and you could easily make your own version and save your money for a better game.

review_title: Great, Fun Game, but not good quality
review_description: Loved this game, and you can play it with any age really. We even played as groups at work with 25 ppl(3 to a team) but the quality of the dry erase boards is very sub par. When we went to play at work the brown team board had some kind of stain on it that won't come off. Very disappointing.
Good clean fun! All ages can play! We had a blast playing this over the holidays!

My family LOVED this game. We have played it at a lot of family gatherings. My sister even asked to borrow it to play at her game night with friends. It is a really loved and fun game for adults and kids. Kids can easily play, but some words may be harder for them to associate other words with. I bought different dry erase markers with eraser tips to replace the ones that came in the box.

Got this game for the family for Christmas. We've played it twice ourselves, and two additional times with friends at parties. This game is great because is bridges the gap between trivia geeks and gamers and allows people of all gaming skills to play together; no more "braniacs" dominating game time!

We have a gaming night at least once a month and this game fit in nicely.  The rounds go fast and everyone enjoyed the experience. Very fast to set up and easy to explain. Would recommend to anyone who likes groups games.

This game is fun for family game night or adult game night. Everyone truly loves playing it! We also have started playing over Zoom during the recent “stay at home” orders and it’s just as fun as in person.

Perfect family game at the perfect time! My family really loved it. We were even able to include family members via FaceTime! Gota do what ya gota do when “sheltered at home” away from family & friends!

Got it for family and friend entertainment at our house.  Easy to learn.  Used it for ages 8 (they needed a little help) and above and everyone had fun.  Nice to be able to have a group and let everyone sit wherever they want and still play.  No table needed.  After playing it, 2 families went out and bought their own copy they liked it so much.

My family really enjoys this game. We've played just the four of us (11 and 13 year old daughters) and with other family and friends and everyone loves it. It's easy to play and can be really funny.  You could even play with all adults and have a more R-rated version if you want.  It's easy and moves quickly.  Highly recommend!

This game was recommended to us by a friend as a great family game.  I bought one for our daughter's family, and one for us.  It is so much fun - I would definitely recommend this game as a great family game!
Excellent game for children age 7+ and adults alike. The mood and level of the game evokes with the active players! Fun for quick games and easy entertainment.
This game is so fun!!! We got it for entertainment during the holidays . We played it so much and had a lot of laughs. Fun to see answers from different generations. Easy to play !!

The game is really quite easy and fun for groups of all ages! Great party game!The lower rating is mainly due to the fact that this was purchased as a gift but it arrived to our house without any exterior plastic/box/etc. The shipping labels were stuck right on the outside of the game box and they were NOT easy to get off which isn't ideal (especially when gifting),
So much fun for a group!!
Such a fun family game! We played with more players then recommended. We also played with teams. It was a lot of fun to see everyone’s answers! Highly recommend
I bought this a gift for my daughter and son-in- law. They play it often when friends come over.

review_title: We love it! It’s a new fave at game night!
review_description: Easy to learn. Very fun and entertaining for both small and large groups!

review_title: Fun for all ages !  Even if it’s just adults.
review_description: Seriously perfect for kids and adults.  We used it with just adults and had a blast!  We were shocked because there were 7 of us playing and we had fewer matches than we expected!  Definitely recommend.  The little boards and erasers on the markers don’t work for long and that’s a bummer because the boards get dirty.

review_title: We have one gripe about material quality, but great game
review_description: The markers must be of a cheap quality because we were left with ink on our fingers, but the gameplay concept and replay ability is excellent.  I bought this game with the hopes that our 6 year old niece would have a better chance at playing the game independently instead of being a ‘helper’ On game nights.  I do agree with the rating of 8+ years old, but boy does she have fun as a player.  Some games her simple mind came up with the best answer out of a tableful of adults.  The whole family instantly agreed this game is a keeper due to her reaction to it.
This game is awesome! We have weekly Game Night parties,  and this is selected 100% of the time!This would be a family friendly game, but we adults have a blast!
so much fun! no long length of directions . easy to catch on. We have kids ages 7 thru adults 70 and everyone played over and over. sturdy board, great game pieces
We love playing this game!If you have a friend that hates games they will probably love this one.I have recommended this game to several friends.

review_title: Super fun game for a wide variety of crowds
review_description: We've played this game with family, business associates as an ice breaker, and various groups of friends.  It is easy to learn and everyone loves playing it.
Fun easy family friendly game
We love this game!! Very fun! Only complaint I have is brand new a couple of the white boards were already damaged and peeling. Otherwise, we give it 5 stars!
It was a fun game to play at the holidays.  When we had more than 8 players we worked as teams and switched each card to the other player on your team.

It was the perfect game to play during the holidays. There isn’t a “right” answer so anyone can play and win. Our family is split with those that love competitive strategy games and those that won’t play with the competitive strategy game lovers, ha! But this got everyone together, laughing and having a great time - young to older. Enjoy!

review_title: Take a walk through a mystical forest!
review_description: We have hundreds of games, so believe me when l tell you, this game is amazing!  Played with kids 7, 10 & 11 and they all loved it. They've just recently outgrown Sleeping Queens that we've played to death. Dragonwood is the perfect next step up. Thank you Gamewright! There's a reason l have almost all of their games. They know what they're doing in game design. The dice are gorgeous, the card art is great. You really feel like you're walking through a magical wood capturing spooky spiders, finding enchantments and battling a fierce blue dragon.

Our boys received Dragonwood, Dungeon, and Pathfinder as Christmas gifts.  They are 4, 6, 8, & 16.  Our family loves board games and we really wanted to encourage their storytelling skills and imagination.  This game was very easy to learn and teach to each of the boys.  Although the 4 year old played on my team, he would make up a story to go wit each attempt to capture.  Although we used the words capture, the boys eventually told stories that went beyond just capturing the characters on the card.  We also named each of the  cards a special name of their own - The Enchantress, The Wizard, the Dark Knight, The Light Night, & The Elf.  It made for consistency across the stories being told by each boy on his turn.  The pictures are fantastically illustrated and the cards have a very nice feel.I did notice that another review complained about the directions for this game.  I found the directions very clear and well illustrated.  Our boys who are all solid readers, still preferred to reference the picture in the directions of what constitutes a Strike, Stomp, or a Scream.  Once we had the basic directions down, we added the bit about telling a story to coincide with the cards being played and acted upon and we had played 3 games before bedtime just that first night.  When I came home from work today, I found that the boys had been playing this game all morning on their own!  This is a really fun game.

We have had Sleeping Queens for a while and the whole family loves it. This is a great step up for a family wanting a slightly more involved game. Easy to learn and understand, and it comes with two reference cards to remind you of your play options each turn which was helpful for the kids. My 6 and 9 year old both loved it!

This a fantastic early elementary level math/probability/push your luck game. The premise is simple: Choose a monster card you want to capture.  You can theb play one to six cards of the same number, in a run, or in a flush. You then roll dice equal to the number of cards played. You then total the Dice and compare it to the monster card. Equal to or higher wins you the card.  It's simple enough for my six year old to play (with help from me) against my wife, and it clearly is teaching her the basics theories of probability and early ideas of "push your luck" versus "play it safe strategies."  Once she has another year of school down, she should have no problem playing it on her own against us.  Oh, and my wife wanted to play it with me once the kids were in bed as a nice light distraction game!  A huge A++ for quality math based mechanics, with another + thrown in for cute art.

review_title: Great game for those growing out the of the little kid stuff.
review_description: My 9 year old son bought this game after playing it at church. The pastor's kids brought it one Sunday and they played it in lieu of Sunday school (clutch your pearls everyone!! lol). It's a fun game that gives the feeling of daring and challenge combined with strategy, but easy enough that you don't have to be a perfect strategist to do well. My kids are 6, 7 and 9 and they can all play it. I was actually surprised by how quickly they caught on to the complexities, but they also play Minecraft and other strategy games so they're used to this sort of thing. This is a great game for "inbetweeners" that are too old for Candy Land and too young for Risk. For them it feels like a "grown up" game, but it's well designed for young minds. For the educational minded, this game is good for math skills as well as logic and reasoning. It also encourages long term planning if you want to do well when a dragon strikes! My oldest quickly figured out to save a great hand to be ready for a dragon.The only reason I don't give it five stars is that once you get going it's rather redundant. You're pretty much doing the same thing again and again. But for kids it's fine. As an adult it gets old.  ;)

review_title: Much needed break from the WiiU
review_description: My two boys, 8 and 10, loved this game. They were worried that it would be too nerdy for them but ended up completely obsessed very quickly. I was so happy something got them away from video games!

review_title: Beautiful and fun addition to homeschool game library
review_description: My 7 yr old son and I just received this game and have played it twice already.  He needs a little help to get through it, but he loves the game already.  He is fascinated with the artwork and creatures enough to be trying to read and quickly add up the dice on his own.  He is a fairly reluctant reader and usually avoids reading even simple things so I am delighted this has caught his attention enough to make him excited to read and quickly add as well as think critically about the simple strategy.  As a homeschool family, we are always on the lookout for fun games that reinforce concepts we are learning and this fits the bill! (Having 6 dice makes for great math).  The game is really lovely and simple enough to play enjoyably from the start.

review_title: Great Strategy & Fun for Family & Friends Alike!
review_description: After playing Dragonwood over 30 times in the first week, I think it is safe to post a review.  First of all, this game is extremely easy to learn from the instruction manual, and even easier to teach others how to play.  I have played this game with my wife, my two sons (11 & 9), and 3 other friends who are into strategy games.  It is so easy to pick up and play.  It is a good mix of deck building, random dice rolling and strategy.  It stays fresh enough that you can keep playing, without boring, at least for 2-3 times in a setting.  The art style is simple and elegant, and a great attraction to anyone who is into medieval style.  The game experience is equally fun for 2-4 players.  The instructions include 2-3 variants as well for more experienced players.  I have not attempted those yet but look forward to doing that soon.

You will note in the photo I have included that the Hungry Bears, Pack of Wolves, Wild Boar and Fierce Jaguar are all worth 3 victory points.  Capturing these however, is different for each.  The 'strike' method of capture has 3 different amounts; 1 is 6 1 is 7 and 2 are 8 to capture.  For the 'Stomp" method they have two amounts; 2 have 7 and 2 have 6.  Finally for the 'Scream" method there are again three amounts, 7, 8 and 9.The three methods of capture, scream, strike and stomp all have the same odds of being gathered in the needed order to use them.  The amounts needed to capture should be based on the VP of the card in question not randomly selected per card.  This would allow for a balanced game.Next, for the level of this game, the game play is rather slow.  We got so bored in the first game that we lost interest and did not complete the first game.  A game this simple should be much faster paced, the Lucky Ladybugs are an attempt to do this and while they do add a bit of speed to the game it is still slow.In short, I was hopeful that this would be a good fast or at least quick game that could be used to entertain and teach on a lazy afternoon and used as an alternative to electronic entertainment.  It failed at a very slow pace that was grueling and not fun.  We were disappointed.

review_title: It's a huge hit in the house.
review_description: My GOSH my 7 year old son is obsessed with this game. We recently (in the last several months) became a major gamer family. It's a way to bond with my 4 and 7 year old sons. This is one of many games I purchased and by far the one that is most played. Now, for me personally - I can get bored with this one. But it is just right for my 7 year old. My 4 year old also plays but I often need to remind him of sequences for the 3 methods of attack. He tends to use the "Scream" most of all because it's easier for him to remember to use the same color. But he still has a lot of fun. This game can go on for a LONG time too. I have gotten to the point I remove many cards out of the event deck so we have a shorter play time.The dice are lovely red and smooth. The card artwork is pretty. The entire box and set up is well made and just nice quality. We've definitely played our money's worth out of it already.

review_title: Good game but very easy - with default rules
review_description: The first several tries this game was very fun, but we soon learned to draw cards until we had enough for a 6 card Strike. Once you have that, you can breeze through the whole Creature deck with no resistance... making the game so easy it isn't really fun anymore. However, with a couple minor rule changes it can be challenging and fun again.1. Don't end the game when both dragons are captured, play through the whole deck.2.
